Reviews.Title: “Good but not as good as expected!”
Reviews.Author: Gadabout2210
Reviews.Content: Third leg of our European trip. I think we we're expecting so much more than this hotel actually had. Our room on sixth floor was ok, smallest on our trip so far but by European standards very acceptable. Our disappointment however was with the breakfast, maybe we were just unlucky on our 3 night stay but on not one morning did we find it compared to our previous hotels. Selection was extremely limited,bread dry on the one morning they actually had it. We are frequent travelers throughout the globe so have experienced many hotels, so I'm sorry to say if you are visiting here for the breakfast then forget it. Location is good and walking distance to all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: Swillbos
Reviews.Content: Just a wonderful hotel. We stayed in suite 602, which worked very well for our party of three. The views from the terrace were sublime, and I had the pure joy of being able to sit there reading EM Forster.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have imagined a better stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ChinggisKhaan
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from an 8 night stay at the Albergo del Senato and could not have been more pleased. To begin with, the location is absolutely ideal. We were able to walk to all of the sites we wanted to see. The area is full of quaint eating establishments and small grocers are nearby if you wish to collect items for a picnic (not to mention the market at Campo di Fiori an easy walk away). The staff of the hotel is most congenial and professional. They assisted us with making restaurant reservations for a 50th birthday celebration and surprised us with a complementary bottle of champagne back at the hotel. Our room was the best we've had in our extensive travels in Europe. It was comprised of a sitting area with small table and a separate bedroom. The bathroom was quite large by European standards, easily accommodating the 2 of us. But certainly the best thing about the room were the 2 windows that opened to an amazing view of the Pantheon and Piazza della Rotonda. There is a lot of activity in the piazza until the wee hours but we found closing the windows reduced the noise to quite satisfactory levels. However, we rarely closed the windows. We live in a small town on a lake and enjoy peacefulness and solitude, but "When in Rome......." we enjoyed the vibrancy of the piazza and feeling more a part of the city. The breakfast served is an excellent start to the day. The staff is very efficient bringing hot drinks to the table and always keeping the food replenished so choices were never limited. The cleanliness of the hotel, from common areas to rooms, was impeccable. The front desk staff were always cheerful and efficient, greeting us each day as we returned from our touring and making us feel at home. Another feature of the hotel that we enjoyed was the roof-top terrace. This was open during our stay although the accompanying bar was not. We spent a very relaxing evening up there watching the sun go down and the lights flicker on in the piazza below while sipping wine and eating fresh bread, cheese and salami purchased at one of the nearby grocers. If I had to come up with one quibble, it would be that the wireless internet connection in our room was not satisfactory and wouldn't allow us to connect. We were, however, able to connect in the common areas of the hotel. This was of little consequence to us as we were focused on experiencing Rome and, indeed, we did not even mention it to staff. It's possible there would have been an easy solution to that. Given our experiences at the Albergo del Senato, and at a cost that we believe represents a very good value for what is received, we will definitely return on our next visit to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Travelpig2
Reviews.Content: I took my husband here for the weekend for our anniversary in March 2012. I can say it is an absolutely wonderful place that lived up to every expectation. Friendly, professional reception staff and maids, who all made us feel really welcome and at home. Breakfast was classic continental with a relaxed and comfortable atmosphere created by the lovely man hosting the breakfast room. Bedrooms are classically decorated with all the mod-cons, spotlessly clean with amazing views. On checkout we were informed by the lady on reception that they sometimes have deals on the room rates, so next time we will call ahead to check before we book. We will definitely be back and will recommend this hotel to everyone. Prices are reasonable for the location and exceptional high quality when we went in March, but the peak season prices are much higher. March was perfect temperature for walking round the city (I even got a bit of a pink nose sitting outside for a couple of hours!) so I would recommend avoiding peak season prices.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EBoydTG
Reviews.Content: Our stay April 1-3, 2012 at the Albergo Senato was perfect! The location is the best, with the view from our window looking out over the Pantheon and Piazza della Rotonda, and the roof-top terrace providing a wonderful view of the city. We took a taxi from the convenient taxi stand in the Piazza to the Vatican; we were able to walk to all of our other sites. The hotel is spotless, the room was clean and roomy, and the breakfast excellent- with many choices. To top it off, the hotel staff (especially Alessandra) was unbelievably friendly, helpfull and professional. We will never stay any where else in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel In Rome!”
Reviews.Author: LowCountryIslander
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from my 6th trip to Rome in as many years and after passing the Albergo del Senato many times, I finally decided to book a room here. I am very happy I did, I think this hotel is just terrific. First, the location can't be beat for being in the center of the historic center of Rome. Most anything a visitor to Rome would want to see is either within walking distance, or if you're planning to use Rome's public transit system bus stops are very easy to get to. Secondly, the staff if superior. Any request, including pre-arrival restaurant reservations, were accommodated quickly, efficiently and with a smile. Every staff member from the front desk, to the bellmen, to the housekeepers, and bartender were friendly, even putting up with attempts of my basic Italian language skills. Although the room I had was not in the front of the hotel and had no view, the benefit to being located on the back side of the hotel was blessed quiet. I can't say if the room facing the Piazza della Rotonda are noisy, but it was nice to be able to sleep in a quiet spot. I was happily surprised at the size of the double (twin bedded) room, based on my previous European hotel experiences, this room and bathroom were extraordinarily spacious. And the room was immaculately clean. I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: sunnyweymouth
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night holiday and we loved everything about this hotel! The location is perfect, the Pantheon and the Piazza have a wonderful atmosphere. We could walk to all the places we wanted to visit and could pack so much into each day as we seemed to be in the centre of everything. The staff are wonderful and very helpful, they recommended a local restaurant which was lovely, more Roman and better value than the tourist restaurants. The views from the roof terrace are a bonus, we had been watching the Piazza on the hotel webcam before our holiday, it was amazing to be standing up there ourselves! Our room was on the second floor, very clean and had everything we needed. Every evening our beds were turned down and chocolates left for us. When the windows were open we could hear noise from the Piazza, but we loved this! A gentle hustle and bustle and music floated up to us. We also loved the breakfasts, bacon and egg, fresh fruit, cereals, toast, pastries and cake, tea and coffee, what more could you want! We used the car service for airport transfers, this was a great way to start and finish our holiday as it was so convenient to be driven from the airport straight to the hotel, and we had some useful tips from the drivers. Vincenzo told us where the best ice-creams are in Rome, at Giolitti's, 5 minutes from the Pantheon, and he was right. We had to check everyday just to make sure! This hotel is wonderful, we plan to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jayteacat
Reviews.Content: Just back after a week long holiday in Rome at the Albergo del Senato. There is a lot that is special about this hotel. The location is amazing with the Pantheon a mere kissing distance away. It's very friendly and all the staff went out of their way to ensure that everything was just as we we would like, nothing was too much trouble for them. We had a junior suite (apartment) on the fifth floor and this consisted of 3 rooms, bathroom and small balcony. It was quiet in the evenings and during the night and was extremely comfortable. Above floor 6, there is an amazing roof terrace that has views all across the city. The bar was closed s it was out of season, however this was no problem as we took a bottle of wine up there anyhow. There are also a few chairs and tables outside the front of the hotel, which were great for watching all that was going on in the piazza during the evening. The del Senato was well placed with restaurants all around and we experienced the good, the bad and the ugly. The best was Antonios which is next to the Tazza D'oro nearby. A good tourist menu type restaurant was Ciro e Ciro which is in the next piazza up from Piazza della Rotunda(turn left out of the hotel, and walk up the piazza and into the next one. Grom's Gelati is just a few metres above this (a real treat). When we return to Rome, there will be only one hotel for us and that is the Albergo del Senato.

Reviews.Title: “A trip to remember”
Reviews.Author: niallmcg
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay close to action so chose this hotel. It was a real gem, close to many of the great tourist sites and right beside the Pantheon. We were very pleased with all aspects of the hotel. The rooms were very nice, spacious and clean. The breakfast was just what we were after. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and nothing was too much to ask for. The location was amazing, to open the window and see the Pantheon each morning was something I will not forget. There was a constant buzz about the piazza but the noise was never a problem, it was the sound of Rome, of people enjoying themselves. There are a lot of nice restaurants close by so eating was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “This has to be the best hotel location in Rome ...........”
Reviews.Author: MikeNorthamptonUK
Reviews.Content: There are so many hotels to choose from in Rome that it's not surprising people get confused with the number of options. Well this is where sites like tripadvisor provide invaluable help. Like many people I was astonished by the choice and as this trip was a surprise for my wife I wanted to make sure I got it right. After a fair amount of research I finalised on th Alberto del senato based on almost faultless tripadvisor feedback (and not just a few reviews, over a thousand) which constantly had this hotel in the top 5 in Rome. Location - unbeatable for me. Might not be for everyone as it is in one of the busiest Piazzas in Rome, but I loved that. I do not believe you can beat the location, it's within 5-10 minutes easy beautiful cobbled backstreet walks to Piazza Navona, Campo do fiord, Spanish steps, the Tiber, Roman forum etc. We always returned to the Piazza for a late nightcap watching the entertainment and crowds. Room - We had room 103 whilst not huge, it was fine for our 3 night stop. It had a fantastic view of the Pantheon and the Piazza. We loved having the windows open and hearing the hustle and bustle - even in the evening listening to the crowds and the musical entertainment (guitarists, singers etc). When the windows are shut you can hear nothing so those of you who don't like the noise will not ned to worry. Staff - friendliest and most helpfull hotel staff I have ever experienced, from front desk to breakfast room. Breakfast - great choice of cereal hams/cheeses, cakes, fresh fruit, yoghurts, bread/rolls and also egg and bacon - set us up for the day and we got by with only an ice cream for lunch (Oh my god the ice creams are fantastic) I cannot speak highly enough about this hotel, which is only a 3 star. If...... No actually 'when' we return to Rome we will 100 % be coming back to the Abergo Del Senato - if you are in any doubt, don't be - just try it !

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: ydkdy715
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Rome for a week and stayed at the Albergo del Senato based on a friend's recommendation. We can not thank her enough. Being on the Piazza gives you a whole different "feel" for being in Rome. In addition to the Pantheon just outside your door, the hotel's location is ideal for walking to many of the major tourist attractions: Piazza Navona, Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Campo de Fiori, etc. If you're into espresso, the perfect cup in the whole world, accoridng to a May 15, 2002 NYT article, is a short two minute walk to the Sant'Eustachio cafe - don't miss it. Tazza D'Oro cafe, just a half-block from the hotel, is a close second.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with the best location!”
Reviews.Author: Drew G
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Senato with my husband and 2 14 year old nephews. First of all, the location is perfect. Directly across from the Pantheon on a beatuful historic square. it is extremely well located to major sites plus even just looking at your window, if you face the Pantheon, one feels one is somewhere special. If you are looking for a Westin or Hilton type of feel or comfort level, this is not it but if you are looking for something that is authentic, charming and well located, stay here. The hotel is extremely clean, not new but modern baths. We had 2 rooms, including one facing the Pantheon. that room was on the smaller side as was the bath but well worth it for the view! The bed was comfortable with nice linens. It can be a bit noisy at night from the street so we asked for a fan for white noise which helped.The breakfast we great-- lots of choices and plenty of food. The staff was fantastic! Very friendly, helpful and charming. After touring all day, especially with kids, it's great to be welcomed back with a smile. Free wifi was a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: AmyMoyer
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Albergo del Senato made our first trip to Rome a true pleasure. Fabulous location, beautiful rooms, wonderful staff. We will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “I loved the top floor balconies”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkarchitect
Reviews.Content: Our room was good but not special in its size or decor. What was special was our small balcony looking our over the Pantheon, which seemed so close that you felt you could practically reach out and touch the dome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Tjosan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights end of march 2012. We got a room on the first floor facing Parthenon and initially we were sceptical as we thought we might be disturbed by sound from the piazza. But the room has an excellent sound insulation so with windows closed and curtains it was quiet. The room-double standard- was ordinary size for a hotel located in old centre. Plenty of toilitries and towels. Breakfast was typically European. We only missed variation in the bread assortment.The breakfast room is somewhat small and we had to wait for a table one morning. The hotel also has an excellent roof terrace overlooking Parthenon and gives an panoramic view of Rome As March is low season the roof terrace bar was not open but after a days sightseeing nice place to relax. The location couldnt be better. In the morning we opened the window and from the bed we had Parthenon about 30 meter from the window. All major Rome attractions are within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Albergo del Denato, Rome”
Reviews.Author: Carl C
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, excellent hotel, first-class service - a memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “so good............”
Reviews.Author: steveblower
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a couple of days staying at Albergo del Senato. Everything you read here is true. The lovely rooms, rooftop area overlooking the Parthenon, nice breakfast with great espresso, fantastic location, they let us check in at 0900!, the free wifi, but most of all was the incredibly friendly and mega helpful staff. That will be the abiding memory.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple stayed in this hotel for our first time in Rome. We were awed at being right next to the Pantheon. What a wonderful memory to be able to look right out to that monument! The people working at the front desk were EXTREMELY welcoming, friendly, and helpful. They assisted us with all our restaurant recommendations. The room was great. We chose a standard room and both couples were upgraded. We had a room with a sitting area and our friend's got the only room with a balcony- what a wondeful surprise! The breakfast was more limited than I had in other hotels, but it was fine- with fruit, cereals, pastries to choose from. Location was perfect and it was great to have a taxi stop right nearby. There is a nice shaded area out in front for hotel guests only to sit and just watch people in the Piazza. Also, the piazza is not loud. We had the windows open during the day and you can hear people below, but it was not loud by any means. There was some soft music playing, which was nice. We did not hear any noises at night. When you get up early enough, you have the Pantheon and piazza to yourself! There were many restaurants in the area. We had coffee at Tazza d'Oro around the corner, which was fantastic. The room was cozy and we slept well. The bathrooms were clean and spacious. There was turndown service every night with a chocolate for us to enjoy- that was a nice touch. All in all, this was our favorite hotel of our trip. The nice touches and friendly staff makes it well worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Tina_Oslo
Reviews.Content: It was great to be back at Albergo del Senato this year in March again! It has been refurbished since last I was there, and the rooms were great! The staff/service friendly and the breakfast worth waking up for!!! We stayed on the 6th floor and had a little mini-terrace looking right down at Pantheon! Fantastic view over the Piazza Rotonda and the amazing Pantheon! Nights and mornings are very quiet, so you will not be disturbed here, also nothing is better than getting up early and having a little stroll on the Piazza and inside the Pantheon before your cappuccino – which can also be enjoyed outside! Evenings are a bit more crowded on the Piazza, but that is ok (at least in March), a bit annoying that all street musicians actually have electric guitars and big speakers.. they are not really THAT good.. and they take few breaks, so during daytime you have a constant concert going on, and it’s hard to have a conversation in the cafes on the Piazza..! They should ban the speakers, but keep the musicians! .. but by the time we got back from dinner it was quiet again! Staying at this hotel you are at the perfect location – in the middle of everything! Walking distance everywhere! But, …when in Rome.. wear sneakers!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: bay60
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in the perfect location. We could easily walk to most attractions. I would not want to stay anywhere else after staying here. The staff was very helpful and courteous. We had a 2 bedroom and our windows opened to the Pantheon Square below. A beautiful sight at night. We loved the rooftop bar. Great views of the city. There are very good restaurants down nearby alleys that are run by families. This is the only place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stay couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: dallasdrc
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome for a week with my wife and two daughters, 10 and 13. I looked for a hotel that had two adjoining rooms and a good location. The Albergo del Senato turned out to be perfect. We had two rooms on the fourth floor, overlooking the Pantheon. By overlooking, I meet you could throw a baseball and hit the A in Agrippa on the facade. It's remarkable to be able to stay in a hotel so close to a major monument. The staff were always friendly and helpfull with restaurant recommendations and arranging taxi service to and from the airport. Breakfast was simple and was always a good way to start the day. The location is ideal. We were able to walk to all major attractions. Like most European hotels, the rooms are small, but not so small that you have to climb over furniture or around doors. The rooms look to have been recently updated and were beautiful. We visited in March during good weather and kept the windows open most of the time. The sounds from the Piazza were always present but never disturbing. We all loved the hotel. For the price it is hard to see why one would want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The Albergo del Senato was Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: MontaukFan
Reviews.Content: This was my families first trip to Italy and we could not have choose a better hotel in Rome. We traveled in the fall of 2007. The room was large with high ceilings and a huge bathroom. The location, steps from the Pantheon, is amazing. They have a roof-top bar where you can have a drink and look out over old Rome and the Pantheon, breathtaking, especially at night! The front desk also set up a private english speaking tour guide for the Vatican for us. She got us right in and gave us a fantastic tour. It was amazing! We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: trravelingdog
Reviews.Content: The Albergo del Senato was an amazing stay. The location is well situated right next to the pantheon - we could almost lean out our window and touch it. Well, not that close, but close. If you don't mind walking, you can walk to almost all of the major sites on foot. Otherwise, taxis are very easily accessible. The front desk staff was extremely accommodating and made fabulous recommendations for sites and restaurants, and the breakfast was just perfect. Our room was on the 4th floor and faced the Pantheon and the fountain. We slept with the window open at night and it was a tad bit noisy. However, it was delightful to hear the sounds of Rome. During the day it was wonderful to return to our room, and then people watch from our window. The Piazza was filled with some sort of music every afternoon. The hotel arranged a car service for us from the airport. After a long day of traveling is was so nice to have a driver waiting for us. The cost was worth it. Lovely hotel - would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location; fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: HoracioLima_Peru
Reviews.Content: Albergo del Senato is an excellent choice for Rome visitors. The location is perfect; beside the Pantheon, close to Piazza Navona and Campo di Fiore. The hotel is very well maintained, albeit small rooms. The bathrooms are in excellent shape. There is a buffet breakfast which is adequate, and a pleasant bar for evening drinks. What is outstanding about this hotel is the service: the staff do go out of their way to be polite and helpful. Highly recommended, at affordable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - one of a kind!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bev_d1978
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a great location - definitely deserves more than a 3* rating. We ordered the private car to and from the airport and when we arrived we were met by a smartly dressed gentleman who took our cases to the vehicle and offered us water before we made our way to the hotel. Would recommend paying the hotel for this service. We stayed in a triple room which had plenty of space and was spotlessly clean. There was a hallway, with a large wardrobe, which led to the bathroom. The hotel staff are wonderful and will go out of their way to help you; they are a credit to the hotel. It was my mother's birthday whilst we were there and they gave us a complimentary drink in the rooftop bar. The views from the rooftop bar are fantastic which overlooks the Pantheon and the Piazza della Rotonda, we spent our evenings having a relaxing drink there listening to the music from the square, prices at the bar are not expensive. The breakfast was great - variety of foods to suit all. There are many restaurants in the square and close vicinity to choose from so no need to venture far in an evening, though they do vary in price. I would love to return to Rome and when I do, I will definitely be returning to Albergo del Senato. I can not recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but slipping a bit?”
Reviews.Author: ccran
Reviews.Content: OK-I'm spoiled. I've been to Rome over30 times in the past 9 years and this has been one of the best hotels. Have stayed here multiple times. The desk staff is great, the location wonderful, etc. This time I noticed that the cleanliness of the rooms was a bit lower. Nothing to turn you off - just not up to previous visits. One night the turndown service was skipped. The brrakfast was definitly "less" than before. Again, nothing that could be called a strike out - just the kind of slips that may indicate a coming, bigger problem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully silent - no traffic!”
Reviews.Author: Ann_Onimme
Reviews.Content: This fine property is next to the Pantheon in an area closed to traffic - horse drawn carriages and pedestrians. Beautiful and elegant building, an excellent breakfast and helpful and friendly front desk. It's classed as 3 Stars so don't expect the same facilities that you get in a 5 star hotel at double the price. As far as location goes, can't get any better.

Reviews.Title: “This is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: BERFB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great find. The rooms are small but spotless, the location is perfect and the staff are very helpful. It is right in the center of all the main attractions so you can walk to everything and even come back to the hotel to regroup in the middle of the day. The piazza is charming and there are great restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: EUHawkeye
Reviews.Content: My family spent 3 nights for a long weekend. We had an apartment (room 501) for 2 adults and 2 small children. There was no view of the Pantheon, but a small balcony to the interior (not much of a view). As mentioned, the location is great, very central. It is within walking distance to most major sites, but be sure you have a good map to assist. With small children, we especially liked the taxi stand adjacent to the Pantheon, as well as telling any taxi driver in the city to go to the Pantheon - no confusion or getting lost! I would also recommend taking a taxi from Fumicino airport (40 Euro flat rate) versus the hotel recommended service (90 Euro). The hotel's taxi vendor was very nice and hospitable, but not worth over twice the cost of a taxi for a couple complimentary bottles of water. The desk staff was very helpful with recommendations and advice and other staff was always courteous. The breakfast was standard, but quite suitable. We would recommend the hotel and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “terrific place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kevin A
Reviews.Content: I picked this Hotel for its reasonable rates and amenities and it was terrific for our short stay. Rooms were a little colorless, but with very clean, full-amenity bathrooms. For this reason, I give it an overall 4 instead of a 5.however, if you're looking for a clean and reasonably priced place to stay in a decent area of Rome. We felt comfortable here and have no reservations about recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Kari R
Reviews.Content: We love the location and friendly, helpful staff. Clean, cozy room with a view of the Pantheon ~ delicious breakfast to start each day ~ walking distance to all of our favorite places! The rooftop terrace is a great feature, perfect for relaxing and watching the sunset after a busy day. We look forward to staying here again the next time we are in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it is that good, and who does the painting??”
Reviews.Author: travelingFelix
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as good as the reviews say. Friendly staff, excellent location, spotlessly clean, comfortable room, great breakfast, free wifi. We loved it. But I want to know, who painted this place? It has a lot of detail (tray ceilings, mouldings, etc) with contrasting cream and brilliant white. The painting is flawless! Not like the stuff we get at home with wiggly seams, spots, and brush marks. This painting is flawless, in every room, without exception, its like some Mchelangelo obsessive compulsive painter did every room..remarkable

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!!”
Reviews.Author: Dashingdarcy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my four month old baby and can't praise the location and staff enough. The room was huge and the portable cot was large and comfortable and beautifully made with sheets and a pillow. The staff were very friendly and helpful, Romans love babies so Oscar was always made a fuss of. The location was the best bit, right next to the pantheon surrounded by tiny cobbled streets, restaurants, cafes and gelato shops. We walked to all the major sights and each was about half an hour or so on foot with a pram. Lastly the roof terrace, which while closed for service in the winter is still open for you to sit up there. We bought some bubbles from a supermarket and got some glasses from the bar. I will always come back to this hotel...fabulous!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Roman Holiday Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YVRflip
Reviews.Content: We were collected by the hotels car service promptly in an E class Mercedes. Well worth the 15Euro premium compared to a taxi from Fiumicino. It was very cold for Rome even though it was winter. We got a very warm welcome from the hotel staff and were upgraded to a room with a view of the Pantheon. The room was small but spotless. The hotel is centrally located with almost all the important sites within walking distance. The breakfast is very good and has a lot choices. Customer service is impeccable. Everyone, from the housekeeping, bellman and the front desk were very helpfully and friendly. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Kim L
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal, overlooking the Pantheon and within walking distance of most of the great sites of Rome. The staff was very cheerful and helpful. The only negative part, and it was significant, is that the room was very overheated. We were stuck between trying to sleep in a room too hot and opening the window, which meant a lot of street noise from the Piazza della Rotonda.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: megan2391
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Albergo del Senato was faultless! It was absolutely incredible. We stayed in the Seminario Suite which was spectacular to wake up in every morning. it was the most amazing moment getting out of the pick up service and realising the location of where we were staying. The staff at this hotel as just as great as the location. Everyone was so nice and friendly, even the cleaning staff! There were so many great restaurants located right near the hotel. I cannot fault this hotel and we really hope to be able to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “On the whole, wonderful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: glencove1
Reviews.Content: I started the headline off with "on the whole" because our initial arrival there was one of the worst and most unpleasant experiences we've had in 40+ years of travel here and abroad. We had reserved a car service through the hotel to pick us up at Fiumincino airport. We arrived after an all-night flight to find no driver waiting for us. We waited 20 minutes. One of us had a cel phone from the U.S. & tried to call the hotel, but couldn't get through. So we got a van service to the hotel (there were four of us so we couldn't fit us & all our bags into a regular cab). When we arrived and I identified myself to the desk clerk (Mauro) he began a harangue that included snarling and sarcasm, insisting that we had not waited for the car service. It was really a disgusting, shocking, inappropriate and disrespectful display. If we hadn't been so tired, we would have looked for another hotel ... but we went upstairs, accompanied by a lovely bellman who had witnessed the incident and tried to make up for it. It is our sincere belief that if we had not been a group of all women -- two lesbian couples -- we would not have been treated that way. I spoke with the night manager later, Ann, and it turned out that there are two possible exits from the area at the airport where we picked up our luggage and the driver was waiting at the other one. All this put a sour taste in our mouths. ----- The hotel itself, however, is a dream. We had reserved superior rooms with balconies and view of the Pantheon. If you can afford it, we recommend those rooms on the 6th floor. There are also two suites on the 6th floor with adorable outside sitting areas overlooking the Pantheon. -- The rooms themselves were very comfortable, well decorated, clean. Very nice bath amenities. & the location couldn't be much better. Quite a good breakfast as well, although we had read complaints on Tripadvisor about it. Good strong coffee, choice of fresh fruit, pastries, yogurt, cakes, cold cereal, ham, cheeses, scrambled eggs, bacon & daily surprises such as quiche. -- By the way, temperature during our week in Rome in February during the day was in the mid-sixties.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean and amazing service...”
Reviews.Author: Julian L
Reviews.Content: There is not much that hasn't been said about this hotel. First and foremost, the rooms are newly renovated and clean. That to me is the most important thing about any hotel. We really loved the central location and the service cound't have been better. Mauro was so helpful and made our trip to Rome a success. For the price of this hotel you really can't go wrong. I will never stay in another hotel when visiting rome.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic long weekend”
Reviews.Author: PKandR
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel which is literally next to the Pantheon and is so well-placed for visiting all the sights in the historic centre of Rome. The hotel is well-kept and comfortable and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. Views from the roof terrace bar are great too. One of our two rooms was overlooking a lane at the side of the hotel so was a little noisy at night but this was the only slight downside to an otherwise enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Best Yet"”
Reviews.Author: JohnC436
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect in every way. Its staff is superb, its location can't be better, its rooms are impeccable. We have just returned from a 4 day stay at the hotel and look forward to our return with great anticipation. Would not consider staying anywhere else in Rome. Thank you for such a memorable visit.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THIS HOTEL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nadine Y
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite hotel EVER! The perfect location is second only to the amazing staff who make us feel like Barack & Michelle (sans Secret Service!) every visit. The recent room renovations are fabulous and have gotten rave reviews from our traveling companion who is an 11-time Emmy winner for Set Decoration. Every trip to Rome reiterates the sayings "All roads lead to Rome" and that Rome is the Eternal City. With the Pantheon just steps away from this hotel's front door, you can almost reach out and touch this ancient foundation for modern architecture from your room window if you're lucky enough to score one with a view of the Piazza. Seeing the Pantheon either very late at night or very early in the morning while the city is sleeping is like having it to yourself - an indescribable feeling. (You can get up early and take a short walk to the nearby Trevi Fountain and have a similar experience there which is in sharp contrast to seeing it typically packed dozens deep.) You can people watch visitors from all around the globe while having a refreshment outside at the hotel's front door piazza patio lounge or enjoy the breathtaking panoramic view of the city's skyline from the hotel's rooftop bar. Conveniently and centrally located, the Senato is either a short walk or cab ride away from Rome's major attractions & highlights. This also makes it accommodating for any inclement weather (hot or cold) or to take short breaks in the day to adjust for jet lag or other fatigue. After check-in, the amazing staff greets you by name and provides over-the-top personalized attention. They'll provide directions with maps, make reservations & offer recommendations. Anne, Alessandra, Mauro, Michele, Giuseppe & Adem make us feel like old friends and personify Italian hospitality at its finest. We are anxiously awaiting our next visit with sweet anticipation like children for Christmas. We stayed at two different hotels on previous visits to Rome, but staying at the Senato completely changed our entire experiences in this magical wondrous city. We now cannot consider wasting our vacation time by staying anywhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic again”
Reviews.Author: dean j
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from another fantastic stay at Albergo del Senato. Everything about this hotel is just wonderful - room, location, breakfast, bar, and especially the staff who never cease to amaze with their friendliness, knowledge, politeness and professionalism. Thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MYZoTo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 day trip to Rome. This hotel is great - rooms immaculate, location utterly amazing and staff extremely helpful. I can`t think of a single negative other than the fact that I did not want to come home!

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: mayo73
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short break in Rome, celebrating my wedding anniversary.my husband and I arrived at noon and we were told we had been upgraded as we were celebrating our anniversary, the room was fabulous (room 310) the ceiling was like something form the Vatican ,fab! Four poster bed,dressing gown,slippers ,minibar ,tea/coffee making facilities.the staff were very friendly and efficient , nothing was too much for them, breakfast was continental ,ideally situated beside the pantheon. Thanks to all for a great stay ,it made our anniversary,would definitely stay there again if visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Romes Best”
Reviews.Author: GariJenny
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a fabulous weekend proposing to my girlfriend. The Location of the Hotel is unbeatable and the rooms and service are better than any 4 star I have even stayed in, and that's quite a few. Every member of staff was helpful and very friendly, The rooms and level of decor were to a very high standard and we just had standard room, I cant imagine what the deluxe rooms are like, I will be telling all my friends, and I will be returning

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, scene and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LEB71
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a 40 hour stopover in Rome. We didn't spend much time there other than to sleep, but the rooms were very comfortable and quiet. That was especially impressive since our room overlooked the piazza in front of the Pantheon. A wonderful location to walk and explore to the South, including the Colosseum, and then to the North/West for the Fountains and Vatican. Don't forget the fab espressos shops along nearly every piazza!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: supergym2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great panoramic view over the Pantheon and surrounding ancient part of the city. It was luck for us to get a perfect a room on the top most floor and with an access to rooftop terrace. Smartly combined room was very nice. Perfect support by the hotel staff made us delighted. We would for sure return to visit all this great sites of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “the best stay”
Reviews.Author: michael n
Reviews.Content: my wife and i recently spent our wedding aniversary here to say we were well looked after would be on under statment ,i dont remeber ever staying in a hotel with staff so friendly and helpful on our arrival we were informed we had been upgraded to a room that when you lay on your bed you think michael angelo stayed here for a while and painted the cieling thank you all for making our stay so special

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Nick-sticks-Pearson
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights here in September 2011 and was very pleased. The view from our window was of the Pantheon and the bustling square of happy people and in the evening buskers playing their music, great sound and atmosphere. But close the windows, shutters and curtains and all is serene inside. The rooftop bar gives good views of Rome both night and day. For us all the major sites are within walking distance, we only used a tour bus to visit the Appian Way. This meant we could see one site in the morning and easily nip back if needed to freshen up or rest before going to another or before going out to eat in the evening. For an early start trip to Pompei (pre-booked with Viator.com) we walked to the other side of the square to get a taxi to take us to the coach office near the train station. Being whisked around the empty narrow streets of Rome was another fun experience you would not get during the day. We are thinking of going back to Rome and even though we will be travelling further to see the sites we missed we will be staying here again. There is no restaurant but this is not needed because it is surrounded by them and you would rather eat outside looking at the Pantheon or some other wonderfull site and watch the people walk by. Breakfast is continental, cereals, cheeses and cold meats, the usual affair with some hot food but don't expect a full English cooked breakfast, you are in Rome after all. I would also recommend booking the airport to Hotel taxi pick up. Being met at the airport by the driver and taken directly to the hotel starts the holiday just right with no worries of being ripped off as you can read about. The same return taxi journey back to the airport is also worth doing but you just book that at reception a few days before leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: antonioandgemma
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful wonderful hotel, in an even more wonderful location. We went on this trip as a treat for my partner and I for one night, principally to go out dinner ("we're going out for dinner love", "ooh, where?", "er, Rome"), and I wanted to get it all absolutely right. We booked this on the various high recommendations on tripadvisor and elsewhere, at a really good rate thru Expedia. On arrival, we were upgraded to a superior room with the most magnificent view of the Pantheon and the square - the most delightful view in the most romantic city on earth. Opening the windows up and listening tothe hustle and bustle and music and singing was magical, as magical as being able to close them and the noise out at bed time. The staff were always attentive and helpful without being too ott; the room and public areas are well decorated, very marbly and ornate but in a stylish manor. Location wise, it is perfect - a 3 minute stroll to piazza Navona for lunch or a coffee and to absorb the 4 river statue or the bustling caricaturists in the square, walk the other way and the Trevi fountain and Spanish steps are several minutes away, all the while meandering through cobbled streets with small interesting shops and boutiques along the way. We had breakfast in Campo dei fiori which is a 5 minute walk away too. So the trip was a success in terms of accommodation and location; dinner wasn't such a success - see our review on the Onego restaurant at the Hassler - not good. We felt really really lucky to be alive being in Rome, near the Pantheon, in this hotel; we have always loved this area; we have now found our favourite hotel to stay at when we return. This is what it's all about - If you stay here and don't feel full of passion and love and life, then you must be walking through life with your eyes wide shut. Life's short - come here and you will feel happy to be alive. Promise.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: Pervin C
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend had booked the trip as a birthday gift for me as i had always wanted to visit Rome and he could not have picked a better hotel for our visit. The Albergo del Senato is ideally situated right next to the Pantheon overlooking the Piazza della Rotonda. Its not every day you get to look out of your bedroom window at views like that. Even though we visited during romes worst snowfall in nearly three decades it just added to the beauty of it all. The staff were fantastic, very warm and friendly and always willing to help with a smile and joke. If only you could bottle staff like that, all hotels would be a delight!!! The hotel itself was devine, our room had a sense of opulence, the breakfasts a perfect start. I would most certainly recommend this hotel to anyone and would most definately stay there again. Out of ten? a well deserved 11 !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful June Stay at a First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeBson
Reviews.Content: My wife, 23 year old daughter and I stayed at the Albergo del Senato for one week in June 2011. After reading several TripAdvisor reviews, we decided to book our stay there over other area hotels. We were not disappointed ... here is why: * Service - The service at the hotel was much more outstanding than typical rated hotels. There was never a moment when the staff wasn't "on hand", offering suggestions for dinner, dessert, coffee, and so on. * Location - I can promise there is not a better location in all of Rome. When other reviews say the Pantheon is located close by, that does not adequately do it justice. Walking out the front door, you are easily less than 25 yards away from it's front door! Our suite overlooked the beautiful architectural relic, and it felt like we could "touch it" every moment! Also an easy walk 5-15 minute to all of the popular tourist spots ... no need for taxis. And lots and lots of wonderful dinner places within a 5 minute walk. We are returning to Rome this coming June with our two adult children and will most definitely book the Albergo del Senato ... we would not consider another place!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: GarethRhysMorgan
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and far more impressive than the official 3 star rating. Had a great room on the 4th floor overlooking the Pantheon, very comfortable stay. Mauro on reception was very helpful and his restaurant recommendations were spot on. Breakfast good but could do with some more hot selection. Overall, very pleased with the choice and wouldnt hesitate to suggest this hotel for anyone wanted to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “My all-time favorite”
Reviews.Author: runnergirl1970
Reviews.Content: I am a Rome-a-holic. I've been there 89 times (and I'm not *that* old!), sometimes for weeks but more often for a quick 24-hour fix. I found the Albergo del Senato in 2001 and haven't stayed anywhere else since. The staff is friendly, helpful and discreet--last year, after I went to bed early with jet-lag, my husband and his best pal wanted to go out dancing; the night deskman told him, "I've known your wife many years, and the only places open now are places I would not send her husband." Now that's service! The views of the Piazza della Rotonda are wonderful, and you're only steps away from the best coffee in the world. The rooms can be small, but tastefully decorated. One tiny drawback is the lack of fast wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in a super location”
Reviews.Author: John A
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that I would definitely recommend - we stayed here for 5 nights from 14 January 2012. All of the staff are friendly and helpful and it is in a perfect location - we walked everywhere. I'd booked a standard double room, but what we got (Room 207) was more of a suite with a large bathroom and splendid view of the square and the Pantheon. We will definitely use this hotel again when we re-visit Rome. (I've written about our holiday here: http://www.jalodrome.com/rome/)

Reviews.Title: “Grazie Mille!”
Reviews.Author: ilReLeone
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely amazing and should be ranked first! If you go to Rome you definitely need to stay here and book a room that has a view of the Pantheon. I went with my brother about a week and a half ago, and we had an absolute blast. The rooms are spotless: you leave in the mornings to have breakfast (which by the way is also amazing, including lovely custard filled pastries and tonnes of savour elements to choose from as well) and the maids have already cleaned your room when you go back. And don't miss the nutella pots tucked in the corner of the breakfast room! The views are amazing, the beds so comfortable, and there is always a chocolate on your pillow and a pair of slippers waiting for you each night. However it's the people that run this hotel that make it so amazing! It was my first time travelling anywhere, let alone overseas, and Alessandra and Mauro especially made me feel safe, comfortable and at home. Being in my late teens and having to spend my 19th away from home wasn't as sad as I thought it was going to be, as I was greeted later on that night with a bottle of champagne, two glasses and a handwritten letter from Mauro at the front desk! :) Honestly, these people and this place is amazing! Book it if you ever go to Rome!!!!!!! And it's also central! The Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Colosseum are all within walking distance, including major streets like Via Del Corso.

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: Tim T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo three nights before a cruise. The location was outstanding. The price was a little more than what we wanted to pay but the location made up for it. The staff was super friendly and helpful. My first day there I wasn't paying attention while walking in front of the hotel and ended up getting bitten by a horse that was attached to a carriage. The lady at the front desk was there immediately insuring I was alright. We had one of the rooms near the top floor with a balcony overlooking the Piazza della Rotonda and the Pantheon. The hotel is within walking distance of a bunch of landmarks that I have always wanted to see while in Rome. We will definitely stay there again if and when we ever return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: TiggywinkleLondon
Reviews.Content: Perfect location overlooking the Pantheon. We were fortunate to have a room on the top floor with a small balcony which was amazing but there is also a rooftop terrace with fabulous views. Room was small but perfectly formed and the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The location is perfect for visiting all of the major sites and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: alitravels
Reviews.Content: A well-situated beautiful hotel. Lovely employees and nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime Roman retreat”
Reviews.Author: CUinSF
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an immediate connection to Rome and its history, nothing could be better than being 50 steps from the Pantheon, one of the most iconic of Roman sites. This hotel sits on the delightful Piazza Rotonda, fronting onto a cobblestone piazza with splashing fountain and obelisk, and a world class view from all the windows. Old world charm is present throughout, from the beautiful, traditional lobby to the uniquely furnished rooms. Bathrooms are huge, and many overlook the piazza as well. A charming roof top bar terrace, available only to hotel guests, puts you at roof (and Pantheon dome) level with this old part of the city. Perhaps the most distinguishing feature of this hotel, other than the wonderful and attentive service and clean rooms, is the absolute change that happens once you enter the front doors; the noise and hustle of Roman life are left behind as you enter a tranquil, civilized respite from the crowds beyond the front doors. Also, the rooms have acoustically insulated windows with heavy drapery, so even the late night cafe crowds in the piazza won't spoil your sleep. Another great feature is the highly efficient AC, which if you travel during the summer months (it was 94 in August during our stay) you will appreciate! Highly recommended as a way of making your visit to Rome an unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just exquisite ...”
Reviews.Author: SouthforkTx
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location - must be one of the best in all of Rome Superb quality 'boutique-style' hotel - plenty space to have a quiet seat around the foyer if waiting for friends. Rooftop terrace gives fabulous views and perfect for aperitif or evening drinks. Room quality excellent. Staff extremely helpful although terrace barman felt undervalued and wasn't do loyal as not to moan about it - I'd do his job in an instant!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent venue”
Reviews.Author: 81__Michael_
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights from 20/01/2012. The location is the major selling point of this hotel, central enough for all the major sites and overlooking Pantheon - as stated the view from the front of the hotel has to be one of the best in Europe. The staff are fantastic, very friendly and helpful, they went out of their way to make us feel welcome and it instantly made the hotel the right choice. Its a simple thing but having a conversation with someone rather than simply handing them a room key can go a long way. The rooms are very well decorated and there isn't anything you could fault. The breakfast is a standard continental breakfast (cold meats, cheese and bread with a choice of cereals or fruit) - not fantastic but you wont find many "fry ups" being served elsewhere. I aim to return to Rome to try and see all the things we missed during our stay, I will be staying at this hotel again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Times in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Richard I
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Albergo del Senato in Rome on two occasions on the same trip (with a multi-day trip to Florence in between). The location absolutely cannot be beat (facing the Pantheon on the Piazza della Rotonda). The staff were exceedingly helpful with museum reservations, dinner recommendations and reservations , etc. Although it is an older building (it is Rome, after all) the rooms have obviously been renovated recently and are all top rate, as are the common areas as well. The price is certainly not budget, but neither is it outrageous and it is certainly worth the value. We were upgraded for the second stay to a room that actually overlooked the Pantheon. We will go back again whenever we go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Top floor room with balcony overlooking the Pantheon.”
Reviews.Author: George-and-Paul
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Great staff. Great location next to the Pantheon. Good location for walking to the Colosseum, and to the Vatican area. Understand though that we consider a half-hour or more walk quite enjoyable. We went to Rome, Florence and Venice, and only took 6 taxi rides, to/from the airport in Rome, and to/from train stations. Otherwise, we walked everywhere and loved seeing everything that way. We're 53 and 60 years old.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better than this”
Reviews.Author: SwissBrit-1283
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a rare gem set right opposite the Pantheon. My husband and I were given a small but lovely room in full view of the Pantheon for just 130 Euros including breakfast. The entire experience was perfect, starting with the concerierge Mauro's calligraphy and amazing language skills. He really made us feel at home. Many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Camm_SP
Reviews.Content: Albergo del Senato is located in front of Pantheon, and it is really close to almost all the tourist attraction in Rome. The neighbourhood is really safe and you can stroll during the night and tasting a wonderful italian gellato (try Giolitti, 5min from the hotel). Our room on the 3rd floor was renovated and spotless clean, with an unbeatable view of the piazza and Pantheon. Sound-proof windows provided us good nights of sleep, even when the Piazza della Rotonda was full of people in the mornings. I need to mention the impecable and friendly staff, specially Mauro - a truly italian gentleman at the front desk! We were in Rome for the Xmas period, and it was a greatful surprise to find a bucket with ice and a complimentary bottle of Prosecco on the Christmas Eve. Please, look no further. Don't waste your time trying to find a better place to stay in Rome. This is the place! Amazing location, surrounded by some good small italian restaurants (try La Sagrestia, at Via del Seminario - 2min walking from the hotel). I am confident to say that choosing Albergo del Senato enhanced our Rome trip!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: BSCRaleigh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo in December. We had 2 rooms one with a perfect view of the Patheon and the other with a cute balcony (a little cold but nonetheless perfect). The staff was amazing, we arrived early in the morning and our rooms were ready. Breakfast is large and the staff very attentive. The front desk team is helpful, courteous, and knowledgeable. It was the perfect stay...Directly across the cobblestones was a perfect sandwich shoppe, attended by a lovely group of people.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay here. After my family went on a Rick Steve's tour, we decided to stay in Rome for 2 extra days and stayed here. We had 2 rooms a suite and a room with 2 queens. The rooms were fantastic, the staff terrific. My room was on the highest floor and our small balcony looked direcly at the Pantheon. Its the best view of a hotel i've ever been too or ever heard about, it was EPIC

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to see Rome”
Reviews.Author: The_Boo_Radleys
Reviews.Content: Origionally picked as an overnight stay close to all the attractions of Rome, the Albergo would now be our choice and recommendation for a stay in the Eternal City. The hotel is superbly placed in Pantheon Square with great restaurents and typical Italian cafes on its doorstep. Rooms are spotlessly clean and if you can book one, the 5th floor with a balcony overlooking the square gives you an opportunity to soak up the wonderfully busy atmosphere of the scene below. The roof top bar offers spectacular views across the city from the Colleseum to the Vatican and sipping cocktails as the sun set over Rome was a sureal experience. This experience was added to by the wonderful staff making mocktails to keep the children happy ensuring all enjoyed the experience. Certianly, given the opportunity, we would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Elaine K
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay at the Albergo del Senato. First time in Rome and this is an absolute gem for exploring the city. Location is perfect and all the major sights are truly within walking distance with a huge variety of restaurants and wine bars in the immeidate vicininty to choose from. The room was cosy, clean and the view was breathtaking but as previous reviewers have said, its all about the staff and service at this hotel and a special thanks to the lovely Mauro who made this an extra special stay. Dont hesitate, just book, you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay at the Albergo del Senato”
Reviews.Author: Alec M
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location in the center of Rome. Gorgious breakfasts. Just ask the concierges for anything you are looking for. They will give you the right information in different languages

Reviews.Title: “Second stay even better than the first...”
Reviews.Author: TexasAMC3
Reviews.Content: ...and that's saying a lot! Absolutey love this hotel for its location; beautiful, comfortable, immaculate rooms; and most of all, the lovely, professional, dedicated staff who, once again, were so welcoming and made me feel at home. I cannot thank them enough for their help, care and concern when my friend became ill and needed a doctor. Of all the places I've stayed this is one of the best hotel experiences ever. This was my second stay at the del Senato in 5 years and I never will stay elsewhere when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location and perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: sisinbc
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all of the staff! First, there were the quick and detailed responses to my e-mail questions regarding choosing a room at the hotel and requests for additional information about the hotel. Next, we were on an extended trip on two different cruise lines. We had a day in Rome on our first cruise and then we embarked in Civitavecchia on our second cruise. I contacted the hotel and asked if we might drop off one of our suitcases when we were in Rome for the day and have them store it until our arrival for our stay at the hotel. “Yes” was the immediate response and, when we dropped off the suitcase, we knew from the warm welcome at that time that we had chosen the perfect hotel. For our stay at the hotel, we had booked a driver from the hotel to pick us up at the airport. He was waiting outside the baggage claim holding a sign with our name. The check in staff and all staff were wonderful throughout our stay. Service is definitely a high priority at this hotel. There is a circular stairway that goes to all floors if you don’t want to use the very small (slow) elevator. We were in suite 606, a penthouse suite. In the entrance hallway there is a closet. The bedroom had a king bed, large closet, TV, and patio doors leading outside to a small terrace that held a table and two chairs. The terrace looks directly over the Pantheon and Piazza della Rotonda. There is a second area where there are a single sofa bed, chair, coffee tables, minibar, coffee/tea maker and supplies, luggage area as well as additional TV/phone/drawers. The large window in this room also overlooks the Pantheon and the piazza. The bathroom has a fabulous shower, two sinks, a bathtub, and all the amenities that one could want. We had booked a rate that included breakfast and that was offered in the breakfast room on the main floor. The breakfast was good but the hotel could improve the experience for guests by explaining that there are items that can be ordered. For example, eggs and cappuccino must be ordered through the wait staff. However, even if you only eat from the items on display, you will not go hungry. Finally, most of the major tourist sites, with the exception of the Vatican City, are within walking distance. There are two shops within a couple of minutes where one can buy groceries (water, wine, cheese, specialty items, etc.) on the small streets leading to the square. The non-tourist grocery store across the square from the hotel had the best prices. The hotel is also in an unbeatable location for immersing oneself in the history of Rome, having fine or casual dining experiences, and people watching. We could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Service and location could not be faulted.”
Reviews.Author: PerthJackson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early December and had a room at the rear of the hotel. I was originally disappointed as our room looked out onto the rear of other buildings, however it was actually a godsend as it was so quiet at night and we were able to leave our windows open to get fresh air in through our room. The room, although small, was very well furnished and there was plenty of room for luggage and enough room to move around without tripping over either furniture or belongings. The bathroom was newly renovated and was spacious and extremely clean with good toiletries available. The breakfast provided was of excellent quality and freshness and items were varied daily. Staff at reception and in the breakfast area were friendly, polite and exceptionally helpful at all times. Location was perfect. Would I stay here again - you bet!

Reviews.Title: “First class !”
Reviews.Author: LLG1976
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, rooms, location and staff. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location, Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cintemani
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed in Albergo del Senato for three nights. The hotel is a boutique hotel with a very good management in a very good location. The room was very good - quite spacious, clean, nicely decorated, with free wi-fi. The bathroom was also very good - spotless and everything worked fine. Breakfast buffet was much more than adequate. The location was superb. Our room had a nice view of the Pantheon. The hotel is in a walking distance to all of the highlights in the old part of the city. There are lots of restaurants and cafes very close to the hotel. The people at the front desk and the breakfast room was very courteous and helpful. We would certainly consider staying in Albergo del Senato in our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Senato Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RST-NYC
Reviews.Content: My family of seven people spent nine days during the Christmas-New Year Holidays at this lovely small hotel. We had three rooms, each of which was lovely. One, a suite without a view from the window had the most incredible view INSIDE the room: a genuine fresco on the ceiling. It had a four-poster bed, lots of space and a small separate dressing room which was perfect for the one-year old that travelled with us. We had a second suite with a small terrace with a million dollar view of the Pantheon. The third room was a superior twin-bedded room with an even better view of the Pantheon. The location speaks for itself and there is none better. It faces a very active piazza but is actually quite quiet after 8 PM (except for New Years eve of course with firecrackers all over Rome). There is still more: the quality, helpfulness, friendliness and professionalism of all the staff, including the front desk, reservation department, breakfast room servers, and others was outstanding. We plan to definitely return to this gem of a hotel in the best location in the best city.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Elegance and Service”
Reviews.Author: FSHphd
Reviews.Content: The Albergo del Senato is a lovely hotel next to the Pantheon. The rooms are well-appointed, the staff is most helpful and pleasant, and the morning breakfast is delightful. I was quite pleased with the hotel and absolutely plan to stay there again. Although somewhat expensive, though consistent with similar hotels in Rome, I was pleased with my short stay there.

Reviews.Title: “First time,but not the last”
Reviews.Author: kandamort
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay immensely, our lovely room overlooked the Piazza della Rotonda. The staff were excellent, the location is the best we have ever experienced in Rome and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Seat_0A
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in the best location in Rome. It is clean, modernized and comfortable. Excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaijaH
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at Albergo del Senato. The first stay in 2008 was a lovely one, this second stay in October 2011 was a perfect one! I was once again lucky to get a room with a view to Piazza della Rotonda and Pantheon - the view that I enjoyed so much. The hotel reception staff was extremely friendly and helpful all the time. My special thanks go to Alessandra and Mauro who did all they could to get me enjoy my stay at Senato. I arrived before noon, but was lucky to get my room at once - oh how much I enjoyed its view and a small balcony I had! The room is not that big, but there is everything you need and the location, that can not be beaten! You can walk everywhere, to Vatican, to Colosseum, to Trastevere... and admire the lovely historic Rome. The room had a lovely bed, a safety deposit box, minibar, lovely bathroom. I travelled solo so I also appreciated a location for that purpose. I felt so safe to return to the hotel even later in the evening and also loved thr chance to join the life ar Piazza della Rotonda staying at the square or staying at the balcony of my hotel room listening to the music in the square later in the evening. Breakfast was ok, but nothing so special to be honest. However, after having breakfast at the hotel, there was no need to eat anything until at lunch time. Besides, I love to have my morning coffee and something to eat at the hotel, that way the mornings start so easily and calmly. The price of the room is not cheap, but I think I got such a lovely rom, service and location that it was well worth their price. I tend to spend quite some time to choose my hotels and am prepared to spend some extra money to go to the nice place, so I harldly have been disappointed with my hotels recently. However, it is not always when I can say that I loved the place where I stayed - I did it with Albego del Senato - with my favourite hotel! I'm looking forward to return there. Albergo del Senato is definitely my hotel for my next visit in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Just Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: PensionerflyingNanny
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews - but - this Hotel is exceptional and deserves praise. From the minute you step through the doors of the Hotel, you are truly cared for by all the staff. From our previous visit 4 years ago, you can see that they retain their members of staff, which in itself is a recommendation. The standards of cleanliness is exceptional. The breakfasts are substantial and varied. The helpfulness of all the staff is outstanding - they made my birthday stay really special. Well done Albergo del Senato - see you on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great position and amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: econokal
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise this hotel enough and certainly intend to return with my family. Best friend and I went on a girlfriend holiday and the Albergo is perfectly positioned adjacent to the Pantheon with an exquisite view from the window over the piazza and to the Pantheon itself. Bedroom cosy and bathroom small but more than adequate. Staff absolutely amazing- friendly and helpful ( even lost my diamond ring and this was returned to me in an envelope on return from my trip out sight seeing that day!) Mauro, Luca and Alessandra were knowledgeable and ever wiling to assist and help. Our stay was made all the more pleasant by them and also great restaurant referrals Hotel very close to the main shopping areas and you can shop and walk till you drop! Adem at breakfast very attentive and friendly. Cannot fault this hotel or its location. Will definitely recommend and return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay at Albergo Del Senato”
Reviews.Author: NTS_2011
Reviews.Content: My mom and I had a wonderful stay at Albergo Del Senato - the location is fantastic, within walking distance of many of the historic sites in Rome and close to a major bus stop/main street (that connects you with Termini and the Vatican City). The hotel is well-maintained, looks lovely, and the staff (from the front desk, the bell boys, to the servers/hostess in the breakfast room) was very professional, courteous and extremely helpful! Our room overlooked the Pantheon/Piazza, was well-appointed, and clean. They ensured that we had a pleasant stay and even surprised us with a bottle of Proseco on my mom's birthday! All in all - a great experience. I'll definitely go back to Del Senato the next time I visit Rome (hopefully, the coin thrown in the Trevi Fountain will do the magic soon) :)

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Imanuelle
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with very service mined staff. One get a personal service. I will be back

Reviews.Title: “Could not find a fault!!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay in Rome over 6 nights. The Hotel was extremely clean and the rooms quiet. It has a wonderful Bar on the Rooftop which was great for a pre or post dinner drink. From the moment we arrived to the day of our departure, every staff member we had contact with was extremely professional and pleasant. All our needs were catered for efficiently and with a smile. Would not hesitate in recommending this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location...best service...best comfort”
Reviews.Author: Linda E
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for a relaxing stop in Rome. Just stroll onto the piazza and watch the action. Beautifully detailed hotel and the staff was the best. Helped my teenage son arrange some tours and even helped find him when the tour company dropped him off at the wrong hotel. We spent 3 days in a very hot August but the rooms were cool and fresh and the evenings in the piazza are something I will never forget (opera singers at your very door) and a view of the Pantheon from the roof top lounge area. I have traveled very very frequently for business ....staying in the top 5 star hotels and resorts in Europe, N & S America and this little gem compares quite nicely. No room service, but this makes you venture out next door or across the street and enjoy the atmosphere even more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: mike b
Reviews.Content: Great location and great staff made this hotel the perfect spot for our Roman holiday. The rooms on the 6th floor have balconies looking out on the Pantheon and Piazza della Rotunda.

Reviews.Title: “my best holiday”
Reviews.Author: srutihari
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were planning to visit Rome for a week after a week's stay in Tuscany. This was our first visit to the city and we didn't have too much time to do much planning. We were going on a holiday after a long time and being busy professionals we wanted to make best use of our holiday time. So we were very particular that we stayed in a very good place and most importantly we wanted to soak in as much Rome as we can for a week. So the location of our hotel was very important for us. We had a difficult time to narrow down our place of stay because most places that were located in a good locality did not look very impressive online. We finally chose this hotel hearing that it had a view of the Pantheon and the location was also close to most popular places in Rome. Unfortunately when we called for a booking they said they cannot guarantee us a room with the view of Pantheon. So we decided to take a risk anyway and also decided to spoil ourselves by booking the suite for the last 2 days which guaranteed a balcony and a great view. From the moment we arrived at the hotel we have had a wonderful experience. Our room did finally have a great view, the staff were very courteous, the breakfast buffet was yummy and the services and cleanliness were at its best. We loved our rooms (both the regular and the suite) so much that we chose to stay in our room on the last day without going out anywhere. Just watching people going about with their activities at the Piazza was an amazing experience.the view of the Pantheon under different lighting of the day and night was truly magical! I would recommend anybody visiting Rome to consider this hotel and i would go back again if i had a chance to visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View, Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Amanda F
Reviews.Content: There is nothing more memorable then waking up every morning in Rome and seeing the Pantheon out the window. The room was a really nice size for Europe...same size as some hotels here in the States. The location was perfect. We only used a car twice...from the airport and to the airport. We walked everywhere else! I cannot wait to return to Rome and when I do I will be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-rooms a little small.”
Reviews.Author: LDBlock
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice during my trip to Italy-for 3 nights at the beginning and 1 night before going to the airport. For the first stay, I had reserved a single, but was upgraded to a double overlooking the Pantheon and Piazza Rotunda (room 303). The bed was great, but took up most of the room. The bathroom was huge! The second one-night stay I received the single room that I had reserved (301-next to the elevator) and it was tiny with no view. The breakfast was unremarkable. The rooftop bar had stunning views. As has been noted in other reviews, the location is fantastic. Several really good restaurants are very nearby - Hosteria Pantheon, Armando di Pantheon, and Nice Ice for gelato. Staff was very professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Luca is the best.”
Reviews.Author: Joann C
Reviews.Content: Albergo del Senato Plaza della Rotonda 73-00186 Roma Dear Sir or Madam, This is a very long, overdue letter in appreciation of the great service we received at your hotel October, 2008, by Luca. When we (my husband, myself and my niece Lisa Amoroso) arrived at your hotel, Luca smiled and welcomed to us to the hotel, he asked “how are you” we explained to him that we were not very happy. The car we hired from the airport could not find the hotel and we had been driving in circles, passing the same streets for 45 minutes. The driver became frustrated and left us off several blocks from the hotel, told us to walk straight, make a right turn and our hotel would be there. Luca listened to our story and said he was sorry we had a problem but everything would be alright now. Our room had been upgraded and we would have a good time in Rome. We then told him that my husband, who is a diabetic, left the United States without his insulin. Luca once again listened to our story and then said “no problem”, he immediately picked up the telephone, called the pharmacy around the corner from the hotel, explained the situation and arranged for someone from the hotel to walk us to the pharmacy. Luca once again smiled and said he would have our luggage delivered to the room while we were at the pharmacy. We then told him we did not have any luggage because our luggage did not make it to Rome and was most probably still in the Heathrow Airport.
