Luca smiled and replied “senora, now you have a problem.” We laughed, and said we knew but we would continue our trip in hope that everything would work itself out. We were only going to be in Rome for the night, we were continuing on to Egypt the next morning, if our luggage did not get there soon we did not know if it would ever catch up with us. That night we met a friend of ours who is a priest and studying in Rome, and went out for a terrific Roman dinner. Fortunately, our luggage arrived at the hotel very early the next day. Everything went well at the pharmacy and we were able to pick up the insulin around 9:00 a.m. We checked out of the hotel at 11:00 went back to the airport and flew to Egypt. Whenever I relay the story to friends and family I always say I have to write a letter of appreciation for all that Luca did to help us enjoy our stay in Rome. All this time I had very good intentions of writing. It does not seem possible that three years have gone by without me doing so. I apologize that it has taken me this long. But at least I know I have finally given thanks to someone who really deserves it for going well beyond what was expected and solving our problems. So many times people write or complain about things that go wrong, I feel it is more important to thank and congratulate the people who help to make things go right. So once again I apologize for not writing this letter sooner. I hope Luca still works for you hotel and continues to greet and help your patrons with the same grace and good humor he welcomed us to your fine establishment. Sincerely yours, Joann Campo

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: StevenMK
Reviews.Content: Located right next door to the Pantheon, location is central to all Rome tourist sites, allowing you to walk everywhere! Throw in gracious hotel staff, clean rooms big enough for an extra bed for our teenage son and breakfast each morning...it was a gem. Of course being close to some of the best gelato (Geolitti and Del Parma) made it that much better. Highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service,really professional, amazing location looking out perpendicular to the Pantheon.”
Reviews.Author: Shikon67
Reviews.Content: Brought my partner here for her birthday. Great reception from the staff fantastic service all round It seems really genuine. The view from our room was a fist floor front view of the square and fountain with stunning views of what is now my fa Pureite building the Pantheon. Would definitely recommend this hotel if you are coming to Rome and you can easily walk everywhere from here.

Reviews.Title: “A holiday to remember!!!”
Reviews.Author: AshvitaFineLiving
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself had planned on a week long vacation to Rome. We found this hotel through Trip Advisor and the various photos posted here. We figured that the location was good as it was outside the Pantheon. We called the hotel to book a room reservation. We were calling from India. The hotel staff made it so easy. We however were extremely insistent that our room had a view. They told us there were no guarantees on a view but would do their best. With that little hope we made the booking. There are no words to describe the immense sense of joy we felt driving right to the heart of ancient rome. The taxi pulled up right outside the Pantheon and the taxi driver pointed us to the hotel. Our jaws dropped. Still not sure of the view we rode up the tiny elevator to our 4th floor room. Once inside, even the gods could not have planned our view better. We literally were looking at the Pantheon and the square below. The fountain, music, restaurants, people, life and Rome were all at our window's view. Need we say more... our holiday was perfect! But wait! it got better. On the third day, we had to move to another room due to some availability issues and were given the penthouse suit! What we thought was a perfect holiday got even better! We had a whole sit down balcony and a bottle of campaign in the room!!! Well we did pay substantially more for this room but as they say, can you put a price on beauty? The hotel staff were very courteous. One day I decided to stay in and enjoy the balcony view. When I got in the room was clean!!! the house keeping wizard lady did the most amazing and quick cleaning job i have ever seen. Morning breakfasts are quite filling. The waiter took good care of us every morning. All i would like to say is: if you can manage to stay here on your visit to Rome, surely you will thank me for this advice :)

Reviews.Title: “Gracious piazza, nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: AnnonUs
Reviews.Content: ROOM: The hotel is renovating rooms and they look great. We first booked the apartment but upon arrival shifted to a renovated room. Don't get me wrong, the apartment was fine (and HUGE with 3 big rooms) but for $400 I wanted something with more "uumph". Our new room faced the Piazza/Pantheon. VERY VERY HAPPY with room. It was delightful. Big, bright, beautifully appointed. One of the few hotels that provided bath robes. STAFF: The hotel staff were extremely helpful in changing room, booking cars, etc. MAINTENANCE: Hotel spotlessly clean and pristine. No chips, scuffs or marks in general areas. LOCATION: can walk to everything. Vatican is an extremely nice 20 minute walk west. HOTEL BAR: hotel has a little lobby bar inside open to 11:30 pm for hotel guests only. Nice touch. Can pop down in the evening for a coffee or drink. PIAZZA AND NEIGHBORHOOD: Facing the piazza is magical. The site of the Pantheon is DEFINITELY worth the cost. In the evening musicians come and play classical violin as people chat in the cafes. The Piazza is small (the hotel website shot the piazza with a super wide-angle lens) and charming. We learned the Senate is block so at lunch and dinner Italian diplomats, etc dine in the neighborhood. There is nice upscale feeling to the area. The area is less touristy than others. One evening we walked overt to Camp di Fiori neighborhood. SO GLAD we did NOT book a hotel there. It is 100% tourist (ok, we are tourists too, but you know what we mean). Chalk boards outside restaurants with "happy hour" scrawled in pink chalk.... eeeew. Not an Italian in site. Even people WORKING in restaurants were foreigners! Might as well stay home. With millions of tourists descending upon Italy every year, you can't avoid tourists, but we want to be around SOME resident Italians!! If you feel the same way then we suggest you consider the Albergo del Senato. Better neighborhood. The only thing we can nitpick about was breakfast. It was okay, fine, nothing to write home about but I would not let this be a deterrent. It really is a very small thing. It had eggs, meats, cheese, breads, pastries etc, but smaller scale and simpler in presentation than the other hotels we stayed at in italy. (ONE THING: there is a cafe/restaurant on the ground floor. I don't think its part of the hotel. Do not eat there. It was the only place we can say we had bad food. The pizza was inedible. Poured the tasteless sauce out of can with no flavorings or herbs. Waiter tacked on additional beverages to bill thinking we wouldn't notice.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: n2research
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel literally next to the Pantheon. You could walk to everything Piazza Navona (5'), Trevi Fountain (5'), Spanish steps (15'), Borghese Gardens (20'), Castel d' Angel (30'), Vatican City (35'). The english speaking staff were extremely helpful and wanted to make our stay most enjoyable. They gave us room 204, which is the balcony room, that overlooks the Pantheon and the piazza. The city really never sleeps, so be prepared to hear noise even with the windows closed. The bed was also quite firm but the room was remodeled and lovely. My parents also stayed in a remodeled corner room 302, which was also very beautiful with two windows, one overlooking the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the center of the ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: claus007
Reviews.Content: Fine little exclusive hotel. Fine rooms. Very service-minded personal. Don't try to find the way to the hotel by car. Use the Limosine-service from the airport to the hotel (55€).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: plan2travelfar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel for three nights in September. It is centrally located on the magnificent Piazza della Rotunda. We walked everywhere. Very accommodating staff. They arranged an airport pickup and a guide for a city tour - both excellent. When in Rome, wouldn't consider any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Changed our minds about Rome”
Reviews.Author: Helen C
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel gave us a completely different Roman experience to past visits. The location couldn't be better. We were worried about the proximity to the popular Piazza della Rotunda, but instead it was a huge bonus. Although we could see the magnificent roof of the Pantheon from our little balcony, the room was very quiet, and what a treat to be able to visit each day as soon as it opened to the public. Great restaurants within an easy walk, extremely comfortable room, comprehensive breakfast selection, and very helpful staff. In fact when we arrived early morning after a 27hr journey from Australiaand asked for a map, we were greeted with "You are in Rome! First you must have a cup of coffee in the breakfast room and relax". What a welcome. We plan to include Rome in our trip next year so we can stay at del Senato.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise for a last minute booking!”
Reviews.Author: Flaneuse1
Reviews.Content: It was just over a week ago that I found out that I was required to attend a function in Rome on Saturday night and I was worried that I would not be able to find anything near the function or within my budget, at such short notice. However, thanks to Tripadvisor and my partner's excellent internet skills, we were able to discover Albergo Del Senato and book for four nights. As part of our booking, we decided to go ahead with their car service to/from the hotel. This is 55 euros each way and well worth it, as our drivers were very professional, on time and allowed us to practice our Italian (as dismal as it is!) The car was also quite new and very clean and it saved us having to get stuck in traffic and stressed, especially as we arrived quite late at night. Location? What can I say, right next to the Pantheon and within 10mins walk from the location of our function and also a number of other sights (including the Trevi Fountain). We would awake each morning to the sound of highly skilled musicians outside and the birds singing and our room allowed us to look right at the Pantheon and down on the Piazza (our room was on the third floor!) Reception staff were very helpful at all times, with directions, bookings and maps, especially Alessandra. The breakfast staff always had a smile, cheery disposition and were asking you if you would like a coffee before you even sat down. The only potential downside (and it was only little) was that they turn off the airconditioning functions during Autumn/Winter. This was only a concern to us as we were blessed with amazing weather in Rome (sunny/twenty degrees) and this meant that our room often became quite stuffy/hot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a short stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister & I spent four days in Rome last month and we must have said at least 20 times how very fortunate we were to have chosen the Albergo del Senato as our home away from home in Rome! It was a lovely, immaculate hotel with the greatest location in Rome. We marveled at just being able to sit in the reserved seats with umbrella tables right in front of the hotel, sipping wine and looking at the incredible Pantheon. It was a very lively piazza with plenty of music, entertainment & people watching. The hotel was immaculate and while the room was small, it was beautifully appointed and the beds very comfortable. I loved the large marble bathroom with towel warmer and window that opened up to a side view of the Pantheon. We definitely agreed that this hotel with its spectacular location highly contributed to the wonderful experience we had visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: dean j
Reviews.Content: A belated review from August 2011. This is one of the best hotels I have ever been in - if not the very best! Position superb, room (the downstairs apartment) gorgeous, the breakfast excellent, the roof bar great, etc, etc. But the thing that makes this hotel is the service, and the people who work there. I don't think I can ever remember such helpful, knowledgeable, kind, friendly hotel staff - and great with kids too. Ottimo!

Reviews.Title: “Albergo del Senato, a true gem!”
Reviews.Author: k9poppy
Reviews.Content: We decided to return to Albergo del Senato after a perfect visit in 2010. Upon arrival we were very pleasantly surprised to find out that we had been upgraded to a suite, what an awesome gesture. As usual, everything about del Senato was perfect, the room had the best view in Rome, the Pantheon, so close you could almost touch it!. The staff is superior, many thanks to Ms. Johansson! The breakfast staff is lovely and attentive, with wonderful coffee and plenty of items to choose from. Everyone at del Senato is very friendly, helpful and polite. We also were lucky enough to have a drink on the rooftop terrace, one of the most beautiful views of Rome at night imaginable. Albergo del Senato truly rates 5 stars!!!! Another PERFECT stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel,Breathtaking View”
Reviews.Author: Sparklebabe
Reviews.Content: I spent weeks researching our hotel as it was a special occassion for my husbands birthday . As usual trip advisor did not let us down . The room looked brand new the view I imagine must be one of the most special and breathtaking in Europe and the service was flawless. The location for Rome was fabulous. The only thing that could be better is the breakfast whilst it was adequate and offered the usual continental fayre it could've been upgraded a bit....fresh fruit etc. If you get a good internet rate without breakfast take it as the most amazing coffee shop in Rome is around the corner 0.90 euro for espresso and 1.20euro for cappucino best coffee I,ve ever tased in my life!!!! Think is called Tasso d'oro. As for Albergo Del Senato we were delighted with our choice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Richard C
Reviews.Content: The Senato is located within steps from Pantheon in old Rome. The hotel has great rooms at good prices which include breakfast. Hotel staff is exceptional especially Mauro at the front desk and Michele the barman on the rooftop who mixes the best martini and Bellini in Europe! Stay at Senato, you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, with a couple caveats”
Reviews.Author: compound7
Reviews.Content: The overall quality of the hotel is excellent. However the simple twin rooms on the first floor are quite small. It is definitely worth it to upgrade to a triple room on a higher floor. Also do not trust the front desk restaurant recommendations, and avoid the restaurant "La Donata at Due Colona" at all costs, in my opinion. Otherwise front desk is very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: bfq1266
Reviews.Content: The staff was gracious, patient and accomodating in every way. They arranged private tours with an excellent guide and transportation to and from the airport. The rooms were clean and well appointed and the view of the Pantheon from our rooms was amazing. The hotel enhanced our stay in Rome. We were within walking distance to many major sites and in the evening we relaxed at the rooftop bar. We plan to return to Rome and will stay at the Senato.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: Keshet
Reviews.Content: This is just a lovely hotel on the most gorgeous piazza in Rome. The view of the square and the Pantheon make it special. Ask at the desk or the bar for restaurant recommendations, it's difficult to distinguish the great from the terrible restaurants without local advice. The rooms are on the small side, but nicely done, and because of the view they don't feel cramped at all. We stayed on the 6th floor with a small balcony, it was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Look no farther....”
Reviews.Author: macpwv
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay and my first room without a Pantheon view and still I would recommend it. For the value with an online reservation, location, hospitable staff, hot breakfast it is the place to stay. When in Rome next time I will be staying there. The rooms are economical on space but comfortable with lovely bath products and tubs to soak in after a long touring day!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, excellent staff, disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: GvKl
Reviews.Content: The Good: excellent location, lovely atmosphere, more than helpful staff. The Average: breakfast was fine, without being memorable. The Bad: we were first given a rear-facing, dark, room on the 2nd floor without any air-conditioning which, apparently, had been turned off from the 1st and 2nd floors and could not be reinstated. We were moved to a front-facing room on the 1st floor with excellent views of the Pantheon but the heat was unacceptable when the window was closed - and the noise was unacceptable when the window was open. The pillows were incredibly hard and uncomfortable. Advice: when booking, insist on a front-facing room on the 3rd floor or above (apparently, the air-conditioning works perfectly well at those levels!). Also, bring your own pillows. My overall rating is Very Good on the assumption that the advice above is taken. Otherwise, overall the hotel was a disappointment for the reasons above.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dave C
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Albergo del Senato. can't imagine staying anywhere else in Rome. This trip was a last second trip and we were staying 3 nights in Rome. I wante to stay in the Penthouse suite with the best view of the Pantheon imaginable but it was booked for all but the 2nd night we were staying. The staff bent over backwards to moved all of our belongings twice, so we could listen to the music in the Piazza from our terrace. The rooms ae modern, clean, and spacious. The breakfast staff is friendly and the food is acceptable, though not spectacular. To me, breakfast is an add-on anyway. There isn't much more that would make the say better. Just uderstand that you are on busy Piazza, so until 11:00 or so, there is a lot of street noise. We travel to be part of the action, so this is better for us. We go to the beach for quiet vacations.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel in 5 star location”
Reviews.Author: joanne m
Reviews.Content: Perfect location at the Pantheon within walking distance to just about everything in Rome. Front desk personnel were extremely helpful and knowledgable. Room was small but impecibly kept and looked out on the Pantheon. In the evenings muscians would play music in the square and we could open our windows and hear them. One evening a gentleman was also singing Italian songs. It could not have been more romantic! Yet close the windows and the room was very quiet. Worth every euro!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: emmamaria
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at the Albergo del Senato. The location is excellent on a pretty square overlooking the Pantheon. Hotel is very efficiently run, breakfast good, rooftop bar a must. Book a superior room with view of the Pantheon, you may as well enjoy! We walked everywhere - the Forum and Colisseum (excellent value at 12 euros), Vatican Museums (book online to avoid queue) and fabulous Sistine Chapel, plus the Piazza Navona, Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps. Cross the Tiber to the Trastevere district, very cheap to eat out there - we paid 10 euros in the afternoon for 4 courses. The Tazza d'Oro coffee shop is right by the hotel, espresso 80 cents, cappuccino 1.30 euros. Arrange for a taxi from the airport with the hotel (55 euros) not worth messing about. Rome is more Italian than I expected and unspoilt. Loved it, very impressed. Will go back again and do the rest and would definitely stay at the Albergo del Senato.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ready2travel06
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best location, and the hotel was an excellent choice, convenient to the historic center city. With the Pantheon just steps away, you couldn't go wrong! As a single, despite booking almost a year in advance, and requesting a room with a view of the piazza and a renovated room (upper floors), I was given neither. Turns out the single rooms are limited in number and located only in one corner of the building with a window view of a side street. However, after the first night I was 'bumped-up' a floor and into a renovated room for the remaining three nights. While I had decided it wasn't worth checking out in the morning and returning to the hotel at 3 to make this change, they held the room for me, so I did. It definitely was worth the change! Lovely newly decorated interior with beautiful wall coverings, fabrics, and more modern furniture. Same small room size with a twin bed, street view, and an almost equal in size large bathroom. Delicious breakfast buffet included in the rate. Very helpful afternoon and evening desk staff, and a friendly barman on the Terrace. Rome is wonderful and exhausting ... the cobbles take their toll ... so the del Senato was a delight to return to after a 'hard' day of sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kingbadger
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights here (departing 25th October 2011) and enjoyed the whole experience. We were lucky enough to get a 1st floor room overlooking the piazza and the Pantheon. Spectacular view. Excellent soundproofing...although a busy square, the room was very quiet. The staff were all excellent with nice touches such as beautifully hand-written (calligraphy) key cards, thoughtful recommendations for restaurants (not the same ones for everyone who asks) etc. The hotel is smartly and traditionally appointed and very clean. We particularly enjoyed a glass of prosecco on the roof terrace with a view of the illuminated dome of St Peters Basilica (yes, even in October!). Breakfast was friendly, efficient and of a good standard. WiFi is included. A great central location from which to explore Rome. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ccran
Reviews.Content: We were staying for a week and wanted to be centrally located in a 'good' hotel. Albergo del Senato fit that bill perfectly. Regards location, it is hard to beat being next to the Pantheon. Regards the rooms and service - both were wonderful. We had a refurbished room and while a bit small (as are most in Rome) it was very modern with a good sized bathroom. The desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Requests for restaurant reservations and cars were expertly handled. The breakfast room was delightful as was the food.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caroline S
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel with a very friendly atmosphere, it also felt like the staff could not do enough for us. The hotel is central to all the major sites in Rome and we had a fantastic modern, clean room overlooking the Pantheon. I was recommended the Albergo del Senato by a friend and I will certainly be recommending other friends and family to stay here when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location...”
Reviews.Author: Kristen G
Reviews.Content: My group stayed at this hotel for three nights before we disembarked on a cruise around the Mediterranean and it was such an amazing experience. The central location was worth every penny, the view from our room was a direct view of the Pantheon, it was breathtaking. The staff was helpful and kind, and the breakfast was always top of the line. It was clean and offered all of the ammenities you would expect from a hotel. We were able to walk to all parts of Rome from our hotel, colleseum...vatican...villa borghese...traverste market...and much more. We all agree without a doubt this would be the place to stay for all future vacations to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: popjoy
Reviews.Content: Location, location. location - that is what you are paying for here. Bang on the Piazza della Rotonda, and with many rooms having a direct view of the Pantheon. The hotel has a roof terrace too (check times - I think it is closed 'out of season') with a view of the Pantheon, Piazza and surrounding rooftops. We went with family. Hubby and I had a double (interior well view) and the other person had a 'single' which turned out to be a small double, right on the front with a cracking view of the square! Both rooms were fine - ours felt a little bit more 'old fashioned' furnishing wise, but everything was good quality, and the square view room was beautifully furnished. The 'view' room was naturally more noisy (Rome never sleeps), whereas our room, though no view, was wonderfully quiet. Breakfast was fine - not a massive choice, but totally acceptable. The whole place has an air of olde worlde charm, a faintly mellowed grandeur. Service was very friendly and efficient. Hotel was spotlessly clean. Nothing was shabby. And for what you got, I thought the prices were an utter bargain. I would definitely stay there again, hubby was more unwilling despite the fabulous location as he likes a much more modern vibe. However, both of us thought it was a good hotel that could be recommended. And the 'other person'? My 75 year old ma-in-law who loved every minute of it!

Reviews.Title: “Bella, Bella, Senato!”
Reviews.Author: Fiona49463
Reviews.Content: Many thanks to the staff of this incredible hotel. They made our stay perfect in everyway possible. From the room with a terrace view of the pantheon to the Happy Birthday bottle of chilled Prosecco and hand written note (in calligraphy no less) from Mauro. We never mentioned it was my husband's Bday when checking in. The staff genuinely seem happy to be working at this wonderful hotel. I could sit in bed and look at the Pantheon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caritsa
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Albergo Del Senato. The location is perfect and the view of the Pantheon from our room was amazing. We cannot wait to go back for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do not miss this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: suntandrews
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best location in the world. Look out of your bedroom window right into the Pantheon! I have travelled all over the world and this is my favourite for business and pleasure. Although it has no restaurant, all the other services are 5*. The staff are outstanding, especially Mauro and his colleagues on the front desk. They never need to ask your name. Beautiful roof terrace for sundowner drinks overlooking the rooftops of Rome, over the Pantheon to St Peters in the distance. Do not miss this hotel - the best kept secret in Rome....walk round the corner to the Enoteca Capranica restaurant....walk to the Piazza Argentina to visit the cat sanctuary....

Reviews.Title: “Everything is great: location, service, decor! Going back in March!”
Reviews.Author: Tina_Oslo
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at Hotel Albergo del Sentao! Rome is expensive, so this hotel is actually reasonably priced if you start comparing prices. However the situation of the hotel is fantastic and nothing compares with it!! !!! I have been to Rome a few times, and this hotel is very central and in easy walking distance (you wear walking-shoes of course! ) to most sights and right in front of the very best one, the Pantheon!! From our window we could actually look straight onto the Pantheon, and it is really magical!! The Piazza outside is a great place to enjoy a cold drink or a coffee and just soak up the atmosphere! The area around the hotel is charming with many little side-streets and great restaurants.. ! A very nice hotel, perfect service at the front desk – we were upgraded to a suite upon arrival, and enjoyed great service throughout our stay! The hotel is beautifully decorated and our suite was beautiful! Breakfast is nice, with many choices! I have already booked my next visit, but I’m staying an extra day this time! I really look forward to it already! PS. Take the car-service, it is really nice to be picked up at the airport, and this way you know that you will be going the shortest way from the airport to the hotel.. !

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: I can thoroughly recommend this excellent hotel. It is centrally situated within easy walking distance of most of the sights, has spotlessly clean well-furnished rooms, comfortable beds, helpful and friendly staff and a good breakfast. There are plenty of restaurants and bars nearby. I will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding 4 days in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: GAJ5655312
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early September, and truly had great service on the Roofop Terrace from Guiseppe and Michel! We went to the rooftop every night, the views we superb, and the service matched! Location is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Place”
Reviews.Author: MJSKentucky
Reviews.Content: After spending more than a week traveling through the hill towns in Tuscany, we planned to return to Rome for two final nights in Italy. We had started our trip in Rome, then stayed in Florence before hitting the Tuscan area. We enjoyed the hustle and bustle of Rome on our first stay, but honestly, were missing Tuscany before we left it. Albergo del Senato was a perfect ending to a wonderful vacation. There are no words to describe the Piazza Rotunda with the Pantheon commanding all attention. If traveling to Italy, you must see it. Staying at the Albergo del Senato was icing on the cake. Mauro greeted us warmly and always did whatever he could to make our stay perfect. We stayed in the room with the fresco, which was amazing! While it did not have a view of the Pantheon, it was a spectacular room in every way. The rooftop terrace was a great place to go before and after dinner with an outstanding view of the piazza and great service from Michele'. Mauro and the staff went out of their way to make my birthday very memorable. Beautiful hotel! Great service! Fantastic location!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DeanC38
Reviews.Content: We knew as we planned our trip that we were saving the best for last - 3 days in Rome and the Albergo del Senato. For those that see this hotel as being outside your price range, you need to fit it in....period. You are on vacation, and a trip to Italy is special. It is on the piazza where the Pantheon is located . Every street takes you somewhere amazing. (You are two blocks from the best espresso/cappuccino in Rome at Sant' Eustachio.) You are basically positioned to walk and explore anywhere. Our double room was incredible (thank you to the caring staff!). The staff were very professional and attentive , and as vigilant as you need to be when you are located in an often pedestrian-heavy location . Breakfast was outstanding. First class all the way and a great way to end our trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: brityney_hauke
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, super comfy beds, lovely staff and an overall wonderfull stay. We stayed for 3 nights in a Deluxe Double on the 4th floor. Great view of the city and the rome.

Reviews.Title: “"Location, location,location"”
Reviews.Author: Lover-of-Travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights beginning of October......unusually hot temps in Rome with gorgeous blue skies every day!! The hotel is in superb location on Pza Rotonda, and sits across from my favorite building, the Pantheon; its location makes visiting the sights in ancient Rome easy. Our room was on 6th floor with the most wonderful views of the Pantheon....rooms are not large by new hotel standards but perfectly appointed, comfortable and very clean....and the view is worth every Euro we paid!! Cocktails at the rooftop terrace bar in the evening enjoying the sunset were the end to a perfect day before our meal in the neighborhood. Italian buffet breakfast with tasty choices and great cafe lattes. Staff was very professional, helpful and friendly. I plan to return another year and would send friends to the this lovely hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuliannaEssex
Reviews.Content: Truly beautiful hotel set in Piazza del Rotunda. Beautiful room (407) overlooking the Pantheon. The whole hotel was immaculate and staff could not be more helpful. Breakfast was a comprehensive buffet including ham, eggs, fruit, yoghurt, cheese, cereal and plenty of bread and delightful pastries. Staff even coped with a gluten free diet and arrange for bread for me!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience”
Reviews.Author: Hermosa90254
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the recommendation of a friend and had a terrific experience. Gorgeous hotel located directly adjacent to the Pantheon which makes for easy walking to literally everything you want to do and see in Rome. Wonderful rooms, large bathrooms, comfortable beds, very good breakfast, views overlooking the Pantheon and the piazza. Rooftop terrace and bar with views in every direction. The staff was also very helpful in arranging an airport transfer for us so that we didn't have to deal with luggage and the train into the city and then a taxi to the hotel. Nice touch -- they remembered us by name and greeted us whenever we left or returned to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Third time is a charm!”
Reviews.Author: Regal328
Reviews.Content: Our third visit to Rome and Albergo del Senato. Neither ever disappoints. We love this location. Our room overlooked the Pantheon and piazza below. Was it noisy? Yes, during the day - when you opened the window and looked out, it brought the sounds of the city right in. But at night after 11 or so, it was just fine. Beautiful room, lovely views and delicious breakfast made our stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “June 2011”
Reviews.Author: Alison C
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in early June and I'd recommend this hotel highly to anyone. It has an excellent location, ideally placed in the centre of the city and the quality is superb. A good variety of breakfast food, clean rooms and bathroom and very friendly and helpful staff. The view from the roof garden is fantastic. Our room was upgraded to celebrate my 40th birthday which was a lovely surprise when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Sydophie
Reviews.Content: What a lovely property. It was a great location, easy to direct taxis to it being directly next to the Pantheon. The roof top terrace was nice - wish we had more time to spend up there. Rooms were beautiful. Our room looked out over the piazza and the Pantheon. The view was great but it was very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Libby H
Reviews.Content: My family and I were very happy with our stay at the Albergo del Senato. The room was beautifully decorated, overlooked the Pantheon and the square; and, (at least in the triple room) a large (even for American hotel standards), well equipped, immaculate bathroom. The bed was very comfortable (always a plus!). Concierge and hotel staff were helpful and pleasant. We did a lot of 'touristy' things so did a lot of walking and the hotel was in a good location to get almost anywhere you'd want to go in Rome. Breakfast was good - yogurt, cheese, meat, bread and pastries. After a good night's sleep, sitting down at a table covered with a white tablecloth under the restaurant's high ceiling with a cup of coffee or tea and a pastry is a great way to start your day! (superior triple-no balcony)

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joseph_HCovington
Reviews.Content: the location is perfect for those who love to walk on the same routes as the locals. At night, the close bars and restaurants give the visitor a multitude of superb choices for true Italian and Roman cuisine. Monte Bellisimo!!!

Reviews.Title: “suite dreams”
Reviews.Author: romerBirmingham
Reviews.Content: celebrated my retirement by reserving the seminario suite, a dream fullfilled. Hotel has a wonderful staff and the location is central to all my favorite places in Rome. I recommend the hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne M
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in a superior room with a small balcony overlooking the Pantheon. The room was very clean, the bathroom appeared newly renovated. The bed was very comfortable. The rooftop lounge was a wonderful spot to have a nightcap and look at the different views of Rome, especially St. Peters in the distance. The view from the room was just spectacular and we could not hapve been happier with our accomodations. We will definitely stay in this location again when returning to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: adetom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. We stayed in a Superior room with view of Pantheon. The room was not large but perfectly layed out so it seemed roomy. It was nicely decorated. Nice closet space. Large well-appointed bath room. The balcony overlooked the Piazza; it was such a joy to watch the action below. The staff was professional, efficient, friendly, and (in regard to a particular front desk clerk) witty and funny. We were always greeted with a smile. Breakfast was plentiful: yogurt, cereal, cold cuts, cheese, fruit, bread, sweet rolls, eggs. Location was perfect. We easily walked to all tourist sites including Colloseum and Vatican (not on the same day). I can't imagine staying at any other hotel when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: tsovs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights after our New Year's cruise. The location was really perfect! Hotel sits right near the majestic Pantheon, in the lively Piazza della Rotonda. This amazing place located in the historical centre of Rome. We walked to the Spanish Steps, the Piazza Navona, the Campo dei Fiore, the Fountain, the Castel Sant'Angelo… We didn't get the room facing Pantheon. But our room was nice, clean and sufficient to stay for 3 persons. It has a large comfortable bathroom and a balcony overlooking to small quiet courtyard. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. The breakfast at the hotel was excellent with many choices. I would definitely recommend this hotel for for exploring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Central charming hotel on Piazza of Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: drfred48
Reviews.Content: The Albergo del Senato was perfect and worth every Euro! The location is so central it's easy to walk to the Colosseum, Piazza Navonna, The Spanish Steps, and Trastevere. The staff was always helpful and patient. We pre-arranged from the hotel a pickup from FCO for €55 which made our transfer smooth and even a nice orientation to Rome from our driver. We requested a view of the Piazza and our room was charming, air conditioned, and quiet with windows closed, and with a large marble bathroom also with a view! We had arrived early but were able to check in right away. The rooftop terrace is lovely for excellent drinks and views over Rome. Breakfast was included and plentiful with lots of choice. We even found restaurants nearby that we walked to and were more than satisfied with, and excellent gelaterias for 2nd and 3rd desserts! Our last night was a Friday so we joined the walkers promenading til the wee hours.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jill52_11
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days in Rome early last spring with my 80 year old mother and we wanted a hotel that would be comfortable and central. The Albergo del Senato was perfect! If we never left the piazza we could have had a great time in Rome. The hotel is beautiful and run in a highly professional way. The staff were uniformly polite and concerned about our comfort. The room was lovely and extremely quiet. The location could not have been better - a lively beautiful famous square outside (with private hotel benches to sit on and enjoy the atmosphere), restaurants were a stone's throw from the front door and we could walk almost everywhere from the hotel. I would go back in a minute and hope to do so sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “5 days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kazlausk
Reviews.Content: We opted to stay at the Albergo del Senato for 5 days and were very impressed. The location is super with many of the major sights within easy walking distance. Nice breakfast buffet and it was fun to sit outside in front of the hotel and watch the world go by! The hotel arranged both pick-up from the airport and return to the cruise port.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: HotrsellTraveller2
Reviews.Content: There have been many comments about the reception staff. We didn't ask for restaurant recommendations on the first night, we wandered out and then chose very poorly - a tourist trap. Our fault! The staff are very knowledgeable and very willing to help. We asked on other nights and were given very good recommendations. Whatever your requirements in terms of price, food and location. They can help. This is a very unusual hotel. It doesn't really do food (breakfast is just about OK), but the rooms, the service and the location are absolutely wonderful. One tip: if you like coffee or tea in your room, there are facilities but no milk - just ask reception and they'll bring a jug! Another tip: If you want tickets to the Hop-on Hop-off bus (110 Open), reception sells them for €18 - cheaper than the online price €20.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Suzofleeds
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated right in the heart of Rome. Evereything s within easy access but we regret not spending more time in and around the hotel (as this was our first trip to Rome). The hotel tried to accommodate our wish for a room with a view over the Pantheon and did up- grade us for half our stay as they were not able to oblige. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the roof top bar is an absolute must!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!!”
Reviews.Author: Davidson186487
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights on our honeymoon. We were in one of the rooms on the sixth floor with a small balcony. The view was amazing, there was always something going on in the square below and it was brilliant to sit above and enjoy a drink in the evening. The staff spoke great English and were always really helpful. The location is second to none and everything is within easy walking distance. I cannot wait to go back to Rome and I wouldn't even bother considering other hotels it will be Albergo del Senato every time!!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid in All Ways”
Reviews.Author: Ted1K
Reviews.Content: Everything splendid! From warm welcome by concierge, especially well laid out bedroom, and lovely breakfast room with superb choices. Bedrooms are small, but we expected that. Very up-to-date; recently renovated. Location could not have been better. Walk to so many sites and gret variety of restaurants; shopping too. Roof top for drinks is extra nice bonus.We were there for five nights and then returned for one more night. Will book this hotel again on this December's trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Markie_Mark115
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Albergo Senato twice. We went there when we first arrived in Italy and stayed three days. The room was not large, but the building is quite old so that wasn't a surprise. It was very nicely decorated and the large windows overlooked the Pantheon - a beautiful view. Other windows overlooked the pretty little streets around the Piazza. The staff at the hotel are wonderful - nothing is too much trouble. The Trevi fountain, the Spanish Steps, the Piazza Navona, the Campo dei Fiore are all within 15mins walk of the hotel, so the location is perfect. The top of the hotel has a rooftop terrace overlooking the Pantheon and the Piazza, so in evening you can sit up there with a glass of Frascati and gaze out at the view. Our second stay was for our last night in Italy. I reserved their deluxe suite. It was beautiful - actually an apartment almost!! The door opened into a hallway, there was a small sitting room with views over the little streets, a walk-in closet room, a large bathroom and a huge bedroom with the fantastic view of the Pantheon. The breakfast is served in a small dining room. It is kind of a pseudo continental breakfast. The had eggs and bacon, or eggs and sausage. In addition, they had a selection of cold meats and cheeses, croissants, yoghurts, some breakfast cakes/pastries, cereals, fruit juices...I thought it was fine. Not fantastic, but fine.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: lim0nata
Reviews.Content: Pros: helpful and friendly staff clean and comfortable rooms, lovely rooftop deck. Cons: skimpy breakfast offerings with cheap, low-quality motel-like food that is a shame. We have travelled extensively in Italy and in Europe and this is the worst breakfast situation we have encountered regardless of the price of the room. The place is over-run with American tourists many on a stop over before or after a cruise and you mainly hear English spoken. Prefer a more international clientele. If you don't bring a laptop you have to pay to use the internet.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ninahje
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location for exploring Rome, very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are small, but very charming. The view to the Pantheon will make you forget any shortcomings...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing location, great staff. Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Two_Travel_Bugs_WI
Reviews.Content: Before we even got to this hotel, we were impressed. Their response to every request we sent - whether to make or confirm our room reservations, to make dinner reservations for us, to secure a driver to and from the airport, or just little questions about the room and area - was well-informed, quick, and so, so helpful. When we arrived, and throughout our stay, we continued to be thoroughly impressed! Our room was beautifully decorated, and very clean. It was well-equipped with all standard traveler necessities, and anything else you needed, the staff was more than happy to provide. And, the view was incredible - our tiny balcony opened up right over the Pantheon!! Breakfast each morning was plentiful, fresh, and delicious. What we loved most, though, was the rooftop terrace, which became our nightly hang-out. After a long day of sightseeing in busy Rome, the rooftop was a perfect, tranquil place to relax. The bar staff was fantastic, and we really enjoyed talking with them as we recapped our day. And the views from up there are not to be missed. Overall, this was a fantastic hotel, in a great location, and we would highly recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Area centrally located to all the popular sights”
Reviews.Author: MaryBUSA
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a terrific location. Our hotel Rome was a chip shot away from the Pantheon with marvelous views. The room layout was perfect and spacious. The staff was very helpful during our stay. The location of this hotel is the best! We had access to great dining and shops and always felt safe in our area. The value,location, and services this hotel offers makes it a true find. The roof top terrace is also a huge plus!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at Albergo del Senato”
Reviews.Author: Greg2Greg
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for exploring Rome. The Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, the Coliseum and the Vatican are within walking distance with the Pantheon at your doorstep. (Rooftop bar also offers beautiful views of Rome at night). However more impressive was the hospitality and friendliness of the hotel staff. Everyone was a delight to deal with. The hotel was impeccably clean, service was excellent, and overall delivers an authentic Rome experience. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and prime location”
Reviews.Author: lionspaw3
Reviews.Content: Unrivaled location literally next door to the Pantheon. Front desk staff was helpful with great restaurant recommendations and tour information. Breakfast was complete and varied, wifi is speedy. Rooms were clean and comfortable, although small. We appreciated having a private entrance foyer linking our two rooms, which made for a convenient family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Location - Well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 days. Room overlooked the Piazza and the Pantheon. Rooms were very updated and comfortable. No outside noise at all. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooftop bar was great. Nice breakfast. Location!!! Walk to Navona and Campo de Fiore; light rail to Travestere. Expensive but worth every Euro. We would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: tgal7791
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Albergo del Senato from Aug 22 to 26th. We were assigned a lovely room on the fourth floor overlooking the Pantheon. The room was very pretty and very clean, the view was outstanding. I loved that there were no screens on the windows, so when you opened them up, you have such a lovely and unobstructed view. They must not have bug problems like we have here in Canada! You could lean out, and take marvelous pictures, and really feel the vibe of the city. With the shutters closed, you could not hear any street noise. Bathroom was spacious and clean. I think these rooms have been newly rennovated, and it shows. The cleaning staff are very friendly and do a great job on the rooms. I know you have read it before, but the front desk staff are above and beyond what you expect. Lovely people, very helpful, and fun. Location - PERFECT. enough said. Beds were firm but comfortable. Lots of fresh towels everyday. The elevator is small. When I say small, I mean, really small. The staircase was very beautiful, and you could feel the history of the building, if you know what I mean. You could turn corners and be suprised by a stainglass window, or a lovely view to someones garden nearby on a terrace. Breakfast -- we never had any issues of it being to busy, but we generally out and about pretty early in the morning - there was everything needed for a good start to the day on the buffet, not a lot of hot varieties, but very typical of European hotels I thought. The Bar terrace -- we visited it 3 nights out of 4! The bartender (I never did get his name) was super, very helpful, pleasant, chatted with all the customers to make them feel welcome and important guests. The view was incredible, it was such a nice way to end the day in Rome. It was always the same bartender every night we went up - I dont know if that is always the case, but he was part of the reason the terrace was so lovely - very charming without being over the top or in your face. So every aspect of Albergo del Senato met or exceeded expectations, and I imagine that most people will fall in love with this hotel, and there fantastic staff. Kudos to them!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly impressed- would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: quevara
Reviews.Content: Great location. Clean, beautifully finished rooms. Fantastic, personable and gracious staff, including all the lovely ladies who served us in the breakfast room. Fantastic, friendly reception staff, particularly the charming Mauro. I would definitely stay here again the next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: 45Marion
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel; it was perfectly situated in a lively and beautiful square overlooking the Pantheon. The bedroom was small, but comfortable and we had a view over the square. The interior and exterior of the hotel are gorgeous, particularly the rooftop terrace bar, where we spent an hour every evening before dinner. The views over the Roman rooftops and surrounding sights are amazing. The hotel staff are lovely, particularly the receptionists, who speak amazing English and are extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ianjwhite
Reviews.Content: If you want an excellent and reasonably priced hotel in Rome look no further. Main attractions in walking distance , very helpful staff and good amenities make for a perfect base. I had looked on trip advisor for some ideas and this hotel sounded ideal , it was. The rooftop bar was a real bonus to kick off the evening and the rooms were very comfortable and the hotel spotless. Being in a pedestrian zone it was also quiet at night. No complaints at all and have no hesitation in recommending this hotel or this amazing city !

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: athena2012
Reviews.Content: This review is a bit late in coming; I actually stayed here in mid-April of 2010 for 5 nights. I had written some notes regarding this hotel in my journal, but unfortunately, Air France lost my luggage containing the journal. The volcanic eruption in Iceland during the period of my stay that stranded tens of thousands and created havoc throughout Europe no doubt resulted in plenty of lost luggage. Back to the Albergo del Senato. I still remember it fondly. The Hotel arranged for airport transport which arrived on time. The driver was friendly and knowledgeable. Arriving at the Hotel via an air conditioned Mercedes, I was greeted by the lovely and gracious Allesandra, who seems to enchant all who meet her. My room faced the Pantheon--literally only a few yards from my window-- and waking up to that view each morning was truly an awe inspiring experience. I emailed ahead to request this view and the Hotel delivered. The room was well appointed and comfortable complete with a complimentary bottle of mineral water and just about every bath toiletry you can imagine. A large marble bathtub, you bet. Plush bathrobes and slippers, check. Yes, European mattresses tend to be firmer, but that issue was easily addressed by placing the extra duvet in the closet on top of sheet. The maid quickly caught on, and after the first night began placing the extra padding between the sheets without my saying a word. I had breakfast delivered to my room early each morning (included in the booking rate)and it was spectacular. Always several delicious baked goods, yogurt, juice, coffee (with a piture of heated skim milk for home-made lattes) and an assortment of jams and spreads, delivered with a smile. In the afternoons and evenings musicians serenade from the Piazza below. The gillatoria next door is the best in Rome. This Hotel is well located and in walking distance to many attractions as well as plenty of shops, cafes, and restaurants. The only down side is the crowds of tourists which can be a bit daunting after a few days. Ironically, one of those tourists who contributed to the over-crowding of this beautiful city, was me. The service at the Albergo del Senato is excellent and is the reason I am taking the time to write this review so belatedly. All who work there should be commended for making the guests feel so at home in Rome. This Hotel has earned its outstanding reputation not only for its ideal location and comfortable rooms, but also for the level of service and welcoming attitude its staff extends to all who visit here. I'm sure my fellow travelers will enjoy their stay here.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong here!”
Reviews.Author: smartrip
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, excellent service, comfortable and well-appointed rooms, marble baths, and a perfect location! What more could you ask? A lovely rooftop bar? check! Nice breakfast:?check! Car service to the airport? check! Dozens of restaurants just steps away? check! You will be glad you chose the Senato. Ask for a room facing the Pantheon. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Spiker17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo del Senato for our family trip to Italy (6 days in Rome, 3 Venice, 1 Florence), and I can't imagine a better hotel to stay at while touring Rome. I spent many hours researching hotels in Rome because I knew I was going to be on my own with my four kids for 5 days in Rome before my husband could arrive, and I wanted a location where we could walk to most of the sites, and which was safe and beautiful. Thanks to tripadvisor I chose the Albergo, and it was truly perfect! Pros: The location can't be beat. It's in a beautiful setting, everything you imagine when you think of Rome, the Pantheon is right outside your door, and unlike other popular tourist areas (e.g. Piazza Novana, Spanish Steps, etc.) - the crowds usually never get that bad, and the area is kept clean. Architecturally, it's in a beautiful part of Rome, Berlusconi resides in his mansion just a few blocks away. We were able to walk to most of the important site, Coliseum, Forum, etc., and it's a short cab ride to the Vatican. There are so many restaurant choices right outside your door or within a short walk, Piazza Novana is just a few blocks away. When we go back to Rome, we will definitely stay at the Albergo. Service is excellent. The woman at the front desk (sorry I can't remember her name) was knowledgeable, efficient, and friendly. We arrived early in the morning from our flight from the US, and she was able to get us checked into our two rooms after a short wait (we relaxed and had our caffe lattes overlooking the Pantheon). She also recommended the best restaurant for our family, it was an authentic restaurant where the Romans go, had wonderful pizzas and pastas in a quaint setting, tucked away near the Piazza Novana (never would have found it on our own). We ended going there many nights and for lunch - we tried other restaurants which were recommended on tripadvisor, but this place was better. I think the name was La Foccacia. Breakfast was also excellent with many choices, and my kids loved the hot chocolate. Rooms were large by Rome standards and nicely renovated. The hotel's interiors and ambiance were in keeping with the feel of being in Rome. The photos on the hotel's website and other guests are accurate. We did not have a view of the Pantheon, but it must be wonderful if you do. One downside though is that it will be noisier because if you keep your windows open, you will hear the noise from the many people outside. Price is reasonable by Rome standards. It's not cheap, but it's more like a four star hotel rather than the three stars it is rated. I could afford to stay at any hotel in Rome, but I chose the Albergo and it lived up to my expectations. I thought it was good value for the price. Cons: The only con is the outside noise if you stay during a time when you need to leave your windows open. If you have a room that faces the interior, it's pretty quiet, but if you face the Pantheon or side street, you will hear the noise of the many Romans who like to be out and about until midnight or later. But, this is the price to pay for being in such a perfect location. Rome is a beautiful and magical city, and staying at the Albergo makes for a perfect trip.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: patwee
Reviews.Content: Was there for 9 nights and am so glad I chose this place: Step out of the hotel and there's the Pantheon in all its magnificient glory. Del Senato is an easy enough walk to most of the other attractions (if you read the map right and can dodge the millions of tourists) and it was great exploring, especially the many wonderful and gorgeous churches...plus wondering beforehand what treasures you'll see inside (imagine seeing Caravaggios in some of them). Oke, back to the hotel,,,it was clean, safe and the staff - from reception to breakfast room and root-top bar and chambermaids - were all friendly and ever ready to show you how to get to places etc and offer advice. I found myself going back to my room at various times during the day just to stand at the window and look out at and muse on the madding crowd in the piazza...what a sight. It was a cosy room too, and bathroom was big, with great water pressure. If only there was BBC on the TV..but that's not a big deal. The breakfast was not award-winning but more than adequate to get you started for the day, and the people serving were really gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel, Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Gorm0
Reviews.Content: So delighted we choose this hotel. The view of the Pantheon every morning and every night was heart warming. We also never took a taxi, bus or tram anywhere such was the excellence of the location of this hotel. The hotel is spotless and very relaxing and well run by the courteous gentlemen at the front desk. The rooms are small but well equipped, modern and again spotless. Free wifi in the rooms which was terrific and of great benefit for planning the day ahead! The breakfast buffet was small but more than good. Its not cheap but you have to pay for that location, end of story.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Thomas R
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Rome at this hotel and we enjoyed our stay there. Rooms are elegant and clean, the staff is very gentle and the location is great! Only two minutes from Navona Square and the Pantheon is in front of the exit door. Do not miss the wonderful view from the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Please Stay Here !!!”
Reviews.Author: pauly62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo Del Senato in Rome for 3 nights, the hotel is opposite the pantheon and our bedroom looked onto the beautifal square and directly onto the pantheon. The hotel is very tastefully decorated and could not be more central for sightseeing. The staff could not be more friendly or helpfull and the buffett breakfast lovely. Rome is a beautifal city and the hotel really was the perfect place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Italy”
Reviews.Author: debstrappa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the 1/8/11 for 3 nights. We have been traveling for two months and have stayed at many hotels across Europe and this would have to be the best. You would be hard pressed to find a hotel in a better location in Rome. You walk out onto a piazza with the pantheon directly in front, and within walking distance to every other famous landmark in Rome. The staff where brilliant always willing to help and suggest some great restaurants. The rooms where very comfortable and most importantly air-conditioned. The breakfast was fantastic with a great range of fresh food. But by far the best is the roof top bar, it has an amazing view, it's the best place to relax with cool drink after a hard day sightseeing. Rome is beautiful, would definitely come back and stay at this hotel, simply amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: S R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo Del Senato in Rome for our family trip. The hotel is right next to the Pantheon, and it's surreal to be in front of such a monument every time you step out of the hotel. The staff was very accommodating, and the rooms were very comfortable. We definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: SimonPJ007
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room for 4 nights, and although not guaranteed, we managed to get a pantheon view upon arrival. It was a great view from the room. It was a nice sized room, very clean with nice bathroom. It was also very quiet, considering it faced onto the main piazza in front of the pantheon. All the staff were very helpful, and extremely polite, and were very knowledgeable about where to go, where to eat, etc. The rooftop bar was also great for a drink in the evening. Breakfast was good, and there was a reasonable choice of things to eat. Overall we thought this was an excellent hotel, and would definately stay again if visiting rome. Location was also excellent, most places were within easy reach from the hotel, as it is so central.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a perfect location with amazing service”
Reviews.Author: JMRDB
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that exceeded our expectations in every way. We requested our room be ready for an early arrival since we were travelling overnight and they were able to accommodate. The front desk personnel are very helpful and always delightful. The rooms are remarkably clean and comfortable. All this for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Rome - Overlooking the Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: traderb500
Reviews.Content: We were so fortunate to select this property for our 1st time to Rome. This hotel is in the best location, walking distance to the Top Tourist Sites in Rome. The Hotel Staff is all affluent in English and extremely helpful and patient. This Hotel is a beautiful rooftop Bar, which is perfect for a pre-dinner cocktail. I highly suggest this hotel when in Rome....

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: textlife
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fantastic. Only thing we advise staying away from are their recommendations for restaurants. Stick to TA for that!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the location or the view!”
Reviews.Author: DaZipper
Reviews.Content: While it is a little pricey, it is well worth it if you can afford it. The Senior Suite is huge, free WiFi and has a great view with strong A/C (which was one of my concerns). The only complaint is the pillows are a little on the firm side. The free buffet breakfast is fair -to- good. I researched a ton of hotels around the Pantheon and couldn't be happier with our selection. PS - the elevators are tiny but you get used to it pretty quickly. Make sure you get a room with a view of the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...what a great place! Perfect location, room and staff”
Reviews.Author: Googliomo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. What a terrific place. First, the staff was terrific. They were friendly, had great dinner ideas, and made reservations for us. Our room was always spotless, too! The views of the Pantheon and Piazza della Rotunda were fantastic! It was great being in our room with the windows open to the business of the piazza and sound of the fountain. The location is the best there is for all of Rome. We can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hardydesk
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time back to Rome and I decided to stay at this hotel based on other travelers reviews and was NOT disappointed. The location could not have been better. We even walked to the Forum and Coliseum. Room was very clean, bed comfortable. They provided robes and slippers. We requested room 202 and got it. It had a great view of the Pantheon as well as the lively square below. One of our favorite things to do was after a busy day of sightseeing, we would come back to our room and open up the shutters and listen to the music that was being played in the square below. There are lots of restaurants around the beautiful square with many musicians entertaining every night. And when the Pantheon is lit up at night, it makes for a very romantic setting. Of course, Rome is a bustling city so you do hear the noises in the morning of the city waking up (truck deliveries, garbage pickup, etc.) but it didn't bother us. Our breakfast was included in our room rate and it is the typical European breakfast. Quality was good though. Also, they do have a rooftop bar. We went up there a few times, and the views were great! Front desk staff were also very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: BigB34
Reviews.Content: My family stayed the Albergo del Senato July 17-20th and can not say enough about our amazing experience. Even months before our arrival, staff would respond promptly to my daily emails with questions. From the moment we arrived, we felt welcomed and could tell that this was a very special hotel. Alessandro and Mauro went above and beyond each day to assist us from finding our way to restaurants, arranging car transportation and even a hair appointment too! From our wonderful rooms, delicious breakfast each morning and drinks on the rooftop patio, we were truly "wowed!" My older parents think it was the best hotel that they have ever stayed in and they have travelled the world. My 11 year old son did not want to leave, but we were heading our on a Holland America Cruise! Highly recommend this lovely hotel in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Start to our Italian Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Calgary_bgm
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights on our first trip to Rome. We had originally found the hotel through Trip Advisor. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, it was an outstanding experience. Two of the front desk staff (Mauro and Alessandra) made us feel like family. They never frowned once as we asked the dozens of questions that we came up with each day. They provided excellent restaurant recommendations. We also had a great deal of fun on the rooftop terrace with the two bartenders who made my children virgin Pina Colodas and entertained us all with funny stories. The location was perfect in the middle of all the action. The view from our window overlooking the Pantheon was an excellent way to immerse ourselves. It seems that no Trip Advisor review is complete without a comment on breakfast, so here is mine. Excellent pastries, lots of fruit and even Nutella for my daughter. We definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So fortunate we picked the Albergo Del Senato for our stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LivingstonBfi
Reviews.Content: We were so fortunate in picking this hotel for a 4 night stay in Rome. We had the mini-apartment on the first floor which was absolutely magnificant and newly renovated from head to toe. Unfortunately for us our 20 year old son got sick with a stomach flu on our first night in Rome. The hotel was very attentive to whatever we needed and even got us a great local doctor. Because of the central location of the hotel, we could go out for short periods of time and never be more than a 10 minute or less cab ride from Rome's main attractions or quick walk from the hotel. Alessandra at the front desk was a key part of making every aspect of our trip flow smoothly, especially knowing she was at the front desk every day we were there and our son could easily call her if he needed anything.

Reviews.Title: “I strongly doubt there's a better place to stay in all of Rome”
Reviews.Author: wudia
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in December and have been raving about it ever since to everyone we meet . There's so much to love about this place. The location is amazing. Stepping out of the hotel's front door you're right in the heart of the Piazza Rotunda on the steps of the Pantheon and feel absolutely immersed in the history of the city. It's also surprisingly close to most of the places we wanted to see as tourists, and we walked everywhere. It took about 15 minutes to reach the Roman Forum and 30 minutes to reach the Vatican. The rooms are delightful. Relatively big, very well decorated and extremely cosy. With the windows closed there was surprisingly little noise from the bustling square outside. Service is great and the continental style breakfast was absolutely sumptuous. (Endless refills of all kinds of coffees and hot chocolates helped too!) But what makes this hotel really stand out is the staff. Caring, patient, attentive, relentlessly good humoured, always chatty and cheerful and full of advice and recommendations. I have never ever enjoyed staying in a hotel as much as I enjoyed the Albergo Del Senato, largely because the staff were so good. I want to go back to Rome just to stay here again. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: davidj1970
Reviews.Content: What a view from the room, overlooking the Pantheon. The roof top bar is a great place to have a final nightcap after the madenss of a day in Rome. Everything is within walking distance. Hotel facilites are great and the rooms are lovely. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - what a way to finish our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaBill
Reviews.Content: On a 10-day trip through Italy with friends, we chose to "splurge" on our final hotel - Albergo del Senato in Rome. Everyone agreed they were glad we did. What a beautiful, classy hotel. The rooms were nicely appointed, and we reserved a pair of rooms with views over the Pantheon square...just stunning. The location was perfect and the staff, especially Alessandra, were particularly helpful in assistance with restaurant suggestions, taxi, laundry, etc. The included breakfast was good, including eggs cooked to order if you become tired of cold cuts! One of the best attributes of the hotel is the rooftop bar, accessed just down the hall from our top-floor rooms. The evening views extend from St. Peter's to the Forum. What a great atmosphere for a pre-dinner cocktail or to end a long day of walking, shopping and sightseeing. We will hopefully return to Albergo del Senato!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: mamabu
Reviews.Content: I couldnt be happier with the location of this hotel. Not only were you in a great spot to walk to the Trevi Fountain & Spanish Steps, but the Piazza was so lively at all times of the day. My teenagers loved people watching & the entertainment that seemed to appear eveynight in the Piazza. We had a Penthouse Suite and it was beautiful. The view was fantastic, and we heard no noise what-so-ever at night with the windows closed. I would have rated this hotel 5 Stars but the breakfast was definately in need of improvement. Also because we had to walk out from the rooftop bar after ordering because the gentleman who works after 9:00 p.m.(not the young guy) was too busy chatting with his friend and eating potatoe chips to get our drinks. After watching him chat with his friend for 20 minutes, we finally got upset enough to leave. That was very rude of him...

Reviews.Title: “Second time here - twice as good !! Staff, comfort,location !!”
Reviews.Author: Michael J H
Reviews.Content: 202 Corner room. We have been to Rome twice so cannot generate a fair comparison of this hotel against any other but, again loved this venue recommended by 3 sets of friends on the first time we visited Roma. We really wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. This is where its at - right on the Pantheon where the swirl of life is always just outside the double glazed windows. The staff are incredibly personable and helpful. The breakfast is good and so is the double shot latte if that's what you like. Everything from the Palantine, Colosseum,Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps and all the main shopping areas are accessable on foot. The hotel is surrounded by little tavernas, tavolas and all manner of places to have a bite of something. At night we loved eating at Antonio al Pantheon, Vitti Ristorante, Ristorante da Donato alle du Colonne, via del Seminario. For lunch if you like porketta or that type of paninni try Paninado - cheap fresh and tasty and enjoy a beer. If you like tap beer really cold go to Pummarola Ristorante and have a Morretti in a frozen beer mug. Superb. Campo di Marzio has great coffe, snadwiches and pizza @ Medriana and also has a bagne calda for other meals. Busy,clean and vibrant. So, if you have read this far you know we love this Hotel, it's staff and it's location. Since our last stay the owners are well down the road to completing an extensive room makeover and on our return from Positano we were on the 6th floor - in a lovely room with balcony and views in the direction of Piazza Navona. Our unguided Vatican tour was a bunfight - too many people. Free internet and wi fi for multiple devices. The hardwire internet was best.

Reviews.Title: “Steps from History”
Reviews.Author: herewegoDetroit_MI
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the del Senato. We shuttled in from the Rome airport after driving back down from our 10 days or so in Florence and rural Tuscany and dropping off our rental van. We were amazed as we emerged from a maze of streets to the square containing the Pantheon and the del Senato - it's literally right to the side of the Pantheon. The hotel lobby was cool and inviting on a hot day. The desk staff were fabulous. They were always at the ready and helpful with reservations, etc. Although the rooms are on the small side they are well appointed, clean and cool. We slept well! We had a busy few days of sight seeing and enjoyed heading out to dinner - many walkable locations. The hotel is not far at all from Piazza Navona area. Also nice are the number of shops right near the hotel as well as famous coffee houses and gelateria. We took advantage of the roof top terrace twice - unbelievable views - especially at night. It was nice to have a cocktail and look over the rooftops. Breakfast too was great - lots of things to choose from - pastries, scrambled eggs/bacon, toast, cereals, hard boiled eggs, meats, juices, nice pots of coffee, fruits, etc. The only very minor thing we encountered was a brief trail of ants in the bathroom - after using some hand sanitizer, we had no more visits. In sum, I definitely would recommend this hotel, both for the great location and views and for the nice room, breakfasts, etc. We definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: clgarb111
Reviews.Content: The Albergo del Senato hotel was lovely. The staff was extremely helpful and very professional. They went out of their way to help us and we really appreciated that. The location was perfect right beside the Pantheon so there was plenty to see and do right outside the hotel door. The room was very clean and serviced every day and night. The rooftop bar was the perfect location to watch the sunset over Rome. The breakfast each morning was very nice with plenty of choices and great service. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the reviews say - 5 star service!”
Reviews.Author: RichF18
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and it lived up to expectation. Great location, clean, safe with excellent staff. We were collected by a driver (can be prebooked on their website), well worth the money and not much more than a taxi. The front desk staff was very helpful recommending good restaurants, booking tours etc. Our room was exceptionally clean with a turn down service in the evening. The rooftop bar had lovely views and excellent staff. Look forward to staying there when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Size and Newness of Room Should be Priced Accordingly”
Reviews.Author: traveling2_9
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel, especially since it was right next to the Pantheon. Breakfast was very good, and when we missed the time period one day, food was brought to us at a different location than the breakfast room.
