All of the people who worked the front dest were extremely helpful and informative. That being said, our room on the second floor, in front of the stairs, needed some improvements. Even though it looked out to the Pantheon as we requested, it lacked the remodeling that other rooms had. I would have requested a newer room, but thought the rooms had all been remodeled. Just make sure that you request a newer room, as the prices were the same. My cousins had an end room on the third floor overlooking the Pantheon and it was beautiful! They paid the same price as we did. That really upset me, since we stayed for three nights, and they stayed for one. If I return, I will stay there, but will make sure that I get a better room.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but the best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: rhip
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in mid-June. My wife and I had an interior room, which was very nice - our son had a single, which was almost as large, and had an incredible view of the Pantheon below. The staff was knowledgeable (excellent restaurant recommendations) and helpful. In Rome, location is everything, and no hotel of comparable quality has a better one. Everything is within walking distance, and what a great city to walk in! It is expensive, but worth it if you can handle the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, knowledgable staff, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Canamital
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed stay at the Senato. Centrally located, nice rooms (good Internet), very nice desk staff. Great restaurant recommendations. We were able to walk everywhere and our kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing view of history...right from your bedroom!”
Reviews.Author: trip-together
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights for our honeymoon June 10-13th. We took the train from Florence to Rome and a taxi to the Hotel....very easily done. We thought we were prepared to see the Pantheon and square when we arrived....but the pictures over the years just don't do it enough justice! What an amazing site!!!! We thought front desk was friendly, but sometimes a bit ...well....pretentious sometimes...depending on who was on. We had a Superior Double Room...queen bed with a Pantheon View. We paid an average of $340.00 Euros...not cheap...but for our honeymoon...we decided to splurge...and we thought it was worth it! Our room was on the 6th floor...room 603. We had a wee balcony overlooking the incredible Pantheon. Breakfast was quite good...with juices, fruits, cereals, breads, and two out of the 3 days scrambled eggs...the breakfast room is not huge, so you saw some people waiting....it is a very pretty room, wonderful service. \ The roof-top bar was open when we were there. We took advantage of this one evening. Service was friendly, and fast, with little nibbles of olives, and nuts with your drinks. You can see the city quite nicely up top. We were given some advice on restaurants in the area by the front desk staff...and these worked out very nicely. they were booked for us no trouble at all...in fact, the one person on the desk made certain she gave us a look on the internet and read the description of the restaurant for us. We also booked a tour guide from our hotel for 3 hours....again....pricey...nothing in Rome is cheap....but it was well worth it, we bypassed long lines to the forum and other spots on a very hot day. Our guide gave us bits of information on this and that ....which I am sure we would not have gotten otherwise. We did do a hop on hop off of the city first....just to get a good feel of the city. We found this to be the perfect location for site seeing all different areas....Trevi fountain, Colosseum, forum, Spanish steps etc etc...shopping and restaurants and across the river to Trastevere was all very close...we walked most places...taxi to Trastevere Our room was small, but well appointed. It held many areas for unpacking clothing, mini bar, pretty bathroom, very clean...and although the square is very busy into the night....when we closed the shutters, we heard nothing. Air conditioning was a must here....and we were so happy to have it :) There was a very well equipped bathroom with lotions, and soaps, and shampoo and hair blower, bath robes and slippers. We were also treated to wine and nibbles for our honeymoon in our room. If you are going to do Rome only once....staying here is something to think about. Waking up to the Pantheon is something special...The hotel is beautiful, small, and mostly friendly. We found many of the front desk staff very friendly and answered every question that came to them....there were many....:) We did throw a coin into the Trevi fountain...so we may be back there some day...we hope.....it is such a beautiful city...friendly and we found it quite clean especially for a major city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service and roof top bar too!”
Reviews.Author: BocaArchitect
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after our cruise arrived in Port Civ. The hotel is right next to the Pantheon and convenient to major sites. We walked to Coliseum 20-25 minutes, Vatican 30 mins and Steps and fountain in 15 minutes. Never needed a taxi/bus and the walks were safe and enjoyable with lots to see along the way. We want to mention the excellent service Joseph at the roof top bar, gave us both nights!!! He was helpful with local knowledge and very charming. Not to mention the excellent Bellini, and sangria which were very refreshing after a long hot day of touring. The snacks were delicious too. The view/sunset to the Vatican is awesome! It is so nice to take the city in from atop after a day of touring. If you stay here you must plan on relaxing here before you head out to dinner. Luca -front desk, and was extremely helpful and friendly with directions, restaurant reservations, maps and bus routes. Alessandra was too! Our room 405 was chosen based on another Trip Advisor review. It was on the 4th floor and the window had a view to the Pantheon Square. The room and bathroom was small but very clean and recently updated. For 2 nights we did not mind the limited space, or after being on a cruise ship for 12 days. The walls had beautiful fabric wall covering, there was a coffee bar with mini-frig and a closet/cabinet. The shower/bath has pretty glass tile with great water pressure. The counter space was limited. The breakfast had delicious fresh fruit, eggs, tomatoes and cheese/meats as well as the standards - yogurt, baked goods (excellent coffee cake), cereal and fresh juices. There are plenty of good choices to fill you up in the morning. I debated where to stay for a while in Rome, and maybe that is why the cost was higher since I waited to book until 2 weeks before we were to arrive. We decided to stay here based upon recommendations from friends who had stayed here several times before. The cost was much higher than we usually pay for a hotel, but the convenience and amenities were great. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and will recommend to our friends visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: PortiaG
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel based on reviews on TA and we couldn't be more thrilled with our choice. The location is spectacular! Our room was very nice with a fantastic view of the Pantheon. From the window you could watch all of tha action in the piazza. The hotel was located so that we could walk everywhere we wanted to go in Rome. There were many nice restaurants nearby - we particularly loved Trattoria Antonio. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful, especially Allesandra and Mauro. We took a day trip to my husband's home town in Molise and they helped us with the travel arrangements to this remote town. The breakfast staff were also fabulous and the food was great. A very substantial breakfast that gave us a good start for the day. We are planning to return to Rome this summer and will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, amazing location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnthyne
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best located hotels in the city because directly out your window is the Pantheon and just around the corner is Trevi Fountain with the Spanish Steps also a short walk away. The staff at this hotel was exceptionally kind and accommodating. The location really can't be beat as stated above. The room we had was a decent size with a cozy bathroom but nothing spectacular. Breakfast was good. You should definitely ask about and find the Saint Eustachio coffee shop around the corner, this is worth the walk!! Also, there is a little restaurant/bar just a few buidlings away from this hotel that has a rendition of the bocca de veritas (mouth of truth) on the wall and it is an excellent restaurant, we went twice in 4 days! All in all this is a decent place to stay but for the money you may be able to find another small luxury hotel with a little more to offer. To be fair, we were there in January (not a peak season).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lalassie
Reviews.Content: What could be better than stepping out of your hotel and seeing the Pantheon and stepping into your hotel and finding an oasis of calm and comfort from the madness that can be Rome? Very nice breakfast, lovely room, and very helpful staff -- especially Alessandra who was absolutely a gem. Restaurant recommendations were great with one exception . The hotel is so central to everything (except a metro stop). For a change of pace, try the little electric bus nicknamed the camel because it takes forever! But it was a wonderful way to get to the Gallerie Borghese. Grazie mille. Hope to be back sooner rather than later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - we will return!”
Reviews.Author: YaYaCruiser
Reviews.Content: We picked Albergo del Senato based on reviews on the web and we were not disappointed. The location is perfect, the rooms are lovely, clean and well appointed. The staff are excellent; helpful, friendly and provide great recommendations. This was our first visit to Rome and will not be our last. This Hotel is centrally located for easy walking to most attractions, there's a taxi stand just across the square; the Pantheon is literally a dozen steps from the front door and there are plenty of shops and small restaurants for excellent meal choices. A plentiful breakfast is served in the morning with really good cappucino and late enough in the morning that you don't need to get up at the crack of dawn if you don't want to. Very civilized. The rooftop bar was a lovely place to have a drink and look at the City lights. We loved Rome and we loved the Albergo del Senato - would not stay anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place. Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Michael2002
Reviews.Content: The staff were lovely. even put a bottle of Prosecco in our room for my birthday. lovely touch. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo del Senato the best!”
Reviews.Author: Jesse54
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for three nights, June 16 to 19th, and loved the hotel. Staff was excellent, everything immaculate, lovely morning breakfast, great rooftop bar, service was perfect and the location was so much fun! We were right next to the Pantheon, so much shopping and touring and restaurant access right by the hotel, it was just a great choice, and a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel and staff.”
Reviews.Author: TurfTycoon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at del Senato for 4 nights in Room 204, which has a private balcony which looks out on to Piazza della Rotonda and the Pantheon. We really enjoyed our stay and were impressed with the service – special mentions to Luca and Alessandra. I’m not entirely sure why this lovely little hotel only rates three stars. The room is spacious, comfortable and tastefully furnished, and the bathroom has a bath tub. The only negative (and it’s hardly a deal breaker) was the wardrobe configuration. It doesn’t make the best use of the available space and was a bit frustrating to use. The air conditioning is controlled via a computer at reception – we encountered this system once before in Italy. The breakfast spread is modest but ok, and the breakfast room can get a little cramped, but the service was good and I enjoyed Serena humming happily along with the classical music. We visited the roof top bar twice, once for coffee in the afternoon sun, the other time for cocktails in the early evening, when we were stalked by pigeons – we did intend to go up there after dark to enjoy the ambience but never made it. Piazza della Rotonda is lively in the evenings – there are always buskers and even a bit of street theatre. I needed ear plugs to make sure I got to sleep but had no trouble doing so. Being an old building there are also a few creaks and plumbing noises, especially in the morning. To really enjoy the Piazza and the Pantheon (opens at 8:30 AM) get up early and just walk out the front door of your hotel. The hotel is in a very central location. While it is a 10 or 15 minute (flat) walk to the nearest Metro station we utilised the small taxi rank on the other side of the Pantheon and found that it was no more than about a 7 euro fare to any point in the city. While there are many restaurants and cafes on the Piazza, these were not recommended by the hotel staff. Instead they directed us to a lovely enoteca (wine bar) just around the corner “Spiriti” and to a nice local restaurant “Casa Copelle”. I thoroughly recommend Albergo del Senato for a true Roman experience.

Reviews.Title: “Second time even better then the first!”
Reviews.Author: lisaleslie
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on a two week family vacation. Upon arriving at the aiport we were greeted by our friendly driver arranged by the hotel. Checked into our room overlooking the Pantheon, which itself is stunning. Our 4th floor room had been remodeled since our last visit. Rooms are small but clean and up to date. Lovely decor. This hotel is all about location, location. The rooftop bar was open and we enjoyed the amazing views of the city. You can even see the top of Saint Peters Cathedral. Mauro and Alessandra were wonderful and made our stay a much more pleasurable experience. Their help was greatly appreciated. The day of our departure the local taxi service went on strike. Alessandra was able to secure a private car for us.

Reviews.Title: “Location + Roofbar make this special”
Reviews.Author: safeasmilk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights and have no complaints about this hotel. Staff, decor, breakfast were all very good and on a par with a good four star; we even got a turn-down service! What makes this hotel really special however is the location and the roofbar. All this comes at a price of course and I'm sure other hotels in Rome can offer more m.sq for your Euro. Rome is a fantastic location for a city break with so much to see and do both indoors and out that I'd recommend it to anyone who is able to go. I'd also recommend a restaurant if we had found a decent one but frozen food, microwave cooking, high prices and contempt for customers masked by overbearing geniality appear to be the norm in the centre of town. We didn't try the top of the range restaurants but found it best not to be over ambitious with menu choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Experience Rome”
Reviews.Author: BubbaJak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Albergo Del Senato at the end of May 2011. The location is extraordinary - right in the middle of the buzz of the piazza, which has an electric feeling to it. Front desk staff were top notch. Our room was on the 6th floor facing the Pantheon with a little balcony. The room appeared to be newly renovated and was quite lovely, albeit a bit small. We walked to every major tourist site, to include Vatican City from this hotel. Breakfast had good staples to tide you over until lunchtime. Weather was great at this time of the year - sunny, but not overly hot and humid. About 70F. I was very pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: 186334Richard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo del Senato for 4 nights at the beginning of June 2011. Our stay from start too finish was fantastic, all the staff were very helpfull, restaurant bookings etc were dealt with in an instant, the view from the room was amazing, music in the square in the evenings, but the room was quite and cool with the aircon. The terrace bar - what a view, what service - really professional but still very friendly. We could not find fault and would go back in an instant! Rome is such a great place to visit and the Senato is ideally situated to see everything, we walked everywhere. Thank you to all at the Senato.

Reviews.Title: “Great second stay”
Reviews.Author: rapjkp
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Senato. We were in rooms 305 and 312. 305 has a terrific view of the pantheon and piazza. Noise was not a problem when the shutters, double paned windows and drapes were closed. The room is very elegant and newly remodeled. Although small it is very well planned with lots of storage and closet space. Comfortable beds and great AC. I enjoyed being able to make a cup of tea with the hot water carafe. There is also a reasonably priced minibar. Twice a day maid service with turn down service. I did miss the candies that were placed on the pillows at our last stay. Staff was helpful and knowledgable. We appreciated all the gelato recommendations. The only criticism would be of the breakfast. We stayed at two other hotels in our two weeks in Italy and they both served fresh juices. Canned juice for a hotel of this caliber is puzzling. Breakfast here is just adequate. However the service was always good. As said by many other reviewers the location can not be beat and we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every single penny”
Reviews.Author: cyasukot
Reviews.Content: Amazing location next to the Pantheon and many Churches of Interest. Fantastic front desk staff who are truly looking out for you and make every effort to make you really happy with your stay. They recommended restaurants, made reservations, dealt with tour company snafus, negotiated a taxi strike, checked us in for our flight, gave us directions. Every single person manning the desk is friendly and competent, be it noon or midnight. I'd revisit Rome just to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a location!”
Reviews.Author: Colleyville_traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in May 2011 per the recommendation of our Italian guide. Just outside the Pantheon. We had a free breakfast with our meal. Staff was very helpful and spoke English well. Rooms were clean. Great shopping nearby and a lot of popular sites are within walking distance. Restaurant at the front of the hotel has a great view for people watching in the plaza and the Pantheon. I will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: dusty100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only one night for our last night in Rome. Location great-the Pantheon was literally outside our window in the square. We thought the noise of the crowds would be bothersome through the windows but it wasn't. We got an automatic room upgrade which was nice. Older hotel with worn but clean furnishings. Very helpful front desk. Breakfast was included with our room. Very Pricey room probably due to location. Lots of restaurants around the area. Again right by Pantheon and close to Piazza Navone.

Reviews.Title: “Location Perfect, Front Office staff incredible”
Reviews.Author: MomTo10Dogs
Reviews.Content: Although we had to endure a harrowing cab ride from the train station (only cost about 15 Euro and didn't take too long), the location here was SO worth it and the front office staff was just incredible, starting with a demonstration of calligraphy on our room folder. We walked from here to our Colosseum tour and found a great pizza place on the way back, then had drinks on the roof-top terrace, overlooking the Pantheon. Our room also faced the Pantheon and the view of both it and the square were so impressive! The room had a little sitting area when you first walked in and a nice bathroom. Extras included slippers and a really nice little shoe polishing sponge that we were so impressed with we took with us and used several more times during our trip. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JohnS46
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 nights at this hotel in late May. First of all the location cannot be beat if you want to be within walking distance of the main Rome attractions. Room was typically small as most are in Europe, but it still provided for enough room to easily get around and to store a months worth of travel clothes. Our view was overlooking the Pantheon and the piazza in front of it. Clearly a wonderful site. The room was clean and serviced effectively. Bathrooms were modern and well designed. The reception desk personnel were very helpful with directions, dinner suggestions and other travel type questions. Most, but not all, restaurant recommendations were good. Lots of options for dining exist in the area with others available with a 5-15 minute walk. We rate this very high for value and location. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedTravelerz
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel made our vacation in Rome very special. We found it though TripAdviser. The location is perfect. The hotel is on a beautiful piazza, along with the Pantheon. The piazza is always filled with activity. Outdoor restaurants line the piazza and the small streets around the hotel. You can easily walk to most major sites from the hotel and if you need a cab, the cab stand is right there. Our room had a wonderful balcony overlooking the piazza. (It is the only room with a balcony, so be sure to request it.) Our room was spacious by Rome standards and very comfortable, with a nice bath. The hotel staff is warm, friendly and very helpful. They knew our names and always greeted us personally. We often asked them for recommendations and they gave us excellent suggestions about what we might enjoy and what to avoid. The hotel interior is beautiful and well-maintained. An added benefit was the free wifi in our room.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: centralarea
Reviews.Content: I can do little more than repeat the comments of others on how good this hotel is. My wife and I stayed here for six nights in May 2011. The hotel is elegant but at the same time relaxed. The location is near-perfect, within walking distance of most of the main sights and close to a wide range of restaurants, bars and cafes - and ice cream shops. The hotel accommodation is extremely comfortable, quiet and well-maintained. We had a standard double room, which didn’t have a view of the Pantheon, but was of a good size, tastefully decorated and very quiet and cool. The buffet breakfasts were pretty good and service was quick and attentive. However, what really makes this hotel stand out is its wonderful friendly and helpful staff at all levels. We are already planning our next visit to the Albergo Del Senato!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Billyjeanne5281
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Rome was all the more incredible because of this hotel. Staff went "above and beyond" with their kind and professional manner. The room was wonderful, the breakfast was delightful, and the location couldn't be beat. If cost is any concern make the sacrifice on something else and indulge yourself here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dep0515
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed only one night in this lovely hotel, but the staff did everything they could to make our short stay a perfect one. We stayed in a double room (room 315) and it was very nicely appointed with a large bathroom and huge shower stall (which is rare in Italy). The room itself was quite small, and we didn't have a view. But there were nice touches, like a delicious fruit basket upon arrival, slippers and robes, and several English speaking channels on the TV (not that we watched much, but it was nice to have). The location simply cannot be beat. The Pantheon is steps away from the front door and all the major sites are within easy walking distance. The staff members are wonderful - from the first email I sent to them, they were very responsive and willing to accomodate any requests that they could. Mauro and Luca at the front desk are very friendly and welcoming. Special mention for Piero, who walked over to Armando al Pantheon (had an amazing meal here) to secure a reservation for us when they weren't answering their phone! Views from the rooftop terrace were breathtaking. I wish we could have stayed longer, but the one night we had there was a very enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JC2
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. The location is excellent - easy walking to many sites and to tons of restaurants, plus a taxi stand on the other side of the Pantheon. The piazza can be a bit noisy though, and the a/c in my room did not cool so well so each night I faced a dilemma of cool and noisy vs. quieter and warm. The beds are small and acceptably comfortable. The pillow is very flat. The bathrooms are big and modern. The rooms have refrigerators and safes. The breakfast buffet was fine, with the typical stuff.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LeslieE
Reviews.Content: The Albergo is perfectly located next to the Pantheon. It is totally quiet in the rooms when the windows are closed,has air-conditioning,great breakfast,delightful and helpful front desk,clean updated rooms,great cleaning staff and is walking distance to every attraction. We spent 5 nights at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ccrosner
Reviews.Content: I booked the Albergo del Senato based on all of the glowing reviews here on Tripadvisor. And I'll agree with all that people have to say--the location, service and cleanliness of the hotel are fantastic. But for over $500 per night, I have to say that I think the room was very small and that we might have found a bigger room in a similar location for a lower price. We stayed on the 6th floor in a superior deluxe room. The view was gorgeous, we loved the french doors and balcony and my fears of not being able to sleep due to noise were unfounded. Very quiet and the drapes block out all of the light. But you could not walk to the window if your spouse was sitting at the desk, there were only three small drawers for storing clothes and only one person could be at the bathroom sink at a time. Everyone always says, "But who cares because you are not in your room much." Yes, but if you are paying over $500 a night, you'd like to be able to move around when you are in your room! Yes, the staff is friendly and helpful though I wouldn't say they sent us to restaurants that were out of the ordinary. And any time we asked them to book a restaurant that I had researched here on Tripadvisor, they would say "we're not hearing very good things about that restaurant these days." Our last night, we asked them to book the restaurant anyway and it was the best place we ate the entire trip. They clearly have their favorite spots. It sounds like I'm totally negative here. I'm not. It was a lovely hotel and we enjoyed the bartender immensely as well as both the piazza-level outdoor area and the roofdeck. It's just that I'm not sure it was worth over $500 a night for two people.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Guacharaca
Reviews.Content: What can I say that it hasn't been said already? I stayed at the Albergo last week with my husband and daughter, it's a lovely hotel, best location in Rome, we walked everywhere, lovely rooftop bar, the barman made one of the best sangrias I had lately, but the best thing about this hotel is the staff, from the moment you arrive until you check out they make you feel more than welcome, I want to thank all of them, Luca for the great restaurant recommendation and specially Mauro who was soooo nice, he is great! No matter how many times you bother him, he always helps you with a smile and he speaks as many languages as you need :) Thank you for making our stay so pleasant, next time we come back to Rome we will stay at the Albergo, no doubt about it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Can't say enough positive things.”
Reviews.Author: Steveut02
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights a couple of weeks back as the first stop on our honeymoon. Although it was very close with another fine Florence hotel, my wife and I both agree this was the best hotel of our stay. Room #407 was perfect. The staff recognized (I'm assuming when they copied our passports) that my birthday was during our stay and left a nice note with 2 free drinks at the rooftop bar (which was also perfect). Also a perfect location for exploring. Can't imagine staying anywhere else and after seeing the location of a couple of other hotels we considered (slightly higher rated on TA), I'm extremely glad we stayed at Albergo Del Senato. We won't consider another hotel whenever we return.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel right next to the Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: KesslerPark01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Albergo Del Senato for 3 nights in May 2011. It was lovely. Our room overlooked the Pantheon, which was very special. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and knew us by name almost immediately after we checked in. The location of the hotel is great. It is right next to the Pantheon (which makes it easy to take cabs -- just tell the driver you want to go to the Pantheon), and relatively easy walking distance from a number of other sights, such as the Forum/Colloseum. The Spanish Steps are a bit further, but still walkable. We liked the neighborhood around the hotel as there are a number of good cafes and restaurants and very safe at night. The coffee place right next to the hotel was terrific. Breakfast was included in our rate, and it was adequate for us (pastries, coffee, juice, etc.). If you want something more substantial, you'll have to go elsewhere. We also enjoyed the rooftop bar, especially at sunset. Its a very nice way to relax for a few minutes before heading to dinner. Just watch out for the pigeons!

Reviews.Title: “Best accommodations, location and staff in ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: ChioTravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 days. The Hotel exceeded our expectations relative to the 6th floor balcony room with view of the Pantheon, the excellent staff and the incredible location.The Piazza Rotonda which our room overlooked is also a bit of the real of the life of old Rome, without being as extreem as the Piazza Navona and Spanish Steps. Additionally, the staff went well beyond expectationsin regards to an issue we had with our missing passports. After midnight on the day we were to return to the US the staff were able to contact the hotel in Positano where we had left our passports and had them delivered to us by 9:30 am the same morning. Finally, we travel alot and found this hotel to fit all our requirements to the T and .would not stay anywhere else when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Albergo Del Senato”
Reviews.Author: Ted047
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a penthouse suite from 24 - 29 April. The room lived up to all expectations and had a beautiful terrace with table and chairs and a wonderful view of the Pantheon and the piazza. Staff were very friendly. The wireless Internet service was free and fast. This was a great stay (our second great stay at this hotel). We most highly recommend the hotel and it's ideal location for Rome sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel,fantastic location, brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: whitehead59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 3rd May to 10th May and booked a double room and a single room.The double room (206)was directly overlooking the Piazza and the Pantheon-fantastic location/views.We had a wonderful stay and all the staff could not do enough for us.The breakfast was very enjoyable-bacon/scrambled egg toast croissant meats fruit etc-as much coffee/tea as you wanted and great service. A thoroughly enjoyable experience and we hope to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: Beaune
Reviews.Content: Well, the staff are very helpful, friendly, and understanding. Luca and Mauro are probably the best front desk people I have ever encountered in decades of traveling. And after all the reviews that point out how well this hotel is located, all of which are true, I thought it useful to mention the excellent staff. There are some other hotels in the neighborhood, but the staff and the accommodations make this place the place to stay in Rome. In terms of location, it is not just the Pantheon that is the attraction. Within a stone's throw there are St. Ignatius Church, Santa Maria supra Minerva, St. Ives, St. Andrew, and Gesu--all archetectural masterpieces and art museums with free admission. Moreover, there are excellent restaurants (e.g., da Donato), coffee houses (e.g., Tazzo d'Oro, St. Eustache), and gelato (e.g., Blue Ice--try the mango sorbet!) very close by. The cab stand is just across the piazza. This area has it all! It is the hub of the wheel of Rome attractions--Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Quirinale, Piazza Navona, the Vatican, etc. So how is it inside the hotel? We loved it before, and we loved it this time as well. The hotel has 6 stories; now the top 4 floors have been redone. Our room 604 was quite attractive; the balcony was a special treat. The one negative I must point out is that the rooms are small. But not too small. There is a rooftop bar that is open in season. It is a great place to have a drink at sunset. The breakfast is quite good. There is a large spread of fruit, meat, cheese, cereal, bread, pastry, and eggs. For the number of guests, the breakfast room is small and can get crowded, especially at the end of the time for breakfast. Uusually when I travel to a city I study all the hotel options. But not when I go to Rome. This is such a perfect place, I just book it, knowing I have the best place to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “don't think about it - just book it!”
Reviews.Author: Lina41
Reviews.Content: I know that this hotel has several wonderful reviews with lots of gushing compliments.....and this one will be no different because it is all true! This was one of the best hotels we have stayed in - ever. The staff were extremely attentive, polite, kind, and answered all of our touristy questions with patience & sincerity. Alessandra & the staff at breakfast were exceptional - a pleasant way to begin & end our day. The rooms were a wonderful place to come back to after sight seeing all day - always clean & comfortable. The photos posted are for room 606 - we did splurge & booked this suite, but it was worth every penny!! We used the balcony overlooking the Pantheon/piazza daily & it was a perfect way to relax & enjoy the bustling of the piazza. Being right in the piazza you may be worried about noise, but you need not. We had absolutely no noise issues at any time of day. The beds were comfortable; the original pillows placed in the room were a tad hard - but a quick call to the front desk & the perfect pillow presented. (The 'tad hard' pillow is really the only negative thing I have to say; however, my husband disagrees about the original pillows & thus has nothing negative to say!) The bath was clean, nice amenities, lush towels, and plently of hot water. The breakfast buffet had lots of variety - cheeses, eggs, meats, yogurts, fruit, breads, etc. The location of the Senato could not have been more perfect - we were in the center of Rome; walked to all points of interests - from the Vatican to the Colosseum to the Borghese. The Borghese was a little bit of a walk, but break it up with a stop for dinner and it was more than doable. Rome is such an easy city to walk and the Senato puts you right in the middle of it all. We only used a taxi once to make our very early Vatican tour. (We never used any other public transportation as there really was no need.)The Senato also has chairs/tables right outside thier hotel for use of their guests only - so even if you don't book a room with a balcony, you can still enjoy the piazza comfortably without any pressures/worries. This hotel is MUCH nicer (and friendlier) than many 4/5 star hotels we have stayed in this year. The Senato definitely is a 4-star quality hotel at the very least. I would (and have) recommended this hotel to everyone & will definitely stay here on our next visit to Rome - which we hope is sonner than later!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for Rome”
Reviews.Author: VerdantTrip
Reviews.Content: I'm sitting in the rooftop terrace looking across Rome. We spent four nights. A great hotel - clean, comfortable and spacious. Well decorated , right on the Pantheon square walking distance to many attractions. Good selection if restaurants. Hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: ykjetset
Reviews.Content: The Albergo del Senato is a beautiful hotel. The staff are most helpful, in particular Mauro was so friendly and helpful he helped make our stay a memorable one. The hotel is in an ideal location as you can walk to all the main tourist attractions. You walk outside the hotel and the Pantheon is right in front of you it is an amazing sight, one of the many! Rooms are very clean and spacious, breakfast is served in a lovely bright room with plenty of choice. This hotel was truly amazing a little bit more expensive but worth every penny. I would wholeheartedly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home base for walking the streets of Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: dave2step
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of April after reading the reviews about how perfect the location is - and everyone was right! You are not going to find a better location than this, right smack dab in the middle of everything you want to see that made you want to go to Rome in the first place. Within about a half hour walking time, you can be at the Colosseum in one direction, or the Vatican in the other direction. There's plenty to see along the way too, which can really only be appreciated on foot. Nice restaurants right outside your door, gelato readily available, and depending on your room, a fantastic view of the Pantheon. We were lucky enough to stay in room 204, which is the room with the balcony you can see when you look at the front of the building, just above the main entrance. That was a nice surprise, and a great way to view the exterior of the Pantheon and people watch. The hidden gem of this hotel is the rooftop terrace. Althought the bar wasn't open when we went up (you could still buy a drink inside and take it up with you if you wanted though), we thoroughly enjoyed the views, and watched the sunset over St. Paul's Cathedral. We really enjoyed our stay here, and would highly recommend it to anyone. Yes, it's a little on the expensive side, but everything in Rome is. How many times in your life are you fortunate enough to travel to Rome, especially if you're from North America? Spend the little extra and stay at this hotel, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location, Recently Updated”
Reviews.Author: STinNC
Reviews.Content: The Albergo del Senato is literally next to the Pantheon. You can walk to all the major sites in Rome. When all the recent upgrades are completed ( and most are), this hotel should gain another star. Front rooms are on the piazza, which was wonderful for us. The noise from the activity was minimal. Enjoy, you are in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “It has all been said before.”
Reviews.Author: seiryu79
Reviews.Content: Seriously, what more is there to stay. The location in insane!! You can almost touch the Pantheon from the hotel's windows. We were lucky enough to stay in the penthouse. If you feel like splurging, go for it! The room was large, tasteful, and we had our own private terrace on top of the entire Piazza Rotonda. Such a cool Piazza and cool hotel! You cannot ask for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Negative About this Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mzimmerman2
Reviews.Content: Having lived and studied in Rome for a full college academic year in the mid-seventies, I knew the general location I wanted to stay on this return trip some 35 years later. After a tip on this hotel from a fellow classmate, I researched it further on the internet and of course, TripAdvisor. It was the perfect choice. Prior to arrival, the Hotel staff emailed me and helped arrange pickup and drop off from the airport via a private driver/service. That went flawless. They had a power adapter ready for me upon arrival for my medical needs. Again, this hotel and staff were true pros. Rome's a very walkable city and one cannot appreciate the architecture, the art, the culture or the "surprise" of this ancient urban plan if one doesn't physically walk the streets and experience the excitement from that perspective. Key to that is finding a centrally located hotel for your "home base" and the Pantheon-Piazza Navona-Campo di Fiori neighborhoods should be the target search zone(s). Albergo del Senato is directly on the piazza in front of the Pantheon. The energy of street life on the piazza is worth the price of a night's stay alone. We propped open our windows immediately to enjoy a backdrop of street musicians, performers, and just the pleasant din of multiple conversations occurring at the various restaurants and cafe's ringing the beautiful piazza. We particularly enjoyed the young male opera soloist who's acapella renditions in Italian were beautiful. Morning breakfasts were superb. Fresh. Varirty. Attentive and friendly staff waiting on your coffee needs. The rooftop deck was not yet open for the season. I can only imagine breakfast al fresco or a sunset glass of wine would be an added treat up within the domed skyline of this part of Rome. The front desk man was personable, helpful and always accurate with a superb restaurant recommendation. Some of the best dining I've had in Rome. The neighborhood has the famous coffee shop Tazza D'oro nearby...simply the best. Pizza by the slice about a block east of the coffe shop. Piazza Navona is a short walk as is the Campo di Fiori and it's fresh colorful produce. The del Senato is clean and the room we had was perfect for our travel needs. I understand during a recent remodeling of a different room on a different floor, an original ceiling fresco was discovered and restored. So there are definitely some additional rooms to request on our next visit. This hotel is highlt recommended by this writer.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to venture out from in exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: bobtaylor908
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the sixth floor overlooking the plaza and the Pantheon. Always something going on in the square. Great shops all around within walking distance. Rooms and bath are a bit small, but very nice. Staff very helpful and friendly. Only negative might be the elevators which are quite small and on the slow side, and challenged wifi access.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and outstanding staff make this this hotel stand out”
Reviews.Author: bellknob
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are extremely attentive and they go out of their way to help you in any way they can. Alexandra, in particular, exceeded in all of the above but Luca and Mauro were also very helpful, polite and delightful. The location is perfect because it is in the middle of the historic center overlooking the Pantheon, but the Piazza della Rotonda can be noisy, especially in the evening when Puccini arias or Andrea Bocelli songs are being sung by various street artists. It can be hard to sleep with all that going on, especially if you have jet lag; however, it was magical once we got on Roman time. The breakfasts at the hotel were excellent and the rooms are very tastefully done and elegant with sound absorbing padded fabric walls. Most of the rooms have just been redone and look brand new right down to the ornate crown moldings. Our room, which, fortunately, was on the (top) 6th floor, was one of the few that had a small balcony. Imagine opening the curtains and doors to reveal a spectacular view of the Pantheon only a few feet away and the din of the crowd below.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: bullyboy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in early April. We booked a superior room through their website and I had asked for a room on a high floor based on other Trip Advisor comments. Was pleased to find out upon check in we got one of the few rooms with a little balcony overlooking the Pantheon. Once outside I realized only 3 rooms besides the suites have those balconies so was very happy. The weather was still in the 60s so we left the windows open most of the time, they had louvered covers for nighttime. We would close the windows early when trying to get to sleep, they blocked out most of the sound from the square and I had no issues sleeping. Room was small as most older hotels, but that was expected. Furnishings, linens etc were all clean and met our expectations. We went to restaurants both nights based on staff recommendations and they had more locals than tourists which we appreciated. We quickly realized that any restaurant in any guidebook (Rick Steves, Lonely Planty, Rough Guide) were swamped with tourists and wanted to get away from those. Although the guidebook places do tend to speak English better. Rome was more crowded than I expected, turns out it was Cultural Week the Forum, Colessium and Palatine Hill were all free entry. The thousounds of teenagers from around Europe were there on school trips. I can't imagine how crowded it must get there in the peak of summer.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: traveler187791
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel was Michele the bartender; excellent housekeeping and breakfast servers. Everything else was terrible, especially the indifferent, and even scornful, management. Guests were never warned in advance of major renovations, including constant noise, dust, and construction throughout our ten-day stay--with no compensation offered, either in the form of a discount or a voucher. Truly inhospitable and indifferent management. Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lexi71
Reviews.Content: The location of the Albergo del Senato couldn't be any better. The Pantheon is right in front of the hotel. The spanish steps and trevi fountain are about a 5 min walk. The Vatican and colosseum about 20 mins. The man on reception is very helpful booked us in quickly, gave us directions and booked a table for us. The room we stayed in was spotlessly clean and the rooms were thoughly cleaned every morning. The breakfast is continental with plenty of coffee and tea, there is scrambled eggs available if you want them, all in all very nice. The only gripe I have is that we were looking forward to the roof top terrace, only to find it was closed for a refurb, which I wouldnt mind but we booked through their website and there was no mention before we booked.

Reviews.Title: “A luxury hotel in the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: JandFF
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Albergo Del Senato. We sincerely wish the stay had been longer. From the very outset, and all through the trip, the front desk staff went out of their way, happily, to meet every request. At the beginning we were put into a very large room (there were three of us) that was a bit dark, so they got us a bright room with a view of the Pantheon, that was perfect -- very quiet, with shutters that blocked out all the light if we wanted to. Yes, the room was smaller, but that was OK. The scene right outside the front door belongs on a postcard, and the location was an easy walk, about equidistant, from (1) the Spanish Steps, (2) the Colosseum, (3) the Vatican, and (4) Trastevere. You couldn't ask for better. Yes, it's not cheap, but in Rome nothing is. The only thing that might be improved is the breakfast -- kind of ordinary compared to the breakfast buffets we got at other hotels on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: HappyWonderers2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel surely met our expectations after staying in many within Europe. The noise from the busy streets did keep up the light sleeper but we managed quite easily. We would definitely consider this hotel again in one of the best locations in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Warning: construction alert”
Reviews.Author: DCtraveler012
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for one night in late March. It was our final night in Italy after a week in the countryside. We had wanted to stay in this hotel since we first saw it on a trip to Rome five years ago. We made the reservation for this one-night stay several weeks before our arrival, through Expedia, and we paid for the room in advance -- more than $400 for the one night. This was a splurge for us -- we had saved money on the hotels we had used during our week in the countryside so as to help pay for this one night at this well-reputed hotel. We were expecting a great experience. When we arrived at the hotel, we were taken to a room on the third floor. That floor was being renovated. About half of the floor -- everything to one side of the elevator -- was a construction zone. The workers had hung plastic sheeting at the entrance of the work zone, but the entire floor reeked strongly of paint solvent. The smell of the solvent was evident in our room when we entered it. We were afraid that we would get sick if we breathed in the solvent fumes overnight while trying to sleep. This was not at all what we had waited five years -- and paid more than $400 -- for. Given the presence of the solvent fumes, we were, frankly, astonished that the hotel management would consider any room on that floor suitable for renting out. We immediately asked for another room. The staff's initial response was an offer to upgrade us to a larger suite on the same floor, which we rejected, since the smell of the solvent was likely everywhere on that floor. They then took us, a bit reluctantly, to a room on the first floor. It was in the back of the hotel, and getting there required going up a few steps in the hallway with our luggage, and then back down a few steps. The room was overheated: it was 27C (about 80F) when we entered, according to the room's digital thermostat -- on a day when the high temperature in Rome was about 16-20C (about 60-68F). We attempted to cool down the room by opening the window, since the room's AC didn't seem up to the task. Opening the window helped a bit -- the temperature came down slowly through the night -- but having the window open exposed us to the noise of a man having a loud cellphone conversation in the middle of the night in the alley behind the hotel, and to another person who was having a coughing fit. It was not a good night's sleep. The bathtub in the room was unusually narrow and had a continuously curved bottom, which made it almost impossible to stand up while taking a shower. The staff was apologetic for initially showing us the room on the torn-up third floor. They gave us a good recommendation for a local restaurant for dinner, and they were helpful in getting us a cab for the ride to the airport the next morning. The breakfast service was nice. The location of the hotel is perfect for a quick shopping trip in the area around the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain, which is what we wanted to do during our one afternoon in Rome. Based on the condition of the third floor and a remark made by the staff to another guest, I got the impression that the renovation work might last another one or two months. If you are considering staying at this hotel during that period, you may wish to call ahead to check on the status of the renovation work, and obtain a written guarantee in advance from the hotel that your room will not be on a floor that is undergoing renovation work. My answer of "yes" to the question of whether I would recommend this hotel to a friend is based on this proviso. I also hope the hotel management reconsiders its apparent policy of attempting to rent out rooms on floors that are torn-up due to renovation work -- it is completely inconsistent with a hotel of this standard.

Reviews.Title: “Is it Possible to exceed our expectations? Yes!”
Reviews.Author: luvnormandy
Reviews.Content: Our third visit in 4 years and we are still in love with this hotel. Once again, the hotel staff did their best to make us happy per our request for a room on the 6th floor – with balcony overlooking the piazza & Pantheon. I’m almost reluctant to write about it because the more well known the hotel becomes, the harder it will be for us to get a reservation – but they are so deserving that I must. This hotel has everything you could want – location, luxury, charm, & service. Rooms are beautifully appointed; you FEEL like you are living the life of luxury. The windows are double-glazed & keep out most street noise. We left the doors open but closed the full-length louvered shutters at night & fell asleep to the sounds of street musicians and the dull buzz of activity below that gradually faded into the wee hours. All front-facing rooms have a fantastic view of the Pantheon. Bathrooms are all marble with all amenities – good water pressure & lots of hot water. The property is beautifully maintained & constantly being updated. We were able to get WiFi in both the room and down in the bar. Breakfast has a wonderful selection & is served in a lovely room. Being able to walk out the door into one of the most famous and beautiful piazzas in Rome is worth every penny and then some. Having traveled extensively in Europe, we know the value of being in the historical center of a city & most of the hotels that have that distinction are even higher priced & mostly complacent with guests because they think their location alone will keep people coming back. Not so at the Del Senato. There is no better staff – on a consistent basis – at any hotel where we’ve stayed in Europe. At the front desk, I must single out Mauro (because we saw him on the most consistent basis) for his hospitality, humor, and helpfulness. I neglected to get the name of the man who checked us in the first day, but he “apologized” for having to put us in a slightly larger room than the one we stayed in last year. We left at 5:00 am the last morning to catch our flight. The night desk clerk insisted on helping my husband carry out our many overstuffed bags to the taxi, and then just as I was getting into the car, he ran back in & got the English daily newspaper for me. Michael in the bar was very attentive & friendly to talk to. Since we were celebrating an anniversary, we slept late the first morning & casually got ready for the day, so we didn’t get downstairs till 10:45. Breakfast is served till 10:30, but we just wanted a cup of coffee. There were a few lingering couples & food was still out, so we asked the server if it was okay to come in. He enthusiastically told us “Of course” and wanted us to have some breakfast as well. Although we declined, we were made to feel welcome & were never rushed to finish. Before booking, I consulted Trip Advisor to be sure things hadn’t changed since our last visit and saw only one posting that wasn’t complimentary among all the glowing reviews, but I knew right away the reviewer was obviously not well-informed about European hotels. Double rooms will not accommodate a family of 4, like a Holiday Inn. If that’s what you need, this is not the place for you. Is the elevator slow – yes, but there are 2 elevators. Although not speedy either, the small one is faster. That might bother some people, but it is a small inconvenience so overshadowed by the total experience that it would never occur to me to mention it. This hotel is our very favorite anywhere in the world & we can’t wait to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the noise-senstive”
Reviews.Author: MontePozzi
Reviews.Content: I recently (March 2011) spent 4 nights at the Albergo del Senato. The location is fabulous, right on the Piazza della Rotonda and within walking distance of all the sights in the "centro storico" of Rome. The location is, at once, an attraction and a liability. The Piazza della Rotonda is a lively place that generates a lot of noise. I had a room facing the piazza, and closing the windows only muffled the noise from the square. I welcomed the rain when it came during my stay as it did more than the windows to diminish the noise from outside. I was prepared for the external noise and made appropriate allowances for it. I was not prepared, and felt I couldn't make allowances for, the internal noise, such as the bickering children in the room on one side and the television in the room on the other. I felt that the hotel has inadequate soundproofing for both the external and internal noise. The "superior" room itself was cozy, bordering on cramped. If I sat at the desk, the back of the chair was pushing against the foot of the bed. Sitting in the armchair, though, allowed a lovely view out over the roof tops of Rome. A better view could be had from stepping out onto the balcony. The bed was very comfortable, indeed. There were nice amenities in the bathroom, with good water pressure and plenty of hot water in the shower. I noticed some slight water damage around the tub, but this may get resolved in the renovations currently being made in the hotel. (The third floor apparently was being completely re-done at the time. I presume they're working they way upwards.) Housekeeping was a bit hit-and-miss. The room was generally very clean, but there was a layer of dust on the floor behind the door when I closed it. I guess the chambermaids must leave the room doors open when they're cleaning, so they don't see that they're missing this area. The website advertises air conditioning, but in March I had no control over the room temperature. It was altogether too hot for me, registering 28C (83F) on my thermometer. I had to ask twice before the heat got completely turned off. After that the room was sufficiently comfortable. Breakfast is adequate, if unremarkable -- cereals, pastries, rolls, fruit -- the usual items. I avoided the odd -looking scrambled eggs in the chafing dish. The Wi-Fi reception was poor in my top-floor room, but very good on the ground floor. Every member of the staff with whom I came in contact was pleasant, helpful and friendly. The people at the hotel are, without exception, delightful. I've visited Rome each year for over ten years. In the past I've always stayed at hotels in the Prati, near the Vatican. I don't regret staying here, but I don't plan on returning to this establishment. I'd give it a cautious recommendation, at best.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was amazing”
Reviews.Author: terrik
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel very tired, jet-lagged after a long flight. We arrived at 10:00am-way before the room was due to be ready. Thankfully, our room was ready for us right when we arrived. The room was beyond our expectations! It was on the top floor, overlooking the Pantheon! We had a gorgous balcony. The room was beautifully decorated and everything was top line, including the Frette linens on the bed! Our son, who is currently a student in Rome, arrived at our hotel and could not believe our good fortune! The staff quickly whipped us up cappucinos, even though the breakfast was over. The breakfast the next day was delicious and served in their gorgeous breakfast room. Unfortunately, we only had this hotel booked for 2 nights and then were to move on to another hotel. We tried very hard to extend our stay here, but they were fully booked. We loved this hotel and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: coyotetraveler
Reviews.Content: Location,Location,Location. This hotel had it. Perfect for easy access to all the sites of Rome. The rooms were o.k. During our stay construction and major renovation was going on throughout the hotel. There was some noise but really not intrusive. The breakfast was a treat. The service staff were efficient, and friendly . The spread of food was perfect for a good first meal of the day. What really made the difference was the friendly, helpful and very professional front desk staff. I can't say enough good things. We made a mistake in our booking and needed another night. Lucca went out of his way to secure a very nice hotel and room for us at a great price. Allessandra was very good at finding us the perfect restaurant for each night of our stay. I was clear that we did not want a tourist trap restaurant and she got it. Each restaurant she recommended was exceptional. Most of the patrons in the restaurant were Romans and we knew we were getting the real deal in great food. It's clear whoever runs this hotel or owns it, is an exceptional individual. It's typically the owner or leader who sets the tone for how staff treats their guests. If the owner treats his staff with respect, kindness and professionalism this gets passed on to the hotel guests. Throughout this hotel from the maids to the manager we received smiles, courtesy and warmth. This added a very special element of good feelings and memories of our vacation in Rome. We loved staying here and its no surprise that they are ranked so high on trip advisor. I highly recommend Albergo del Senato to travelers. This hotel offers exceptional service and you can certainly trust that they will do everything they can to make your stay in room a pleasant and positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenprs
Reviews.Content: Just stafyed 4 nights and it was perfect. Great staff - perfect room. Definately returning.

Reviews.Title: “Eternal City's gem”
Reviews.Author: topnotch_10
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from our third stay at the Albergo del Senato. Each time we visit, it's like returning to a friend's house that just happens to be in the center of Rome. Management and staff could not be more welcoming, professional and helpful. There is a pride in the establishment shown by the staff and with great reason. Many of the rooms have been recently renovated and one full floor is currently being renovated with an opening date of April, 2011. The location is central with most of Rome's famous sites and restaurants within easy walking distance. Need help, just ask Mauro or Luca at the front desk for the up to the minute information and best recommendations. Can hardly wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieBStarkville
Reviews.Content: My daughters (22 and 25 years old) and I stayed in a standard triple room at the Albergo del Senato for six nights. We found the hotel to be a wonderful choice! The location is perfect for walking to almost all of the great sights in Rome, and the Piazza Rondunda and Pantheon is terrific! Several great places to eat right on the square, and delicious gelato, too. Street musicians and horse drawn carriages await your coinage - but no one is intrusive. The hotel personnel were terrific - 24 hours a day. We felt secure at all times. The included breakfast buffet was delicious and varied. We only regret that we were there too early for the roof top bar to be open! Our room was small, but the bathroom was large and had a huge bathtub. The rooms were quiet and we had free internet service. We could have paid more for a room with a view of the square, but why do that when you only have to walk out of the front door of the hotel and actually be on the square?! We highly recommend the hotel and look forward to returning someday!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pbtrip2011
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room was clean, quiet (even though it was located right on the Piazza Rotunda, which we enjoyed) with a comfortable bed and a great shower. The breakfast is plentiful. The location is perfect for walking to all the popular sites in Rome. The staff at the hotel is superb. They went out of their way to be helpful and provide exceptional service. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring Rome.”
Reviews.Author: CWMBoston
Reviews.Content: We loved being on the piazza Della rotunda, at the front door of the Pantheon. Awe inspiring to walk out and see it each morning. We had a spacious two level room (101) that had a brand new luxe bathroom. But the loft configuration didn't have the separation we wanted, and the heat was way off on the upper level. And we really struggled with wifi which is an important feature for our family. Overall a good choice and we would return if we could find a better suite.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Uktraveller84
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay for a birtday weekend. We arrived on a Saturday morning when the desk staff were a bit busy with checkouts but still charming and helpful. Room on the 6th floor with gerat views. Staff friendly (especially the lady on the desk afternoon/evening) and breakfast good (more busy at weekends so worth getting in early). Local restaurants all good, the only difference that we noticed is that the ones right by the key attractions were more expensive. Pantheon 0 mins! Trevi fountain 5 mins, Piazza Navona 5/10 mins, Vatican 15 mins even Collosseum only 25 mins slow walking. Forget taxis and walk every where there is so much to see. Also use Trip Advisor to find great restaurants Osteria dell' Anima and Mimi & Coco.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel stays ever”
Reviews.Author: tillyhorn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a superior double room on the 6th floor for 2 nights in December 2010. Do be aware that the level of service may be different for standard rooms. The location of this hotel could not be more perfect; it is situated on the Pantheon square right in the centre of old Rome with several restaurants, bars and shops in the vicinity, although do be careful, some of the eateries on the square are rather overpriced! The staff, especially the front desk, were extremely welcoming, friendly and informative. We were especially touched by the evening visit made by the housekeeping staff to provide clean towels and ready the room for sleeping. The room was clean and of a decent size as well as being very tastefully decorated; there was a balcony with an incredible view overlooking the Pantheon. Although the square was quite active during the day and night, with the doors shut, no noise could be heard. The room also featured a mini-bar, air-conditioning and a flat panel TV. The double bed was the most comfortable I have ever experienced in a hotel. The bathroom was of a decent size with an impressive selection of toiletries. The only complaint I would have is that the shower screen was not very effective meaning a lot of water ended up on the floor. A buffet breakfast was included in the price and featured your usual selection of cereals, pastries, fuit and cold meats/pizza, although I would have appreciated more hot items. Highly recommended hotel in Rome if you have the budget for it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holtel experience”
Reviews.Author: AoifeDub
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay. I had young children and the staff could have not been more accommodating. The room was quiet and the whole experience was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location - get a room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: Englisher
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a a perfect lovation right next to the incredible Pantheon in the Piazza Della Rotonda. We walked miles didn't come across a better situated hotel in old Rome, although their are others such as the Waldorf Astoria which as impressive on the outskirts of the city. The hotel is small inside with two tiny lifts (not one as in another review). The staff are excellent and if you can pay for a room with a view as we did, then do so. Breakfast is functional and a little basic; you may have to wait a few minutes to be seated as the room is very small considering how many guests there are in the hotel. Mauro on reception is exceptionally helpful - a real asset to the hotel, thanks Mauro. The airport collection service which the hotel can arrange if definitely worth it - a nice vehicle taking you both ways perfectly on time. We would definitely stay here again despite it being a little more expensive than other hotels. The piazza is a hub of activity and skirted by a mix of restaurants, the best of which is the one opposite the hotel with the white tablcloths and black covered chairs - exellent food, service and atmosphere - we ate there twice. We looked at most of the restaurants in the local vicintity and made the mistake of trading down one day to a place whichb name escapes me but was a few hundred yards up the lane to the left of the hotel begain with L' A******* (sorry that's we remember) and had rows of tables with pink tablecloths - avoid like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Bait & Switch”
Reviews.Author: Sudeep1973
Reviews.Content: I booked this room after reading all the reviews at $140/night...in fact I called the hotel to confirm the type of room since the online reservation of the hotel's website only offered one type of room, i.e. a double. When we got to the hotel the manager told us that since we had our 2 little children we could not stay in 1 double and since no larger room was available we had to get 2 rooms. Since it was already 9 PM I had no other choice and ended up paying DOUBLE of what I was expecting to pay. They told me that the next day a "Senior Suite" was going to open up and I could have that for $240! Additionally the web site stated that they had a special where you get 15% off if you stay 4 night or more, but they told me that they would not honor that special for the "Senior Suite". NEedless to say I am now looking for another hotel for the rest of our stay. Hotel is quite old with small rooms, small elevator. It is VERY dated. Location is RIGHT next to the Pantheon so street side rooms are very loud. Hotel staff were OK though their little trick has left me with a really bad taste.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to stay and see Rome.”
Reviews.Author: NadineDJM
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on trip advisor and because of its location I chose Albergo del Senato Rome for our stay. I'm very happy with my choice. The hotel is in a perfect location to walk and see all of Rome's major sites. Albergo is a comfortable and clean hotel. Our check in was fast and easy. Luca helped us make dinner plans and recommended a restaurant nearby, Ristorante da Donato alle due Colonne. It was an excellent recommendation. The room was warm in the winter due to the heating system. But we find this to be case in most hotels all over Europe. (With the exception of my daugher's student apartment in Madrid, brrrr.) In Albergo if you kept the windows closed you couldn't hear the street noises but then the room would be too warm. So we had to open our window a little bit to let in some cold air. Then we heard all the street noises. But I thought of it as an experience to hear the sounds of Rome at night and I got used to it and slept. The breakfast wasn't the best but sufficient to start the day. One morning at Luca's recommendation we went to a nearby cafe, Lunatico Vino & Caffe, for breakfast. It was very good, inexpensive and we went back later for lunch which was also very good. On the day of our departure we needed to get to the Ciampino airport early. The front desk arranged transportation for us, a party of five. We arrived at the airport on time.

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: redsetter60
Reviews.Content: the hotel was centrally located right next to the pantheon as I looked out the window there it was, I chose the hotel based on reviews on Trip advisor and was not disappointed the service from arriving to departing was beyond a doubt fantastic the rooms were clean and modern and spacious even with the refurbishment going on we never heard a thing.. the only point my partner picked up on was the selection at breakfast was limited but you can make up for that when you walk rome and eat and drink, I would recommned this hotel and would return

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lakefront
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here. Our room was a wonderful clean, spacious, suite with a balcony. It was almost as if you could reach out and touch the Pantheon. The rooftop was had amazing views at sunset. The neighborhood and the Piazza della Rotunda which is the location of the hotel had many nice restaurants. Also, shopping , gelato, and cappuccino. We were able to walk everywhere from this hotel. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless night followed by a lousy "breakfast"!”
Reviews.Author: serpiente_7
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Albergo del Senato. The first one a few years ago was fantastic, hence my prior excellent review at Trip Advisor. This time due to personal difficulties we only had the luxury of spending just one night in Rome, thinking that it would be quite adequate if everything went as planned. The communication that I had with Laura Luca was excellent and she was kind to offer us a double room overlooking the Pantheon at 195 euros per night including "breakfast". The same went for the pick up service, fast, polite and efficient. Since we had a very early flight from Athens we tried to get some sleep during noon. The moment we closed our eyes a fire drill with its excruciating noise woke us up. It was around 14.00 pm. We decided to get up and go for a walk thinking that we would compensate for our lost sleep at night. I did not complain for the unfortunate happening at the reception as I thought it was a one time event. The same fire drill woke us up however, with its terrifying noise at 06.30 am, twice in the same day without any prior warning!!! Having slept only for three hours due to some drunks down at the piazza that were having an open air party, I was infuriated at the situation. Residents of the hotel from nearby rooms were anxious of the situation, they were slamming doors, running at the corridor, asking in loud voices what was going on, toilets were flashing through paper thin walls and a scene of acoustic chaos prevented me from sleeping again. One single night in Rome with only 3 hours of sleep. The same had happened to me at a resort in Florida and they gave everybody a 50% discount, without waiting for them to ask for it of course. To the "breakfast" now.... We went at 10.00 and the service ends at 10.30 am. At 10.00 am there was no omelett left, just an empty tray, next to which there was another empty tray. Both were never replenished. There was no toast bread and when I asked the non english speaking waitress what was inside another empty basket she started rambling in italian. Zero communication during breakfast as the only thing she understood was coffee and tea. After 20 minutes 5!!! pieces of croissants arrived to accomodate the hunger of a breakfast room still full with people. Three men grabbed four instantly and like a beggard for 195 euros per night I run for the last one. There was no yoghurt left and when the cheese was replenished after i ferociously pointed at the empty tray, I realized that I had to get 4 slices to make up for the size of a normal one. Actually there was nothing to eat except for the usual corn flakes and little vases of jam which you had nowhere to put them on as there were no croissants and just some stale bread cut hours ago... I was furious to say the least. I asked the reception for a compensation and they reluctanty reduced the price to 165 euros. Do they care? I do not know... Rome has zillions of tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.....again!!!”
Reviews.Author: 16canuck
Reviews.Content: Although we usually like to try new hotels in our travels, we decided to stay at the Albergo again and liked it even better than last time. The rooms are in the process of being newly decorated, we stayed in a renovated room....very nice, the front desk staff and the staff in the breakfast room were incredibly helpful and friendly. The front desk staff suggested and made reservations for several restaurants and museums and gave excellent directions to some of the out-of-the-way places that we wanted to explore. During our seven nights in Rome, we covered an extensive area on foot from this great location and would not hesitate to recommend the Albergo del Senato!

Reviews.Title: “Can't find a better HQ for a stay in Roma”
Reviews.Author: Field_Stone_Farm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a 3 night stay at this Hotel. We arrived early on the first day and received a complimentary upgrade from a standard double to a superior double with a Fantastic view of Piazza della Rotunda and the Pantheon. The Hotel itself, was located in an area devoid of Buses and cars, with only the clamour of spectators in the sqaure for noise (easily blocked by closing the windows). The people watching was superb. With it's perfectly central location to the Colloseo, Victorrio Monument, Trevi fountain, Spanish steps, and Piazza Nuvono, we were able to travel on foot to every monument and tourist attraction, save the Vatican (which we could have probably done as well, but decided to take a short bus ride instead). The restaurants and gelaterias in the immediate area were amoung the best. (Mimi e Coco's was our highlight!) All around great trip to Roma and Albergo Del Sanato played a huge part. Thanks and recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Markk2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for business. I stayed there for 3 night on business. good location was great places to eat out at night, try out Denelli Italia in the centre a great place to eat out at night Mark

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Spain
Reviews.Content: Do not doubt - this hotel is great. the location is perfect, the rooms are functional and clean (yes, small as all the hotels in Rome). Staff at the reception funny and professional - great experience. Our room faced the Pantheon and the square - i was afraid of the noice, but no such fear! Nearby you can find excellent cafes, enotecas and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: prxmid
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to the Albergo Del Senato, this time I recommended it to host a small business meeting of 10. Everyone was satisfied, It's the perfect location all of Rome is in walking distance. The palazzo and Pantheon at night offer a spectacular setting. Great restaurants in every direction. The staff could not be more friendly and helpful. The breakfasts are interesting and offer enough variety. It would be my only hote when in Rome.
