The suites are generous, standard rooms are very small. Internet service is spotty and slow

Reviews.Title: “Take a room with the VIEW - what a VIEW”
Reviews.Author: 49fiori
Reviews.Content: Truly the best hotel in Rome! - Try to book in advance so you get the best possible price. Book only with the hotel website. Take the room with the VIEW! Location - VIEW - LOCATION - VIEW! I've been to Rome over 100 times, this is the best way to experience Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: KarenPua
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in Sep’10. All reviews in tripadvisor is true! We LOVE this hotel & their roof top terrace!! We had a comfortable room with balcony on the top floor. Algergo Del Senator – a beautiful hotel, great location near to all the major attractions (within walking distance), friendly staff. Received complimentary champagne as birthday gift from the hotel during the stay. Will back for the same hotel in my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo del Senato, " the best part of Rome"”
Reviews.Author: k9poppy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after checking on tripadvisor, and their rating is correct, this hotel is fabulous!!!! The staff are all very kind and helpful (they arranged a taxi for us , very professional staff). The hotel is very beautiful with awesome views of the Pantheon and Rome, we loved our room, the buffet breakfast was super, the hotel was very clean and safe. We rate the Albergo 5 stars!!!!!!! We will be returning soon!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls, uncomfortable beds, over-heated- little sleep in 4 nights”
Reviews.Author: owenturney
Reviews.Content: At £250 a night for a triple, a decent night's sleep is a pre-requisite. Unfortunately weaknesses with the hotel's infrastructure meant we only got a few hours a sleep a night. Walls and floors are thin/partitioned - you really can hear all your fellow guests (and their children) coming and going, talking/shouting/even singing, the TV-- until 3am every night for us. Add in rooms with centrally controlled heating to 20 degs; hard pillows; our 3rd 'bed' fold down chair with a few broken slats (on which our daughter got a few bites) and sleep was difficult or impossible. (and Wifi seemed to work for about 5 mins then 'die' as well). Yes great location, good service, decent breakfast-- but the infrastructure problems left us pretty tired and worn down.. and that's not where you want to be in a great city like Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Gracious Staff!”
Reviews.Author: juliemarie08
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Christmas in Rome. We stayed 8 nights at the Albergo del Senato and I cannot say enough about how wonderful our time was at this delightful gem of a hotel. The location is simply perfect within walking distance to everything and so many great restaurants around every corner. The rooms were well appointed and the staff incredibly helpful and gracious! I would look no further for a hotel in Rome, book your stay at the Albergo del Senato.

Reviews.Title: “You can't find a better location!”
Reviews.Author: tcuprincess430
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Albergo del Senato August 30-September 4th and the location of this hotel is fantastic! Most of the major sights are within walking distance (Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, Campo de Fiori, Victor Emmanuelle monument) we took a cab to the Vatican and to the Colosseum, each cab cost roughly 7 euros. This is a beautiful hotel, inside and out. The rooftop bar has a magnificent view of the vast city and you can see the top of St Peters and the church in Piazza Navona. The breakfast room was big with plenty of seating and a nice spread of food. The front desk staff was friendly and accommodating and they all spoke wonderful English. They were able to arrange a laundry service for me and they helped confirm my tour reservations. I booked the Semenario Suite as we were celebrating our 5th anniversary. The suite was the biggest hotel room I've ever stayed inane the fresco painted ceiling added a perfect Italian touch. In addition to the massive bedroom there were two sitting areas, the room would easily hold 4 people if necessary. The air conditioner was powerful and it worked well. The bathroom was clean and big with plenty of counter space. There were only 2 drawbacks, the bed was hard and the room was noisy at night. Even though the mattress was hard I still managed to sleep well. (the couches in the room were more comfortable than the bed!) Piazza Della Rotunda and the surrounding streets are a very popular place to be and occasionally the street noise was loud. HOWEVER, all of the great qualities of this hotel and the location far outweigh these 2 little details. I would definitely recommend the Albergo del Senato and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: The Albergo del Senato is one of my favorite hotels in the world. The location could not have been more perfect with the Pantheon just outside the front door and centrally located allowing easy walking distance to all the major attractions. The rooms were large, very clean and luxurious with nice furnishing. Keep in mind that they do have turn down service so if you don't like that then keep the "do not disturb" sign on the door. Personally, I love the turn down service and really enjoyed the treats left on the pillow after having a wonderful Italian dinner. The service was top notch and very helpful, while the breakfast was large and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: kiters
Reviews.Content: Back again after 4 years and just as we had remembered it. The staff are all welcoming, speak perfect English and nothing is too much trouble. This hotel is a little gem, it doesnt get better than this, right in the middle of a splendid piazza bursting with life, easy to wander to the main sites and we walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: RoseKnows53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the overall rating and reviews I read on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed in the least. A gorgeous Italian boutique type hotel. Beautiful decor, gorgeous room with fabric (not wallpaper) on the walls. Our Senior Suite overlooked the Pantheon and square. What a view! My husband and I had our own bedroom and my 17 year old son had his. Beautiful marble bathroom. Room spotless and chic Italian decor. I can not say enough about the front desk staff (Mauro and Allesandro). Just so helpful, fun, smiling and genuine. The included breakfast was wonderful. Different fritata each morning. Fresh breads, fruits, cappucino, meats, cheeses! Now just add the incredible location. You can literally walk anywhere. Terrific restaurants very close by with recommendations by the hotel staff. Remember to bring sensible shoes...the streets of Rome will eat your stylish heels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in ROMA!!”
Reviews.Author: Missemvee
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at the Albergo Del Senato, you walk out of the hotel and there is the Pantheon staring at you - simply amazing!! Male staff are very helpful and so friendly, I felt the female staff in reception were at time a tad too aggressive. Breakfast is typical continental breakfast, wait staff are extremely accomodating. I have recommended this hotel to family and friends. The room was a triple and was still spacious. The triple room we had has the chair converting to a fold out bed, which some people might find a bit too firm and uncormfortable, perfect for a child, but my sister who is 5'6" had her feet just fitting on the bed. Also, internet would never work in the room - however I did read this on previous reviews so was not shocked when it did not work. Overall a lovely stay in the centre of Roma!!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS STAY”
Reviews.Author: ntm4
Reviews.Content: Do not hesitate to stay here! We were 3 single girls traveling from NYC to Rome for vacation. The location was fabulous, rooms well appointed and staff superb!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheerana
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome & what a fantastic weekend! Myself, my husband, 18 yr old daughter & 12 yr old son. I decided to stay at this hotel on recommendations on Trip Advisor which I can always depend on & it's location. We were not disappointed. Lovely traditional homely hotel. Comfortable rooms, amazing view of The Pantheon, even from our childrens standard room. Breakfast was lovely, any requests dealt with immediately by lovely waiting staff. Front Desk staff were wonderful people, both day & night staff. Restaurant suggestions & bookings made. My son was given special attention. Just lovely decent people. Our last visit to Rome was to a 5* hotel & a very bad experience from staff to extortion at the hotel bar & restaurant! This hotel is rated 3* which from the standard of rooms & service, I would disagree with. Then again who wants the deluxe hotel types descending on this special place ... lets keep it our secret! I would not hesitate to recommend & return to the Albergo del Santo. Hopefully sooner than later!

Reviews.Title: “Made us fall in love with Rome”
Reviews.Author: Worldtravelorplus
Reviews.Content: I had been in Rome before but the location and beauty of this hotel really showed us why Rome is such a great city. The location is unbeatable...we spent lots of our time on the balcony people watching, listening to the street performers and enjoying the buzz around the Pantheon. It was a busy square but not nosy but gave you a great sense of the vibrancy on the city. There is a supermarket about 1/2 a block away and restaurants within a few minutes. We had a suite with a balcony and although it was smaller than I expected, it was clean and elegant. The breakfast each day was quite good. The hotel really made our trip magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with superb staff”
Reviews.Author: monepennie
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of location and trip advisor rating. Am only surprised it is not number one. First of all, location: right alongside the amazing Pantheon (great to be able to go in at 9.30 in the morning and have it all to yourself!). From the hotel it takes about ten to fifteen minutes to walk to the Spanish Steps (fun place where everyone meets and very posh shops) and the Coliseum and Forum (amazing place, needs time to really absorb the history). I don't walk fast, so times are realistic. To get to the Borghese art gallery (etc) and the Vatican would take about half an hour to forty minutes' walking; we got taxis and it took about ten minutes and cost about 10 euros.Around the small streets near the hotel are some excellent trattorias and pizza places, the Piazza della Rotonda itself has plenty of (rather expensive) places to eat and there is usually some entertainment going on in the piazza. So I cannot fault the location. Wherever you stay in Rome, you have to walk to each of the other highspots; it is not like Florence where all the places are within five minutes of each other. The hotel: it is lovely. Immaculately clean, very professional and friendly service. The reception areas are very attractive, the breakfast room is very smart and the breakfast is absolutely wonderful. More like a buffet in a 4 star hotel. Really, really good. And they very happily will pack a small bag for you with fruit or croissants if you want to take something out as well. I was visiting Rome with my adult daughter and we shared a twin room. The first one we were given was a bit small although beautiful, so we asked if they had a bigger room. They gave us an upgrade (no charge) to a lovely room, much bigger and with a fabulous view of the Pantheon. We were delighted. The room service was superb. Clean linen/towels every day, bed prepared for sleeping each evening, fluffy towelling robes and towelling slippers and, on request, the housekeeper even provided us with tea-making facilities in our room (we are English!). However, what really makes this hotel an exceptional place to stay is the staff. We stayed for just under a week and we asked the reception staff for help every day about something! They are not only reception staff, they are tour advisers, restaurant advisers, shopping advisers (even what presents to buy for male relatives!); nothing seems to phase them at all. They are just lovely, all of them, not only on reception (although they are the people we most interacted with), but also the housekeeping staff and the breakfast room staff too; all warm, friendly, courteous and yet so very professional. This hotel isn't cheap but I certainly felt that I had excellent value for money. I've stayed in more expensive hotels with more 'gloss' and haven't felt anything like the level of caring professionalism that the Albergo del Senato gives.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: RMJMW
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed the location and view from our room of the Pantheon. We usually don't spend a lot of time in our room when traveling but on this occassion were fortunate enough to have what appeared to be the only Superior room with a balcony. This made it practical to enjoy sitting on the balcony watching the circus like atmosphere of the square in front of the Pantheon rather than being in the circus. It was a little disappointing that the side of the Panteon that we were looking at was covered up with scaffolding. Beeakfast was frsh and plentiful. The room was very clean and beautiful with a large bathroom. we found the staff to be very helpful when we needed advice with restaurants and directions plus arranging for a taxi to get us to the airpport for an early morning flight. After getting "fleeced" by the taxi driver that took us from Termini to the hotel, getting a courtious driver a a set rtae was a relief.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay near the Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: Aldo_Nola
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this lovely property. Staff was courteous and helpful. Great location steps away from the Pantheon. Suites are roomy and have direct views. Rooms facing the Piazza can be noisy until around 9:00 p.m. or so due to the street musicians (some of whom are pretty bad) and general hubub. By the way, why do they allow amplifiers in the piazza? Bathrooms spacious. Bed very comfortable and on the firm side. Nice bar for relaxing. Keep in mind this is a 3 star property so there is no dedicated concierge. The desk staff keeps pretty busy so you might have to wait awhile for help. This will be our first choice for future stas in Rome. Exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding 3 star”
Reviews.Author: JohnNB64
Reviews.Content: In terms of cleanliness, style, location etc, I am staggered that this place is only a 3 star, and I can only attribute this to lack of additional facilities - the breakfast room is small and you may have to wait for example - because everything else about it is 4 star. Mauro behind the desk is extremely helpful and all of his colleagues are fluent in English. In terms of location, it is superbly placed right next to the Pantheon, and with the Piazza de Navona and the Trevi Fountain only 5 minutes walk away in opposite directions. In terms of value for money, it's perhaps not so great (the rooms at the front facing the Pantheon cost over 300 Euros per night - somewhat excessive at the moment given that the Pantheon is covered in scaffolding), but we were extremely lucky to be given room 602 which has its own terrace and additional lounge room. We would definitely go back as it's a lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: possiblyaprincess
Reviews.Content: The location is second to none in Rome as the hotel overlooks the Pantheon and a busy square. We stayed in a standard room overlooking the Pantheon and the decor and fittings were immaculate. The rooms are excellently sound-proofed and so even though the room overlooked a busy square, once the windows were closed it was quiet and beautifully cool. A kettle and tea-making facilities were very much appreciated and so was the fruit platter upon arrival. Free wifi a real bonus. As others have mentioned, the roof-top bar is a real highlight and a great place to have a drink before heading out for a late dinner. From the moment I arrived (slightly flustered as my partner missed his flight) the outstanding staff made me feel welcome. They all speak excellent English, are professional, friendly, and real professionals. Book one of their drivers to pick you up from the airport. It was wonderful after a long flight and it turned out to be cheaper than a regular cab! I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Lovely. What a view, what a room!”
Reviews.Author: kareneg061
Reviews.Content: Yes pricey. But a little luxury is worth it at the end of a long trip. Think of it as splurge. Room is small but so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: nigelwelch
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel right in the heart of Rome opposite the Pantheon, close to the Piazza Navonna and within easy walking distance of all the other major tourist sites. The rooms are nicely and comfortably furnished although on the small side as in most European Capitals. Good bathrooms well equipped. There are plenty of good restaurants to visit in close proximity to the hotel. We particularly enjoyed L'Angeletto and had some beautiful fish. The main strength of this hotel though is it's wonderful staff. They are always very polite and helpful and take a great pride in making your stay happy and enjoyable. You get a warm and friendly welcome every time you come back from sightseeing or Dinner. We will return next time we are in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Should be rated higher.”
Reviews.Author: lynndesign2000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very welcoming and clean and well decorated. We got all that was promised in the hotels advertising, and more besides as the staff and building itself were brilliant. We booked two rooms at the same time and strangely both rooms were completely different. Although both were roomy and well decorated, one was very modern and had tea/coffee making facilities and the other room was more traditional with no tea/coffee facilities but an additional pack of toiletries. This did not detract from our pleasure in staying there however but this hotel would probably gain a higher star rating if it was more consistent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveller046
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Room small but very clear and fresh decor. Bathroom basic and a bit small but it didn't matter as we didn't spend that much time in the room anyway. Room overlooked Pantheon and Piazza del Rotunda - fantastic view - it was noisy but if the window was closed the noise was acceptable - more noise from the stairwell in the hotel. The rooftop bar was superb although not always open due to weather. Buffet breakfast excellent. The reception staff were helpful and friendly. The best thing about the hotel is the location, walking distance to everywhere. Not the cheapest hotel although we had a Sunday night deal but still highly recommended. Only downside no tea and coffee making facilities in room - some rooms have this but not our cheap one!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sydneyc10
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family stayed in the penthouse room for 2 nights in July. We had an absolutely delightful experience - every single member of staff was so friendly and welcoming, the room was incredible, and the view spectacular. Our rooms (2 bedrooms, huge terrace overlooking the Pantheon) were divine - spotless, modern, comfy beds, and a welcome fruit basket. The terrace was brilliant, very sunny during the day but great for people watching (the Piazza della Rotonda is directly below), and the Pantheon is opposite! As others have mentioned, it is a perfect location. Close to everything!! Breakfast was probably the only downside - it wasn't the greatest and a bit cramped. But to complain about that is clutching at straws, this hotel is fabulous. Would only stay here in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent boutique and central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadasnorkelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights (September 11 to 15, 2010) at this very well maintained and clean hotel. It was well located in the historical center just beside the Pantheon on Piazza La Rotonda and only 10 or 15 minutes from all the interesting sites (Piazza Navona, Trevi fountain, Piazza di Montecitoro, Via del Condotti, Piazza di Spagna, etc.). However, we took a taxi to our French tour of the Vatican City (St. Peter’s basilica, Vatican museums, Sistine Chapel) and to our tour to the Ancient Rome (Colosseum, Forum and Palatine Hill), both well organized by the hotel reception. We had a room on the second floor with a large window overlooking the piazza which was animated in the evenings. We had a nice dinner at Ristorante Di Rienzo, the only good restaurant on the piazza with artistical shows all along the dinner : what a piece of Dolce Vita! Mauro who speaks French recommended another good restaurant Donato located on a lateral street two minutes from the hotel. The room was not large but we had a small living room, the bathroom was efficient and the bed was comfortable. The air conditioning was too cold for the night. Since it was controlled centrally, we must call the reception to shut it down. The maid service was efficient and regular. The breakfast was good and plentiful. All the personnel at the reception was helpful and smiling. We appreciated very much our stay and we strongly recommend this hotel to everyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovelydreamin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo del Senato for the first leg of our honeymoon. The hotel is in a perfect location and our room had a view of the Pantheon. Wow! The staff was usually very helpful, although upon arriving on our first day, the concierge scolded us because we didn't find the limo we had reserved at the airport (the limo driver was no where to be found). However, the other concierges during our stay were very helpful and polite. If you do get a room with a view of the square, it can be a bit noisy at night, so keep that in mind. Overall we had a wonderful stay and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes!”
Reviews.Author: eagletraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel - a comfortable and welcoming refuge from the hustle and bustle of Rome. It really is right opposite the Pantheon in a perfect location for walking around old Rome. Our twin room was small but cozy and perfectly formed, with a spacious bathroom and a little balcony. The staff were kind and helpful. We loved the roof-top bar with the stunning view where we could relax with a prosecco after a busy day sightseeing and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Elysse2010
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, clean and comfortable. Perfect location, right across from the Pantheon and near great restaurants and cafes. Service was very good, especially at breakfast, where the friendly staff remember our favorites and looked after us very well. Rooms were clean and freshened daily, the staff were very good. The dim lights in the room made reading hard but that is a minor issue. I would easily recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location and Service in a Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tenmileHuntsvilleAL
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel. The front desk staff speaks very good English. The entire staff from the bellman to the restaurant and housekeeping staff is courteous, cheerful and helpful. The hotel is clean and our standard deluxe room was comfortable and large enough to stow 4 suitcases comfortably. The double bed is queen size and very comfortable. The bathroom is fully marble. The hotel common areas are beautifully decorated in rich marble. Because we were here later in the season and it was cool in Rome, the rooftop bar was only open one night, but the view of Rome at sunset is one to be experienced! One guest ordered a kahlua and cream, and the bartender left briefly to get cream from the breakfast room--this is typical of the great personal service they offer. We asked for local restaurant suggestions each night, and each restaurant recommendation was very good and reasonably priced. The breakfast buffet is fresh and has a good variety of meats, cheeses, bread and pastries, fruits, cereals, and scrambled eggs from which to choose. One can walk virtually to all major attractions from this site, and a taxi stand is across the piazza. The Pantheon is directly next to the hotel on Piazza del Roma. We had a room on the first floor that opened to the Piazza and an incredible view of the Pantheon. The windows are sound proof, and we never heard the noise from the Piazza. The piazza crowds disperse after 10 o'clock. Air conditioning is turned off in Oct., but the fresh air from the large windows kep our room comfortable. When we return to Rome, we will only consider this hotel. The rooms may be a little on the pricey side (we paid $310 per night), but worth the price for the location, beauty of the hotel, and helpfulness of the staff--the best quality 3 star we have ever experienced in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “BEST in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sjohn1210
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel the end of September through the first part of October, 2010. BEST location and BEST hotel with the BEST staff in Rome. Mauro, Alessandra, and Piero at the front desk are the friendliest and most helpful individuals you'll encounter. Arranging cars, dinner reservations, and taking a genuine interest in their guests' enjoyment of their beloved city is their forte. Don't forget to meet Michele who is in charge of the rooftop patio. You won't regret it. We've been to Rome twice in 2 years and would never consider another hotel for future travel. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the views are breath-taking and the service of the staff surpasses anything we've encountered in Italy. They make a visitor to their city feel like they're among family.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo del Senato Hotel in the Piazza della Rotonda, Rome superb hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: BigG99_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed briefly for 2 nights prior to our cruise. Wonderful hotel with very helpful staff. Hotel has a roof-top bar overlooking the Piazza. Our room was very comfortable and the hotel is nicely furnished. Breakfast is simple but tasty. The hotel location is ideally situated. We would stay here again when back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: WakingLife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in September. Took a taxi from the train station (17 euro). The staff was very helpful with directions and recommendations for restaurants. The room was comfortable. Lots of english channels on the TV. WiFi. Okay breakfast (get there earlier rather than later). We also used their limo service to the airport, which was very nice. The location can not be beat. We walked everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “AH-Roma Therapy! Excellent Staff, Perfect Location. Center of the Action.”
Reviews.Author: justvisiting1025
Reviews.Content: At Albergo del Senato you will open the shutters each morning to the amazing Pantheon on the Piazza della Rotunda perhaps you will see the workers turn on the fountains, you will turn to see your lovely room, comfortable, charming, and clean. You will enjoy a marble bathroom with soothing bathtub and prepare for the day. At the desk, you will be greeted with a smile, and join other guests in the charming breakfast room to be fortified by a delicious breakfast of abundant choices. As you start your day, all your questions will be answered, and you will be asked how you can be assisted further. Every issue will be addressed. How do I know all this will happen to you? Because it happened to us. Here at the center of the many tourist sites, is the center of the action, here is where you can see all of the Historic Center's offerings and end the evening with a fabulous cocktail on the rooftop terrace. Michael will pour a glass of Frascati...and point to that village in the distant hills or perhaps it will be a special cocktail. You will turn to see the dome of St. Peter's Basilica in the middle distance, as the lights come up in the night sky. Every professional courtesy will be extended and some very special extra attention. It is unforgetable It is a treasure! And perhaps you may be serenaded by a beautiful young voice on the Piazza singing Nesun Dorma (!) as you drift off to peaceful sleep! Thank you, Luca, Mauro, Michael, and each of the staff of Albergo del Senato, for making our anniversary more special than we dreamed possible.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great staff, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: sidsidney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the first week of our honeymoon. It is a lovely hotel, our room was clean and comfortable, with a powerful shower (always a must!). Our room looked out onto the piazza and the Pantheon, and so we could not have asked for a better view. (Although when the square gets busy there is a little noise - this would only have been a major problem had we slept in late, but there was too much sightseeing to do for that!) Breakfast was a continental style breakfast, with meats and cheeses, pastries and fruit. There was not a lot of hot food, but the food available was definitely enough to set you up for a day of sightseeing, and the dining room was beautiful - all marble and mirrors! The staff at the hotel were excellent, with the reception staff being very knowledgeable and speaking excellent english. The hotel is in a great location - we walked to all the sites we planned to see (I overheard reception saying Vatican City was about a 40 min walk away, but when you stop off at a restaurant or two for a caffe or some bruschetta the walk doesnt feel so long!). Our only critisism would be that there is an indoor bar and a rooftop bar, and only one of these is open at any one time. On the first night, we went to the roof bar but I was a little too cold there and would have preferred to sit inside. This really is only a teeny tiny gripe - on other evenings I wrapped up more and we saw the fantastic skyline as the sun set. The cost of the hotel was a little more than we would usually spend, but we wanted a little more luxury as we were on honeymoon, and thats what we got! We loved this hotel and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect for Rome”
Reviews.Author: MickeyBull
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights with our 2 teenage children (aged 14 and 13) in the mini-apartment. This is 2 large rooms on the ground and 1st floors (with their own stairs) at the back of the hotel. Very quiet as no street frontage in these rooms, but also limited natural light and no view. Fantastic breakfast for the 4 of us included each day. Fluent English spoken by the front desk and also very helpful. Very limited kitchen facilities (in a cupboard) but restaurants (many very cheap) abound in this area. Location was brilliant though as the front of the hotel overlooked the Pantheon and Piazza Rotunda.

Reviews.Title: “Nice.....but attitude toward Americans was not good”
Reviews.Author: scooter12326
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed two nights at this hotel after a lovely 12 night cruise from Venice to Rome. The hotel is great and the location would be hard to beat, but the cool attitude toward Americans was NOT pleasant!!!! The bar tender on the roof top bar was THE WORST!!!!! We did not go there with haughty American attitudes. We were well dressed, acted polite and friendly and were almost completely ignored by the bar waiter. We also ask for a nice restaurant for dinner at the front desk and were told it was only a 10 minute walk from the front door. They sent us on a wild goose chase. We finally came back to the Piazza near the hotel after about an hour and a half looking for the restaurant, and found a little cafe after having walked ourselves to death!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing hotel with private roof bar overlooking the Pantheon piazza”
Reviews.Author: MrsACJ
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay in this hotel. The location is great as it is next to the Pantheon. This means it is central and all main sights are within walking distance. It is also just a few minutes walk from the bustling piazza Navona. The location means you can open your windows and enjoy the sounds of the Pantheon piazza (chatter, musicians etc) or keep them closed - the glazing keeps it quiet and the air conditioning keeps you cool. All the staff were very friendly and as the hotel does not have a restaurant they are very happy to make recommendations for places to eat. We ate in a number of excellent restaurants where there were more italian diners than tourists which has to be a good sign! We stayed in a suite with amazing painted ceilings and it was huge. The bed was very comfortable and the furniture was lovely with lots of room to unpack into. We were also able to go straight to our room when we arrived, even though it was only 10am. This was very welcome as we had arrived on an overnight sleeper train from Cologne and needed to freshen up. The roof top bar is a must. It is only open to residents so is very quiet and from there you can see right over Rome to St Peters. It was lovely to sit sipping wine, looking out across the city, listening to the bustle of the square below. One small downside is the breakfast which is a standard buffet style, Nothing particularly bad about it - just quite average in what is otherwise an amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations (which were high).”
Reviews.Author: yogabear1208
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small but luxurious hotel professionally run. I got that and more. We had a beautiful room in the center of the hotel (the one with the balcony). The bed was comfortable, the bath well appointed, breakfast substantial and varied and the rooftop bar was lovely (and well run by Michele). The view of the square at night, with opera singers in the lamp light, was magical. Add to that the convenience of being in the heart of Rome and I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Thanks to a great staff for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: aygen
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Albergo del Senato in July. The location of the hotel is fantastic. It is very central and you have a great view of Pantheon and Piazza. We had a room with a small terrace and it was really a pleasure to watch the Piazza from the balcony. The room is very beautiful, but was on the small side. If we stayed longer, we would have a serious storage room problem. The service was good and friendly. Breakfast was Ok. It also has a very beautiful terrace where you can have some drinks. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Theoph
Reviews.Content: We expected something better for a hotel rated number 9 by TripAdvisor out of over 1200 in Rome. To be sure the staff were very friendly, the public spaces tastefully decorated and the location was excellent. However the rooms were tiny and musty. The air conditoning did not work (though it was repaired the second day) and the bath drained so slowly that it would have run over had we not stopped showering.

Reviews.Title: “When we go back to Rome, we will stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisa_a
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel back in January 2007, I have not had time to add the review! We stayed off season and because the hotel was under occupancy they let us have a pantheon view for the price of a normal room. The location was amazing and the view from the window takes your breath away when you look in the middle of the night; My husband loved it because of the historical feel. The hotel is clean, the rooms comfortable and the staff were polite and attentive. There is a brilliant family run trattoria off the square that the barman in the hotel recommended and after the first night we went there every night. It was cheap, simple food and full of Italians, there was a line of people down the street waiting to get in and it was the same every night. I stayed in Rome the year before in another hotel called the Albergo Ottocento and this was very good too and located at the top of the "Spanish Steps". We have two young children now so we won't be back to Rome for a while; when we do return we will be staying here, without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Great location worth the money alone”
Reviews.Author: wheels1000
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small and we didn't get a front room. But overall it was so well located and the service professional. Breakfast included and quite ok. Located in Pedonale area (pedestrian) part of Rome which made it highly desirable and made our trip. Quite reasonable restaurants around and lots of littel streets. Didn't have the hassle of busy Rome. Driven in and on to the coast by Zelit Limosines which were great, on time and nice drivers

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: fatimarandolph
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4) stayed here in August for 5 nights and days. We couldn't have made a better choice. The location in absolutely, unquestionably, the best. On the same square as the Pantheon! The staff is very professional and helpful. Due to its location in the historical centre, we walked all over and only used taxi to go to the coliseum. We even walked to the Vatican. Room 101 where we stayed was spacious the only negative being that there is no sunlight because the room is on the ground floor facing other buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with an awesome view”
Reviews.Author: certamenator
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice with my parents, and we love it! Luxurious rooms (we had one of the suites) with TV, A/C, and many other amenities, marble tiled bathrooms, rooftop bar, and beautiful breakfast room. The Pantheon was right outside our window, and there were several little restaurants and shops around the square. The staff was quite friendly and spoke excellent English. It can be difficult to get to sleep because of the night life going on outside the hotel, but the beds are much more comfortable than in many European hotels. Breakfast was delicious, and the waiters gave us helpful sightseeing tips. We will absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NeedatanToronto
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed at this hotel on September 4th. All I can say is WOW!!! The staff went out of their way to accomodate us and even moved us to a bigger room. Unfortunately, we didn't have a room with a view of the Pantheon because they didn't have any triples available. The staff were great and very helpful, the continental breakfast was delicious and the room was very beautiful. The location couldn't have been any better and enabled us to just wander and explore on our own. I would definitely stay here again and hopefully it would be longer than 1 night!

Reviews.Title: “exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: olliebaba
Reviews.Content: We read the great reviews are were excited about our stay at this hotel, but were a little wary that it wouldn't be as good as it was made out to be. It was! We requested a view of the pantheon and were told that they were not sure if it would be available. We also requested a renovated room, which we read about through a previous review. Our room was absolutely perfect, brand new, tastefully decorated with a gorgeous view of the pantheon. It felt like we could reach out and touch it! They also had a fantastic television system at the hotel, and my husband was able to watch American football (a welcome change after a week of BBC and CNN!) Great proximity to sites too.

Reviews.Title: “Look no furthur, this hotel is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cocoKaysville_Utah
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel in Rome after searching the web for three days and reading such good reviews. The hotel was even better than I'd hoped. As for location, service, cleanliness, beauty... everything was excellent. First quality. Breakfast even included! One note: Do not get in a cab at the train station (or airport) if the driver tells you that cabs are not allowed to drive up right to the hotel. This should have been a red flag, but we fell for it. Before we could get the driver to give us our luggage we had to pay 30 euros, as the metor stated. The concierge told us the ride shoud never be more than 15 euros, and the cabs that scam tourists drop off down the street and run. (Also, no need to tip ever.) The cab was white and looked like all the others. Not sure if it had a number on the side. Ask the price before you get in and ask if it drops off right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MikeMerseyside
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel after reading reviews in Trip Advisor and was delighted with the location, the cleanliness and how helpful the staff were. The bonus of a rooftop bar with splendid views was perfect for a pre dinner drink. With this location you walk out of the hotel and the Pantheon is right there, you are able to walk to all the main attractions although we booked a tour for The Vatican which was the furthest away. The Piazza Della Rotonda offers you plenty of choice for drinks and food and you really cannot see the Macdonalds unless you look very closely. Highly recommend this hotel and location, would certainly book it again if we return which I am sure we will. Tip, try the first restaurant/bar you come to actually on the piazza, food and staff are great.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: castellet12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 4 nights in sept. the location is awesome, close to everything. walking distance or taxi. very clean hotel. no noise at night even with all the noise outside. people working there very nice. We will go back there for sure. Very safe choice. 2 really great restaurant: Ferrara, in the trastavere, expensive, but amazing food, is a wine bar restaurant. staff very nice, helpful. and il cantuccio, 5mns walking from the pantheon, excellent food, and the people super nice, a bit cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with all the previous reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Marlarkey
Reviews.Content: I can only add further praise to all the previous reviews of this hotel. Everything was perfect. The staff could not do enough to help and always with a smile. I stayed in the Junior Suite with my husband which overlooked the Pantheon, fantastic way to soak up the lively atmosphere from the piazza, yet so quiet when the windows were closed! There are so many restaurants to choose from here but we followed the excellent recommendations from Luca and Alessandra and would advise future guests to do the same. The only one we found for ourselves was the Cybo which is just off the Piazza Navona, you have to cross the square and go down the side street next to the Tre Scalini restaurant which is situated on the square itself. The food was fantastic, though not cheap but then nowhere is in Rome, but you know this before you go......! Piazza Navona is a great place to spend time in the evening, it's just so lively and buzzy with artists, street acts, living statutes etc. Some fantastic ice-cream bars, these are just everywhere in Rome and all excellent. Go on a diet BEFORE you go to Rome, the food is amazing and you will want to try everything. The hotel is so conveniently located within reasonable walking distance of the all the main attractions, although initially the open top tour bus is quite a good way to get your bearings. By the end of the weekend we had finally got to know exactly where we were going! Rome is an amazing city and a place where you just have to re-visit as apart from all the obvious sites to see there are so many other places to visit and it really is impossible to do all this in just one visit. I would also recommend buying tickets on-line to see the Vatican and Colesseum as the queues are SO long, As far as the Vatican is concerned make sure you buy a ticket for the basilica as well as the museum, I didn't realise that the tickets I had bought were only for the museum (Sistine Chapel) and the queue for St. Peter's was just so long and that I will save that for my next visit. I threw three coins into the Trevi Fountain so I will HAVE to come back! Next time though I will visit in early spring or early autumn as Rome is so crowded in summer and early September that it spoils viewing of all the major sites and it was also very hot, about 80 deg. F every day! If you're a cat person do visit the Cat Sanctuary at Argentina Square. It's run by a voluntary organisation who take in all stray and abandoned cats in an effort to reduce the amount of feral cats who are at risk of being killed or injured on the streets. I will definitely go back to Rome and most definitely stay at the Albergo del Senato.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay for 2 nights pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: Janmd4
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Friday morning at 9:45. We were very jetlag and needed to get a nap. The room wasn't ready yet. The bellman was so nice and so helpful. He was excellent. We were hungry and breakfast was still open but they did not allow us to get in to get a danish. Friends had stayed here 2 years ago and told us the market was very close and we ended up going over there to get drinks, danish. We walked around the narrow roads and then got pizzia close by. Came back at 12:30 and the room was ready. We had asked for a front view- it wasn't available. They kept saying that we booked through expedia. We booked through hotel.com. Still couldn't figure that out. The room was 314 and it was perfect. There was no view but it was perfect for us. We were able to get sleep. It had hardwood floors, 2 long beds, single sofa bed- and a beautiful bathroom. We had them remove everything out of the Mini Bar. There was huge closet. Also, a flat screen tv. There are 2 elevators in the hotel. Breakfast was always at 7am. Nice selection. The eggs could have been hotter each morning. The room that does the breakfast is warm. The staff at the breakfast was very helpful. The hotel has alot of great lightening, the rooms were very light. The lobby is nice and a/c. The front door is motion opened- which is very nice. Did go upstairs to get photos and drinks both nights. The views were perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Seat11A
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough..friendly helpful staff, great location, amazing view from window facing the square, clean and comfortable rooms. Small beds but this is the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: UKMarkB
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best locations in Rome, but make sure you book a superior room with views of the Pantheon and Piazza del Rotunda. Better still, ask for room 204. It's the one with the fancy balcony, smack in the middle of the hotel, amazing! Staff were very friendly and efficient. Nothing was too much trouble, including arranging executive car to the airport (50 euros,taxis are 40). Michele, who runs the rooftop bar, was great, as were the views at sunset, but watch out for the pigeons. We walked from here to all the sights, including the Colesseum, Vatican, Trevi. All within 20 minutes. No restaurant in the hotel but no problem, as there are 30 or 40 decent choices within 300 metres! There is a great breakfast room though, with delicious pastries, meats and cheeses and, as you would expect, superb coffee. The only small downside was noisy air-con. It sounded like it was actually raining one night! But hey, no big deal. Overall, we would not stay anywhere else in Rome (and my wife has stayed in the Cavalieri on a previous trip!)

Reviews.Title: “Wow-Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Reneeover
Reviews.Content: This place is truly a gem! Stayed 5 nights end of August. in a single room. The room I was given (303) was lovely-overlooking Piazza della Rotunda and the Pantheon with a huge bath also overlooking the Piazza. The whole place is spotless and elegant. Rooftop bar is a definite bonus. Requests were met quickly with a smile (ice, extra towels, etc). The front desk staff is especially helpfule. Wireless internet worked perfectly in my room. Breakfast was adequate. Can't recomment the Albergo del Senato enough.

Reviews.Title: “I could almost touch the Pantheon!”
Reviews.Author: exit98
Reviews.Content: Great location! So close to all the attractions of ancient Rome and many of of the famous sights that you can walk to most of them. Even walked home from the Vatican. Rooms were very small which is typical for most European hotels but the lobby and public rooms were beautiful. Hotel is amazingly quiet. I opened our window and could almost touch the Pantheon and felt the noisy excitement of this popular tourist spot filled with outdoor cafes. But as soon as it was closed there wasn't a peep to be heard inside the room. Staff is friendly and very helpful. Very nice rooftop bar. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, nicest hotel we stayed in”
Reviews.Author: plasins
Reviews.Content: Our room on the 6th floor overlooked the Panethon from our terrace. Great location to all the sights. Agree with previous reviews that Mauro and Allensadra were very helpful and accommodating. Roof-top terrace was a great plus and was a relaxing way to end the day. Good breakfast and liked the 7 am start time. Many good places to eat and a good supermarket across the piazza for snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Amore!”
Reviews.Author: Europe2010_10
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel in mid July and absolutely loved the hotel and the location. I had requested a room with a Pantheon view and was not disappointed our room over looked the Piazza della Rotonda and it felt like you could almost touch the Pantheon. We fell in love with Rome and this fabulous hotel. We walked everywhere from the hotel including the Vatican, Trastevere and Colloseum. The room was large and well appointed the bedding was very comfortable and there was no street noise at all. The bathroom was marble and also large. The breakfast was as good as any we had during our 5 week european vacation. The front reception staff particularly Mauro and Allesandra were so friendly and helpful - they greeted us professionally but personally a wonderful combination in the amazing city. The other staff were also very attentive. The roof top bar was a great place to finish the evening Michele was wonderful serving Prosecco as I gazed across the rooftops and domes of Rome. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CJK50
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with our choice of Albergo del Senato. Our group of 5 spent 3 nights there, and were impressed with the very helpful staff, and comfortable rooms. The location is the BEST, for all exploration of Rome, and we walked to nearly all sights. The staff was very helpful when we needed a large taxi to take us to our Vatican tour. We could have walked, but in the August heat, we took a cab. The rooftop bar was a highlight of our trip, as we enjoyed a drink while listening to opera singer below on the piazza. Very close to Piazza Navone, with many restaurants and nightlife. I highly recommend this hotel, and would choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby-Rooms are a little run down”
Reviews.Author: HeatherWilson
Reviews.Content: The good: the location in the now traffic free square, the breakfast is better than most most and in a lovely room with great service, the rooms are quiet and clean. The bad: no matter what they say they do not have wifi in all the rooms. After complaining that we couldn't get it in any of our rooms they admitted that there was very limited coverage. A minute later new guest arrived and the very same person assured new guest that the wifi signal covered all the rooms. The front desk also served as the concierge--this seemed to overwhelm and frustrate them them. They would assure us that they would help us with RSVs for tour, dinner, massages, then never follow through. No problem...I'll just use the wifi in my room!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, but one Superior Double is not equal to another at the del Senato in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: dog98
Reviews.Content: I booked the Superior Double room with a view of the Pantheon back in Sep. 2009, for the rate of 220 euro per night for 3 nights, with the understanding that this was the regular rate for the room and not a discounted rate on the hotel's website. I also chose this hotel because it was advertised as having free wireless internet and safety boxes in each room. The photo on the hotel's website at the time of my booking showed a superior double with a full door to a walkout balcony/terrace. During my stay from July 31 to August 3, 2010 I stayed in Rooms 302 (for one night) & 605 (for 2 nights). Here is what we received in Room 605 for the same money that we DID NOT RECEIVE in Room 302: Room 605 had: *a balcony you could walk out on for a better view of the Pantheon & piazza *a comfortable double bed with nicer coverings (obviously newly renovated) *a safety box BOLTED DOWN to a secure cupboard *internet connection on the wall and wireless internet worked in this room *a coffee maker and supplies *a clock radio *a safety mat for the tub *his and her amenity kits in the bathroom We were very happy with Room 605 and this is what we expected for our full 3 nights at this hotel. A lot of our time was wasted on trying to get the internet to work & hooking up the unplugged tv in room 302. Also, when we went to lock our valuables in the safety box we noticed you could pick up the whole safety box and walk out the door with it. It was not bolted down. As, you can see we spent a lot of our long travel day dealing with these issues in Room 302, with no help from the front desk staff. I even asked if we could change rooms and was told "no" there was nothing in our category and would have to wait at least a couple of days to get the safety box bolted down, so we put our passports in the small safety box at reception and carried our laptop and other valuables around Rome with us. Our second morning we went back to the reception desk to make sure our concerns regarding the safety box and no internet in the room would be dealt with. The male desk clerk suggested we change rooms and he would call up to our room in 1/2 hour. He called and said nothing would be available in our category and I told him I was disappointed that I was not getting what the hotel advertised. He then called back in 15 minutes and offered us a move to room 605. I believe the hotel staff would have known that room 605 would become vacant by noon that day and could have assured us of a move when I talked to them earlier. We had a few other issues as well: In room 605- - the key card to the room did not work (another trip to front desk) - the internet code had expired after one day(another call down to get new code) - the plug was stuck in the tub almost causing a flood (maintenance man came 3 times during our 3rd day to fix the plug) As you can see, one Superior Double in this hotel is not equal to another. The management has some work to do. Having traveled extensively and having stayed in all types of hotels and categories we did not let this spoil our time in Rome; it was just aggravating and time consuming dealing with these issues that shouldn't have existed in such a highly rated hotel. The location was excellent & the included breakfast was good. The car service that picked us up at FCO for 55 euro arranged by the hotel was excellent. I know this experience is rather unique, but I always report back with the way it was.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcm1101
Reviews.Content: Immaculate and clean! We had connecting rooms 515 and 516. My boys 12 & 9 had there own room with a beautiful bathroom and TV. We had a little foyer to our room and we kept our door open and the kids door open. Our boys were 5 feet away from us a perfect set up. The rooms are a generous size for Europe. A/C was great. The bathrooms are modern and beautiful. The breakfast was ok, watery scrambled eggs, cheese's, meats and croissants. The hotel is walking distance to everything. The Pantheon is right out the front door of the hotel, this draws heavy crowds in the Piazza. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. We were in the back of the hotel and we did not hear any noise at night. I think Albergo should be upgraded to a 4 star. We ate at Santa Lucia, which was great! Forgive me for not elaborating more I'm so jet lagged, just returned from a 2 week trip to Europe. email me if you have any question, I don't mind a all.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: marieSuburbanChicago
Reviews.Content: Just back from four nights at Albergo Del Senato. Great experience! Key: it has working air conditioning (August heat in Rome - brutal!) and is very quiet (astounding as you are facing the Pantheon and it's mobbed all day and night.I couldn't believe how quiet our room was.) Also, great breakfast. You won't be sorry you stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: DavidA8
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel. Small and classy. It is on the piaza next to the Pantheon. Amazing to walk outside and see that each day. The hotel is well located in walking distance to many of the sites. The suite we stayed in was very spacious and comfortable. The views from the roof top terrace bar were magnificant. The hotel was made even better by the staff. Michale the bartender was friendly and courteous. Raffael the night deskman was so helpful and friendly and great with the kids. The staff were friendly in a way beyond having to be so with guests. They truly made the stay remarkable and memorable in the most positive way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent, Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Laritta
Reviews.Content: Just got back form a 6 days stay at Albergo Del Senato Rome. Our stay was simply wonderful! from the moment we got to the hotel till the minute we left, everything, especially the service was wonderful. we have booked a Junior suite via the hotel web site, and when we got there we were pleasantly surprised by the size, the decoration and the cleanigless of the Junior suite. the Bathroom is of an average size by splotlessly clean with all ameneties (slipers were missing though :(). There was also a complimentary fruit basket waiting for us. the next day, the management noticed (from my passport I assume) that it was my birthday so they sent us a bottle of Prosectto for the occasion. It was a greata touch from their side. the front desk staff are very helpful and professional, nameley Mauro and Luigi. they assisted us for making Opera reservations, restaurant recommendation etc.... thank you guys for your efforts. the breakfast room was stylishly decorated, a bit small though... I would suggest for them to use the roof terrace for breakfast during summer. its a lovely place for having coffee in the morning, as it is lovely for a cocktail early evening. the breakfast was rich, and even the breakfast staff are great... Adem always brought me fresh cooked pastries from the kitchen the moment I got into the breakfast room :) the location of the Hotel is perfect for sightseeing especially for first timers in Rome. Finally, at check out we encountered a small problem with the bill. but was immediatly solved, with many appologies. Great Hotel, Great staff... made our stay memorable. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our high expectations”
Reviews.Author: Virginia9616
Reviews.Content: This hotel and our room were immaculate, the staff treated our children warmly throughout our stay, and the breakfast was delicious. It is within walking distance to just about everything and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. (Especially Mauro and Alessandra -- they are fantastic!) The rooftop bar was a delight. We stayed for 5 nights. Since we were a party of 4 and wanted our children (ages 10 and 12) in our room, we reserved a suite; the hotel actually moved furniture around before our arrival to make sure each child had a twin bed instead of a sofa-bed. This was much appreciated and beyond what we expected. Also, we did not find this hotel to be at all noisy, despite what we had read from other reviewers. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CC1980London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to celebrate my birthday, having been already recommended to stay here by friends we knew we would be in for a treat! Cosy it is but it has a fantastic location and with the roof top terrace makes a perfect place to enjoy an early evening cocktails whilst watching the sun go down over the city. Whilst getting ready on our first evening, we received a knock at the door and hotel gave us a bottle of champagne to celebrate my birthday ! It was a lovely gesture. The rooms are small and maybe a little dated but I think it goes with the feel of the hotel very old style marble Italian everywhere. The staff was very helpful, especially when it came to my husband asking for their assistance whilst booking a restaurant for my birthday. My only negative point would be the dinning area is too small, especially when the hotel is full, during breakfast times you may need to wait for 5 mins to be seated. Wonderful place !

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: hannal80
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room from Albergo del Senato after reading several reviews of the hotel. At first I had couple of other hotels in my mind, but because of the location was so good I decided to book a room for 4 nights. And it was much better experience than I would have expected. I booked the room via the hotels own web page because non of the web booking sites had no available rooms (well except hotels.com) and the price was even cheaper. We also booked the taxi service via the hotel. Simple way to get to the hotel and don´t have to wonder about things at the airport. Couple days before we left to Rome I had asked for a non smoking room and view towards the Pantheon. The reception lady wrote back immediately saying they would do their best. Well, when we arrived to the hotel and opened our hotel room door - I started smiling :) We had a double room with our own small terrace towards the Pantheon. So lovely! Only the suites upstairs and this double room have the terrace. We enjoyed time at the terrace, nice way to start your evening, couple of drinks and the atmosphere of the Pantheon. I didn´t expect to stay in a 4 or 5 star hotel. Good 3 star hotel with a great location and good service. Especially the service we received from Mauno at the reception was simply perfect. He gave us lots of tips where to go for a good, delicious dinner and made table reservations. And we were never dissappointed (i.e. ristorante Grano, ristorante Virginiae, ristorante La Focaccia). Breakfast was better than I expected to have in Italy (usually just coffee and smt sweet). It included bread selection, chees, ham, salami, mozzarella, cherry tomatoes, yoghurt, cereals, sweet cakes, srambled eggs, different kinds of fruits, juices, milk, coffee etc. It was a good way to start a day. We will definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: cbpalmer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in June. We have a family of 3 and booked a suite on the 4th floor. It was perfect for us. Having a separate second bedroom worked out fantastic for our son. Nice big bathroom and you can't say enough about the view. The Pantheon right outside your window. This was the last of the hotels we stayed at as we visited several places throughout Italy and it was definitely a good way to end the vacation. If I was to give any negative feedback it would have to be the pillows on the beds...hard as a rock. We found an extra pillow in the closet that was soft and asked the front desk if they had any other "soft" pillows, but was told no. We ended up taking turns sleeping on the soft pillow, because the others were just too hard to use. The front desk was always helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good and well prepared. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful staff, fantastic five-day stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: bec228
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through Tripadvisor comments and was so pleased. The included- breakfast was ample and the staff was genuinely helpful in every way. The rooftop bar was charming and the location was fantastic for walking everywhere. Including coming in out of the heat for breaks in the afternoon. The room was very nice and comfortable with great AC. Only one disappointment. The second floor room's AC for my father-in-law never got really cool enough though the staff tried. And he could hear night noise in the piazza, we didn't up high. We were on the 6th floor and had a balcony. What a treat overlooking the fountain and the Pantheon! This wasn't cheap, but for us was worth the extra for the location and the quality and service. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel picks of my life :)”
Reviews.Author: Traveller-ZAK
Reviews.Content: My wife & I - along with our 2 kids (9 & 17), arrived in Rome on the 1st of Jul for 4 nights / 5 days. From the moment we arrived @ this dainty little place - thru the seemingly 1000 yr old narrow / cobbled streets in the heart of Rome, we all had a perpetual smile on our faces. While it is not a 5-star hotel, it is certainly up there in some categories (quality of furnishings, cleanliness & staff). On the down side (relatively small rooms but u shud expect that in the heart of old city, no room service / kitchen - except @ breakfast times & some rooms with very poor inner court-yard views). That's where the downside ends. Rooms provided to us were a pair of side-by-sides which had no view, but were extremely well furnished with excellent bathrooms. All thru our stay, the service staff kept the place (rooms & everything else), spotlessly & refreshingly clean (nothing short of 5-star quality. The location of the hotel ... trust me ... from the tourists perspective (ESPECIALLY 1st timers to Rome), is absolutely unbeatable. When u match that with the quality of staff & accommodations @ this hotel, u've got it made. The icing on the cake ... was the staff. Talking to & servicing a never-ending stream of guests with mostly the same endless line of questions & problems, the reception staff (including my ALL TIME FAVOURITE Allesandra), just keeps on going - without a break & always with a smile. News / views & tips on everything & all the short-cuts on hand, they are one of the most helpful & friendly bunch of hotel folk I've met (and I've met my share). I left the hotel - Sated?? Odd word to use for a hotel description, but thats how this place left me feeling ... satisfied, full & happy. Thank u tripadvisor, Albergo del Senato staff & Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bauerdvm
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at the Albergo (june 27-July1) - Got to the hotel few hours before scheduled check in and our room was ready and waiting. Very helpful when coming off an overnight flight of 9+ hours, with 6 hr time change! First off, location was terrific. In the Piazza Rotunda, with direct view of the Pantheon. Opened up the window and there it was. Even though the window was overlooking the piazza, once the windows and shutters were closed, could not hear the outside world. And with the shutters and double drapes closed, the room was very dark (great for sleeping). Standard room, nothing exciting. Beds were VERY hard. Breakfast was standard, maybe not up to par for what hotel is charging (honestly, not basing my hotel stay trip on breakfast). But the lack of free internet is wrong. With how much they are charging, they should not be charging for internet usage. Bed, breakfast mild negative. Charging for internet, just wrong. Front desk gave food recommendation of Coppelle (good), and Grano (very good). Ate at Pier Luigi which was recommended by tour guide and even though very crowded, food was mediocre @ best. And if want an excellent tour guide for private tour of Rome, Ivanho from Driver Guide Service was TERRIFIC. Would recommend this hotel, esp for its location.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, small hotel with class”
Reviews.Author: islandwoman_9
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on trip advisor I made a reservation and was not disappointed. Staff were very helpful, friendly but not familiar and quietly went about their duties. The location was perfect , most sights could be walked to and there was a view to admire from the bedroom window, The view was The Pantheon just a narrow street width between the hotel and this impressive building. Despite being on a busy square noise was not a problem. Breakfast was served in an atrractive room off the reception area. Fresh fruits, delcious baked goods, cold meats, cheese, yoghurts and cereal were offered which was more than enough to start the day well fed and in a good frame of mind. Breakfast is the only meal served but this is not an issue because of the numerous restaurants nearby. I read many postive comments about the roof top bar but I am afraid we never made it-too busy walking around! A good reason to return again!. My husband and I took a lap top with us and were able to enjoy free internet access in our room. There was one computer near the lobby. The elevators are small for those who have problems with confined spaces but there are stairs. Rome is a wonderful city to visit, much quieter than I thought it might be, very safe and perfect for walking around-take comfortable shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toute_le_Monde
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, literally beside the Pantheon, and close to many good restaurants, a good deli, what some say is the best coffee shop in Rome, and gelato shops. It was never far away when exploring the main sites on foot, so it was very convenient for rest stops. The public areas of the hotel are elegant. The roof top patio/lounge (private for guests only) was a real bonus. Foodie alert for the breakfast--all the usual suspects on offer for a European boutique hotel breakfast, but the quality of the ingredients was exceptional (best mozarella we had in Italy--who would have expected that?). Service was excellent at the front desk. We stayed for one night in the mini-apartment, which was good value for our family of four. It was a charming retreat at the back of the main floor of the hotel. A bit different. Had a long dining table that was surprising useful. The apartment was fairly large (two levels). Had a small kitchenette. No views at all (which we knew before we booked). A bit dark. The bathroom was fine but the ceiling needed repainting. If we were staying longer, or if Rome was a central part of our vacation, we would have looked harder at the the view rooms facing the piazza. But as long as you know what you are getting, the mini-apartment can be fun, and it was for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mali2007
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Albergo Del Senato from June 29 to July 3rd. We had a triple room and then moved to a suite. Both accommodations were beautiful and perfect. The location can not be any better right next to the Pantheon. I could see the Pantheon from the window of our rooms. The staff is helpful, nice and competent. The breakfast was always delicious. The rooms are decorated beautifully. There is attention to details and I can see that they care about the esthetics of the rooms especially the suite is gorgeous. I always appreciate it when hotels pay attention to details and create a tasteful beautiful environment. This is a small, charming hotel with a lot of character and I recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Queensgirl55
Reviews.Content: I researched our thirtieth wedding anniversary trip in detail, using tripadvisor as our guide, as I have done many times in the past. We had fabulous hotel experiences in Venice and Florence (check postings), but we honestly do not understand, after staying in this hotel, why they are rated number 8 on Rome's hotel list. We made our reservations in March of this year, but when we arrived on Friday of this week, found out that we were being placed on one of the only two floors that hadn't been renovated as yet. When shown to our room, we found rust on the sides of the bathtub, dirty wallpaper, blackened, dirty ceilings and gouged out, old furnishings. When I tried to use the bathtub, I had to call the front desk, as the knob to convert from shower to bath was stuck from age. We found holes in our sheets! We were disappointed to say the least. When we went to the management to complain, as we were paying premium rates for this room, we were told maybe something could be done tomorrow. In their defense, they did show us to a larger room, but in the same condition. It seems the renovated rooms were not to be available to us till perhaps the next day, and we could not face moving again. If you choose to stay in this hotel, be sure to ask for the renovated rooms.To compound the issues, the air conditioner was not working for almost two hours on a very humid, almost 90 degree day. Unfortunately, the air conditioner never worked correctly in the days we were there. As previous posts noted, the area is centrally located to everything, and very lively at night with large groups of teenagers gathering in the Pantheon square. As we were in the back of the hotel, we did not hear the noise, but if you take a front room, it will be noisy. Whenever I read postings like this, I always think (disgruntled patron) but I have used tripadvisor for many years now, and depend on the reviews of others, and feel I would be doing a disservice if I did not recount my experiences there this past week. If you do stay here, the benefit is the location, but words like charming would not be the words I would choose to describe this hotel. Old, and in need of repair is more like it. At least in the rooms were were placed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff with rooms on the smaller side”
Reviews.Author: JMBinDC_07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Albergo del Senato on our most recent trip to Rome. The location was fantastic with the Pantheon right outside the front door of the hotel. It was within walking distance of many of the other main sites including the Piazza Navona and near bus stops, a travel kiosk and a number of bars and restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had free-wi-fi in our room. The breakfast buffet was included and was pretty good. There was a selection of pastries, meat, cheese and yogurt along with juices, coffee and teas. We booked a double room and it was very clean, but on the small side considering the price. The bathroom was modern and a decent side. We had a great view of the Pantheon from our room and even through there was a rally outside our room one night you couldn't really hear it unless the windows were open as the rooms were pretty soundproof. The roof top bar is great with a wonderful view of the Pantheon and the square below. Overall we'd recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: adldoughty
Reviews.Content: This was our first destination on a two week trip to Italy. The hotel was in a great location, within walking distrance of many sights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. the room was large, modern and with free wireless. The morning breakfast was the best we had in Italy. We enjoyed the rooftop bar with Michel. The view from the top is outstanding. Our only negative was our daughter having to sleep on a pull out chair.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: luvhrsz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few weeks ago with our three teenagers (18,16,13) and with friends who had 2 teenagers with them. It is in a perfect location.....we never had to take a taxi anywhere. The staff are impeccable....they speak perfect English, and took care of our every need with a smile. Actually, we never needed anything except for directions, which they happily provided along with a well-marked map. The rooms are very nice, and quite comfortable. We had wireless internet (yes, we brought the iPads), the temperature was perfect, the bathrooms very modern. We had a lovely view of the Pantheon. I was worried about a lot of noise at night, but did not hear a single thing....we slept like babies. The breakfast was delicious. I would highly recommend staying here, and will absolutely stay here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel, unbeatable location and super nice staff”
Reviews.Author: nextstopheaven
Reviews.Content: the location is superb - Pantheon seems to be at your finger tips, which is particularly amazing to a first timer of Rome. very nice staff, and the concierge is especially pleasant. and the room is not noisy at all despite its location thanks to the double-glazed window. I'm a light sleeper and before I booked the hotel, I went to Fodor's forum asking around. everyone told me not to worry and they're right! very glad of my choice and will definitely stay there next time in Rome. just wish next time I can get better rates, LOL....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: seabreezer
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you like to be where the action is then you'll love this charming hotel - right next to the Pantheon and on a very lively square in ancient Rome. The staff at the front desk is fabulous. Friendly, professional and their restaurant recommendations are spot on. The breakfast room is nice but don't order the cappuchinos unless you like lukewarm, weak coffee. You'd be better off with a cafe Americano. The rooms were recently renovated and very nicely appointed with beautiful bathrooms but the ventilation system is obviously as old as the building which is at least 100 years old. Everyone in my group had trouble breathing at night and developed allergies to the dust over the course of our stay. We were all glad to leave at the end of our visit. When the blowers kicked in you could see the dust swirling around in the room. The mattresses were also rock hard so we didn't sleep well at all.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel, in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: LISAMARIE333
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived home from our stay at the Albergo Del Senato for 7 nights. The hotel is wonderfully situated within walking distance of all the famous areas, such as Piazza Navona and Piazza Di Spagna. The hotel staff (ranging from the reception desk and breakfast room, to the maids) are very welcoming, friendly and helpful. The breakfast was lovely (tea, coffee, yoghurts, pastries, fruit, scrambled eggs) and it was great to be able to see the pantheon from our bedroom window.
