The rooms were larger than expected and the hotels’ décor was beautiful. The views from the roof-top terrace are stunning: especially at night when there is entertainment in the Piazza Della Rotunda below. The restaurant opposite the hotel, Café Di Rienzo, served delicious meals and we ate amazing gelato at Giolitti, which was only two streets away. We were able to visit the Vatican, the Colosseum/Forum, the Trevi Fountain, Piazza Di Spagna and 12 churches in one week. A particularly striking Church, Santa Maria Sopra Minerva, is just one street away from the hotel, behind the Pantheon. We will definitely book this hotel again and look forward to returning to Rome again soon. Lisamarie Ayres, UK

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: MelvinaSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for five nights. We had two rooms, which were basically identical except for differing, bad views. This was fair as we did not pay for "view" rooms. The pros: Fabulous location. The sleek, modern decor was a nice change from the over the top baroque-ness of previous hotels. The location was fabulous, right next to the pantheon and overlooking a busy square. Appreciated the free wi fi, access to Sky TV and the included breakfasts. The best thing of all, though, was the rooftop bar and Michele (sp?) who worked there. The views were phenomenal, we watched the sun set every night. Michele was more than friendly and patiently listened as we practiced (mangled) our rudimentary Italian. The cons: The lights and air condiditoning only work when you put your key into a slot when you open the room. This makes the room like a furnace when you return from a hot day of touring. We left one key in the slot one day to keep the room cool, the maids removed it and took the key! Also, the air conditioning only goes down so far, we had it set on the lowest and our room still was uncomfortably warm at night. Our bathroom sink had a steady leak, which was substantial enough to get the towels wet that were hanging in front of it, and wet the floor. We alerted the front desk the first day, but it was never fixed. One afternoon after a hot day of touring, I jumped into the shower and didn't notice until I was finished that they forgot to leave bath towels. So I went to use the hand towels in front of the sink... see above problem. Also, the modern doorways are elegant, but they must be literally slammed to close. The hallways are all wood, with no carpeting, and you hear every slam and footstep outside your door. but the worst was they were doing work on the hotel, started early in the a.m. and their equipment was kept right outside our window in a tiny courtyard. BANG BANG CLUMP... one morning I woke up to the smell of cigarette smoke as they were smoking outside the window and it drifted in (through the closed window, mind you.) And where were they working? The ladder was literally right in front of my sons' door. As teens, they usually sleep like the dead, but this was a little too much. Yes, we got a fab rate, and we did not pay for a room with a view. But unless the hotel was 100% full, I don't think these rooms should be occupied during such heavy maintenance. Also, although we were there five nights, I don't think the staff recognized us. One afternoon I came in and felt like the front desk guy was following me, making sure I wasn't a tourist going to use their bathrooms (Why are Italians so possessive about their bathrooms?) Again, I balance this against the fabulous rate and wonderful location, so I can't be too upset. I just think if they are trying for a four star, as is rumored, they need to up their game.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: xodar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of May. Wonderful hotel centrally located in Rome. Friendly and helpful staff. Our room overlooking the Pantheon (superior double) was a good size for a European hotel as was the bathroom. Rooms have a safe. Free breakfast was included with our booking which I made directly through the hotel web site. Also received a prompt reply when I e-mailed the hotel for a confirmation before we left the US. Only negative is that the floors are wood and if you are below a room with someone who walks with a heavy gait, you will surely here them. Someone paced back and forth for over an hour at 530 AM and we could hear every one of his heavy footsteps. This however did not detract in any way from the many positive aspects of the hotel. If you want a very nice hotel in the heart of Rome, look no further than the del Senato. Should I get back to Rome, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Pagetraveler
Reviews.Content: Second time at the del Senato, this time with my 88 year old mom who had never been to Rome. What a beautiful hotel to introduce her to a beautiful city. We stayed three nights in early May, and for our first night, were given a room with a terrible view: a wall. Luca at the front desk listened to my complaint and worked miracles and moved us the next day to a corner room overlooking the Pantheon. My mom was beaming!! He and Alessandra provided good advice on restaurants and Michele at the bar made us laugh every evening. The location cannot be beat--restaurants everywhere at every price range, a good breakfast each morning and the best view in Rome. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: jen0088
Reviews.Content: Albergo del Senato is in a fantastic location in Rome. It is so central that we walked to everything...even the Vatican. It is close to nice areas such as Campo Di Fiore and Piazza Navona. The room was beautiful but small, and the view was phenomenal! We requested a pantheon view room and fortunately one was available. I could never get tired of that awesome view. Breakfast was nice with meats, pastries, fruits, scrambled eggs and cappuccino. The dinner recommendations were wonderful: we ate at Hosteria Costanza (our favorite), Le Volte, and La Virginae. The staff was helpful but a little bit stuffy compared to the staff at the other hotels we stayed at. That's really the only negative thing I could say...it was a great choice for us!

Reviews.Title: “Would not look anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: EllieD0303
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in an ideal location. Very friendly staff, spotlessly clean, just lovely.

Reviews.Title: “This place is magical, impeccably clean, and in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Mollsker
Reviews.Content: We LOVED Albergo del Senato and will plan to stay there again next time we travel to Rome. I think it was a big part of why we enjoyed Rome so much. I had sent the hotel an email when I booked the room asking if they could give us a room with a view of the Pantheon because it was our wedding anniversary and I wanted to surprise my husband since neither of us had been to Rome before. At the time, they said they could not accommodate us but when we arrived - guess what? They not only had a room with a view waiting for us (and we checked in quite early - 11 am or so) but also a bottle of champagne on ice! The whole stay really was quite magical. The hotel is right next to the Pantheon, see attached photos for a view of it and the square below from our room–(taken from room #406). We could open the window, lean out and see everything going on in the square (including a movie being made, a Gaza protest with hundreds of protesters, etc). It was in a superb location so everything we wanted to see during our 3 days was within a half hour walk. The staff was very friendly, spoke excellent English, was extremely accommodating – even brought us a scale to weigh our luggage. The room was impeccably clean, and to top it all off they have a very quaint terrace bar on the rooftop. (It would have been nice if they had a bar/tables outside the hotel on the sidewalk as others do). They also served a very nice breakfast with freshly baked yummy pastries, sliced fruit, cereals, eggs, yogurt, cheeses, breads, meats, but get there early because they don't replenish the food once it's gone (at least they didn't appear to). They are a 3 star but are working on getting their 4 star certification. I’m sure their prices will go higher when they get the 4 star rating but I thought it was reasonable in comparison to other hotels I reviewed – roughly $300 a night. I did have a problem charging my computer - the problem was likely my converter. It charged our cell phone just fine but not my netbook so I had to use the computer in their lobby (they have free internet if you have your own computer, otherwise you pay 3 Euros (roughly $4) for 30 minutes. A tip regarding restaurants in Rome - before you sit down ask the waiter if they charge a bread fee (not every restaurant charges a bread fee) and a service fee. If they say "yes" to the service fee, ask "how much" and whether or not that goes to the waiter or the owner. I thought I had asked all the right questions at one restaurant after being duped at others (one restaurant charged us 6 Euros ($8) for a couple pieces of bread that I didn't even eat) and although the restaurant said there was no bread charge but they did have a 10% service charge, I thought that would be fine since I would have left a 10% tip anyway but when we paid, the same guy then told us the service charge goes to the owner and they (the waiters) get nothing expecting me to then leave more money for him, which I did but I was not happy that it felt deceitful. Italians generally don't tip but I think they expect Americans to tip - I've read that 5-10% is appropriate. Great city. It was not "just a big, dirty city" as several people had told me before we left - I didn't get that feeling at all. I think it had everything to do with the location of Albergo del Senato. It is very clean and quaint in that area of Rome. You really cannot go wrong booking a room at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing in every possible way!”
Reviews.Author: YagaTanzania
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely three star hotel with a bright future given its location and most of all absolutely amazing staff! My husband and I travel considerably and have come to realize that the best hotels are made up of great staff and service. We give this hotel a top rating that full satisfied our needs. They were always very warm and so helpful with making all the different bookings in terms of our daily tours whether it be to a museum or the opera or even just a taxi. They were incredibly organized!! Although they worked in shifts, everyone at the front desk was upto date on our requirements and updated us accordingly. The location couldn't be better either! There was entertainment every single night at the Pizza Rotonda which the hotel overlooked along with the Pantheon. We were in 105 right in front of the elevator and just a floor away from all the noise, but it never disturbed us. If I ever went to Rome again, I would waste no time shopping around for hotels - I'd just go t Alberto del Senato.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel with a truly wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Footnoted
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo del Senato for five unforgettable days last month. Our family of four (myself, wife and our two boys ages 14 and 11) had a spacious mini apartment on the first floor. We have never stayed at a hotel so superb in every respect--location, value, decor, on and on. Of all its wonderful attributes, it is the smiling faces of the staff that comes to mind first when I think about our stay at this hotel. From the day we arrived through the morning we had to say goodbye, we found the staff to be wholly dedicated to making us feel at home. If we are ever fortunate enough to return to Rome, we wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful city.Wonderful hotel. Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: ferilecat
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from another visit to Rome. Rome is a beautiful, beautiful city and as usual has been made all the more special for us by our stay at the Albrgo del senato. The staff are always wonderfully welcoming - it really is a pleasure to stay at this hotel,we wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else and we are already looking forward to our next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Trust the reviews...this hotel is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: cubmanruss
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 nights at the del Senato as part of my Honeymoon trip. I chose this hotel based on the reviews here on Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed. The location is ideal...we were able to walk to the Vatican, the Colosseum, the Trevi Fountain, etc. The Pantheon was right outside our room window (spectacular sight to wake up to). The hotel itself has old world charm with great modern conveniences. The rooms were apparently remodeled recently. Tastefully decorated but modern fixtures. Bed a bit firm for my liking but that's to be expected in Europe. The service was efficient and prompt. Very polite staff. The breakfast buffet was very good. They do not have a restaurant only a breakfast room but who goes to Italy to eat in their hotel??? The rooftop bar offers breathtaking views of the city. All and all I give this hotel very high marks. It's a little pricey but I feel it was a great value when you consider the location and qualtiy of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Location plus”
Reviews.Author: czardas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. I had picked this hotel due to the location, travel advisor ratings and that I fell in love with the Senario suite, which had a delightful 4 poster bed and original frescos on the ceiling. When we check in, we go to the top floor and it isn’t the room that I had booked, instead we are in a Penthouse, with the best position in the hotel, right next to the Pantheon. When I finally enquire to why I don’t have my requested room on the third floor, I am told that they are doing renovations. The room is the same price as the one I had originally booked, so I hadn’t achieved a financial upgrade and as it’s not the room I fell in love with on the internet, I am almost tempted to downgrade and go to a standard room but we don’t and stick with this room due to the prime position it is in. The hotel is very lovely and located in a great piazza, which is easy walking distance to most of the sites in Rome. Breakfast at the hotel was very adequate. The lifts are tiny and really only fit 2 or 3 people and make sure you are patient, as they are not the fastest lifts on the planet. The roof top bar is a spectacular place to sit and chill, whilst looking over the rooftops of nearby Rome. The hotel is surrounded by cafes and restaurants. One night we walked to the opposite side of the Pantheon and found a café which was full of locals all watching football. It had a great atmosphere and the food was even better than expected. Probably one of our least expensive meals in Italy but really enjoyed. We couldn’t believe it would be so close to a main attraction without the high prices. Two small problems with our room. One, was that we had two TV’s and neither worked at picking up the sky channels, which were really needed when we were watching the volcanic ash problems. The other was the spa bath. After a long day touring the Vatican, my feet were aching and I really longed for a spa. I hopped in and turned on the spa, only to get my thigh sucked hard against the spa. I screamed and quickly pulled away and rolled on my side but if I was to roll back down to be able to turn off the spa, I would have been sucked back onto the inlet. My husband quickly came in and worked out what was going on. When we drained the spa, we discovered that there wasn’t a cover over the spa suction inlet, which resulted in me being quickly attached to the side of the pump. It might sound funny now but I ended up with a huge bruise the size of an orange on my thigh, not to mention the scare it gave me. If I had long hair it would have been sucked straight into the inlet, which can result in scalping or drowning. We called the manager and when he came to the room, he really couldn’t work out what all the fuss was about. He was more interested in why our TV’s weren’t working rather than the dangerous spa. In the long run it was all handled adequately, resulting in our last nights stay being no charge, which when you consider that was about $400 Euro it was more than fair. I only hope that they do something about the spa inlet and not disregard what happened as frivolous as it may result in a serious accident. Would I stay here again, definitely yes!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here every time I am in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: roeshan
Reviews.Content: This place is a gem! Really incredible! It has everything going for it. Location. Wonderfully friendly and helpful staff. Beautiful rooms. Splendid views. NIce breakfast. Everything was just perfect! And what's amazing is that I can say this even though they messed up my reservation. I reserved a double, and requested two beds (I was with my 10 year-old son). Somehow when assigning rooms they missed the two bed request and assigned us a double. Because the hotel was full they were unable to accommodate the two bed request for our first night (but could move us to the two bed room our second night). I was a little frustrated, but I also realize this was a simple human error that unfortunately happened when the hotel was fully booked. The man who checked us in was clearly bothered by this mistake and was doing everything in his power to make it right. In the end we took the double one-bedded room for the first night and the two-bedded room for the second night and without my asking they offered a pretty significant discount off each night for my troubles. In the end I felt like I got a good deal. Both rooms were beautiful, and then I got a discount that was enough to pay for all our meals for the three days we were in Rome and I was beginning to feel like I was glad for the mistake! The staff were also so pleasant and welcoming at every turn. They were fun with my 10 year-old helping him learn some Italian and lent him a Rome for Kids book. They made us feel so welcome. The rooms were incredible. We were in superior rooms, one on the top floor and one on one floor down. Both were lovely. Very luxurious for a small boutique hotel. Nice touches. Views over the Pantheon were surreal! Breakfast was very nice. Lots of great options. The location cannot be overstated. It is the best in Rome in my opinion. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and efficient service in wonderful surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Marianne53
Reviews.Content: I tend to avoid the tourist traps when holidaying in cities, but this was an exception. It was right on the Piazza della Rotunda, looking at the unbelievable Pantheon. The hotel's appearance echoed the lovely Renaissance buildings that surrounded this buzzing but lovely square, and the inside was as beautiful as the outside. The staff, from reception to chamber maid, were charming, helpful and efficient. I arrived a few days before my husband, and the first room had no wifi signal. It was an inside room, so a little gloomy, too. I took my courage in my hands, and asked the first morning if they had an alternative (I did need to use my computer during my stay). There was no hastle, the showed me a new room on the refurbished floor, and it was perfect: bright, with windows opening over the Pantheon itself, and quieter. It also had perfect wifi reception. The rest of the stay was on the same lines. Nothing, really, was too much trouble. The receptionists were all multilingual, too, but willing to indulge our efforts to try the odd Italian words. And make sure you visit the roof bar. At night, you can see an illuminated St Peters and the rest of Rome laid before you. Worth the stay on its own.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SerBSV1
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel to which I wish to return once again. Huge numbers, ideal service. Huge balcony in number. Went with the child what problems were not. A meal wide choice at restaurant. Had perfectly a rest. Especially many thanks to our operator http://www.tripcatcher.ru for the picked up tour. If you go from Moscow call to them: conveniently, качетвенно, the pro)

Reviews.Title: “Wow Great Hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: deva07
Reviews.Content: We are 2 friends from New York visting Rome for the first time for vacation. Both of us have traveled extensively around the US and a good amount in Europe. We scheduled the pick up service from the airport which was a very welcome service after the overnight flight from JFK. Rooms were spacious and very clean. Housekeeping kept the rooms very clean daily as well. Staff was friendly and very helpful... thanks Mario, Alexandra, Luca and Luigi for dealing with us Americans! This hotel was in walking distance of all the major sights including Vatican, Spanish Steps, Trevi, and Colesseum. Taxi's were easily optained outside as well. The Pantheon square directly in front of the hotel offered many casual dining options as well as convenient outside pre-dinner cocktails for tired tourists, not too mention awesome views and enjoyable people watching. All of the streets around this area had casual dining options if you didn't want to make reservations.. you were able to get a table easily before 8...locals eat later... but after walking and touring all day this was convenient. The hotel breakfast was very convenient as well. The only downside, if you can call it that, was the square outside is very busy and tends to be a lively at all times except early am... I am a light sleeper but the location and clean rooms trumped any sleeping issues...Overall, this hotel was really a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: squibjib
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at this hotel & could not be happier. Great staff,nice rooms & amazing location. The staff at the hotel were so nice & friendly we did not want to leave. They told us of great places to eat & were always very helpful. The location is outstanding. Although they told us they had no rooms with a Pantheon view we still could see it from our room. Really loved this hotel & they got us transport from the airport when we arrived. 55 Euro for the driver from the airport but well worth it. Nice driver & nice car. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience romance, history & culture at Albergo!”
Reviews.Author: Bubilee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights in Albergo del Senato. When we arrived we were greeted with smiles and while we checked in the bell boy took our bags up to our room. We had an amazing view of the Pantheon and although we were on the second floor, there was minimal noise from the street below. The hotel is in the perfect location and walking distance to Fontana di Trevi, Piazza Navona, and the Spanish Steps. The Colleseom is about a 20 min walk. We also walked 20 min to Trastevere to check out an amazing pizza place called Dar Poeta! The Dar Poeta pizza with Zucchini and Sausage and a Peroni was amazing! We were also close to Campo di Fiori and ate dinner at a great little restaurant called Ditirambo (opens at 7pm and you should probably make reservations as it is super small and gets full fast). The rooms are typical for European accommodations and are very clean. The housekeepers come twice a day and are very thorough. The water pressure in the shower is great and beds are fairly comfortable. Breakfast and Wifi were included. The breakfast was our favorite part of the day =) We had cappuccino's and chocolate crossaints, mozzarella and ham and fresh fruit every day. Overall, our stay was absolutely perfect and would recommend this hotel to families or couples, anyone who wants a great hub from which to explore all the beauty and history that Rome has to offer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LiseyLou1
Reviews.Content: What can I say, this hotel is totally amazing! I have recently had a 4 night stay at this hotel at the end of April. From the initial booking process to the hotel itself I have nothing but great comments to add. The weather wasnt bad either! Upon arrival at the hotel I was excited to find that we had been upgraded to a junior suite with a balcony with views over the side of the Pantheon on the top floor. Room 608 was utterlly fantastic, the decor and size of room was great and the balcony was an added bonus for us. We used this every day morning and evening to sit out and listen to the buzz on the piazza below. The staff on the front desk were great, always friendly and polite and could not do enough for us. Everything we asked them for including local information was great. The room was really plush, cleaned every day and had a turn down service on an evening with slippers a little goodnight note and chocolates on the bed. All the facilities you would require in a room were provided. A very reasonable mini bar, bath robes, slippers, hairdryer a television and a great alarm clock. Overall a great hotel that I cannot fault at all. The balcony was full of floral plumes which were exceptionally kept. The breakfast was also extremely nice for a european city. Pastries, yougurts and lovely coffee to set you off on a morning. The taxi service was used from the hotel for our arrival and departure and this was as smooth as possible and at a reasonable rate. The hotel is in a perfect location with all the facilities you require. Its perfect walking distance to everything Rome has to offer. This was our second trip to this amazing city and our first time at this hotel. I can safely say that I would look no futher from now on for accommodation. I am looking forward to booking a return journey to Rome and staying at this fabulous place.

Reviews.Title: “Great but beware of ants!”
Reviews.Author: Raz868
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay in Rome, staying at this hotel. Everything about this hotel is great, the location (we walked everywhere, but the legs are sore now), friendliness of the staff...the breakfast could have been a litter bigger though! Stayed at room 205 with a view of the plaza, really beautiful room! The only issue was a visit from small black ants on my bedside table and on the floor some of the evenings! It was really strange, I kept taking them away but there were still ants coming and none of us could make out from where they came. Probably from a hole in the wall or something...luckily, they never decided to climb the bed! As im not the most bug-loving person, the ants resulted in me having a nightmare of a big spider climbing the ceiling and waking up screaming in the middle night, scaring my gf to death! Hilarious... Anyway, aside from the ants, the room was spot-on! Big bathroom with tub and great view of the night-life of the piazza. We had a great time in Rome, had lots of good food and wine and ice-cream! We will be coming back, but would prefer an ant-free room! :) And the staff were sooo friendly, friendliest staff we've ever met! :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!!! Wonderful Hotel!!! Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: denbenSoCal
Reviews.Content: We had room 603, the room had a balcony and a great view of the Pantheon! We loved this hotel!!! We stayed five nights. My husband kept telling me how great the room was! Room included best view of the Pantheon, bathrobes, slippers, toiletries, safe, hairdryer, mini-bar, nightly turndown service with chocolates, sound proof windows (but we left the windows open because we loved the sound of the piazza (i.e., clip clop of the horses, music, singing - on the weekend there was an opera singer, quite charming!!) Late night/early morning it was dead quiet. At the end of each day, we loved to watch all the activity and drink wine from our balcony. The staff were all polite, very helpful. We enjoyed our included breakfast too, cappuccinos every morning (served by a very nice man, who provided us the great cappuccinos). If you go early enough to get the croissants fresh out of the oven, they will melt in your mouth!! The gelato place across the piazza is wonderful! The little market directly across from the hotel, is a great place to get a tasty sandwich, beer and wine, very friendly people! The hotel recommended a family owned restaurant - Ristorante Due Colonne (Via del Seminario, 122), it was very tasty, reasonably priced, friendly service and just about a block away (as you exit the hotel turn left and left again down the little street, go about 2 blocks, the restaurant will be on your left). That hotel is in a great location, convenient to all bus stops, taxis or walking. This was a great place to end our trip! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here!! Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: FrenchKissLondon
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from our six day break to Rome. We chose to stay at the Albergo Del Senato having read all the reviews about the hotel here on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. What a wonderful hotel, situated from the Pantheon. Beautiful decor, with wonderful, friendly, helpful staff. Breakfast very substantial served in a lovely breakfast room. All the historial sites are within easy walking distance of the hotel so you don't have to worry about transport. If throwing my coins in the Trevi Fountain work, I will be back in Rome at the Del Senato very very soon. Please stay at this hotel, you really will have a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome...again!”
Reviews.Author: Jen_S_08
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at Albergo Del Senato, and it was just as wonderful! The staff is so helpful and kind...they made us feel like old friends. Our room was beautiful and extremely clean. From our balcony, the view of the Pantheon and entire piazza was breathtaking. The location of the hotel is ideal for walking to most places in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel. Great Position”
Reviews.Author: maffei40
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my freinds wedding in Rome and whatever the reason for your trip I would highly recommend this hotel. Its situated in the sqaure which includes The Panthenon and the hotel has a roof top terrace with a bar, so you can sit and watch the amazing sunsets overlooking The Panthenon, which when lit up at night is beautiful and just watch the world go by. The rooms are comfortable and clean, reasonable size but in Rome the rooms won't be large so be warned. Breakfast was continental style and if you don't fancy that just outside of the hotel in the square there are a variety of restaurants too. Just around the corner is an amazing ice-cream parlour which is a must. As in Rome.......

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in the Centre of Historic Rome”
Reviews.Author: onero
Reviews.Content: The Albergo is a classic hotel without a huge price tag. Its location, in the Piazza della Rotonda right beside the Pantheon, puts it in the very centre of historic Rome. Its front rooms look right onto the facade of the Pantheon, and its rooftop bar is a great place to relax and enjoy views over the domes of Rome at the end of a busy day. Right outside the hotel's door, the Piazza del Rotonda is full of famous sights (see http://www.romeartlover.it/Vasi25.htm for a description) and all the legendary sights of Rome are an easy walk away ... The Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and of course the Ancient Roman Forum. Even The Vatican is walkable if you're fit. The hotel is also close to The Corso and all its shops. We had no trouble booking a front room via the internet. It was comfortable; had a bath and a safe; and looked right onto the Pantheon and the Piazza del Rotonda. It's big windows opened onto an excellent view (see photos) but thick curtains helped make it quiet at night. We loved it. The Albergo also welcomed us with an excellent breakfast room downstairs in the morning. It has an ancient fluted marble column in its centre, and a large selection of delicious food at one end. The Albergo staff are courteous and endlessly helpful (thank you Alex). Their advice was wise and their restaurant suggestions were invariably good. In short, we had a wonderful stay and heartily recommend the Albergo del Senato to all. It's in an old palace, with a tiny slow lift; but you'd have to be a real grump if you didn't enjoy these old touches in a city as old as Rome. They add to the flavour of our favourite hotel in Rome ... and we'll happily return every time we visit the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine staying anywhere else in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BuffCrone
Reviews.Content: I booked Albergo after reading reviews online here and also elsewhere on the web. I wanted a centrally-located hotel with full services. While the hotel does not offer a full restaurant, the breakfast is included (delicious and sufficient) and they are accommodating about providing tea, etc. in the afternoon. The view is astounding, and while the room I stayed in (which had not been renovated) would not qualify as a 3-star hotel in the U.S., it was clean and perfectly adequate (although the shower needs some work!) There are shutters to reduce the noise from the piazza below, which can be considerable, but I am a light sleeper and it never affected me. The bed is rock-hard, however, so if you need a little cushion, grab the duvet from the closet and place it under the sheet. What makes this hotel so terrific is the service. At every turn, the staff are kind, welcoming, and accommodating of every need. I consulted them for directions, recommendations, travel advice, and they could not have been kinder. From the chamber maid to the front desk clerk, I felt that everyone in the hotel did everything they could to make my stay an enjoyable one. Mauro, especially, went out of his way to find charming places for me to dine. I'm sure I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “I want to return to Albergo del Senato!”
Reviews.Author: petvetcookies
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on Trip Advisor and the location. I loved this hotel! The location is superb. It is in the city center or Rome and in front of the best preserved Roman monument the Pantheon-A roman symbol. The the front reception staff impressed me. Mauro and Alessandra were most helpful during our visit. They recommended great places to eat at night. Amongst the best recommendations was Osteria del Sostengo in Via delle Colonnelle which we visited twice. The Albergo has an excellent breakfast that includes bread, an egg dish, fruits, juice, meats, cheese and excellent made at the moment cappuccino, coffee, etc. Adem in the breakfast area most graciously prepared many cappuccinos for us! We stayed in a triple room (110) we were traveling with our daughter. It faced a busy small street and Rome is very busy in April so at times it was loud but if the window was closed the noise was to a minimum. The hotel must be well insulated because we heard no noise from the other rooms at any time. My parents were staying at a room facing the Pantheon (104)--gorgeous room. The rooms were very clean and the maintenance staff takes pride in what they do. This is a small hotel but they really take pride in what they do. It has a small bar that serves drinks in the afternoon until 11:30 pm. Claudio was working at the bar while we were visiting and he was very gracious with my parents (hot chocolate for my mother, Remy Martins for my dad and wine for me!). He made the end of a long day very pleasant for us. In summary I really enjoyed my stay at the Albergo del Senato. I would stay again at this location if visiting Rome for pleasure and for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: firsttimetraveller40
Reviews.Content: We had a room overlooking the dome of the Pantheon, which is indescribable! I wanted to stay in the hotel almost all the time, just looking down on the Pantheon and the lively square from my window! The service was first-class, including the breakfast, where staff were always available to get you whatever you wanted and bring it to your table. The staff were very friendly and smiley, and all spoke great English. The rooms were spotless and the bed very comfortable. If I ever return to Rome, and I hope I do, I will not look anywhere else. P.S. My only disappointment was that their rooftop restaurant was closed when I was there, as it only opens in the summer season.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tistone
Reviews.Content: What can you say? Superb location and nothing at all to point the finger at. The staff and service at this hotel is fantastic. Its not the cheapest hotel in Rome of course, but its worth every Euro.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ptslz
Reviews.Content: just returned from a weekend in Rome chose this hotel because of the reviews on here and wasn't disappointed. Location excellent, clean & staff friendly and helpful. All in all a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Service -- Would Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Annagins
Reviews.Content: We only spent 2 nights at the Senato and I wish our stay had been longer. The staff at the front desk were all very welcoming and genuinely warm and friendly (not to mention, helpful) and the rest of the staff seemed happy to be there. The housekeeper had a friendly smile on her face as did the attendant in the breakfast room. The hotel is decorated in the grand Italian tradition with plenty of marble and wallpaper. I believe it's a 3 star hotel, but decor was 4 star all the way. The rooms seemed to be a good size in comparison to some other European hotel rooms, and they were elegantly appointment and very comfortable. The TV had loads and loads of channels in many different languages and the bathrooms were modern with a tub and shower. Our room was a triple, and while we did not have a view of the Pantheon, we could open our window and look out a the little side street below. My daughter really enjoyed this view. We had breakfast on two mornings. The first morning, we missed service in the dining room due to oversleeping in the comfortable beds. But the hotel brough us room service for free. The second morning's breakfast included many nice offerings including a frittata, cereal, yogurt, juice, and other things we didn't have a chance to try. I would heartily recommend this hotel to any friend and especially friends with children, as the staff seemed to like them. They even loaned my 8 year old a Rome With Kids book to use for the duration of her stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here-seriously, end of story...perfect!”
Reviews.Author: daughterteam
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I read the reviews about Hotel Albergo del Senato on Trip Advisor as well as other sites and decided to try it for our 7 nights in Rome. We usually stay at 4 star establishments in the states-so we were a little worried about the 3 star rating. We arrived at Del Senato at 9 am and were warmly welcomed by Mauro. We were eager to start exploring and Mauro gave us a map and showed us a few close by sites--well, actually everything is close by! The location in front of the Pantheon and the Piazza della Rotunda can't be beat. The hotel is beautiful, extremely clean-just perfect. We were helped to our room and we were so pleased with the size, the decor and wait it just keeps getting better--we opened our window "Hello Pantheon!" The breakfast was exactly what we needed, espresso or cappucino, fruit juices, fresh fruit, croissants, antipasta, yogurt, cereal. In the evening we enjoyed the bar and bartender. The staff was very helpful and welcoming. Maybe the three stars is because there is no fitness center or attached restaurant, but there are many restaurants immediately outside. Can you tell we had a great trip! We did-and we will stay at the Albergo del Senato again if we are lucky enough to go back to Rome (we did through a coin over our right shoulder at Trevi Fountain).

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL, PERFECT LOCATION, FABULOUS SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTexatty
Reviews.Content: Perfect location right next to Pantheon. We had a 6th floor front room with balcony. You felt like you could almost reach out and touch the Pantheon. Wonderful to sit out late at night with a glass of wine on the balcony and watch the nightlife in the square. Walking distance to practically everywhere. Very friendly staff, good restaurant, rooms a little small but very clean. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Location next to Pantheon and great service equal outstanding experience”
Reviews.Author: BillandLori
Reviews.Content: The hotel matches a perfect location right next to the Pantheon with unsurpassed service and friendliness by the entire staff. We stayed 5 nights and then booked one more because our experience was so nice. Off-season rates helped earn a 5 star on value. The only drawback on going off-season was that the roof terrace wasn't open. First floor bar area was fine, but not special. Good, but not overwhelming breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenGlobe
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not very big but visiting Rome is not spending time in the room. The hotel is very clean, the staff is friendly and helpful. The location makes it one of the best hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: mbvbLancaster
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights in this superb hotel, and we were really impressed by the staff and the location. The front desk team (Alessandra and Maura) could not have done more especially as our case holidayed in Zurich for a while. The hotel's location, seconds from the Pantheon and 15 mins from the Trevi fountain could not have been better. The only tip is to get to the busy tourist spots early and look up from the guide book to see Rome's fantastic views.

Reviews.Title: “25 Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: sndybttm
Reviews.Content: Rome was the start of beautiful vacation and celebration of our 25th wedding anniversary. We traveled with great friends and stayed at the Albergo del Senato for several nights before traveling on to Venice. This hotel was amazing! We had the most wonderful view of Piazza della Rotonda and the Pantheon was so close we felt like we could reach out and touch it from our hotel window. It was the perfect location for sight seeing. We were within walking distance of everything we wanted to see, including the Vatican. Our room was comfortable and clean. My only complaint was that the bathtub was so narrow that I could barely stand in it to take a shower. I don’t know why they don’t get rid of the really small tubs and just use showers. On the other hand our friends had a room on the other side of the hotel which did not have the view but they had a large garden tub which they said was perfect after a really long day of walking. It was nice to have the included breakfast to start the day and everyone who worked there was very gracious. Don’t miss going up to the roof top bar for breathtaking views of the Piazza and surrounding neighborhoods. I can’t image a better hotel to stay at because the location and view just can not be surpassed.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfection”
Reviews.Author: luvnormandy
Reviews.Content: Our first visit was in 2008, for only one night. By email, I requested a room - "even a small view of the Pantheon would be nice." When we arrived, we were taken to the room with the balcony on the facade of the hotel - with the most fabulous view of the Pantheon that I could barely sleep that night, not wanting to take my eyes off of it. This time we purposely planned two nights to celebrate our anniversary. Again booking by email, I requested the same room. They replied they'd do the best they could but couldn't guarantee it. When we checked in at the hotel, Mauro at the desk, apologetically told us they couldn't accommodate my request but he thought I'd like the room they gave us equally as well. I was disappointed - until I opened the door of our room. We were on the 6th floor, with a terrace overlooking the Pantheon & the piazza - a view to die for. The rooms are beautifully decorated, well appointed, and comfortable. I cannot say enough about the staff - both times we've stayed. You are treated as if you've stayed there many times and are a "regular" even if it is your first visit. We felt we received royal treatment, the best of any hotel in which we've stayed - in any country or city. The Del Senato is worth every penny you will pay - location, service, rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay just as good- fabulous location next to Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: Traveler067
Reviews.Content: I stayed a second time here- this time with my husband in December after a trip a year earlier with three girlfriends. Not cheap but I love this place, really helpful staff and such a perfect location for shopping and sight-seeing. The deli accoss the square is delicious, the ATM is right there, the Pantheon! of course and a famous cafe. The first room they put us in was smoking and smelled BAD but they moved us right as away after we complained. I reccommend this place to all my friends. The windows keep out the sound of the square but we left the window open because we like the bustle. LOVE it.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in a fantastic location - worth that little extra - wonderful trip.”
Reviews.Author: Alandal23
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived, the service was excellent. I had requested a room overlooking the Piazza della Rotunda as we were celebrating a birthday - the hotel then upgraded us to a Superior room free of charge. We were on the second floor with a view of the Pantheon that can only be described as jaw dropping. We wondered if it would be noisy at night but am happy to report that once the windows were closed there wasn't a sound and we slept like babies. Room and ensuite beautifully decorated, with the usual assortment of toiletries on offer. Breakfast was lovely. Good assortment of cereals, bread, cheese, fruits, meats etc as well as scrambled egg. Again, service was very attentive and nothing was a problem. We enjoyed a glass of wine in the hotel bar both evenings - wine delicious and service again excellent. Another huge benefit of the hotel is the fact that all of the main historical sights are within walking distance. During our two day stay we managed to walk to Roman Forum, the Vatican, Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. The taxi to Termini was around 10 euro. All in all a perfect place to stay. Yes, you can stay in Rome for less money, but all things considered, for the difference in price of similar rated hotels, it was well worth the extra. We are already looking at dates to return and won't consider any other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: StymieG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the del Senato for a week at the end of February. Although we arrived early in the morning and before our room was ready, the concierge got us into the breakfast room, and the smiling breakfast room attendant made us some amazing cappucinos, which was exactly what we needed after a long flight. The concierges were only too happy to help us with museum reservations, excellent restaurant recommendations, and advice on travel times. Our room looked out on the inscription on the front of the Pantheon. The only downside is that the piazza is lively at night, and climate control in the room is not straightforward, so that if you sleep with the windows open, be prepared to deal with some noise from the piazza. However, this is more than compensated for by the proximity to the sites we were interested in, and by the helpful attitude and competence of the staff. With that small reservation, we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great position but the best thing was the friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Joan017
Reviews.Content: Our room was pleasant with a great view of the Pantheon. The breakfast was fine although the coffee could have been hotter. The staff were marvellous. However do not use the shuttle from Rome airport. We waited 1 hour 30 minutes to be picked up. The excuse all the time was that they were waiting for other flights to come in but it got beyond a joke. Going back to Rome airport was better but by the time we had picked up other people we were worried about catching our flight.

Reviews.Title: “If only all hotels were this good”
Reviews.Author: DrSAH
Reviews.Content: We took my parents for their first visit to Rome for their 70th birthdays and were so glad we chose the Senato. We have stayed in Rome several timebefore but this was the best. You cannot get closer to the Pantheon, but the hotel does not rest on it's laurels. The hotel was superb. We had small but cheap rooms which were perfectly fitted out, with quality fittings and bedding. The staff too were excellent, never haughty, always helpful, very knowlegeable. The room was a little warm even with the heating off, but we just opened the window and listened to Rome. With the window wide open, the view of the Pantheon and the bustle in the square below remind you why you came to Rome in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jmw6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and loved everything. Our room was 307, on the corner of the building with a view of the Pantheon, so close it felt like we could touch it. Every staff member of the hotel was helpful and friendly. The location can't be beat. We were able to walk to most every tourist spot. When we didn't feel like walking, a taxi stand was within yards of the hotel's front door. Breakfast was included in the room rate - a basic spread of meats, cheeses, breads, pastries, juices, fruit, and an egg dish, and good strong coffee served with a smile. I can't say enough positive things about this hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. If I had to say anything negative, it'd be that the firmness of the mattress was a bit too firm, and we referred to our bed as "the rack" by the 3rd night, but that's probably just me being picky. Great hotel. Great location. Great hotel staff. I'd book again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Around - No Regrets.”
Reviews.Author: Shamu63
Reviews.Content: There was a group of 12 people who stopped here (some for the second time) for a recent rugby international. From all of the people there was nothing but positive comments relating to the hotel, service, accommodation, location and staff. From the initial engagement with the reservations team to the friendliness of the reception regarding the room requirements, saving some packages that we had delivered, to checkout and the return of some left property, the arranged transfers and "Angels and Demons" tour, there was nothing but positives stated. We stayed in a different variety of rooms, from Superior to Standard. Superior rooms had a fantastic view of the Pantheon, large sleeping area with lounger, two walk in wardrobes, large well appointed bathroom, and a separate lounge. All were very clean, and serviced on a daily basis by very unobtrusive staff. Standard rooms, although small in comparison to some other hotels, were more than adequate, and were sufficient for what was needed for the trip. The location is ideal for most places to be visited by foot, and if taxis are required they usually are available straight outside of the door. Plenty of places to eat and drink, but the usual applies that they are more expensive around the Pantheon being a major tourist attraction, than some of the lovely restaurants and bars tucked away in the back streets. The reception staff are only too happy to help in recommending or finding places for all tastes. The hotel arranged at short notice a four hour walking tour based around the Angels and Demons novel / film. This was brilliant!! The guide was passionate, informative and very enthusiastic towards Rome and the various places that she took us to visit. All of the touring party that went on this tour thoroughly enjoyed it. This is the second time of staying at the Albergo, and will definitely be back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...Stay at Albergo del Senato”
Reviews.Author: Angelina8888
Reviews.Content: The whole experience at this hotel was wonderful. We arrived to check in and the hotel is adjacent to the Pantheon in the Piazza del Rotonda, perfectly located, accessible by walking to all the major attractions. It belies its 3 star status and probably doesnt have a higher rating purely because of size and facilities, it does however have a fine breakfast room and bar open from 5.30 through midnight. The concierge speaks excellent English and as we were taking our mother for her 65th and had booked a triple room we checked there were 3 separate beds, he then upgraded us to a 2 bedroom suite which wowed her straight away as she isnt a frequent hotel traveller. Every member of staff from the chambermaids to the bellboy to the waiting staff were helpful, we wanted an Irish pub that showed the rugby match and they were able to oblige with recommendations for this and other travel, nothing too much trouble. The hotel is clean, smart, and decorated in tasteful Italian style, traditional but newly furnished with marble floors throughout. The buffet breakfast is great by Italian standards, a great choice with plenty to see you through the day and the minibar prices are more reasonable than many cafes and bars! I would recommend this hotel to absolutely anyone who is willing to pay €100+ for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Lola7572
Reviews.Content: My husband and I highly recommend this hotel. Our room (406) had an amazing view of the Pantheon and piazza below. Location was perfect. Great restaurants nearby and within walking distance of all the major sites in Rome. There was some street noise in the evening, but nothing too disruptive. We really enjoyed opening the window at night and listening to the opera singer below entertain crowds in front of the Pantheon. We mentioned to the Hotel when we booked that we were on our honeymoon, and were pleasantly surprised to find a bottle of sparkling wine waiting for us in our room upon our arrival - nice touch! Great service. Breakfast was good. Room was very clean. Free wi-fi in the room. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, central and easy to walk everywhere.”
Reviews.Author: JazzAlert
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December, in a triple room. We did not have a view of the Pantheon, which was fine with us, as it was quiet and had a view onto a 'real' Roman courtyard, with a little balcony. The room was lovely, plenty of room for the 3 of us, free wifi, clean, with a reasonably spacious bathroom by European standards. The staff were fantastic, especially Maurio, who chatted with our son like they were old friends. They were very helpful always. The location is unbeatable. Step out the front doors and the Pantheon is before you. We walked everywhere, and loved wandering the streets of Rome (despite the winter cold). If you can, book online to get an entry time to the Vatican. It was far and away the most crowded and longest queued site in Rome. We booked online the evening before, and were very glad to be bypassing the exceedingly long line of cold tourists. There was still a short wait in a very crowded queue, but a lot better than the other option.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - couldnt be nearer the Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: Waldea
Reviews.Content: It was my partners 40th birthday weekend away - I made the hotel aware when I reserved the room and they surprised us with a bottle of sparkling wine in the room on the birthday evening. Very friendly staff made us feel welcome and friendy to our 6 year old who enjoyed the attention. Location can't be beaten, fanastic views and atmosphere. Perfect for a special holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: cameramel
Reviews.Content: Our children booked this Hotel for my wife and I as a present to my wife to celebrate her 60th birthday. They booked it having read the reviews on this site. Thls hotel manages the almost impossible of combining top quality service,excellent location and value for money whilst retaining a very personal touch. If they can maintain this level of pride without pomposity they will have found the golden recipe of success. Having travelled the world for both leisue and business it takes something special to persuade me to write complimentary reviews. Book this hotel and you will not be disappointed. Well done to all the staff at this hotel from the front of house to the breakfast team and the chamber maid. We were made to feel very special. Melvyn & Joan Cross Yorkshire UK

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular location overlooking Pantheon - would stay again despite noise in the street at night”
Reviews.Author: LizzieGAustralia
Reviews.Content: A truly amazing location overlooking the Pantheon. We stayed there with our 2 teenagers twice during our recent European holiday, the first time all 4 of us were in room 606 (separate bedroom with kingbed and ensuite with adjoining room with single bed and another bed which they brought in - there was plenty of room plus another beautiful marble bathroom) This room is magnificent with its own terrace off the main bedroom overlooking the Pantheon. On our 2nd stay we had 2 double rooms on the 4th floor and these were almost as beautiful. Free Wifi, 2 lifts & nice breakfast served between 7am and 10am. Very helpful staff. Only negative was the noise in the square below in the early hours of the morning but this is no fault of the hotel, and our teenagers slept through it all anyway. We would definitely stay here again, though maybe I would bring ear plugs! My husband has been to Rome before and would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: QueenBeeLondon
Reviews.Content: I took my Mum away for her birthday and as I had my 13 month old son with us I wanted somewhere central. This wonderful hotel is certainly that and from our room we had a spectacular view of the Pantheon. Even though we went in October it was baking hot in Rome and because of the location of the hotel we were able to walk everywhere. All of the major sites were no more than 20 mins walk away and the ambience of the square was fabulous especially at night. The staff were amazing especially Mario who couldn't do enough for us. He knew it was my Mums birthday and as he was good at calligraphy he wrote a beautiful card for her and left it on our cases when we were leaving. I had also had trouble with the baby car seat when we were picked up from the airport. One word to Mario and guess what - there was a brand new one in our car for the return. Amazing customer service. The breakfast was complimentary and fabulous. The room was really spacious and the travel cot all set up for us when we arrived. It would also highly recommend a visit to the roof terrace for pre dinner drinks. Wow- you can see the whole of Rome from up there and it was just magical. If I go back to Rome I won't bother even looking for anywhere else to stay. Because of the great location and excellent standard of this hotel, it costs a little more than other places - it's definitely worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “I won't even look elsewhere after staying here”
Reviews.Author: AliciaBar
Reviews.Content: First, I have to say that Mauro and Alessandra were the friendliest and most customer service oriented people I have had the pleasure of meeting. On arriving Mauro was the first person to greet me as we walked in and he was so accommodating about our request to check in early if possible. Luckily the guests staying in our room had checked out early that day so we were able to check-in after about an hour. Mauro offered us breakfast while we waited. That was the best experience we have had with any hotel really. The breakfast was typical, pastries, cheeses, deli meats, fresh fruits, cereals, yogurt, juices and cappuchinos or coffee and tea. The hotel kitchen staff were extremely friendly and efficient and bilingual. The hotel cleaning staff were also great. The room we stayed in had a view which we requested and was a typical size by European standards I would say but there are larger rooms in the hotel just not with a view. The decor is dated but the bathrooms are very roomy which is uncommon. We did not spend much time in our hotel room. Too much to see and do. The view was spectacular. A clear shot of the Pantheon and the piazza and fountain. Unbelievable! We are sold on this hotel and we are never going to look elsewhere when we come back to Rome. It is centrally located to all of the sites. We walked everywhere and ate nearby. Many shops and restaurants. There is a supermercato really close by where we bought bottled water, wine and snacks. There are ATMS just about everywhere. Many of the restaurants nearby are bery touristy spots but the traditional restaurants don't open up until about 8pm and if you are like us you are starving by 6:30-7pm so don't hesitate to eat nearby. We didn't have a bad meal anywhere. It is pricey though.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel lives up to it's billing - fantastic location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterWorcester
Reviews.Content: Since I chose this hotel via the internet it is only right that I should add my comments to it. I chose this hotel based upon it's location (central Rome), it has rooms to accomodate four people (my wife and I + two children) and the reviews about how favourable it was. So having just got back how did the hotel rate ? 1) Location - couldn't be better - the hotel is right on the Panthenon square and is very central to walk in all directions (Vatican, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Colliseum, etc. all within easy walking distance). 2) Room - very big and very clean (we think they changed the sheets every night). large bath with jets an added bonus. 3) Favourable Comments of previous people - the staff were very helpful and friendly. The lady on the first day (sorry didn't catch her name) gave my kids a sweet upon arrival (friends for life after that !) and provided us with an English guide to 'Rome with kids' for our stay (very useful book). In the afternoon's Mauro was even friendlier (if that was possible) and would complement the children on their smiles and was generally a very welcoming person to meet after a day's sightseeing. Their collective English was also very good which helped as we were very basic Italian speakers. Overall therefore top marks - hotel very good and made our four day stay most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in ROME”
Reviews.Author: GSR70
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 day vacation in Rome where we stayed at the Albergo Del Senato. The location was fabulous it was located in the vibrant square where the Panthenon is. Since it was Dec is wasnt noisy so we didnt have that to worry about. I have to say if you are worried about outside noise at night then you arent doing Rom correctly in the day as you should be wiped out after a day of sightseeing! The rooms are small so do not be surprised, we even got a free upgrade to a larger room adn that was still small, again you will not be in the room, and I will take a plush nice small room anyday over a big ugly room. Anyway, the staff was superb, so friendly and attentive, the free breakfast was a great bonus to have as we would eat early and not return to the hotel until about 3 or 4pm. We walked everywhere in Rome from our hotel location, everywhere except the day trip we took (which was worth it) to the ruins of Ostia Antica, which definately rivals pompei although the Italian Gov needs to promote it more as a place of interest for sightseeing as it was really great. Some retaurants we went to which were fabulous were Colline Emilia (Via degli Avignonesi, 22), Da I 2 Ciccioni which is in Trastevere part of rome on a street called via del cedra, just walk all the way down via del cedra and on the left right before the steps there are metal doors (3 is the address) where a guy will cook food for you, it was pretty fun like an underground restaurant (it was written up in the NY times), also loved Il Bacaro and 2 other ones which I will add tomorrow. Anyway, loved the hotel, you will too

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, but Disappointing Room”
Reviews.Author: travelwise
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after a great deal of thought because of its location. I had debated between the Albergo del Senato and the Britannia (where I stayed last time I was in Rome, and where I thought the room and the front desk staff were wonderful and where the rates were considerably lower for this visit). What made me decide to go with the Albergo Del Senato, was the location… more central and an easier base from which to explore the Centro Storico on foot. Most especially, the many restaurants and gelato shops in close proximity had virtually everything to do with the selection. I like being able to walk to dinner and then take a leisurely stroll back (with a stop for gelato, of course!) Positives: As everyone notes, this hotel has a fabulous location. You can (and we did) walk virtually everywhere you want to go in Central Rome (including the Vatican, where we walked on a gorgeous autumn day.) Our room had a view of the Pantheon, which I loved seeing from our window along with the Piazza della Rotunda. Being next to the Pantheon also made it easy to find our way back home each day. On the first two nights, we were serenaded by a band concert, held in front of the Pantheon -- quite delightful! The other big plus is the front desk staff, who are simply wonderful. They are smart, pleasant, helpful, have a sense of humor, and can handle a multitude of questions with ease. Mauro and Alessandra were the people with whom we interacted the most, but the guy on at night and Luca, who we met on the way out, were also excellent. Bravo to all of them! The hotel has free wifi and I was able to use the computer in our room. You need to get a code from the front desk first. There is a computer downstairs for guests, but it was often in use, and when my husband tried to use it one night, it didn’t work at all. When he checked with the front desk, they tried to fix it, but to no avail. They let him use one of their computers to check his Email. The bathroom was well equipped and the shower worked well. We slept comfortably and were not bothered by noise from the Piazza della Rotunda or neighbors. The room and bathroom were kept clean. There are several newspapers available free to guests and among them was the International Herald Tribute. As noted, there are many excellent eating places in close proximity and several wonderful gelato shops are a quick stroll from the hotel. Two banks with ATM's were just across the Piazza and very convenient as well. Negatives: Our room was dingy and disappointing. Yes, we had a great view, and I liked being right at the top of the stairs on the story above the lobby so we could walk up and down without having to wait for the elevators, but the furniture was old and unattractive, the room was small even for a Roman hotel, and there was wood chipped around the door in the bathroom, which was also cramped. For the price and from other reviews, I expected a much nicer room with more luxury. Perhaps all of the other reviewers stayed in renovated rooms, but we didn't. The room was too hot. As is common, the heat was turned on, but there was no way for us to adjust it although there was a thermostat on the wall… it just didn’t work. I asked for an extra bath towel and another pillow. ( I never can understand why some hotels supply only two pillows on the bed and one extra in the closet… so we can fight over it?) I did mention to the room attendant, who when bringing the extra pillow, also brought an extra blanket that it was hot and she said she would speak to the people downstairs, but the room stayed hot all weekend. The television had Fox News, which isn’t news at all and no CNN, but they did have the BBC so we could check on what was happening in the world. When traveling, I like to watch CNN at least once a day if possible. The breakfast wasn’t as good as other hotel breakfasts I have had in Rome. In particular, the orange juice was horrible and should have been fresh squeezed rather than from a can. The quality varied from day to day and could definitely be improved although there was good variety on the buffet.The buffet included cereals, ham and cheese, scrambled eggs, melon and grapes on the first day, but the fruit selection the rest of the weekend was not nearly as good), juices, toast, pastries, some sort of quiche, yogurt and oranges. We ordered cappuccinos from the waitress and ate enough to last until lunchtime. My husband loved the apricot tart served on Friday morning, and he wished he’d left more room to eat several slices (on the other days there was a pastry, but it was never as good as this apricot tart.) Only on vacation do we eat dessert with breakfast! So, although I loved the location, I will undoubtedly stay elsewhere the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful suprise!”
Reviews.Author: Redrebeltraveller
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome with two friends for a 4-day break just before Christmas 2009. None of us had been to Rome before but this hotel had been recommended by one of my friends whose mum and sister had stayed there previously so she booked it for us. I had no idea before our arrival where we were staying so got a lovely surprise when the taxi pulled up outside and I instantly spotted the stunning Pantheon in the Piazza Della Rotonda immediately opposite the hotel entrance. The beautiful piazza glowed with lights from the busy restaurants (with outdoor seating even in December!) and Christmas decorations - it was just magical. We were greeted at reception by Mauro who treated us like old friends and made us feel so welcome throughout our stay. Our room was perfect and overlooked the side street and the side of the Pantheon. It was clean, quiet and had everything we needed. Raffaello the hotel night porter kept us entertained after our evenings on the town and all of the staff we came into contact with were helpful and friendly. The hotel is perfectly situated for enjoying all of Rome's sights and things to do. We only took one taxi (to the Vatican as we were short on time and wanted to beat the queues - but we walked back afterwards!) and walked everywhere else. The Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Piazza Navona are all within walking distance of the hotel and Rome is a very easy place to navigate your way around. When choosing restaurants, we found the lesser known places down the side streets served the best and most authentic food. Just a short walk behind the hotel is the beautiful church of San Ignazio (on exiting the hotel go left and then immediately left again up a side street until you come to the next piazza. The church is on the right hand side) One of Rome's hidden gems with a ceiling that to me seemed of equal merit to the one in the Sistine Chapel - a definite must see! If you are visiting the Vatican get there early. We arrived to find a HUGE queue outside the Vatican museum entrance and were fortunately approached by a rep who offered us a group guided tour that beat the queues and was well worth the €40 we paid. The normal museum entrance fee is €14 but I would still recommend seeing the Vatican this way. Our tour guide Stan was excellent - pleasant, funny, interesting to listen to and very passionate about art history and the Vatican. The tour was 2.5 hours long and included the Vatican museum, the Sistine Chapel and the Basillica de San Pietro. I think the company was called Tour In Rome. Look out for their reps when you join the (long) museum queue! We were desperately sad to have to leave Rome and particularly the Albergo Del Senato. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone. I definitely intend on returning to Rome and will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Hotel and Touring with a Limo/Cab Service”
Reviews.Author: DameAtSea
Reviews.Content: This is a very late review. I did write one and post when we first arrived back home the first week of July, 2008. For some reason, it did not post........so I am now going to try to recreate my review. Better late than never. We were a group of friends arriving in Rome on 2 different days. We arranged for transfers to our hotel with Rome Cabs. Both days the arrangements were flawless/perfect. From the minute they picked us up to the time they took us to our ship, it was a pleasure to deal with such a professional company........more later, below. We stayed at this wonderful small hotel in Piazza della Rotonda. Our lovely, large room, well appointed room overlooked the magnificent Pantheon. To us, this came to be known as "OUR Piazza"! This hotel provides a fabulous central location for a perfect stay in Rome. As is often said, "When in Rome......" We didn't want a modern, chain hotel. We wanted to experience the FEEL of living in Rome. This is exactly what we got. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. They serve a wonderful full breakfast each morning (included). We would choose Albergo del Senato again anytime! The next day all 6 of us shared a delightful FULL day with Stefano himself. Three of us had been to Rome before, the other 3 were Rome 'virgins'. Stefano packed in more important attractions than us 'vets' could ever have dreamed possible......then added in a few hidden gems of his own personal choice. We were amazed and very appreciative of his efforts. He even managed to get us to the top of Capitoline Hill that was closed to traffic.......saving us the climb. We were very grateful for that, as it gave us the magnificent view of the Forum.....a wonderful overlook. Mid-day, we had a scrumptious lunch at La Capricciosa, as prearranged by Stefano.......it could not have been more perfect. He even joined us for a cappuccino.....and our first limoncello.....the best of our entire trip, I might add. The afternoon was just as full of venues and surprises as the morning had been. Again, we were amazed at how MUCH we were seeing. Stefano really knows his magnificent city and how best to show it off to visitors........with a VERY personal touch. We felt as if we had known him forever. He shares what he loves about the city and what visitors expect to see........there is nothing 'canned' about his presentation. It's as if you were his long lost cousin from across the big pond and he just wanted you to see EVERYTHING! The next day he had arranged a guide for the Vatican Museum. In hindsight, though the guide was great for getting us passed the long lines, we all felt we would have seen the things that were most important to us if we had just done this on our own. That is no reflection on Rome Cabs ..... that's just the way it is when you have a guide. Now that we KNOW how it works, in the future we will just plan accordingly. We had also arranged for Rome Cabs to transport us to Civitavecchia to board our cruise on the following day. Much to our surprise and great delight, it was Stefano himself who showed up promptly at our hotel the following morning at the prearranged time. So we had another 1 1/2 hrs. of great conversation as we drove through the countryside to the port......and a little added surprise as a parting gift.....VINO! Now I can't say or guarantee whether that is done on a regular basis or if we were just VERY SPECIAL! ;) I am positive that Stefano's staff also provides a great experience......so no matter who is behind the wheel you are going to have a GREAT time and cannot go wrong with Rome Cabs. In October, 2009 other friends used their services, Marco was their driver. They had nothing but wonderful things to say about their day with him.

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine a better experience!”
Reviews.Author: billsinaz
Reviews.Content: We planned a 4 night stay and wanted to see a ton of sites. This location was perfect for us. We walked all over the city and the longest walk was maybe 20-30 minutes tops. It really did seem like it was the center of all of the major attractions - Vatican to the Northwest, Spanish Steps and World-Class shopping to the Northeast, Colliseum to the southeast, Piazza Novona just to the west and Trastavere dining nightlife to the southwest. The view of the Pantheon was amazing. To think your room looks out over a 2,000 year old building is mind-boggling. The rooms were spacious for European standards. The place was spotless and had nice ammenities. Free Wi-fi, hot showers with great water pressure, comfortable bed, etc.. The staff was helpful, but nothing over-the-top. Breakfast was good enough to hold us over for the day (most days).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location with View”
Reviews.Author: hekili98
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay. Location, location, location. We had a nicely decorated and sized double room and modern bathroom with an amazing view of the Pantheon. The hotel is directly on the piazza with the Pantheon. The hotel's location enabled us to walk to most of the major tourist sites in Rome. There are many restaurants, shops and coffee bars in the neighborhood that cater to both tourists and locals. The best gelato bar is right around the corner! The hotel has a very friendly and helpful front desk staff, and the buffet breakfast included fresh fruit and eggs every morning. The hotel's elegant but small lobby and bar were being refurbished during our visit but that did not detract from our visit. We were disappointed that the top floor bar had closed for the season; its view of Rome must be amazing. We had no noise issues between rooms, and closing the sound-proofed windows silences any noise from the piazza.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service but noisy”
Reviews.Author: pellegrino31
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Italy for our honeymoon and stayed at the Albergo del Senato from Nov 24-30. And even though it's said in all other reviews of the hotel, the location is really amazing. It was convenient for all the areas we wanted to visit. The front desk service was also very professional and attentive. Our main issue was the noise between the rooms, which isn't the fault of the hotel necessarily but still worth mentioning as an experience we had. There is noise from the piazza which is muted somewhat by the double glazed windows but you can still hear the activity outside - we live in NYC so we're used to street noise. Rooms that don't face the piazza will be far more quiet. What was more bothersome was the lack of sound-proofing between the rooms. We didn't really see many comments about this from the reviews which perhaps means others were less concerned with this aspect. We originally started off on the 3rd floor and then we were able to move to a suite in the top floor thanks to the terrific front desk staff so that definitely helped and we were very much appreciative of their assistance and understanding. Perhaps we had bad luck with the guests next to us, but we could hear a lot through the walls (this was also the case when we were in the 3rd floor room).
