I don't expect whisper quiet but I also don't expect to clearly hear other people moving around their rooms, opening drawers, etc. The hotel's location is great and we appreciated the help from the front desk staff during our stay to upgrade our room. We would recommend this hotel for those reasons, but since we're more sensitive to noise we would probably pay a bit more to stay elsewhere unless more improvements were made to reduce the noise in between rooms.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: clancyaustin
Reviews.Content: this hotel was superb. Perfect location, really cute, spacious rooms, a friendly, helpful staff, good breakfast and bar. No negatives. it was great stepping outside and having the Pantheon right there. and the piazza it is on is very active and lively, which was great in the evenings. would absolutely recommend it (and stay) again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: KentShortbreak
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to the Pantheon. Ideally located for the Trevi Fountain, Colosseum, Spanish Steps. About a 40 minute walk to the Vatican. I believe that most if not all rooms overlook the Pantheon itself. The view from our room was fantastic. The staff at the front desk/reception were extremely good and booked us taxis and gave sensible eating options just outside of the very expensive Pantheon area. Expensive for a 3 star hotel, but location is great, the rooms are basic, good sky TV, very clean. Breakfast reasonably limited, but do not let this distract you from booking a very nice top flight 3 star hotel. You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Superb Staff and a Charming Hotel all in one!”
Reviews.Author: Rcase14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Nov 2007 and Nov 2009 for 5 nights and paid a little more than a very nice hotel around the corner because of the great value of this hotel and staff--it is worth it. The staff is very pleasant and helpful including sending us some items we left in our room. For visiting Rome, this is the very best location to be able to walk everywhere in Old Rome. We stayed in one of the newly remodeled rooms that is first class in everyway. Waking up and seeing the Phanteon 50 feet outside your window is quite a trip! We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: redwineandcheese
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right at entrance to Pantheon! We had a standard room with no view of the Pantheon. Our window opened onto an open space in which construction workers were noisily chatting all day. It was disturbing when we were in our room. They also played the radio part of the time. Otherwise, it would have been a quiet room. The room was too hot. We were told the AC was off for the season (this was the end of Oct.). The best they could do was turn off the towel rack heater. That seemed to help a bit. The woman at the reception desk was especially helpful. The men were less so, but still nice. The housekeepers were great. They always came while we were at breakfast. We returned to rooms made up and clean. Breakfast was better than most hotels we stayed at. In addition to the usual sliced cheese and meat, yogurt, juice and coffee, they always had scrambled eggs in warming trays. Also better than usual pastries. Waitstaff were exceptional. Very pleasant breakfasts. But, the best thing is really the location. So close to Piazza Navona, Campo di fiori, trevi fountain. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Alberto del Senato - PERFETTO”
Reviews.Author: DynoJersey
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, fantastic location, very helpful staff - and always stop by the bar and chat with Michele before venturing out for the evening...his recommendations are the best way to enjoy Rome like a Roman!

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have been happier!”
Reviews.Author: DProsserSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a long weekend in Rome and we very much wanted to immediately thank the Albergo del Senato which contributed so much to the wonderful time we had there. From the moment of our arrival we felt like honoured guests and very much appreciated the friendly and helpful attitude of the reception staff throughout our stay. The room itself was beautifully decorated and we were fortunate to have a view over the Piazza and onto the Pantheon itself. I don't know if this is a regular occurence but at 6pm we were serenaded by a military band in the Piazza playing selections from the operas. The hotel is very centrally situated within easy walking distance of all the major attractions - we never needed to take transport to get arround - and there are some excellent restaurants close by. This is the first review that I have written, but we both felt that the hotel should be recommended after the excellent time we spent there.

Reviews.Title: “Just make sure you make a list”
Reviews.Author: creynold02
Reviews.Content: 3 of my family members stayed at the Alberto del Senato in late October. The hotel was in a great location and it was nice to have breakfast included in the room rate. For 360 euros per night, however, I would have expected a lot better service. After our second night of three in the hotel, we noticed that housekeeping had not bothered to give us any new shampoo or soaps, and had not replaced the towels. They left the used ones out and without lids on. When we called housekeeping to get new soap and towels, they brought it to us right away. However, when we called them back 10 minutes later after we discovered there were no water glasses replaced in the bathroom, housekeeping came back and mumbled for us to make a list next time. They didn't seem to realize they should be replacing these items in the mornings when they cleaned the room. In addition, the bathroom shower does not drain well and we found ourselves having to take quick showers to avoid swimming in water (we brought this up to management but I don't think anything was done.) In summary, the hotel was in a great location, some of the staff were very helpful, but overall I think you could do better for your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, in the best possible location for Rome”
Reviews.Author: TriniSoon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding, we had a fabulous holiday in Rome. The service and friendliness from the staff was surprising and outstanding. The location of the hotel cannot be beaten; we walked everywhere in Rome - The Vatican, Trastavere, and all of the sights in central Rome - there really is no need for public transport when you have such a well-located hotel as a base. Will definitely be back if we return to Rome, and will recommend to friends with no hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here! - great location, great staff, great views, great rooms - loved it”
Reviews.Author: billy_od
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Rome (from Scotland) on first time trip with my wife and 13 year old son. Location is fab - faces the Pantheon and couldnt have picked a better location. Rooftop terrace is a must for an evening drink - great value considering what you will pay for a drink elsewhere - but views are stunning. Literally 5 mins from Trevi fountain, 5 mins to Pizza Navona and Campo Fiori and a 15 minute walk to the Collosseum. Staff were so friendly and made us feel so welcome and great breakfast really sets you up for a day walking. We stayed in room 310 which is simply stunning - 4 poster .bed and fresco ceiling in a huge room. . Just round corner is loads of restaurants - too many to choose from. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Michigaloot
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of its central location in the piazza where the Pantheon stand. It proved to be an excellent choice as we were able to walk everywhere in 30-35 minutes. It is a lovely place with very nice rooms, an extremely helpful staff, and a very good (free) breakfast. They arranged for a private car to pick us up at the airport for about 15 euro more than a taxi, which eliminated our transportation concerns. Also, there is a taxi stand next to the Pantheon which made it very simple to get to the train station for the next leg of our trip. I cannot say enough about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - location,staff, breakfasts, service, everything.”
Reviews.Author: hildev
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I booked a triple room for a two night stay. We were able to book in as soon as we arrived ( earlier than normal check-in), and they kept our bags on our third day until our taxi came for us at 6pm. The staff were very helpful, and gave great advice re buses, taxis etc. Our room was fine - not huge, but we weren't going to be spending much time there. A little noisy from traffic in the morning, but no different from any other city centre (and HOW central!) hotel. Fantastic place

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahphila
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, the huge bathroom with plentiful hot water, the in-room tea and coffee service, the comfortable bed, the pristine cleanliness, the elegant decor, the breakfast buffet, the helpfulness of the staff....We will return!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Classy Hotel with Excellent Staff, Views, Location, & Comfort!!!”
Reviews.Author: ugottaluvrome
Reviews.Content: I searched the internet for monthes and kept coming back to this one. Then I decided this was the only hotel I wanted to stay in. It's location can't be beat. You can walk everywhere, Castle Angelo, Piazza Navona, Patheon of course, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, etc. It's a charming hotel and the staff couldn't have been better!!!! Everything appeared new and clean and elegant. The bar on the rooftop provided an amazing view of the Pantheon and piazza below. The waiter was excellent and even volunteered to take our picture! It was an amazing experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sp94122
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its good reviews and rooftop bar. The hotel is lovely. My single room was small and overlooked an uninteresting courtyard--but it was a nice room with a nice bathroom. The hotel itself is clean and very attractive. The location is perfect--very central, right at the Pantheon. This means that many tourists are about, but you don't get the crush of people you find at Trevi or the Spanish Steps. Most importantly--the staff at this hotel is wonderful. Mauro spent an entire afternoon helping me find a dentist when a crown fell off my tooth. He initially called his personal dentist (who, sadly, was not available). We then found a dentist less than a block away. (by the way, if you ever need a dentist in Rome, Dr. Edmondo Maggio was careful and kind) Alessandra at Albergo del Senato was also absolutely charming, always welcoming and helpful. The rooftop bar is private for guests of the hotel and has amazing views. The bar is managed by a charming man named Michael. This hotel really MADE my stay in Rome --I don't think I could stay anywhere else in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: cincykeller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights pre-cruise and loved it! The hotel is small and charming and our room overlooked the Pantheon! When we were shown to our room I went to the window and opened the blinds and it was literally right there! We spent a lot of time leaning out the window and watching people, horse drawn carriages and musicians go by. The rooftop bar is awesome too!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: FrenchLIT
Reviews.Content: I feel so lucky to have stayed at the Albergo del Senato, which made our stay in Rome a perfect one. Perfect location, nice refurbished rooms, impeccable friendly and caring service day and night (but for one person). The hotel was on the expensive side, but the experience was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “You'll Pay More, But it is soooooooo worth it...”
Reviews.Author: halesmail
Reviews.Content: Albergo Del Senato is right in the Center of Rome. You never get lost because it is literally 50 feel from the Pantheon which is an easy landmark to explore from. Short walking distance from everything you will need. Rooms, staff and service are top notch. AAAA++++

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel and within walking distance to most everything.”
Reviews.Author: DITucson
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here in 4 years. Our room opened up to the square that the Pantheon is located. There are many wonderful little restaurants with in walking distance. The rooms had been remodeled since our last trip....very comfortabe. In the evening the roof top bar is open and it is a great spot to watch the sun set. The bartender was the same as our last visit and was very attentive. The front desk staff were most helpful in answering all our our questions. The breakfasts were very good and staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: QuicksilverDigital
Reviews.Content: We actually had made last-minute reservations at the Raffaelo, but when we arrived we were told there was a "good news, bad news" situation. Because of a problem with our room, we were to be relocated to their sister hotel, the Senato. We were quite happy with this arrangement, because we stayed near the Pantheon last year and loved the location. The hotel was in an older building but elegant and well kept up, and the front desk people were uniformly helpful and friendly. The room was typically small but extremely nice, and we weren't there to hang out in the room. The rooftop bar is a great addition, with an excellent view of the sunset to the west over the rooftops. It was quiet at night, but we were in the back of the building; it may not be so quiet in the front. Overall we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, witch of a night clerk”
Reviews.Author: MacDiarmada
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the wonderful reviews I found on Trip Advisor. I was very happy with the hotel, an amazing place and the room had an excellent view of the Pantheon. I couldn't have asked for more. Room was a bit small but bathroom was clean and large. Elevator is not for the claustrophobic. It was an excellent hotel, clean, charming, right on the square. Just a perfect location all around. I truly loved it. It had to be the most romantic spot in Italy, to sit on that charming square and have some wine was such a treat. I loved the bartender in the hotel, he was so sweet and made up for the witch of a desk clerk I met on arrival. He recommended the best restaurant , one that was up the road behind the Pantheon. But ask him for a good restaurant, he'll surely recommend the same place. Our stay there was from Sunday to Tuesday, September 20th, 2009 to September 22, 2009. It was a bit warm but cool at night. Now speaking of the witch, I had arranged for a car through the hotel to pick us up at the airport from our flight from Ireland. We arrived 15 minutes early . We finally came through with our luggage looking for our driver and he was no where to be found. We waited a while but finally decided to take a cab to the hotel. I arrived at the hotel and the female desk clerk with curly blonde hair to her chin greets me in Italian, which was wonderful, however I must have made the awful gaffe of saying hello to her in English because she literally rolled her eyes at me. I'm very shy to use my Italian, I would never presume to speak their beautiful language and not butcher it. I'm pretty shy as a rule anyway. Her response to me was to roll her eyes and throw her head back. When I gave her my name she proceeded to chastise me because I did not wait for the taxi driver. This went on for a few moments with me on the receiving end of a condescending tirade by this desk clerk. I was appalled. It wasn't until I told her that I didn't feel like spending the first 15 minutes in the hotel being chastised by her that she finally stopped. I couldn't believe someone would treat a customer like that. I'm still flabbergasted by her behavior. I loved the hotel though you can keep the blonde witch with the serious chip on her shoulder.

Reviews.Title: “What a location!! Loved the property.”
Reviews.Author: kawarthalakes76
Reviews.Content: My friend and I shared a twin room at this hotel towards the end of September. Rome was just one of many places on our itinerary. We were both spellbound by the location. Each and every time you walk out of the hotel door is the ever so large Pantheon directly in front of you. It looks just like a movie set. The hotel is small and intimate with clean comfortable rooms and classy bathrooms. The roof top bar has amazing views that you must see for sunset if possible. The location is perfect for exploring Rome by foot, it is about centre of everything. Staff were helpful and friendly. My friend used the limo service from the airport arranged by the hotel and the service was very good. You do have to be very careful with cabs in Rome. I would highly recommend the hotel, and remember you are not in your room for very long while in Rome so go for the cheaper rooms that face the narrow streets eitherside if it comes down to comparing cheaper hotels. Internet access area is very nice if you do not have a notebook. Breakfast was very good with a good selection, including boiled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: Billymaze
Reviews.Content: Just back from our honey moon in Rome and Sorrento and felt compelled to review this hotel. I was a little worried about the location prior to going as I thought we should have been closer to the Spanish steps but after spending time in Rome we were blown away by the central location of the hotel. It's within walking distance of literally everywhere. On arrival the desk staff were absolutely polite and professional in every way. All front rooms look directly at the Pantheon. We stayed in one of the superior rooms on the top floor (number 604). It's expensive in comparison to other cities but after exhaustive research I realised it was actually middle of the road for Rome hotels. The room was very small (most in Rome are) but it was very well equipped and absolutely spotless with a very comfortable bed. Small bathroom too but as with the bedroom it was immaculate. I had one problem while there when the key card for the room didn't work, I went down and told them at the desk and they literally tripped over each other to get the problem fixed which was done in about 20 minutes. The breakfast (included in the price) is simple and adequate, don't expect a big lavish affair, they provide cereals, toast, pastries, sliced meats, cheese, yoghurt etc etc, nothing cooked at all. The coffee is surprisingly bad for Rome so wait till after your breakfast to get one in the many cafe's beside it. The bar downstairs is tiny and again adequate to sit and have a beer and read. The piazza outside is brilliant at night for food (expensive but good quality) and watching Italian life go by, every night there were different singers and buskers who were excellent but not in your face trying to get money off you. All in all the place was spotless throughout, small boutique type hotel, extremely courteous and helpful staff, fantastic location and was a lot better than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Touran
Reviews.Content: Del Senato is just fantastic. Wonderful atmosphere, friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms and a perfect location just a few minutes walk to most of the attractions in the city center. The location at Piazza Rotonda is very good. The Piazza with Pantheon is very nice and we was not disturbed by the the nightlife. Nearby the hotel you find good restaurants, lovely espressobars, cafes and icecreambars. We used the pickup service arranged by the hotel and it worked just as expected. The hotel has a lovely breakfastroom serving a deliciuos breakfast. Everthing was perfect and we have already booked another trip to Roma and Albergo del Senato.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: BNJ2009
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome for the last stop on our vacation in Italy. After great experiences at all hotels up to the night before we arrived in Rome (in Sienna---thanks Arthur Frommer--- you are so wrong and Trip Advisor is so right) we were concerned about our room. Upon arrival we were advised that they upgraded us and the room was fantastic! We were given the only room with a private balcony overlooking the Square. It was not large, but it was great to take a break and people watch and smoke a cigar. The hotel was quite pleasant and I loved the location overlooking the Pantheon; it was central to everything we wanted to see. Would stay again and would recommend to everyone. I am a light sleeper on vacation and had no problem at this hotel. The bathrooms were good with spacious showers. Great room size for a European hotel.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECTION”
Reviews.Author: texancruzer
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for both a precruise stay and a post cruise stay. Due to flight delays/missed connections we arrived at 4 pm instead of 7 am and needless to say I was not real happy. We arrived at hotel and check in was fast and easy and professional. Front desk clerk was sympathetic and gave us room 204. When we opened the door tired and hungry......I noticed huge doors that led out to a big balcony. When I walked out the Parthenon was almost within reach.......then I look to the left and to the right and up and down.......WOW they gave us the only room on the front with a balcony ! Other more expensive rooms on the top have terraces but this was the only balcony.......I spent quite a bit of time out there just watching the Piazza della Rotunda. In the early morning...... from totally empty to mid day teeming with people to late night as the city went to sleep. Awesome hotel, staff, breakfast was good and fresh and included. The rooftop bar is the place to experience Rome's sunset. You can see everything from there. You cannot go wrong with this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel - great location, great room, great service!”
Reviews.Author: dan8873
Reviews.Content: Albergo del Senato lived up to my expectations which were pretty high after reading all the positive reviews here on Trip Advisor. Its a great hotel with charm yet functional in every way. It has been recently renovated, so everything was in great condition. The view of the Pantheon from their lobby couch says it all for me. Allesandra and Mauro were always extremenly helpful and made many a good meal recommendation. The rooms were perfect, we had 506, one of the suites with a little balcony. The breakfast room downstairs was great, but bringing up a tray of coffee and pastries to have on the balcony each morning quickly became a habit I dearly miss. The view of the Pantheon from the balcony was insane. Watching the piazza della rotunda fill up with people every morning and clear out late at night was great. The fountain was always our first stop before heading out on our daily sight seeing adventure. Since it was August, having a full water bottle was a necessity. Make sure you go up to the roof top for cocktails. Watching the sun set from that view is amazing. The food from the restaurants on the piazza is fine and well worth the view and people watching. The location of this hotel can't be beat. It is central to EVERYTHING, we walked everywhere anytime we wanted. Our air conditioner worked fine, we closed the shutters when we left the room and were never too warm. The bathrooms were great for European hotel standards. Stay here - you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! great hotel great location!”
Reviews.Author: peglimerick
Reviews.Content: My third time to rome and this was the best hotel. Always stayed out of town thinking in town would cost alot more. I was wrong. This hotel is, great value for money, extremely clean and saves you alot of walking to get to all the great sights and at night you just step outside the door and you are in the heart of everything. The staff were more than helpful, we mainly dealt with Allessandra on reception and she was so pleasant. Offered to print off my plane seat booking for me. The breakfast was georgous, on one morning we left just as breakfast started to get in line for the Sistine Chapel (yeh get there early!!) and one of the waitresses wraped croissants and biscuits and fruit for us to take with us, not to many hotels would do that for you.It is so close to the Pantheon if you stretched your hand you'd nearly touch it. Imagine being able to go into the Pantheon first thing and have it all to yourself, going for a stroll before breakfast and being the first to the Trevi Fountain or first to Piazza Navona, dont imagine go stay at this hotel and make it all come true!!Overall this hotel made our trip relaxing, worry free and most of all enjoyable. Would I stay here again? I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in prime location for sights”
Reviews.Author: molineux1
Reviews.Content: This trip was our second time in Rome and it was faultless. This hotel was fantastically located for all of the sights, going from one end of the city, the colosseum, up to st peters and the spanish steps and beyond. We walked everywhere, taking in the sights as we strolled along the cobbled streets and ate ice creams. It was heaven. The breakfasts in the hotel were great and my only criticism would be that the dining room gets a little packed from 915 onwards and we did have to wait 10 minutes one day but that is the only genuine criticism. Our room was bigger than expected and although it didn't look out onto the piazza and pantheon (we had room 309) we had no complaints. The staff were always helpful and accomodated us when we checked out at 0430 to catch our budget airways flight back home. There is a mini bar in the room which was a nice touch but to be honest we walked to the bearby 'de spar' and bought the odd bottle of beer which was really cheap as nastro azzurro (peroni to you and me) was expensive in the bars and restaurants. Rome can be enjoyed on a budget even in this current economic climate! Look out for Goilitti's which is a meeting place a couple of streets away from the hotel which serves the best ice cream and ice cream type desserts ive ever tasted. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a central location with comfortable clean rooms with a couple of extras like the mini bar and turn down service at night. There is also a roof terrace with a bar which has fantastic views of the piazza and rome which is gorgeous at night. We will most definately be visiting this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very comfortable, great service, nice size”
Reviews.Author: dcdowntown
Reviews.Content: I just had to add my 2 cents to the chorus praising this hotel. First, there is something unbelievably cool about stepping onto the balcony of your room and looking out over the Pantheon, almost close enough to touch. (Sometimes being a tourist means your inner geek has to be humored.) Second, the staff was unfailingly attentive and friendly. Third, the suite we stayed in was quite comfortable (but a typical older European size that others may find a bit cramped). The only item I wasn't happy with was the inconsistent wifi connection in the room. We kept getting thrown off the web. A small annoyance but even when on vacation I need trouble-free access to my office. That said, I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanne99NY
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommeded by friends of ours. It is located adjacent to the Pantheon and the view from our hotel was spectacular. The service was excellent and we enjoyed the breakfast which was provided. I highly recommend this hotel for its amenities, location, spectafular view and excellent service- all at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Surely the best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MrsCP
Reviews.Content: After all the great reviews from other trip advisors, we booked this hotel for our Rome Trip, it was our honeymoon so we prebooked a view of the pantheon. Wow, how amazing!!! The hotel arranged to collect us from the Airport, excellent service. Check in was quick and easy too. Our Room was lovely, it was a corner room, think the number was 417 but I can't be sure. it was beautifully decorated, it also had tea and coffee making facilities which is a bonus in Italy as its not the norm to have this. LCD TV (not that you'd go to Rome to watch TV!), bed was extremely comfortable, the Alarm clock was one of those SAD lights which start to gradually illuminate from 10 mins before the alarm goes off and then the alarm starts making birdie noices, really lovely way to wake up each morning (We had to buy one when we got home!) Bathroom was great too, very well decorated, shower was fantastically powerful, didnt want to get out of it. Mauro on the front desk was great, he recommended so many good restaurants, some expensive, some not so expensive. He really looked after us. Another nice touch was when we got back from dinner, we found they had been in and turned down our bed, little mats next to the bed along with slippers. If you go to Rome and want a nice hotel to stay in, dont look elsewhere, this place is perfect, so very central with great views. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - the hotel exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: JonathanHamer
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I booked this place for our 3 nights in Rome. Most of the other reviews cover the benefits of choosing the Senato so I'll simply say that we stayed here with a 7 yr old and an 18 mth old and had a great stay. The location is great; the staff welcoming, friendly and professional; I have no complaints on the room and if I return to Rome I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of heaven in Rome”
Reviews.Author: gneill6
Reviews.Content: This is such a perfect haven of peace in Rome. All the staff make you feel at home, always taking time to help arrange restaurants or advise on trips. Special thanks to Michel on the roof top bar for going the extra mile for us. We hope he remembers us getting engaged in the moonlight overlooking the Pantheon. Our thanks too, to Allessandra and Ann on the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Great rooms; Helpful concierge; Amazing roofdeck”
Reviews.Author: clememr
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Albergo del Senato in August for our honeymoon. The location is excellent -- the hotel is centrally located within walking distance of most everything & the piazza in front of the Pantheon features several restaurants with outdoor-dining so it doesn't get empty & sketchy at night. The staff was incredibly friendly. At checkin, we were upgraded to a suite. On the roof for a drink while the sun went down, the bartender - Michel - was very attentive & friendly, made an excellent martini, and took some really well-composed photos of us as the sun went down. Later, the concierge helped me book seats on an Italian-only bus website & then allowed me to use their computer to print the tickets (of course, if they'd had a business center, I could've printed them myself). The only reason I'm not awarding 5/5 on service is that the concierge recommended two mediocre restaurants. We should've learned our lesson in Venice & Florence -- don't ask the concierge; eat at places rated highly on TripAdvisor! That aside, the rooms were large, clean, comfortable; it far exceed the expectations I had of a 3-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: CluelessBride
Reviews.Content: What a great find. The location can't be beat with window views of the Pantheon and virtually walking distance from all the major tourist sites. We didn't use a the metro even once although we did have to walk A LOT. The staff was very helpful and friendly and even helped us prebook our Vatican trip using their computer (which I STRONGLY recommend to avoid the long lines). There was no noise from the piazza thanks to the new windows and the hotel is very well maintained. Our room was small but that's what we expect when we travel to Europe. The only complaint was the shower. Unfortunately there isn't a curtain and the glass partition they have placed only covers 1/3 of the shower which allows water to splash EVERYWHERE in the bathroom. I'm 5'2" 100lbs so I can only imagine how much of a problem this would with someone who is larger. It got to be rather annoying moping up water after showering and using up all of our towels for this purpose. That being said, the hotel is great, the free wifi very useful, the breakfast and front desk staff friendly, the rooftop bar peaceful and the location can't be beat. Also, if you decide to take public transportation to this hotel from the train station be ready to walk and make sure to transfer at the Termini to bus 40. We misjudged and thought we could walk from the Colliseum and it was not fun in the 95degree weather.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, in line with previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: PiedmontPirata
Reviews.Content: Just back from an extra long week end. I can confirm that all previous excellent reviews seem to me nothing but the truth. Unbeatable location, extra efficient and corteous staff, air con working, absolutely no noise heard from the Pantheon crowd due to proper double glazing. Yes the breakfast room is a bit small and you might have to wait five minutes for a table but what is this compared to the previous gems? Is it expensive? Probably yes but a price well worth paying for.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location - and what a city!”
Reviews.Author: itsthatbirdagain
Reviews.Content: Triple room lovely with huge bathroom - classy decor throughout, high plaster ceilings. The other great reviews of the hotel are spot-on. The location next to the Pantheon is just fantastic. Nice breakfast, with everything fresh. Good soundproofing. Roof terrace is a nice little extra. If we ever go back to Rome, I wouldn't stay anywhere else. As we walked around the sights in the city we came across lots of other hotels, but none matched this for classy location. So many restuarants and Rome-style takeaways within a few minutes walk! You will not need the metro or a taxi!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best traditions of our family”
Reviews.Author: Anon
Reviews.Content: My mother's favourite hotel was the del Senato. Every time she talked about it, a great smile used to appear on her face. The same happened to a very good friend of the family, whose favourite lodging it was for many many years as well. When I went to Italy with my then boyfriend in the 80s, I stayed there. When I was in Rome on my honeymoon in 1995, I stayed there. Lately I had the pleasure to return with my husband and ten yrs old child. What can I tell you? It has gotten even better. Having booked a long time in advance, we got a great rate and an upgrade to a Junior suite with view of the Pantheon. We got room 402, a corner suite which is in fact two rooms made into a suite. A single with its own TV, kettle with choices of tea and coffee, an alcove for luggage, a small corridor, a great bathroom with rain shower over bathtub and towel heater, large washspace (great toiletries - soap, shampoo, conditioner, two types of bath gel, shower cap, vanity and shoe shine), WC with bidet, bathrobe and fluffy towels, another little corridor and a truly big double room with another TV (both have SKY if you wish to watch TV albeit Rome), a sofa, writing table, big mirror, safe, very large and comfy bed and another alcove for lugagge and clothes. The two windows faced one the Pantheon and another a side street, and the excellent insulation made for very little (until elevenish pm) and then no noise from the Piazza getting into the room. Very good air conditioning, sorely needed during the terrific heat wave which graced our stay in Rome. I loved the decor of the room, which I was told is the result of a recent refurbishment of the fourth floor. Breakfast included in the rates (it wans't back in the old times) nice and quite varied (cheeses, meats, pastries, cake, jams, various types of breads, croissants, toast maker, fruits, yoghourt, juices). Personnel couldn't have been nicer or more helpful - on the day of our early departure, the concierge sneaked into the kitchen to get my son two slices of cake for the journey. Unbeatable location. The Pavlov reaction - Al senato=smiles definitely carries on in my family!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: AFGY
Reviews.Content: For a short stay in Rome, we could not have asked for better! Every staff member was friendly and helpful. Hotel and rooms very clean and well appointed. Our room was small but at 1 day booking notice was possibly one of the last available. That being said it was more than adequate for such a break and more than made up for by the amazing view and location - we could almost touch the Pantheon out of our window. Free wifi was useful and breakfast was good continental in a room with a real Ancient Roman column in the middle. Roof top bar with that view just added to the romance.All in all - a very special trip in great surroundings!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: LoneStarLane
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally right next to the Pantheon. It is a great location where you can walk to any of the sites. Very quaint and old. The ceilings in our room were about 15 feet high. The staff was extremely helpful. They even allowed me to use their own computer and printer to print out our boarding passes for the next morning's departure. If you can get it, request room 204. It is the best! It is the only room with a balcony that overlooks the pantheon. They also have a roof top terrace you can sit on in the afternoons and enjoy a glass of wine. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ssmhawaii
Reviews.Content: Family w teens, and Grandparent, all agreed best hotel of 6 country European vacation. Breakfast was average compared to other hotels. Location is perfect. Not noisy, even with our room facing Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: robsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 4 nights in July. The Del Senato was in the perfect Rome location - overlooking the Pantheon. We only used taxi's once - to go to the Vatican. We were in walking distance of all the major sites and piazzas. The hotel had a nice triple or us with a queen bed and single bed for my son. Very large for a European room. The breakfast buffet was good and did include eggs and bacon, which my son enjoyed. I personally thought the fresh mozzarello and bread were a perfect breakfast!. There were issues with the Internet during our stay and they need to work on extending it to all rooms. The front desk staff was fabulous at helping with directions or making arrangements. Mauro was great in the mornings at helping us get on our way and arranging for a car to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: DASP
Reviews.Content: The Albergo del Senato is excellent! You couldn't get a better location, exactly as everyone on TA has said - right next to the Patheon. We had changed our Rome accommodation at the 11th hour and we are SO GLAD we did. They had a pretty good special and this included breakfast and free Wi-Fi in the room. We opted to have a room without a view (as it wasn't worth the extra money, and it makes you get out and have a look around!) and it was great. It was at the back of the hotel and overlooking a small courtyard. The room was very quiet (except for a little bit of squeaking from the floorboards when someone walked by - not very often) and, despite other comments, our air-con worked really, really well. The room stayed beautifully cool, which was such a welcome relief in the Rome heat. The rooftop bar is a really good idea too. Great view all around, but I would recommend going up there at dusk in summer. There is a supermarket close by (walk out the door, and walk diagonally (approx. 2 o'clock) and about 50m up that street) that sells fairly cheap groceries and the best proscuitto we have ever eaten, along with some yummo cheese & olives! For a well-priced, authentic and rustic Italian meal, head to er Faciolaro (turn right out the door, and then right again into Via del Pastini). Alfredo will look after you there (he runs around an awful lot, but he loves his customers!) If you try nothing else, try the tagliatelle (I think) with wild boar - gorgeous! This is a brilliant hotel and well worth a stay. If we ever return to Rome (despite not throwing a coin into the Trevi Fountain), we will definitely stay here again. Alessandra and Mauro will look after you, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo del Senato - a little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel053
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a med cruise and spent two nights here prior to the cruise. We are very well travelled and have stayed in other hotels in Rome. We had an amazing experience at this hotel, very comfortable beds and rooms, really good bath & shower and an unforgettable view of the Pantheon. The staff were attentive, very friendly and helpful with restaurant recommendations etc nothing was too much trouble. A fantastic start to our cruise....we will definately go back to Albergo del Senato!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our stay!”
Reviews.Author: spiritj
Reviews.Content: Based on TA reviews , we stayed at Albergo del Senato for our 3 nights pre-cruise in July. Being so centrally located allowed us to tour in the morning before the high heat set in, return after lunch for a rest , and venture out again for dinner and walking in the evening. No need for public transport- just walked in every direction and found Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Trastevere, Colosseum, Wedding Cake, Piazza Navona... it was the perfect location for our stay in Rome! Delightful room on 6th floor facing the Pantheon . Sat on our small balcony late at night to listen to random opera singer! Where else could this happen? Staff was happy to do whatever they could for us. Breakfast was very good and cappucino with the foam heart was delicious! Don't hesitate to stay here. All the positive reviews are true! Thank you to the staff !!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: USAMaineTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in July and had a great stay in the centrally located well run hotel. The hotel staff was very accommodating to get our room ready early since we had some jet lag to get over. The front desk staff was always friendly and helpful. The breakfast room staff was also very good. The room (a triple) was very well appointed. The bathroom was very good. There was a small fridge and flat panel TV with some English language channels. The morning breakfast was quite good with a good selection of items. The rooftop lounge is definitely a place you should visit. Like many Italian hotels, you leave the key at the desk when you head out and they give it back to you when you return. The hotel has internet service available but we didn't use it. There is a small elevator and easily accessible stairs. It's not a low-cost hotel but worth it looking at if you want a great centrally-located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, wonderful people.”
Reviews.Author: World_citizen_2
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this hotel three times and will definitely go back. The location is excellent - next to the Pantheon, in the middle of Rome's historic center. You step out of the hotel and you are in the middle of the action. Piazza della Rotonda where the hotel and Pantheon are situated, is always full of people, buzzing with tourist and full of restaurants and cafes where you can sit outside and people-watch. If you get bored with this Piazza, Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain and other touristy places are just few blocks away. We only took a cab to the Vatican, otherwise we walked everywhere. Each time we stayed at Albergo del Senato, we asked for a room with a view of Pantheon and were fortunate to receive it. Despite of all the crowds at the Piazza, the rooms are quiet when you close the windows. The rooms are cozy, not very large, but spacious enough. Nicely furnished, clean, with flat screen TV (I think with satellite – I’m not sure, I don’t watch TV when I go to Italy). Walls are covered with fabric – made me feel like we were in some sort of castle. There is a turn down service at night – they put a little towel and slippers (nice touch) on the floor by the bed for you, and candy on the nightstand. AC is working and you have a thermostat in the room, but we couldn’t get the temperature in the colder than 23 Celsius (about 73-74F). The bathrooms are on the small side (although quite standard for hotels I guess), but very pretty and clean, marble I believe (or something that looks very much like marble); they even have towel warmers. And the water pressure is FANTASTIC! I wish we had that water pressure at home. The breakfast room is beautiful with the usual for Italian hotels breakfast – bread rolls, cold cuts, cheese, frittata, quiche, tomatoes with fresh mozzarella, cereals, pastries (fresh, still warm and yummy), etc. The people working in this hotel are wonderful. Everybody is very polite, smiling, helpful and cheerful. At the front desk we dealt mostly with Alessandra and Mauro – both professional, but also very approachable and with a great sense of humor. If you have any questions – ask away and I’ll do my best to respond.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to love it more”
Reviews.Author: SquashMom
Reviews.Content: The Albergo del Senato has so much going for it -- the location is spectacular, but in our experience both the rooms and the beds are sub-par. At the price point of this hotel, which was the most expensive of our whole trip, I expect a spectacular experience not one in which I needed to change rooms once, and would have a second time had I had the energy to pack up again. Let me say that the people in this hotel are unfailingly lovely and the atmosphere is luxurious and pleasant, but our rooms? Not so much. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a junior suite with a fabulous view over the Pantheon. However, the beds were lumpy and tiny and in making room for a small anteroom, the designer stole space from both the bathroom, which was miniscule and the bedroom, which was also small. The final problem though was the sub-standard air-conditioning, which in Rome's August heat, just didn't cut it. Since our second room also had the air-conditioning problem, I finally figured out what the issue was -- both the vents and the thermostat are in the hallway, which is pleasantly cool, but that cool air doesn't make its way into the room itself. The lovely hotel manager got us a fan, for our second room, which helped alleviate the problem somewhat. Though our second room was quite large, as was the bathroom, the tiles on the wall of the shower had pulled away, and what was left was a poor attempt to repair the area as well as what looked to be a good crop of mildew. It was a real turn off. The wall facing the shower in the bedroom also had signs of water damage. The manager assured us that these rooms were going to be renovated this year, but that didn't help us or make our stay any more pleasant. Also, the beds in this room were very boingy, and desperately in need of replacement, as they had been in the first room. I understand that the top floors have been renovated, so I would assume that this is where you want to be if you stay at this hotel. Also, though the hotel had free internet, the signal was frequently non-existent and really only worked well from the lobby since our room was in the back of the hotel. Free, but not easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and charm”
Reviews.Author: mligas
Reviews.Content: Hotel Albergo del Senato is a must if your looking for a central location to all the sites in Rome with an old world historic feel w/ modern appointments. . When your hotel is right across from the Pantheon and located on the Piazza della rotonda its hard not to fall in love with this hotel. Check out the roof bar after 5:30. We loved every thing about our stay. We tried the higher end Hotel Intercontinental earlier visit but found the charm and location of Albergo del Senato to be superior and reasonably priced......

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, reasonable price, great stay”
Reviews.Author: iamatraveler
Reviews.Content: Albergo del Senato was just as every other reviewer described. The location was perfect, overlooking the Pantheon, and walking distance to Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps, etc. It would be difficult to find a more centrally located spot in Rome. The staff was helpful and friendly, the breakfast was good with an assortment of cold items as well as warm scrambled eggs, the roof terrace gave great views of the city, and the price was right. When in Rome again, we will definitely return to Albergo de Senato.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: airzeke
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in mid-June. Cannot find a more central location in Rome. Front desk staff (specifically Luigi and Alessandra) are very friendly and helpful. Great breakfast selection and attendant. Terrific views from rooftop terrace. Can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate Italian Experience: LOCATION is AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: attymom
Reviews.Content: I much prefer small intimate historic hotels to big fancy convenient chain hotels. Abergo del Senato exceeded my expectations. First of all, as all the reviewers have noted, it is literally next to the amazing Pantheon. In front of the hotel and the Pantheon is a square - with a beautiful fountain - that comes alive with locals in the evenings with al fresco diners and spur of the moment entertainment (Pavorotti-esque opera singers) and of course, people eating gelatto The hotel's staff was very attentive. We arranged for transfers and the service was excellent. (Mercedes mini-van, polite & well dressed driver.) Our room had excellent AC, which was such a treat after a long hot day of walking all over ROME. Not only is the hotel right next to the Pantheon, it is totally walking distance to all you want to see in Rome. The Coliseum, the Forum, the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps. It is a small hotel with a small staff. But the service and the experience was totally Italian and we loved it. The roof top bar in the evening should not be missed. The view is excellent. The breakfast in the morning was simple and also very good. Again, I really loved the hotel! BTW, we arrived at 6:40 am and they let us check in early. There was no wi-fi, but hey, I am on vacation. There was only CNN on TV that was in English - but again, who has time to watch TV when you are in the Eternal City? I would give it more than 5 stars if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Jamex25
Reviews.Content: Quitet and cool little hotel iin perfect spot for walking Rome, including Vatican, Forum, shopping, etc. Comfortable bed and room. Our view was of the back alley but even that was quaint with old painted walls and balconeys. Square in front of hotel with Pantheon and Bernini fountain is mobbed day and evening yet hotel is a quiet oasis. Great breakfast buffet and very helpful staff. Most guests appeared to be American or European families or couples. This hotel was recommended to us by friends and was just the right choice for a three night stay in Rome. Wireless in room was too weak for use, but worked fine from the lobby. There were also two terminals off lobby for checking email or web.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Location!”
Reviews.Author: amdittbe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in the middle of July, and loved it. The service was very good. The staff at the front desk was very friendly and helpful in giving us directions and helping us set up travel arrangements from Rome to Florence. We felt comfortable asking any questions we had and they always did a great job of helping out. The room itself was nice, the view from the room unbelievable! The room is of average size, and had everything we needed while spending limited time in the room other than sleeping. The view was fantastic. We opened up the giant window to find the Pantheon literally right in front of us. The view made this room unforgettable. The location is the best part of this hotel. The piazza it is located in - Piazza della Rotonda - is a lively square that we enjoyed having such easy access to. The hotel allowed us to walk everywhere we went, including these major sites- Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, Roman Forum, Wedding Cake, and Vatican City. It is also only a few streets over from Piazza Navona, our favorite piazza in Rome. The location is awesome. The amenities were limited, but met what we needed. There is free Wi-Fi, and one computer that they have for public use that you can buy usage time for. There is a patio on the top of the hotel with a bar that has great views at night. Liked Best- Location and View Liked Least- none

Reviews.Title: “La Vita Dolce at Del Senato”
Reviews.Author: ptsarro
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite hotel in Rome. We've stayed there 3 times. The rooms are clean and spacious. The beds are so comfortable and the breakfast is above average. The staff is very kind and very helpful. It's amazing to swing open the window shutters and look directly at the Pantheon. The location is perfect for seeing all the historical sites and enjoying amazing restaurants all within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: SchulerFamily1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Rome during which time we spent 4 nights at the Albergo del Senato Hotel. My husband and I were travelling with our two children and booked a room large enough to sleep all four of us. The room was very clean and well tended to by housekeeping each day. I can't say enough about the front desk staff. Everyone was exceptionally friendly and very helpful with restaurant recommendations, directions.... On our third day, our son became ill. We inquired at the front desk as to the location of the nearest physician's office. We expected we would have to take a cab and travel to a medical facility. Without a second thought, the front desk manager picked up the phone and immediately placed a call to a local physician. Within an hour and a half, a physician was at our hotel room to examine our son and prescribe him antibiotics. A special thank you to Mauro, one of the front desk personnel who went out of his way to make our children feel most welcome. The only negative to our stay was that our son was unable to see Mauro and say goodbye to him before our departure. We would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone/everyone planning a trip to Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable location in heart of rome”
Reviews.Author: tjoneser
Reviews.Content: I knew this place was going to be in central rome near the pantheon, because of the reviews I had read on Trip Advisor, but it is LITERALLY 50 ft from the Pantheon, right in that square, you can just tumble out of your door right into all the action. it's a great location, you can walk everywhere, which we did: coliseum, vatican, trevi fountain, spanish steps, villa borghese...all within walking distance...which is good because taxis are expensive in Rome. Also, 2 of the best cafes are stone's throw away + my favorite gelato place just a couple blocks away. The service was very friendly and helpful and the rooms were very comfortable, and there was satellite TV, so it was nice to watch something in english besides BBC world when you wanted to relax in the room a bit for a break. they also had champagne waiting in our room on my birthday. Neither my husband nor I told them it was my birthday, so that was a nice thoughtful touch, they must have noticed it when they made copies of our passports (which all hotels do upon check-in). Complimentary breakfast every morning (or rather it's included in your room charge). they have a roof bar which gives a great view of the Piazza della Rotunda below as well as of Rome. Rooms were very clean, it was a very nice hotel, money well spent. We would definitely stay here again! Only thing that might be nice in Rome in summer would be to have a pool because it was so hot!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: juneroma2008
Reviews.Content: Great, great hotel. From top to bottom. Unbeatable location, excellent staff. I would never stay anywhere else while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: dwhir
Reviews.Content: As others have said earlier, the location of this hotel is unbeatable. It is situated within a 30 minute walk (or short bus/cab ride) to all the major Rome attractions, including the Forum/Colosseum, The Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc. As you walk out the front door of the hotel you are literally steps from the front of the Pantheon, and the vibrant Piazza Pantheon, which bustles with life especially on Friday/Saturday evenings (makes it pretty convenient to grab an espresso, relax listening to various street acts, and then literally walk less than 60 seconds to get to the hotel. The service at the hotel is also excellent, particularly Mauro and Alessandra at the front desk, both of whom were helpful and very friendly. The hotel features a lovely rooftop bar that offers a nice view and allows one to experience light breezes, which is often a relief from hot, summer days. My biggest beef with the hotel was the size of the rooms. We had a so-called triple for my wife, son (9) and I, and we were crammed in. We couldn't even get a chair to fit for the desk , since it left no room to walk past it on the way to the bathroom. The air conditioning vents leaked (and could not be fixed) and the front desk must make changes to the temperature for you if it's more than a degree change from what you want. The floors were pretty dirty in the room, even after the housekeeping staff cleaned it. While these latter comments were my negatives, it should not detract one from coming here. It is a great hotel, driven by its location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: beaglemomCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Senato in mid-June. Based on Tripadvisor comments I had high expectations, and was not disappointed. The location is excellent, right on the Piazza Rotunda, and athough our room (108) was located toward the front of the hotel, noise from the square was never a problem. The room was on the small side, but average for Italy, and spotlessly clean. My single complaint would be that the mattress was very hard. The bathroom was generously sized with a combo bath/shower and water pressure was excellent. Breakfast is served in a beautiful room, with hot and cold selections. We enjoyed drinks on the roof-top bar ieach evening. There is a taxi stand right across the square and a very nice market down the side street to the left of the McDonald's. Staff were very helpful and assisted us with dinner reservations. We would absolutely stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: aroulaine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. Neither of us had traveled to Europe before so we did as much research as we could. Our only concern was that my husband would not fit in the rooms very comfortably (regardless of hotel) as all the advice was how small European rooms were compared to the typical American hotel room. My husband is tall and thin - he is 6'8. Due to reviews, this was my number one pick based on location alone and it was better than expected!! Our room was on the third floor and overlooked Piazza del Rotunda and the Pantheon!! The noise from the square didn't travel too far and never prevented us from getting sleep. The bed was bigger than an American queen but smaller than an American king - my husband had no problem fitting! Space was limited, but it all the major necessities (a/c, private bathroom with shower and bath, safe in closet, minifridge) - what more could one ask for? The week we were there, our tour guide said Rome was in an unusual heat wave (our room stayed very cool - so no problem with the a/c). Being from Texas, we thought they were crazy! Yes, it was hot as you were walking around in the sun, but it was very bearable and crossing the street and walking in the shade solved that problem! For us, the weather was perfect! We had a bottle of champagne waiting when we returned to our room on our first day. I can't say enough about their complimentary breakfast. Cheeses, meats, fruit, cereals, oatmeal/grains, eggs, breads. It was quite enjoyable - even for an American! I didn't have their coffee because the Italians are known for their cappucinos - and they were great! The staff was beyond exceptional. We started and ended each night on the roof top terrace. Words cannot say how beautiful the view was!! Our last night there we wanted to splurge on a nice restaurant. The front desk called a couple of restaurants, asked about wait time and made a reservation for us at the location that had the shortest wait! By the time we arrived (5 minutes) our table was ready! We did take advantage of the market (small grocery store) around the corner. We bought two large bottles of water there our first day and then continued to refill them at all of the aqua-ducts that are scattered across the city. The reviews are not misleading when they say that the location is the best. My husband and I were able to walk everywhere we wanted!! We also booked private tours of the main sites we wanted to see (Vatican and Ancient Rome) and after seeing what it COULD have been like without it, are so glad we spent the extra money - it made Rome so much more personal! Whether you need information regarding a cab, tour, cheap or expensive local cuisine, exchange booths, wine, etc the staff was the first place we went and got all of our answers! Cleaniness, service, location, amenities truly were fantastic. We are already planning a return to Rome next year with family and have already told everyone we know that we will be staying here!! We did take two cab rides while there and each time we spent less than 9 euros, including tip - so I think we lucked out with not being "taken" by either one of our cab drivers. They did have a computer downstairs although my husband was able to print off our return boarding passes on the staff computer - how fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mraff2003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in room 603. The room was immaculate, spacious but the best thing was the view!!! Wow! The location is close to everything, staff extremely helpful. The only negative was the roofdeck was only open for 1 of the 3 nights, although it was cloudy it was not raining.

Reviews.Title: “expensive but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: travelmom92
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, comfortable rooms, impeccable service, delicious breakfast and a truly heart stopping view right outside your window. If you have only a little time to stay in Rome, this is a place that will let you savor every moment. Where else could you lie in bed and watch lightning crash over the Pantheon?

Reviews.Title: “best little hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: elliot52
Reviews.Content: This hotel went beyond what i expected in a european hotel. It had a comfortable and quiet rooms.Youcould reach out and almost touch the pantheon. The staff including Mauro and Alessandra did everything they could to make my stay comfortable. They even pulled up the weather report so we new what to wear during the day.the breakfast they offered had a good variety of items so we didn't start out hungary. The easy check in and out gave more time to visit the enormous amounts of shops and sights in the immediate area. This hotel is in the middle of everything in rome. I would never stay in any other hotel in rome if there were a room available in this 57 room hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Pixdale
Reviews.Content: Located right next to The Pantheon & within 10-15 minute walk from Trevi & The Colosseum (about 45 min walk to The Vatican) & 5 minutes from the bus lines you cannot beat the location. Our room was a good size, not huge but big enough. The nice thing about the Piazza Della Rotunda is that it is large so it doesn't feel so crowded (the one at the Trevi is very small & feels very crowded). Good places to get a quick bite of pizza or gelato in the Piazza as well. Breakfast was good as well. The staff was very helpful with directions & getting us a car to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “TOP QUALITY IN THE PRIME LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: lilkal
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome 6 times and travelled extensively throughout Europe. The service and quality standards in this hotel are hard to beat and being 15 mins walk from both the Vatican and Coloseum, it could not be better positioned. We stayed in Room 606 which has its own balcony directly overlooking the Pantheon. An end of day night cap on the Roof ~Terrace is an absolute must and next time we visit we will consider no other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dkv23
Reviews.Content: Located next to the Pantheon and within walking distance of most of the historic sites of Rome. The staff was very attentive and very eager to please. The room was smallish, but was well appointed. We had a second floor room overlooking the square and the Pantheon. Breakfast was included, ample and well presented. It would be hard to beat this value in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel worthy of the Pantheon right next door.”
Reviews.Author: Jdr1637
Reviews.Content: The Senato was the perfect first-stop on our honeymoon. The room was small, but elegant, with a proximity to the Pantheon that is not to be believed -- you feel as if you could reach out and actually touch it. We almost took as many photos off our balcony as we did on the streets of Rome. And amazingly, once we closed the windows, the life and sounds of the rotunda below nearly disappeared. The rooftop bar is also a nice touch that offers a respite from the crowds. You cannot beat the location, as it is perfect walking distance from most of Rome's infinite treasures.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: kiltielukey
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely bar on the top with a great view of Rome and the pantheon. Single rooms are tiny - but good value. Double room facing the Pantheon was recently redecorated and was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey, but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: jmac59
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May as part of a two week tour of Italy. I wanted two bedrooms for my two adult daughters and me, in a central location. After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, I emailed the hotel, and found they had a junior suite available for Euro 265/night. It was at the top of my price range, but the promise of a view of the Pantheon sold me. We were not disappointed. The hotel is literally right across the street from the Pantheon, and we could look out our bedroom window and watch the traffic in the square. In fact, on a couple of nights we fell asleep to opera being sung on the street below. Our suite was small, but adequate, consisting of one bedroom with two double beds and a small sitting room with a daybed, which was quite comfortable. Everything was well decorated, almost opulent. The breakfast area was very nice, and the breakfast was excellent, with lots of selections, including fresh fruit and yogurt. The staff was very helpful with recommendations for restaurants and shopping, and they let us store our luggage after checkout on our last day. There was free wireless internet service in our room. Our only regret was that we did not get a chance to use the rooftop bar. We were too tired our first night, and the second and third nights, it was closed because of the weather. But the lobby bar was a nice substitute.

Reviews.Title: “Probably best in "Class"”
Reviews.Author: PietroMaryland
Reviews.Content: Despite its location overlooking one of the most active tourist destinations, the hotel is very quiet. The public areas and our room were very clean. The staff were consistently helpful, couteous and professional. The breakfast is modest but sufficient. The terrace (guests only) is a real plus and has a marvelous view of the Pantheon. There is so much within a leisurely 10 minute stroll that you will never take a taxi, though they are available at the taxi stand on the far side of the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: SRQRedhead
Reviews.Content: We found Albergo del Senato on Trip Advisor and checked the reviews on other sites as well. We had no difficulty in booking a room. We arrived very early (8:30 am) after a cruise and one room was ready (our traveling companion's room was not ready yet) and were offered breakfast. The Breakfast room was very nice - the cappuccinos were excellent and the little heart they made with the foam was a nice touch. The room itself was not large, but not tiny as many European hotel rooms are. We had a good 5 feet between the bed and the closet on one side and about four feet between the bed and the window on the other. That side had a nice love seat and a chair. There were two nice size night stands and a dresser that had one side occupied by the mini bar and the other opening to a compartment with a single shelf. There were some shelves in the closet, but no drawers. The safe in the closet was a good size and easy to use. The bathroom was a bit tight - but not bad. Toilet, bidet, single sink. The tub was a tad narrow but typical of others i've had in Italy. Shower was in the tub- great water pressure and temperature. The terrace on the roof is accessed via stairs from the 6th floor and was very pleasant - still a tad cold at the beginning of May but very nice while the sun was still out. The absolutely best feature of this hotel is the location - right on the Piazza de la Rotunda with the Pantheon. It was the perfect location for walking to all the places we enjoy such as Piazza Navonna, Campo di Fiori, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps. The first morning we walked to the Vatican - it really wasn't that far and we took our time. A totally pleasant walk through the streets of Rome as everything was starting to open for the day. The front desk staff at the Hotel were wonderful and very helpful. The Bartender was very accomodating. We had an early morning flight and had to leave before breakfast and they made us bag breakfasts to eat on the way. I have absolutely found my hotel in Rome. I can't think of a single complaint other than no box of kleenex in the bathroom (pretty petty complaint!).

Reviews.Title: “Albergo del Senato - A Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: GWeis
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Albergo del Senato - what a great location. Using the hotel as a base, you can walk to almost everything. As for the level of service and the attitude of the staff, here is a message that I sent to the hotel after our return to the US... " I just want to thank the staff at your hotel for making our recent visit to Italy very enjoyable. Each member of the staff that we had contact with was friendly and made us feel like they wanted our stay to be perfect. I would also like to give special mention to Alessandra who was exceptional - what a great person to have at your front desk."

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we stayed in”
Reviews.Author: danmonCanada
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome just for 3 days (going to Amalfi coast now) and wanted to splurge. It was the right decision. The location is perfect, you are right in the middle of everything - but it is quiet nevertheless! The rooms are spacious and impecabbly clean, service verz attentive. It is a bit expensive, that is right, but if you have the means and/or want to splurge, it is the perfect choice - totally "Roman Holidays" feeling!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: HoneyB_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect spot for our honeymoon. The location was perfect; we walked everywhere while we were in Rome. The staff went above and beyond any other hotel I've been to. The front desk was always available and helpful with suggestions (especially Alessandra). The staff came to our rooms twice a day to clean up the rooms and to turn down the beds at night. The rooftop bar gave great views and the bartender Michele was very hospitable. The room was beautiful and looked right onto the Pantheon and the Piazza della Rotonda. The bathroom was spotless. And last but not least, the breakfast was amazing. There was plenty to choose from and it was all good!

Reviews.Title: “Fulfilled Every Expectation”
Reviews.Author: Jill143
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a one-night stay in Rome while en route to Spoleto. We wanted to get to the Pantheon in the early morning before the crowds arrive, and to dine at Da Fortunato, about 50 feet away from the hotel. Both plans were successfully executed. The hotel itself was superb--an oasis of calm and comfort. The room was large and well-appointed, with a little sitting room as an anteroom; bathroom not huge but perfectly fine, with lots of shelf space. Stunning view of the Pantheon. We don't understand remarks about noise from the square--our windows were remarkably efficient at excluding noise, and we were not disturbed at all. Of course you can't expect the centre of a city to be like a monastery but we were on the first floor and really noticed nothing. The people in the hotel were absolutely charming. We too were interested in the roof bar but it was explained to us that it opens a little bit later in the year. True, the temperature in Rome is quite comfortable in spring but it is a city that also has sudden downpours at certain times of the year and this could cause a fair amount of chaos with service in a roof bar, so we thought this was reasonable. We are certainly planning to revisit this hotel on future trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: dndBucksCounty_PA
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 day stay in Italy which began with four nights in room 305 and ended with a one night predparture stay in room 204 with a balcony. Both rooms overlooked the Pantheon with a simply stunning view, We just loved this hotel. The location is central and walkable to most anything in Rome and the surrounding area is fun and safe. The staff, especially Mauro, were helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and the showers were great...hot and big! The bed was a bit hard for us but wasn't a big deal. The only thing you should be aware of is the potential for noise from the piazza on the weekend nights. We brought a white noise machine with us from home and it drowned out any nightime revelry noises so this was not a problem for us. It could be if you are a very light sleeper. That said, anywhere in Rome which is a city with narrow streets has the potential to be noisy. Anyhow...the rooftop bar was open and we really enjoyed the panorama of the city. In Room 305, you could lie on the bed and see the Pantheon not 70 feet away!! Amazing! In Room 204 which was a little larger, you could stand on the balcony overlooking the piazza and just feel like royalty! Will definitely return next time we are in Rome should we be so fortunate!

Reviews.Title: “Definately worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: silvershoe
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an Easter break at the Albergo del Senato, having chosen it from the previous reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed and had a very good time. The room we had 205 was quite small but had a fantastic view of the Pantheon and the Piazza. It was very clean, fresh linen and towels every day sometimes twice if the cleaner came in while we were out and saw they had been used! Even chocolates on your pillow at night.The only minor critisism was the fact that the furniture and fittings etc. could have been in slightly better condition. The hotel staff were particularly helpful especially Mauro and Alessandra on the front desk and the staff in the breakfast room were always friendly and cheerful and after a day or two able to anticipate your preferences for cappachino, espresso, etc. The hotel is situated very centrally and we were able to walk to all the major sites quite comfortably. The main shopping road is about 10 minutes walk away. Its quite a good idea to invest in an A to Z road map of the area if you are doing a lot of walking as there are so many little side streets they are not always marked on the normal maps. The best restaurants we found were across the river in Trestavere, with some quite memorable meals taken at half the price of the restaurants on the Piazza. If you want to go a bit further afield the trams and buses are quite an easy option, and of course the main line station at Termini. The weather was just perfect during our stay but I can imagine it wouldn't be quite so comfortable to do as much walking as we did during the heat of the summer. All in all we had a great time and would definately recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Rome

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing place, can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: michellehobbs1
Reviews.Content: If your flying with easy jet, you can buy tickets on the plane for the Terravision bus from the airport to the Termini. Then catch the number 64 bus, we had trouble knowing which stop to get off at, but we just asked another passenger, it was about the 4th stop. The Hotel is only a couple of minutes walk from here. It is very easy to get lost in Rome, especially if you are not very good with a map, I suggest you get the Hop on/Hop off bus, 18 euros. The hotel was just amazing, the staff are so friendly and helpful. It is immaculately clean and the room was lovely and big, 308, we had a side view of the Pantheon, we had slippers and they turned the beds down at night and left lovely chocolates. The breakfast was gorgeous, scrambled eggs, toast, fresh fruit platters, cold meats and cheeses, pastries and cakes, and lovely cappachino's. The lift is very small but we just closed our eyes. The restaurants were quite expensive about £15 to £20 for a main meal, but lovely and don't forget to try the Icecream. When going up the Cupola at St. Peter's Basilica, it is very small, do not go up if you don't like small places, but it is worth the view. When using the buses, it is very difficult to pay, it is 1 Euro from a machine on the bus, but you can never get near them as the bus is usually too full. Rome is absolutely amazing as is this Hotel, I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Consistent excellence !”
Reviews.Author: nobst
Reviews.Content: Location of del Senato,atmosphere of Piazza della Rotonda and hospitality from the staff of this hotel make for lifelong memories. Most desires satiated within steps of the del Senato. Handmade chocolate,fried artichokes, gelato, spritz and a different pastry for every day of the month,burn it all off by walking into or around art & architecture,retire to your room or engage in the people parade.
