Fantastico! This is our second trip to the Albergo Del Senato in as many years. The location was a factor in our selection though it was the condition of the hotel (immaculate) AND the staff (friendly, efficient & professional) that made us want to stay here again. From the smooth front desk check-in Allesandra was friendly, helpful and cheerful while multi-tasking. Ettoro whisked our luggage to our rooms. Luca as professional and sharp as he was back in Nov. 2007. Mauro and Luigi most helpful and friendly and a big thanks to Ms. Tintoretto for fulfilling a last minute request. Alto grazie! The breakfast & staff -most excellent zucchini 'panckes'- efficient, attentive and friendly, especially Adam, selection of fruits, pastries, cereals, breads,etc... fresh and varied. Rooms and common areas, clean,clean,clean. Even had a 'face cloth'!! I hope management realizes that their staff is as valuable as their location. Roma abounds with hotel properties in prime locations. What separates good hotels from great is the staff. Albergo del Senato is a great hotel because of its staff! We'll soon return. ps. Heads up that the hotel is painting and light plastering in the main stairway April10th. No inconvenience whatsoever as both elevators were operational. It was cool to see craftsman at work in the morning and their finished product in the late afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom53
Reviews.Content: Just finished two weekends at the Albergo del Senato (separated by a trip to the Amalfi Coast.) This hotel is situated 200 ft from the Pantheon - the absolute center of the historic area. The staff was so wonderful and helpful, the beds were very comfortable and the breakfast excellent. For Rome (an expensive city for hotels) the price is reasonable. The rooms are small but you can literally walk everywhere, so unless you love to take taxis, this is a perfect location. Ask for a quiet room in the back, as the front rooms look out directly over the Piazza della Rotonda, which is a crowded place. This is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “At an amazing Rome spot, a lot of comfort and great staff”
Reviews.Author: marciopsiq
Reviews.Content: All I had read here about Albergo Del Senato was true: a great deal, for its comfortable rooms, nice breakfast, the very central location - you can walk to almost every Rome attraction and you are face to face to the Pantheon - and the extra helpfull and nice staff. About the staff, I have to mention Mauro, who impressed us by providing all the help needed, plus great restaurant recommendations. My parents had a great room, with a living area, baldaquino bed and frescoes in the ceiling, after I have written to the Hotel to inform they were celebrating their 47th anniversary. Our room was a regular one, and we had a very comfortable stay. The only two little flaws are the shower, that wets the bathroom, what has prevented me from taking a nice strong shower, and the lack of an effective cooling system in the room, what didn`t affected us much for it was March, but has made me wonder about what would happen around summertime.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Treat”
Reviews.Author: Griffy100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a long weekend to celebrate my 40th birthday. Given that we were in the centre of Rome with all that it has to offer we simply wanted a clean and comfortable base rather than a hotel to lounge around in all day. The Albergo ticked all the boxes. Location could not be faulted, you just don't get tired of looking at the Pantheon, rooms were spotless, beds comfortable and the whole place had a charming elegance to it. Breakfast was good, coffee juice pastries etc. The staff were fantastic, informative and helpful. They even put a bottle of sparkling white wine in an ice bucket in the room on the dayy of my birthday - compliments of the house. I would not hesitate to return, in fact I would love to, and would certainly recommend

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: nolaleemc
Reviews.Content: After a long trip and lost luggage, we arrived at Albergo del Senato to find that we had been upgraded to a master suite. We arrived early and were ushered into a lovely buffet breakfast. The location is right across from the Pantheon and we were in easy walking distance of most of Rome's attractions. We again received an upgrade on our return trip the following weekend. The service was excellent, the hotel was truly a gorgeous boutique hotel and we will happily return anytime we are in Rome. A++++

Reviews.Title: “Incredible View”
Reviews.Author: Chellebell
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights in junior suite with an incredible view of the Pantheon. Our suite was the perfect size for the three of us, with a nice fold out bed in the entry room for our son. The bathroom was a good size and we felt there was enough room for our luggage and all the souvenirs we acquired. The room was not loud at night as the windows seemed to be double paned. The heat was a little much in the room, but I just popped downstairs and asked them to turn it off. We opened our windows for air during the day, but the housekeeper always closed them. I asked the front desk to have them keep them open, but they always closed them. One day I even put on the do not disturb, which was ignored. The only time they did what I asked was the day it went into the high 30's! Well, that was a small inconvience I suppose! Allessandra at the front desk was very nice and helpful. She was very sweet with our son and always gave us a great choice of restaurant recommendations. The other people I felt were pushing a place for one reason or another, but she always gave us at least two choices and they were always very good. Michel in the bar was fun to sit and talk to. They high wi-fi on the first floor so we would go in and have drinks and catch up on the news. He always had a nice selection of little snacks to go with our drinks. Breakfast was really good. There was a nice selection of breads, yogurt, fruits, fruit juices, meats and cheese and they made a very delicious cappaucino. We would go back again in a heartbeat. I found the property through trip advisor, and just want to give my recommendation for other like me. Please email if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for Rome expierence”
Reviews.Author: joelst
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the Senato during spring break for 3 nights. The location cannot be beat. It literally is right beside the Pantheon. Our room had a nice window that opened up and looked out over the square and a beautiful view of the Pantheon. It is in a very central location, we were able to walk everywhere within 15-20 minutes - Colosseum, Vatican, Spanish Steps, etc. Piazza Novana is 2 minutes walk. Only had to use taxi for to and from airport. The staff was extremely helpful. My husband was always asking them for help with directions before we left for the day. They even looked up the train schedule for us without us asking and had it ready for us when we came in one night. I def. recommend Albergo del Senato!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: CorruptedSanity
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for 5 days early December 2008. We dont usually stay at anything less than 5 stars but this hotel had a direct view of the Pantheon. And I mean its almost like you were sleeping in the Pantheon. Walking out the front door meant you were literally 20 meters from the Pantheon and the piazza. The hotel itself is not all that. Its been renovated nicely. Its clean. The staff are mediocre, nothing special. Breakfast was your typical European spread. Cheeses, pastries and cereal. Dont expect Dubai style breakfasts. Rooms were nice, small, bathrooms clean and well lit. We chose this hotel for it's central location. We were only 15 minutes away from the majority of interests like the Spanish Steps, the Fountain and so on.

Reviews.Title: “feels like home.....”
Reviews.Author: HenryandLily
Reviews.Content: My second stay at this hotel was exceptional again. Cannot fault this hotel in any way and would not hestitate to recommend to whoever wants to enjoy Rome to its fullest. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and not lacking in any comfort, the breakfast is hearty and the area cannot be any better.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: Canterqueen
Reviews.Content: We based on Rome stay at the Albergo Del Senato completely on Tripadvior ratings. It was a lovely location. From our suite we could have thrown a rock at the Pantheon. The front desk staff was incredibly helpful. We were a group of four. We were able to book a tour of four for a private tour of the Vatican and a city tour for not much more than taking the bus tours with earphones. Our tour was outstanding and highly recommend you compare the cost before signing up for a group (bus) tour. Our two room suite was also very nice, though not what I was expecting from the picture.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, very central”
Reviews.Author: SurreyLyn
Reviews.Content: The Albergo del senato is a lovely hotel. It is so central to all the sites, most within 5-10 minutes walk. The staff are great, nothing is too much trouble. We had a room on the 1st floor which was fairly large considering the comments on trip advisor about the rooms being small. OK the beds were a little hard and it could be noisy in the square at night, but for the location of the hotel it was great. Breakfast was included in our price which was good, continental and a good selection. We didn't expect to like rome as much as we did, it was wonderful there. We didn't find it terribly expensive apart from one restaurant in the side street by the hotel which was certainly not worth the money, even though it was packed on a Sunday lunchtime. The square was great lots of little resturants and a great atmosphere at night. Most of them did a tourist menu which included a starter, any pizza/pasta and a glass of wine for 10-12 euros. The cheapest meal we had was at the Roman Forum, huge king prawn pasta and garlic bread for 7 euros, perfect. The taxis can rip you off. We booked hotel connections limo service which were an hour late and certainly nothing like their advertisement. A taxi into rome from the airport is a standard 40 euros, make sure you agree the fare first. All in all I would certainly recommend the Albergo to anyone. Its a great little hotel, very clean and wonderful friendly staff and we hope to return there again one day.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Roma!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WeLuv2travel2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel was above and beyond my expectations! First off, the location is superb, with the majestic Pantheon right outside your window and the night time ambiance of the piazza out side the door. The hotel is central to everything and the rooms are immaculate. The staff was so polite and courteous & very helpful with directions, maps and arranging car service. Best of all was the roof top bar! Enjoying a glass of wine a top the 5th floor of the hotel at a little bistro table watching the sun set over the Vatican was incredible. It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip and we traveled all over Italy. It will definitely stay here again when I return to Rome. One last tip: there is a little grocery store nearby, ask the staff. This is a great place to stock up on water and snacks(wine too) very inexpensive as compared to the street vendors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nearlyfortyBelfast
Reviews.Content: Best located hotel in Rome, everything within easy walking distance. Location at Pantheon excellent, great atmosphere in the square at night. Plenty of nice but inexpensive restaurants nearby. Avoid ones offering three course for 10 euros etc not worth the money and a bit of a con avoid Restaurant Rotonda, round the corner. Taxi from airport to Pantheon 40 euros. Reception very helpful when asking for directions etc. Would definitely return to same hotel. Hotel was a bit more expensive than others we could have had but location was well worth the extra money - no need to pay for any bus/metro when you are staying here. Overall couldn't recommend the location too highly.

Reviews.Title: “Probable the best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Imanuelle
Reviews.Content: We loved every minute at this hotel. The service was best and we will be beck

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: tmaxxx
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice midsized hotel. The staff was great, the property was beautiful, the location perfect and for all those that complain about the beds and room size they obviously don't travel much in Europe. The only downside was the early a.m. renovation at the property.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel, Big Prices !”
Reviews.Author: networker35
Reviews.Content: Loved the friendliness of the staff but that was it. Paid £395 for Friday & Saturday night and really not worth the price! Hotel is a 3 star and it shows, the rooms are very small and very warm with no A/C, bathroom was the size of a shoe box. I guess what you pay for a this hotel is it's location, but last time I'll be paying £197 a night for a 3 star !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful comfortable, friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Riff M
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 day stay at the Albergo del Senato. From the moment I arrived the front desk staff could not have been more helpful and friendly! Although the hotel has 57 rooms the person at the desk knew me and made me feel at home. They were helpful in every way! Although my room was an inexpensive single with no view, I didn't mind at all. The high ceiling and long entrance hall made it seem larger. I slept well in the quiet atmosphere. The bathroom was delightful with a deep soaking tub and shower. The heated towel rack made for extra comfort and was useful for drying clothes. They even provided slippers and chocolate bedtime snacks. I thought the breakfast buffet was ample and you certainly canNOT beat the location right at the Pantheon! I would love to come back in warmer weather to enjoy the rooftop terrace bar BUT the inside bar area off the lobby made for a great meeting spot and a relaxing after dinner retreat. This was a most excellent place to stay while in Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: croesio
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome on many occasions and this hotel is a must:- - ----fantastic location. All major sites are in easy walking distance in all directions. (Be warned. Wear flat shoes as streets are cobble stones and not easy for heels).The Pantheon really is in the centre of tourist Rome and you could not get a hotel any nearer to this beautiful building. The hotel faces the square and is ideal for people watching and soaking up the atmosphere. The area is also safe for late night strolling or window shopping etc ( not all areas of Rome have felt this safe in the late evening). The buzz of activities in the square does not affect your stay as the noise is not a problem in the hotel. -------Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. We had a problem with a leak in our bathroom one night and we were given a free upgrade to a suite with a balcony and an even better view of the Pantheon! We also received a free bottle of champagne and nibbles. (It's a shame we didn't have the leak earlier in our stay!) Our previous room was 307 and was also a good room. The rooms are adequate. They are on the small side but not too small. Shower and bath and constant hot water. Rooms were kept spotless and the beds were turned down and chocolates left every night. The rooms were always warm as some nights were extremely cold during this visit. ----- Eating out is no problem with so much choice. Eating on the square is the most expensive but each side street has lots of cheap restaurants. There is a coffee shop called Tazzo d'oro just around the corner which has an international reputation for good coffee. And it was good!!! You can also buy cheap Pizza and eat as you walk if you don't want a sit down meal. This only costs a few Euros. The hotel breakfast is good although the coffee was not the best that we have had in Rome. -------Travel to and from the airport is also not a problem. You can use the buses as mentione by other tripadvisor members, but we prefer to use a taxi. The travel time from the airport is about an hour and the traffic can often be awful. The price is about 55 Euros(one way) but if there are a few of you travelling it is not too expensive and the convenience is worth the cost. The hotel can also provide the taxis at about the same price. We find it better to pay out for the taxis as once you are at the hotel, eating out can be cheap and travel is zero Euros! -----Viator tours are good. By far the best ones we have taken are the angels and demons tour and the underground Rome tours ( both taken last year) ----- Tourist attractions. All are obviously good depending on your preferences. We were not impressed to find that you now have to pay to go into the forun. The entrance has also been moved and the free guides are a thing of the past. (12 Euros) One surprise for us this year was the "birthday cake" or Victor Emmanuelle monumnent. We ahve walked around this a number of times and never thought to climb the steps but it really is worth a visit. You can get a lift to the top (7 Euros) for paoramic views of Rome. There is a cafe on the sun terrace , also with good views and access to yet another church ( a very interesting one) and also access to the square on the capitaline hill ( with small statue of Romulus and Remus) ---- Lastly!!! Don't miss out. Book this hotel and enjoy Rome.

Reviews.Title: “World Class”
Reviews.Author: ZakRichardson
Reviews.Content: The AdS is a world class hotel. It's close proximity to the Pantheon is amazing and is central to all other must see sites. The staff are friendly and attentive and hotel itself is beautiful. We went to Roma to celebrate my wife's 40th birthday and had a fantastic time. Wonderful City and Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE! Will Return!”
Reviews.Author: evelynmonica30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Senato for 6 days first week of February, this was our first trip to Europe and we actually booked the hotel based on past travelers reviews on tripadvisor. I can not tell you how happy we were to have booked this hotel, since the minute we arrived we were treated kindly. We were given an upgraded room with balcony and beautiful view of the Pantheon. Many nights we would sip champagne and just stand by our balcony and view the Pantheon and the flow of people below, that view alone is unfortgettable. Please be advised this upgrade was given to us because we were celebrating a late anniversary, as a matter of fact we booked this trip through Expedia. Many nights my husband would go down to the front desk and have them confirm dinner reservations and they always assisted us in a kindly matter. They always recommended great restaurants. We stayed there for 6 days and never had to hire a taxi. The hotel is near every thing you will be seeing, near Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Vatican, etc. Reserve this hotel you will not regret it and please do have some Gelato at the Gelateria next door and coffee at the coffee shop in the corner, Oro Cafe. and ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “6 out of 5 for everything! Truly Fantanstic.”
Reviews.Author: TheLongFella
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things. Brilliant, friendly helpful staff. We had some problems, not-hotel related, that they went out of their way to help us resolve. We awoke too late for breakfast one morning.They brought it up to our room! They folded our night-clothes and put them on our pillows with chocolates that were different every day. They told us we were looking nice when we came down dressed to go out. The rooms were spotless and beautiful. They are renovating although I see no reason for them to do so. The location is absolutely perfect. Right in the Heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: bmarshall
Reviews.Content: Just have to back up the other 5 star reviews. Everything is excellent except its difficult to get here ...but thats because you are in a pedestrian historic centre....rooms small but far more compensated by the Pantheon view ( if you get it) which is breathtaking. Hotel staff awesome especially Alessandre who greeted us as friends whenever we reurned to the hotel and really worried about us going to a football game ...although the hotel thankfully told us how to get tickets. My tips:Central location so you can walk everywhere Good shoes because you walk everywhere See the Pope sunday at 12 to 12.30 in St Marks square Check vatican museum opening times so you dont miss it Take the lift in Basillica you may save 2 euros but there's anoher 320 steps after ( You must go to the top) Check out bus numbers before you go to Rome or get a map asap No need to book the Terravion bus the normal shuttle bus is 4 euro cheaper Throwing coins in Trevoli fountain is great fun day and night Spanish steps not worth a diversion for Shops open after 5pm sunday! Corso ( main street) very busy then Someone said you are either a quick pedestrian or a dead one in Rome ...the mopeds seem to have right of way Colosseum much better than rest of ancient city but ticket gets you both. Watch for orange trees in the ancient city if you have strength to walk around it. We didn't think much of Campo de Fiori square and market (also its closed as a market on sunday). Don't appear too keen to go into a street restaurant..we were given a free bottle of wine one day and a free course the next. Spare a few coins for the street musicians (or those on the Metro) the atmosphere added by them is awesome Bus transfer coaches stop at each side of Termini not in the bus station at the end Cheapest way from Ciampini if you only have hand luggage is to catch bus from Airport to Ciamponi Station for 1.2 Euro then the local train to Termini 2 euro. Only snag was trying to work out the train platform (be brave and ask) as the train board gives you the times of every station stop of the next train not a list of coming trains as it is in uk We also went to watch soccer at the Olympisc stadium and saw Lazio lose 3 to nil to David Beckhams AC Milan. if you go walk to Flamimi ( about 25 mins) then tram 2 to Mancini where you can see the stadium 10 mins walk over the river) . We left 5 mins early and were on the first tram back

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: weloveditaly
Reviews.Content: The Albergo del senato is in a wonderful location - it is right next to the pantheon which is one of Romes oldest buildings and certainly the one in the best condition. You literally open your window and look straight at it.... The rooms are quite small, but you will find that all you do is sleep there anyway as there is so much to do in ancient rome! You can walk to all other main attractions: the monument, roman forum, palantine hill, the colosseum etc. The staff are friendly and the breakfast is quite good for continental. We enjoyed our stay and think it is the perfect hotel if you care about location but not room size. Also, advice for other travellers, if you are facing the hotel and take the road immediately to the left of the hotel, there are some fanastic italian restuarants in that street that are well priced. The ones in the square are for tourists and double the price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: pgbowen
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing in every respect. We got there and the guys on the desk were jovial and glad to see us - they welcomed us to Rome after we'd got ripped off by the taxi driver. The room was expectantly small but we didn't choose this hotel for the room size - the location was exceptional and the view was unbelievable, we were at eyelevel with the roof of the pantheon. The rooms are clean and the bathroom spotless. Linen was changed everyday. The receptionists were ridiculously helpful whenever we asked for advice and couldn't have reasonably done more for us. I would wholly recommend this to anyone who wants to stay centrally but isn't bothered about a massive room to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, not suitable for business travellers. Good location though”
Reviews.Author: Mirkotravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very average and I think mainly benefits from it's great location (literaly 25meters and your standing in the middle of the Pantheon!). Unfortunately they didnt have WiFi nor LAN connectivity in the Rooms and my room was extremely hot (in January!) and it's been impossible lower the temperature (the AC only works in summer). I also found it was overpriced for what it offered.

Reviews.Title: “Location - WOW!”
Reviews.Author: tdyno
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is wonderful. We were in room 107 which had 3 windows from which we could see the Pantheon. The room was a junior suite and slept 3 very comfortably. The bathroom was nice with a towel warmer. It was a bit on the small size for 3 women but workable and very nice. We were in walking distance form all of the major sites. The only one that we didn't walk to was Vatican City. The staff was very courteous and helpful. I would highly reccommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: LondonScott
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip as a surprise for my others halfs 40th birthday and decided to book through Expedia rather than direct as the price of flights was shocking with BA direct, so I got a much better deal with Expedia matching up with accommodation. I searched on this site first and saw the many outstanding reports and knew I had to give it a go. Fortunately Expedia had the hotel on their system and whilst we normally book 4star, I was so pleased we booked this 3star wonder. Our flights were cancelled going out on Saturday due to the fog, but we managed to get out on Sunday instead, our first thought was we couldn't believe how central the hotel was, you never quite believe descriptions that say they are near a certain attraction, but this really is as close to the Pantheon as you can get. It's my partners favourite building so made the trip even more of a success. When we arrived, the staff were so welcoming and sympathetic about our cancelled flight, we were taken straight to our room. I couldn't believe our luck when we got a room overlooking the pantheon - room 103. It was a small, but stunning room, clean, well furnished and just the best view in Rome. I was quite hot in the room as the air conditioning is turned off during the winter but despite the cold air outside, it was still very hot, so we left the windows open over night and luckily we didn't get too disturbed by the morning rush. One fellow writer on here talks about the beds and I would have to say that I agree, the beds are hard and can be a little uncomfortable, but having said that, the room was really great. On my partners birthday we received a surprise bottle of presecco which was a lovely treat and may have been because of all the grief we went through to get there, so don't expect to get this. Breakfast was usual Italian fare and the staff were very welcoming each morning. You really can't fault this hotel as a romantic getaway, it's great value for money, it's in a fantastic location with everything nearby and it has the friendliest staff I've ever come across in Rome. There are a couple of restaurants in front of the Pantheon but we didn't try these although they were very busy every night, so I'm sure they were good.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Perfect Hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLawyer1
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, delightful staff and pleasant rooms overlooking the magnificent Pantheon. What could be more perfect? The Albergo del Senato is a gem, planted within a short stroll from so many of the top Rome top attractions (walk to Pantheon in 5 SECONDS, Piazza Navona in 3 minutes, Campo de Fiori in 5 minutes, the Ghetto in 9 minutes, Trevi Fountain in 7 minutes, Spanish Steps in 15 minutes, the Campidoglio in 15 minutes, and the Roman Forum in 20 minutes). Some tips: ask for the highest floors or at least a renovated room. Hotel is redecorating one floor at a time and top floors have been renovated. Seek out rooms with larger bathrooms. Some are very small, and rooms themselves are on small side. The front desk staff are fabulous. My favorite was Mauro, but they are all wonderful. The breakfast room is small but pleasant. There is a nice selection of breads, fruits, meats and cheese, but nothing fancier. The hotel's roof bar (a true gem) is closed in the Winter. Come once, and then return often. This is the ideal hotel to enjoy this fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic amd thrilling”
Reviews.Author: Tessa080
Reviews.Content: Spectacular boutique hotel that captures Rome's vibe and yet maitains a peaceful stay. Wonderful location. The rooftop bar is the perfect starter to a night out in Rome. Superb staff, rooms are clean. The views are worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Hard Beds”
Reviews.Author: docoliver
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, almost a 4 star. The service is very friendly and they go the extra mile to make your stay the best. I believe that the beds are extremely hard for USA standards and that everyone should know this before they decide to book this property. I had the junior suite at the 2nd floor and had some noise coming in from the street. The location is good but in Rome everything is a 7-15 Euro taxi ride away. If you are used to large 4-5 star hotels like the Westin, I do not believe Albergo Del Senato is for you. I actually changed to the Westin at Via Veneto and was extremely happy with the Heavenly Bed and awesome service. I notified Albergo del Senato that I would be cutting short my reservation at 7AM in the morning and they charged me half day (110 Euro) for the cancellation (even when I told them that I could not sleep well the night before).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: SueFab
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't be in a better spot - our room looked right onto the Pantheon and there are loads of bars and restaurants around. It's also really easy to get to the main sights - the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Vatican - we didn't have to use a bus, taxi or the metro once. Very friendly staff and comfortable and clean room. Would definitely stay here again if we return to Rome - which we will, as we threw coins into the fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Scoobytx
Reviews.Content: I took my parents to Italy as a retirement gift and we stayed at the Albergo del Senato for 1 week in November. The hotel and the staff were amazing. Everyone at the hotel was helpful and friendly. My mom's health is not great and they were willing to be flexible around cleaning our room and recommending places to eat that were close by the hotel. It was also great for my mom to have a nice, clean room with a spectacular view for days that she didn't feel like leaving the hotel. There is a cab stand right outside the hotel, so for days my mom did want to venture out, it cost about 8-10 euro to get to most places (Spanish Steps, Vatican, etc)....would also be possible to walk to these locations, if you're up for it. We would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again if we returned to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “An unforgettable experiene”
Reviews.Author: Ramond
Reviews.Content: We spent the last week of November at the Albergo del Senato. Everything written about this delightful hotel is true. The most wonderful thing is the location, just a few feet from the magnificient Pantheon. To get up in the morning and to look out on the inimitable Piazza del Rotonda, empty at first, and then gradually filling up with sightseers wandering through the piazza and the nearby streets, going in and out of the Pantheon, is an experience you cannot have enough of. The location is ideal, within close walking distance of Piazza Navorna, Campo del Fiori, the Trevis fountain and the Spanish Steps, but for us the best was just walking the endless ancient cobbled streets radiating out from the Piazza del Rotonda,, with their ochre fronted buildings, little piazzas at every turn, and all kinds of shops, pizzerias, gliderias, and restaurants. About the hotel itself: a marvellous combination of old-style dignity and taste, coupled with such warmth and friendliness from the entire staff. The room, though on the small side, is perfectly furnished and very user-friendly, the bed was excellent and the marble bathroom just right. The breakfast, including tasty Danish pastries, fresh fruit (kiwis, pineapple, melon and grapes) and toast, kept us going for the whole day, (although the scrambled eggs could be kept warmer). The front desk staff booked us an excellent old-fashioned fish restaurant (L'Angeletto) just round the corner (very reasonably priced) and were ready at any time to help. The limousine service provided by the hotel to and from the airport (50 Euro) is highly recommended. In short we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: martyap
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location and the views from our third floor room of the Pantheon and Piazza della Rotonda were amazing. The entire staff could not have been more gracious.....Mauro, Lucca and Alessandra were amazing! They helped with directions, restaurant suggestions/reservations and were willing to do anything to make our stay perfect. On one rainy day they had umbrellas ready for anyone who needed. We were in Rome during a huge student demonstration and they made certain the bellboy escorted us several blocks to our transfer vehicle. The rooms were small but spotless and the continental breakfast was more than satisfactory. The location puts Rome at your doorstep.....Piazza Navona and Campo d' Fiori are very close but we also walked to Trastevere, Spagna and even Villa Borghese. I could not imagine staying anywhere else........a little more expensive than other hotels but keep checking for promotions on their website......Karen and Marty Bellmore NY

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: GoForHols
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a base to tour Rome this is your place. Yes its fairly expensive, the rooms aren't huge and the breakfast is only a buffet but, if you want to be able to walk to all the sights in Rome and still be back for dinner, if you want to open the window and touch history, if you like beautiful decor, clean rooms and friendly and helpful staff, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Better!”
Reviews.Author: Don0945
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity of celebrating our anniversary at the Albergo del Senato. We were picked up at the airport which was arranged by the hotel. The desk staff was professional and very informative. Our room (for 3 nights) was #202 with an amazing view of the Pantheon. The continental breakfeast was terrific with a very intentive staff. In all of Rome after our tours of the various sights led us back to this oasis in the heart of Rome. After traveling to Venice and Positano we returned to Rome for one more night before returning to California. We were upgraded to a beautiful suite #602, that was absolutely amazing, and again, the staff welcomed us back with warmth and grace. We will have indelible memories of this experience at the del Senato and will surely return on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: SpiderUR05
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the first nights of our honeymoon at the Albergo del Senato in mid-July, and it was amazing from the moment we stepped off the plane. They coordinated a car to pick us up at the airport (which is about 45 minutes from the hotel), and when we arrived, the front desk worker (Luigi) was extremely polite and we were checked in quickly. Our room was on the top floor and looked right out at the Pantheon, complete with a very small balcony and double-doors. The room size was typical Europe (not very big), but the bathroom was roomy and the room was extremely comfortable. At night, we would open up our balcony doors and sit there listening to the street performers and street sounds, which weren't loud at all with the door closed, contrary to what one may think, facing a main piazza in Rome. The hotel was within a 20 minute walk of anything worth walking to in Rome. Basically, it was nothing short of perfect. The free breakfast that came with the room was also great. Not a large spread, but it was good. The roof-top bar was probably the only negative (or, should I say, not very positive), as it was small and and the bartender (one night) had to go downstairs to get my wife a hot tea (yet the night before the barman didn't). Overall, if we're ever luck enough to go back to Rome, I would stay at the del Senato in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the Albergo del Senato”
Reviews.Author: Jemimagold
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Albergo de Senato in Rome from Oct. 4-7 for 3 nights. Our rate was 310 Euros per night and are here are the highlights: 1. Room – Our room for two people consisted of not 1 but 2 very large separate sitting areas, a separate bedroom and a balcony. The bathroom was also unusually large. 2. Breakfast- A large breakfast buffet was included in the room rate and offered the usual assortment of pastries, bread, yogurt, cheese, eggs, cereal, fruit and coffee/tea. The breakfast room itself was an ornate baroque style room that was picturesque. 3. Location- One of the huge draws of the hotel is its location directly facing the Pantheon piazza which, of course, is in the center of town. There are plenty of cafes surrounding the Pantheon so the area had a lively atmosphere but as our room faced a back courtyard, it was not noisy. 4. Rooftop Terrace- The other great thing about the Albergo de Senato was the glorious rooftop terrace which looked out all over Rome and we could see major sights like St. Peter’s and the Vittorio Emmanuele II Monument. It was never too full that we could not get a table at sunset and there was a good selection of cocktails and wine on offer. 5. Staff- The staff were multi-lingual, patient and very helpful. Yes, the elevator was small and yes there was a charge to use the internet (5 euros for 30 minutes) but I think this is very typical for Europe and so neither thing bothered me. I was very pleased with the hotel and would definitely like to stay there again the next time I am in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “The staff made us feel at home”
Reviews.Author: HodyPeel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and the couple we were traveling with loved this hotel. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The terrace bar was the highlight of our stay. Michele the bartender made excellent drinks and was great to talk to. Enjoying sunsets from the terrace is a memory we will never forget. It was truly a sad moment when we had to leave this hotel after our 4 night stay. We would definitely stay here the next time in Rome. It was 100 degrees F one day we were there and even though our room was on the top floor it was always cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdminor
Reviews.Content: In our recent stay in Rome, my wife and I stayed at the Albergo del Senato hotel which was located in Piazza della Rotunda right next to the Pantheon. In fact, our window faced the piazza which gave us a breathtaking view of the Pantheon, which was absolutely amazing. The best thing about this hotel is the location. In the heart of Rome, you are a short walk away from every major attraction in Rome, including the Coliseum, the Roman Forum, the Vatican, the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, etc. When staying here, you are also very close to many restaurants and shops, as well as near Piazza Navona and Campo de Fiori. The next best thing about the Albergo del Senato is the staff. We found them to be both friendly and extremely helpful, and they also do a good job of keeping non-guests out of the hotel, which was nice to see given the amount of people that hang out in the piazza. The room itself was also quite nice. We stayed in a suite, and although it was not as nice, or a big, as I expected based on the photos on the website, it was still a nice size room and a good value for the price. They had Sky TV, which enabled us to have 3 English speaking stations (Fox, Sky World, and CNN), which was 3 more than we had during the rest of our stay in Italy. The bed was a little stiff, but comfortable nonetheless. The main complaint I would have about this hotel was the lack of Internet connectivity in the room. Unless I overlooked it, I didn’t see any way of accessing the Internet, except for a computer in the main lobby, which was 5 Euros for about an hour of time. I also didn’t notice any wireless networks available in the room. However, these complaints were insignificant when you consider the location, quality of hotel and room, and friendliness of staff. In addition, there is almost nothing better than to open you window to the sights and sounds of Piazza della Rotunda and enjoy all of this from your hotel room. I highly recommend you book early and request a room facing the piazza. Also, they offer personal transportation from the airport for just slightly higher than the normal cab fare. I also recommend you take advantage of this feature, as it is a good way to kick start a vacation in one of the best cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: Napalover1
Reviews.Content: Not sure what all the fuss is about. Yes, the location is excellent and the view from our room was amazing. But certainly not worth the 409 euros/night (yes, euros; not dollars) that we were charged. We stayed 3 nights. Our suite on floor 2 was average. The sitting room was very dark. We had a fruit tray in our room on arrival (fruit wasn't ripe) and the used plates and pits/cores were never picked up. The desk clerk gave us wrong directions to 2 restaurants AND he even looked up the addresses on the internet. One evening we asked him to call a taxi. There was a taxi stand up the street, but as it was raining and we were dressed for dinner, we wanted a taxi to come to the door. Across the piazza, a taxi was waiting for passengers and the clerk told us that was our taxi. Breakfast was nothing to write home about. We struggled with our luggage when checking out and the bellhop just stood there and watched us. On our next visit to Rome, we will definitely find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in city centre”
Reviews.Author: Denis-Cork
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August in a Junior Suite. Perfect location for all the main attractions day and night. Our room looked out onto the Pantheon and the piazza. The staff are very friendly and helpful. In terms of location, accomodation this hotel was far superior to any of the other hotels I had considered in Rome while planning our holiday. Hotel will book a limousine pickup/dropoff at the airport if requested.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Clean and Location again”
Reviews.Author: hirsh1
Reviews.Content: I agree with every thing that was said here. The hotel is in best location. We were two girls and we did not hastate to come back late at night back to the hotel. The piazza was crowded and full of people even at night. Some may think that It is a little bit nosy but closing the room windows solve this problem. And after visiting all the must see places in Rome I agree that this hotel has the best location in Rome. We did not use any public transportation at all almost every place was by foot. The room was in good size and was very clean. Its seem like they clean the room twice or tree time a day. The beds were comfortable (never slept so good at home). Best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MadelineDevi
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay from start to finish! Fantastic location in the heart of Rome. Piazza is delightful, opposing the Pantheon and surrounded by dozens of restaurants with outdoor seating. Spotlessly clean, quiet and spacious rooms, friendly and accomodating staff. I would definitely stay here again when next in Rome and would recommend it highly to anyone! Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel i've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: shell86
Reviews.Content: From start to finish this was the best hotel i've ever been in. check in was effortless. staff were extremely helpful and friendly, spoke perfect english. hotel room welcomed us with a fruit basket was imaculately clean, and was cleaned every day with fresh sweets and sheets and towels. the view from the room took my breath away!! the roof top bar was lovely and had a nice atmospher, but the mar man Michele made it special! would definately come back here if i could afford it!

Reviews.Title: “Albergo del Senato...Simply the Best!”
Reviews.Author: skicrystal
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed 3 nights at Albergo del Senato. It was a fabulous hotel! We stayed in room 602. We could practically reach out and touch the Pantheon from our large balcony! The hotel was beautiful, our room was very nicely decorated, and we thought very large. We enjoyed the fruit basket in our room upon arrival. The breakfast was spectacular. The front desk staff was very kind, as we very much appreciated their maps for us. Their dinner (and gelato) recommendations were right on. The hotel's terrace provides remarkable views. And the location cannot be beat. It was an easy walk to: The Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Piazza del Polpolo, Piazza Navona, The Vatican, etc. The hotel was even kind enough to direct me to the closest hardware store when my curling iron over circuited and quit working. The A/C was awesome (and believe me in August it was very hot outside), although in the evenings we enjoyed falling asleep with our balcony doors opened listening to the musicians down below performing. Does it get any better than that? To see the Pantheon Square full of people in the evening and then to see it deserted in the early morning was a wonderful comparison. I would not hesitate to stay at Albergo del Senato again. My only complaint; they were not quick to respond to my emails before hand. And when I requested assistance scheduling a tour of the Vatican they said someone would be emailing me closer to our arrival - that email never came. However, I booked a tour on my own, and would not hold a minor detail like that against them. Albergo...is so worth the persistence.

Reviews.Title: “What a view from #602”
Reviews.Author: Nicole2007_7
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Albergo del Senato. If you like the Pantheon, this is the place. We requested room 602, a 2 bedroom suite with a balcony that easily seats 4. When we arrived the immaculate room had a basket of fruit on the table to enjoy on the terrace. The view of the Pantheon was breathtaking, and as the front desk clerk said of the ancient structure, " For 12 years I look at the Pantheon everyday , and I ask myself, "how do they done that ?". Really, there is nothing more to say. Yes it is pricey, but you will remember that view a lifetime. One more thing, at 6:00am I looked over our balcony to find that there was no one in Pantheon square . I quickly got dressed and ran down the steps to find myself the only one in Rome to be standing on the portico of the Pantheon, peering into the crack of its massive doors. Total magic moment.

Reviews.Title: “Back Again”
Reviews.Author: SpectatorBelfast
Reviews.Content: Stayed here some time ago, and wrote a review .So would my family feel the same way about this hotel when the obvious "wow factor" about its location is not a surprise. Yes ,this hotel deserves its high rating on Tripadvisor. Now the rates do reflect its location.But they are not excessive compared to other Rome hotels I have priced. The staff are friendly,mostly speak English,and the business is well run.If you speak to them outside busy check in/out times they will phone various attractions for opening times and so on. I would have no hesitation in recommending it to friends - in fact I have already done so. I shall return again.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo del Senato - location and value in one Roma hotel. Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: Europe_Aficionado
Reviews.Content: We booked two triple rooms at the Albergo del Senato for three nights in early August based on the generally excellent reviews on Trip Advisor and other websites, and on the central location of the hotel to most of the famous sites. We hit a bulls eye on both counts. The location could not have been improved upon, overlooking perhaps the most famous intact ancient building in Roma (the Pantheon) and yards away from many of the grand sites we all come to Roma to see. Taxis? Never used them beyond getting to and from the airport, this location is so central. Noise from the piazza? Delight to Puccini sung in the Piazza in the evening. Who can complain? Service? Just fine - unobtrusive, professional, and helpful when needed. Breakfast? Also, just fine while nothing special. If you don't like the coffee, just go around the corner to get what might be some of the best coffee in Rome. You can say the same for the excellent Gelateria just up the street. The rooms are compact but serviceable. The triples are towards the back so you don't get views of the Pantheon from your window, but you can get that out the front door or from the roof top terrace in the evening. Our teenagers, not known for their patience, could not pull themselves away for minutes from that magical view of Roma at night. Assuredly , there are swankier hotels, at greater cost, or budget hotels without the same amenities, but the Albergo hits all the right notes (including Puccini's) with location, service, reasonable rooms, location (again!) and all round value. I'd go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places we have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: RichardJB
Reviews.Content: A perfect location in the heart of the historic city next to the Pantheon. Not cheap, but good value compared to other central Rome hotels. Beautiful decor. Room was just OK in terms of size, but was perfectly finished and impeccably clean. Service really excellent. Every time we came back to our room it seemed to have been cleaned again and all the staff managed to be friendly, yet highly professional and efficient. Breakfast a little basic, but perfectly OK and the roof terrace has views to die for. Extras not charged at inflated prices either. Drinks from the mini-bar in the room were cheaper than at many local bars. Nothing at all to attract any negative comment from us. Small, efficient, stylish, comfortable and unpretentious. Quite possibly the best all-round hotel we have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but slightly overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: ivan06
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located directly in front of the Pantheon. In addition to being able to see the Pantheon every time we left the hotel, this was also a great location because it was halfway between the Vatican and the ancient Roman sites, which were about 20 minute walks away. Also, there's lots of great food (well, ice cream) within 2 blocks of the hotel. The hotel had a rooftop bar with a nice view of Rome and of the Pantheon's plaza below. On the other hand, you could consider this a slightly inconvenient location because it wasn't very close to a metro station or bus stop, which meant we needed taxi rides to/from the train station. This was a nice hotel, but all the other hotels we stayed on our trip to Europe cost the same or less, but were generally far superior to this hotel. First, the hotel was a bit noisy due to the tile floor, and the fact that the room door's would buzz opened. Also, the noise from the crowds outside would keep up until about midnight or 1AM. Second, the tile floor in the room was covered with black shoe streaks. The ceramic in the bathtub had a giant chunk missing. And the staff was reasonably friendly, but only reasonably. These weren't big problems, but considering the price, I expected the same quality I saw in other European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kbug33
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel in the middle of Rome. Situated right beside the Pantheon, within walking distance of Piazza Navona and Trevi Fountain, with great restaurants and gelaterias just steps away. The room itself was traditional and lovely, with a well-appointed bathroom. The window looked out onto the Pantheon and surrounding piazza and the view was amazing. I recommend staying on a higher floor. I was on what they called the first floor (in reality it was the second floor; the first floor is called "ground"). There's live music at night on the piazza and while charming, made it hard to fall asleep on the first floor when I had a very early flight the next day. I think a higher floor and I would not have heard the music with the window closed. All in all, a terrific location, friendly staff and great room. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: CRUISEMANIA
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Albergo Del Senato in July. Could not ask for a better hotel or location. We were in room 107 overlooking the Pantheon and Plaza. Such a treat to look out the window and watch life in Rome. In the morning we actually had the Pantheon to ourselves before the crowds arrived. The room was amazingly quiet even during the highpoints of the day. The staff was so helpful and accomodating. Especially liked the Breakfast room, A nice way to start the day. Very good pastries, fruits and coffee. The room A/C was the best. We arrived earlier than expected. Ann at the front desk had our room ready in 20 minutes with no problem. A plate of fruit was sent to the room which was a welcomed treat. Walking to the various sights was very easy. Plenty of restaurants in the area to choose from. The hotel is a little pricey but worth it. I would definately stay there again for my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great location, fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: STLDixie
Reviews.Content: This location was wonderful. Everything was within walking distance. We had a room on the sixth floor with a mini balconey overlooking the Pantheon. The roof on the top of the building was wonderful. Watching the sunset was really great. There was a nice breeze. The only negative comment I have is that the elevators are small and slow. Who cares???? The breakfast included in just right. We were there four nights and althought our room faced the Pantheon because there were think wooden doors you could close off I did not hear a thing. The staff was nice. Not too pretencious and helpful. They gave us a name of the nearby restaurant that was wonderful. We ate there three times. The name is L'Angoletto.The staff was fun and after our second meal there they left a bottle of apertiff on our table complimentary to have as much as we wanted. Fabulous. If you want a fabulous day trip out of Rome visit the city where the Pope has his summer residence. We went to an incredible restaurant and had a wine tasting from several of their 30,0000 yes I said 30,000 bottles of wine. The food afterwards was wonderful. The restaurant is just next door to the Pope's place and is situated on a lake which previously was the crater to a volcano. The name of the restaurant is Pagnanelli and has been around since 1882.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: crooksy
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay in Rome! What amazing views! We stayed in one of the larger rooms which overlook directly onto the Pantheon - the view from the room was amazing - just like looking out onto a movie set. We stayed here for the first two nights of our honeymoon before travelling onto Sirmione and it was a lovely beinginning to our honeymoon. The staff were incredibly helpful and the room was lovely. We had a bowl of fruit to greet us when we arrived and the cherries were the best I've ever tasted! The hotel organised a limo to collect us from the airport and another to drop us off. Very helpful staff. We had a great stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No better place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: traveltoomuchToronto
Reviews.Content: Travellers need to learn that rooms in Rome are not 700 square feet! This hotel has reasonabke rooms, terrific staff, a great roof bar, and is a pleasure to stay at. Treat yourself and stay in one of the suites with a patio: remarkable. The only negative we can offer is that the breakfast room is small and often crowded, but this is a small price to pay for such a charm. Congrats to the manager and his staff! Igonre the occasional neative comment in TA.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: frankophile2
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely, very clean, not-too-small-for-a-city room at the Albergo del Senato that looked out directly onto the Pantheon. The staff, in general, was friendly and well-meaning, although ultimately ineffective (but occasionally entertaining in a Keystone Cops kind of way) in trying to assist us with finding out what had happened to our lost luggage, which still hadn't arrived in Italy two days after we had. Breakfast was lovely. On the down side, we waited over twenty minutes on the scenic roof terrace one afternoon for the bartender to take our drink order. During those twenty minutes, he chatted with other guests, dried glasses at the bar, and steadfastly ignored us. When we eventually got up to leave, he asked sarcastically if we were “in a hurry.” Also, the hotel’s two passenger elevators are very tight and the slowest we’ve ever encountered. Like everything else in Rome these days, the hotel is no bargain. Nevertheless, as many have noted, its location is superb, and I’d stay there again for the easy access the hotel offers to so many of this great city’s great sights.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect way to start your stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: dreamvacation1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely the perfect way to start off a stay in Rome. It is situated in a "magical" piazza with a direct view of the Pantheon. The rooms are elegantly appointed and come with lots of amenities such as slippers, body lotion etc. There is a mini bar with very reasonable prices. It is hard to put into words the wonderful feeling you get when staying there, like you have been transported back in time and are in a historical/sacred area. The staff was wonderful, Grazia emailed me often before my trip and even arranged dinner reservations for us at a fantastic (best pizza I had the entire two weeks in Italy) restaurant that was very economical and off the beaten path. The only negative thing I could say about my trip is I wish we had stayed longer, this is a very special hotel we will most definately be back! Once I get through the 1000 photos I took on the trip I will post some or feel free to email me for a link to my photo page. Oh one last thing, I though breakfast was very good, there were eggs, cheeses, breads, spreads (including nuttella) fruit,meats,and yogurt plus I believe cereals and such. I was expecting to be dissapointed when I saw other's opinion of the breakfasts but by European standards the breakfast (which was included in the price of the room) was quite bountiful in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly stay at the Albergo del Senato”
Reviews.Author: Joseph
Reviews.Content: We booked directly by phone with Grazia at the Albergo del Senato, and she was able to offer us an attractive rate for two rooms for several days stay. We had not much idea of the layout of Rome, but this hotel is extremely well situated for all the ancient sites. Our room (Junior Suite) had a direct view of the Pantheon and the kids were in a smaller room next door. The front desk was extremely polite and friendly. Restaurant recommendations were reliable and bookings made promptly for dinners, guided tours, transport. The rooms are not particularly large (a few reviewers have commented on this...) but they were well-equipped, clean and modern, as were the bathrooms, with good showers. We weren't tripping over ourselves, but we spent very little time in the rooms, and almost all of it wandering around Rome, which is what most travellers will choose. Breakfast was reasonably standard 'continental' style (no menu of cooked food) and lunch and dinner are to be eaten out, which was a pleasure rather than a hardship. Wait staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the suite with balcony”
Reviews.Author: JamesCA
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed in one of the only 2 senior suites located on the top floor for 4 nights in late June. It was a beautiful suite. A separate bedroom for my 2 girls with twin beds, and a separate bedroom for my husband and I. Both rooms were good size, and both had flat screen TVs. The bathroom was large and clean. The best part was the outdoor patio. It had a table with 4 chairs and we sat out there often. It overlooked the Pantheon. The only thing I would say is that housekeeping could be a bit more attentive at restocking supplies such as toilet paper and shampoo. We had to call to have more brought to the room. The rooftop bar was the perfect location and the bartender, Miguel makes great cosmopolitans. The piazza outside was beautiful. Overall a great location, wonderful hotel, perfect experience. The breakfasts were very very good-even had scrambled eggs! My favorite hotel on the 2 week vacation, and I am picky.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Wattaworld
Reviews.Content: The Albergo del Senato (Hotel of the Senate) is in THE best location in Rome with THE best view - across the piazza to the ancient Pantheon right in front of you. The only reason it's not #1 on Tripadvisor is that the Albergo del Senato has many more reviews than some of the smaller lodgings ranked higher but not as good. Fellow Tripdvisor users should know the following: 1. The Albergo del Senato is located on a wonderful cobblestoned square full of life - you can relax watching it all from your room or the rooftop bar while the charismatic barman Michele serves you drinks. 2. As a previous review stated, you are ideally located in the centre of Rome's wonderful sights - the longest walk is the Vatican 20 minutes away. 3. Our room was bigger and more modern than the mostly-disappointing rooms in Europe - and unlike most, it has great air con! 4. The front office staff including Salvatore are expert in where to go and what to do - all with a smile and good English. 5. A better-than-continental breakfast is included in a beautiful breakfast area that includes a typical Roman pillar. 6. Any visit to Rome should include a visit to one of the wonders of the world - the Sistine Chapel with Michelangelo's mind-blowing tribute to God. Whether you're religious or not, this is truly inspiring. Photos inside aren't allowed, so go see it. Take it from an experienced traveller - for an overall wonderful Roman experience, situated right in front of one of Rome's ancient treasures, you won't find better than the Albergo del Senato.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AbbyAngelsCamp
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed at the Albergo del Senato June 19-23. First two nights were in a small room, then we upgraded to a large suite for the final two nights. The del Senato has the best location in Rome - right next to the Pantheon. We walked everywhere from this hotel. The decor was nice. The staff was helpful and the breakfast was above average. The rooftop terrace has a fabulous view over Rome and is a great place for a drink in the evening, though the bartender was the least friendly of all the staff at the hotel. We would stay here again based on location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Lendrum
Reviews.Content: Recently five members of our family spent four activity filled days at Albergo Senato. The location is prime with much of Rome's attractions within comfortable distance. There is an abundance of excellent restaurants within walking distance, especially L'Angoletto where we had a memorable dinner. Also, there is a great gelaterio right next door to the hotel. Unfortunately, we cannot agree with the rave notices of Albergo Senato posted by many of your members. Although we made our reservations six months in advance and were promised spacious rooms, the room my wife and I got was a tiny cubicle with one straight-backed chair and a miniscule bath. It did have the only balcony facing the Pantheon, but that is about the only positive thing it offered. We do not recommend Room 204. There was a heat wave in Rome last week, and the air conditioning was virtually inoperative despite several efforts by the staff to fix it. Our daughters had problems with their air conditioning also. Their unit leaked constantly and a maintenance man finally came and drained a bucket of sludge out of it. The staff were generally proficient and gracious--expecially in the breakfast room and housekeeping. Our room was cleaned beautifully each day by a pleasant and diligent housekeeper. The roof top bar offers great views and great drinks. Michaele, the bartender, is a delight to deal with and he makes looking over the interesting rooftops of Rome and the next-door Pantheon a fun experience. All in all, we must give Albergo Senato a mixed-bag of a rating:-some sublime, some downright lousy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at Albergo”
Reviews.Author: McGarrity
Reviews.Content: After reading tons of wonderful reviews, we decided to stay at the Albergo del Senato and I couldn't have been happier! We had an amazing view directly onto the Pantheon and it ended up being one of the most memorable stays of my life! I kept telling my boyfriend at the time how much I loved the Pantheon and how amazing it was. He ended up proposing on the steps of the Pantheon our last night in Rome. It couldn't have been more magical and everyone at the hotel was so happy for us! Such lovely people and the location CAN'T BE BEAT. Stay at Albergo and fall in love with the Pantheon as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eck1056
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from long weekend in Rome and stayed at del Senato. It is, as described elsewhere, a great hotel and I recommend it to anyone. The location is ideal, bedrooms well equipped and clean and most importantly the air con works! Staff are very helpful when required, but unobtrusive when not. The location next to the Pantheon is stunning and although it is more expensive than some other hotels it is well worth the money. Negatives? Well being on a piazza it can get a bit noisy, but that is Rome! Hope to go back as soon as we can!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Luco2
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Our suite was wonderful, the location can't be beat, the hotel staff was 100% helpful, including restaurant recommendations, and we would stay there again on our next trip to glorious Rome.

Reviews.Title: “So happy I chose Albergo Del Senato”
Reviews.Author: davcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the splendid Senato for 1 week at the beginning of June. We loved it. As soon as we saw it, the Pantheon became my favourite building in Rome and to be able to see it and almost touch it from our window (room 207) was awesome. The hotel is an excellent 3 star, with a real emphasis on cleanliness and customer service. They do what they do, really really well! The breakfast was fine, would have loved some variety in the cooking of the eggs, it did get a bit tiresome - scrambled eggs every day, but truthfully that is the only slight negative I could give this hotel. The staff are very customer focussed and the roof top terrace is a big plus. The location in terms of sight seeing could not be better, we did get some taxis but mostly in the morning when we had a reservation, otherwise we were always happy to meander back to the Senato after a day's sightseeing and relax in our room with the window open, listening to the hum from the piazza below. I miss Rome and I miss the Albergo Del Senato, hopefully I will get to visit both again .................. someday!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Excellent Room”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoDomer
Reviews.Content: I read the TripAdvisor commentaries and the favorable reviews were right on. Our room was very nice and in excellent, clean condition, the A/C worked well, and the location is absolutely perfect. The Pantheon (designed for Hadrian in 120 AD) is no more than 50 yards out the front door!!!). Imagine that for a moment. You room is a stones throw from a 1900 year old treasure. Also, there must be at least 2 dozen restaurants and gelataria within 400 yards of the hotel. From the del Senato, you can walk inside of 20 minutes to the (i) Vatican, (ii) Colosseo, (iii) Roman Forum, (iv) Villa Borghese, (v) Spanish Steps, (vi) Trevi Fountains, and (vii) Piazza Campo de Fiori, among other attractions. The hotel is in the Piazza della Rotonda if you look at a map of Rome. If you form a triangle with the Vatican, Colosseo and Spanish Steps, the hotel is in the center of the triangle. The hotel staff was outstanding to say the least. They spoke English very well, and went out of their way to greet you and to ask if you needed assistance to find an attaction, restaurant, etc. The morning breakfast, which was included in our price, was very good as well. The bar on top of the hotel is wonderful. You can sit at sundown to enjoy the nightfall over a bottle of wine, and watch all the tourists below wonder past the Pantheon. Once you are in the right mood (thanks to the wine), you can find a great restaurant within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripadaddict
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 19 extended family members (aged 3 - 75!) for 5 days and had a wonderful time. The hotel was perfectly located and opening your window onto a view of the Pantheon and Piazza della Rotonda was dream-like. It is central for just about any place of interest which means walking to sights is no problem (Colosseum, Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona etc.). There is also a taxi rank on the square if walking is too much. The staff and service in the hotel was excellent and I would have to mention Mauro, in particular, who dealt with us for most of the time and was extremely patient with the children and helpful to us all. It may be a bit more expensive than some hotels but you do get what you pay for - plus its location, which would be hard to beat. I don't think I'd want to go back to Rome unless I was staying here. The rooms were all clean and catered for all our needs. We were even lucky enough to bump into Julia Roberts who was filming for her new film "Duplicity"!!

Reviews.Title: “Rome is absolutely great but the hotels are expensive and simple”
Reviews.Author: TripTripBelgium
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review of the hotel. The location is great The reception is great The room had problems with the centrally managed heating. We had to call to the reception 3 nights in a row because when shutting down the heating, after one hour it activated itself again, but was stuck on 18 degrees. So it kept on heating and heating, thinking it was only 18 degrees while it actually was 35 in the room. We had problems with the water and toilet several times. We had an awful smell in the room all the time and therefore could not open the windows. Location was above some exhaust of a restaurant. Breakfast was a joke. Most of the time, tables were not available and the food was extremely limited. Room price per night is 400euro... duh... Rome itself is gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but nice.”
Reviews.Author: JRDCharleston_SC
Reviews.Content: Very noisy locale--the piazza in front of the Pantheon is non-stop tourists--but this is offset by a very central location. Friendly, helpful service; good room cleaning. Decor a bit dated and rooms are a bit small. Bathrooms OK; small shower. Overall, a decent, smaller place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get a better location....”
Reviews.Author: BowensSwanseaUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel has already had some great reviews and I agree with them all! It's a small and friendly hotel in the most fantastic location next to the magnificent Pantheon. The room my friends had was small but beautifully furnished with a view straight out on the Pantheon, our didn't have a view but was large and airy with a frescoed ceiling and a Jacuzzi bath! We took a Tour Bus on the first day to get our bearings, we hoped on and off, as we wanted. In reality though, The Trevi Fountain, The Coliseum, Vatican City, The Forum and Palentine were all in walking distance, no more than a 20-minute stroll. I strongly recommend paying for a guided tour of The Vatican and St Peter's as you miss so much without one, and Eugene, our guide, was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. A word of warning though, we paid to go to the Coliseum on one day and The Vatican the next, without realising that if you do the Vatican first with one of the many tours offered, you get admission to the Coliseum and Forum included and many guides will offer a free tour too! We paid far more than we needed to on attraction tickets as a result. We did find the food and drink a little expensive (not helped by a poor exchange rate) approx 5 euro for a beer or coffee! Surprisingly the hotel bar was the cheapest for drinks! You will be spoilt for choice with restaraunts, the Pantheon and Piazza Navona near by are full of them and all lovely. To summarise we had a fantastic trip to "The Eternal City" and when I return I will deffinately stay at the Albergo del senato again X

Reviews.Title: “A great view of the Pantheon! Wonderful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jnmkbrownell
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week's holiday in Rome, where we stayed at the Hotel Albergo del Senato. It was wonderful! The service was impeccable; the rooms small but luxuriously furnished. We stayed in room 207. It was a corner room, overlooking the Pantheon (one could lie in bed in the morning, open the shutters & curtains, and see the Pantheon 30 yards away. The hotel does not have a restaurant; but has excellent suggestions for dining. They have WiFi in the lobby (not in the room). Beds were very comfortable, extra pillows & duvet when asked for. Mini bar & TV in the room. There are small cafes and ristorantes everywhere, so no need to worry about where to eat. It is located in the medieval portion of the city, and so there is almost no traffic. All the streets are pedestrian, with the occasional taxi threading its way through. It is a short walk to the Roman Forum, to the Piazza Navona, and to the Spanish steps (10-15 minutes in each case). We highly recommend this hotel, and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect end to our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: catelynnshines
Reviews.Content: It has been quite a few months since our honeymoon (my husband and I were married in September), but I wanted to make sure to add a review for the Albergo Del Senato. Our stay was just perfect - the hotel is beautiful, the location is great, the staff were friendly/helpful, the room exceeded our expectations and the rooftop bar was amazing! We highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NC_Freckles
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location of this hotel, it is steps away from the Pantheon on a nice little plazza - Plazza del Rotonda. Very friendly, English-speaking staff, rooms are clean and comfortable. My family was very happy with our stay, we were here for 5 days. We will definitely be back in Rome soon and we will stay in Albergo del Senato. Anna from NC

Reviews.Title: “Small room, high price”
Reviews.Author: Anbai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at del Senato 5 days. The room was small and noisy. You hear the neighbors taking a shower. We had to sleep with open windows because the room was too warm and the hotel does not turn on the air-conditioning in spring. Only one English channel on free tv (CNN). Same breakfast every morning. The staff was very friendly, room was clean and the hotel is centrally located, and that is what is driving up the price. It is not an absolutely necessary to stay that centrally localed, but for a first time visit to Rome a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “4-8th April 2008”
Reviews.Author: Traveller641951
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel well before check-in time but our room was ready for access which was appreciated after a 04:00 start. The room 205 had a wonderful view and the weather information, chocolates and even an unexpected bottle of wine on each of our birthdays was very pleasant touch. The room was small compared with American standards but was perfectly adequate. The most disappointing item was the breakfast. Even in other europeon countries you are able to have toast with your scambled egg not just as bread roll. There is cereal, croissants and other sweet cakes and the selection of meats and cheeses but for the money I think there should be more of a selection especially, as when we were there,the majority of occupants seemed to be non- european. Location was perfect for walking to the majority of sites. 2 of the eateries in the piazza gave very good service but beware the signs saying 4 euros for cappacino and croissant. If you choose caffe latte instead(which costs the same) you get charged 8.5 euros!! with an especially amusing response to the discrepancy. Also know your cappacino from your latte.... The hotel was especially helpful when we had a flight cancellation and needed to stay an extra night and for this we are especially grateful. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYNJNTA
Reviews.Content: While a small hotel it had all the amenities of a larger hotel including a a very caring staff.The Hotel over looks the Paratheon and is withing walking distance of all the Major tourist attractions including the Vatican,The Spanish steps and the Trevior Fountain. While the rooms are very small the this is the norm as we have stayed in Hotels in Rome before..........however this room had a small terrace that overlooked the square. we would defintely recommend the hotel as it is well worth the money you spend.........

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Plenilune
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the Albergo del Senato. The view from our room was breathtaking and while we were very worried about the noise, it did not turn out to be a problem at all. The week we stayed seemed to be "cultural week" with most of the sites offering free admission so the streets were jammed with tourists and students alike. This was wonderful to experience as the city has great energy and life. Breakfast was plentiful and fresh and the staff was accomodating and friendly. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Senato is a safe bet”
Reviews.Author: movemovemove
Reviews.Content: Having been to Rome 4 or 5 times, I know it is not easy to settle on a hotel. If you want excellent location, well-trained staff, clean rooms and fabulous view, this is a really safe bet. A friend and I just stayed 7 nights.
