We paid Euros260 for a room facing the Pantheon, which we requested. It was a lovely view into the piazza, which could be noisy but when we closed the sound proof windows it was really quiet. I've decided this is the best location in Rome because you can walk to just about anything from here, which cannot be said for hotels up near the Spanish Steps, Termini, Colosseum, Trastevere. Two of Rome's venerable caffes are literally around the corner - Tazza D'oro and Sant' Eustachio, which were visited every morning to start the day off right. If you're looking for a glamourous Rome hotel, this is not it. The Senato is a bit more old world, solid, elegant and has properly trained staff with no attitude. They had a solid but repetitive breakfast. I would definitely stay again. It is a safe bet compared to the crap shoot you get yourself into around Rome!! Other great things about it -- near Giolitti gelato and Maccheroni restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what the hype is all about”
Reviews.Author: Canger
Reviews.Content: For 280Euros per night I expected a bit more considering all the rave reviews this hotel gets on this site. We stayed in room 407 for 4 nights. Yes, the view from the windows in the room is breathtaking but that is about it. I suspect they have newer rooms at the back where there is no view but our room was pretty shabby and old - nicked and scratched furniture and floors, material walls which are pretty dirty around the light switches, and the bed was horribly uncomfortable. You could feel the box spring. No facecloths in the bathroom but slippers and robes (without belts??) are provided. Chocolates with next day's weather (cloudy or sunny without temperature indication) left on bed with turn down service. The breakfast was mediocre. I would expect freshly squeezed orange juice in a climate like Rome but found only orange flavoured soda pop without the fizz - they could at the very least use Tropicana from the grocery store. Two types of meat (salami and ham) and one type of sliced cheese, rolls, cereal, yogurt, scrambled eggs and some pastries. I know that the Italians don't have huge breakfasts but considering it is a hotel and the cost of the rooms, they could increase their effort in this area. I've had much better breakfasts at hotels that are much cheaper than the Senato. The staff is friendly but nothing extraordinary. One of the restaurants they recommended ripped us off - l'Angoletto - so, if the hotel doesn't book a table for you directly, beware (though the food was good). They booked us a limo to the airport on our last day and said that they take credit card, but once we reached the airport, the driver said that it was impossible to pay with card, so my husband had to run inside the airport to find an ATM. Susciously, the driver knew exactly where he could find one so I'm guessing he does that all the time. The roof top bar of the hotel was closed which was a disappointment. The cleaning staff changed all sheets and towels daily which is weird - I guess they don't care about the environment much in Italy. We came back from breakfast twice to find our room in the process of being cleaned so we ended up putting the 'do not disturb' sign out every time we went down for breakfast so that we could return and take a last bathroom break in peace before setting out for the day. Next time in Rome, I think we'll stay somewhere else, away from a major tourist attraction and perhaps in a nice residential area. For the price, the Senato just doesn't measure up.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mimocuja
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel with Lastminute.com. Expensive but worth it. Great location with a room on the 4th floor overlooking the Pantheon. Stayed for the Easter weekend. Walking distance to Vatican, Coliseum, Piazza Navone and Trevi fountain etc!. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and well kept. Sky TV etc. No iron or tea making facilities though. Would recommend this hotel for the weekend traveller etc. Be aware of Rome taxis and restaurants. Both are very costly for short trips and basic Italian food..Ask hotel staff to recommend a decent restaurant. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “What a Place”
Reviews.Author: hbird1
Reviews.Content: Date: 30th March, 2008 Jim and Hilde Paxton, Galashiels, Scotland. The Hotel was central for all the main attractions. It is located next door to the Pantheon, and we were lucky enough to have a room which overlooked this magnificent building. We could not fault the hotel, the staff and the service were excellent. We look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - book it”
Reviews.Author: BWOverseas
Reviews.Content: Great, fantastic stay at this Hotel. Our room, 407, looked directly at the Pantheon. It was less than 50 feet away. The room was good size but needed a little cosmetic work however no issue at all. Bathroom was above a good average. In 30 years of travel these were the most helpful and efficient front desk staff I have ever met - they would be a credit to any 5 star Hotel. The location is also great, its a crazy web of streets surrounding you but good shopping and restaurants are everywhere. A memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Del Senato - Top notch”
Reviews.Author: cmelBelfast
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed in this hotel at start of March 08, and I must say, this is the best hotel I've ever stayed in. And what a location! The hotel is situated practically on the front doorstep of the Pantheon which is a beautiful building and a main attraction, and is central to everything else you could possibly want to see in Rome. As for the hotel itself, the reception and lobby are fantastic and the rooms are beautifully furnished and during our entire 3 night stay, immaculately clean. The facilities are as you would expect in a good hotel with minibar and a small bar downstairs. Unfortunately, the rooftop terrace was not open during our stay but given the location, i'm sure its brilliant. The staff were super friendly, helpful and completely genuine and most of them had better English than me! I can't recommend this hotel highly enough and although i've been to most of the big European cities including London and Paris, this is the best hotel i've came across so far. Hopefully i'll be in Rome again soon, and I will most definitely come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location !!”
Reviews.Author: Paddy107
Reviews.Content: I know I am repeating what everyone else has said, but you cannot beat the location of this hotel. We only stayed here for the first half of our visit to Roma and we were so sad to check out. There is not a single site you cannot walk to. Nothing was nicer then to see the Pantheon an either the start or end of the day. As for the hotel itself it was great, we were upgraded to the Senior suite which is huge. There was alot of work being done on the 6th floor so we were a comfortable distance from the noise. The staff at the desk could not have been any more help. They gave directions and advice very eagerly. When I return for another visit to Roma, there is no where else I am staying.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Alberto del Senato was Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: PeteVirginia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Alberto del Senato for 4 nights during the first week of September prior to leaving of a 12-day Mediterranean cruise. We picked this hotel based on the reviews on trip advisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel lived up to all of the rave reviews it received. The hotel staff bent over backwards to help us and give us directions to get to all of the tourist attractions. My wife’s curling iron would not work in the bathroom and they found a long extension cord to plug it into one of the other outlets. The rooms by US standards were a little small but very adequate. We had a third floor room on the front of the hotel with a beautiful view of the Pantheon and the plazza Rotonda. The breakfast was good compared to many that I have had in Europe. One of the complaints on Trip Advisor about the hotel is the lack of a restaurant in the hotel hay this is no problem because with a 2 block radius of the hotel are dozens of excellent restaurants with beautiful sidewalk dining. The hotel was within fairly easy walking distance of the major tourist attraction including the Coliseum and the Vatican. We simply walked everyplace we wanted to go. Once you get your bearings and with the help of a small map we no problem finding our way around historical Rome, after all getting lost once in a while is all part of the fun. Across the Plazza from the hotel on a corner is a grocery store where we were easily able to buy all of the wine and cheese we wanted and any other things such as diet coke we needed. When staying at the Hotel Alberto del Senato you must spend an evening at sunset up on their rooftop terrace where they have a bar. Sunset over Rome drinking a lemoncello is really to die for. The view is spectacular and the bartender was great.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Teodoro08
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults, 2 children) stayed here in February for eight nights and had a great time. We booked online directly with the hotel and had absolutely no problems. This was our first stay at this hotel, and we would definitely come back again. We stayed in the mini-apartment, which although it didn't have a view, was clean and spacious. The hotel's public areas were beautifully furnished and clean. The location of this hotel was great, right in the historic center, making it perfect for setting out and exploring the city. The staff was friendly, courteous and helpful, and it was a nice touch that the desk clerk would greet us by name each day when we walked in. We encountered absolutely none of the "attitude" towards stranieri that one finds in some hotels in Rome. The daily breakfast which was included in the price was wonderful. I think this hotel is a real gem of a find, and we look forward to returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jojo
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Italy - the first time we stayed on the Via Veneto area which was very nice. This time we chose the Pantheon area which was excellent...awesome to come out of the hotel and be looking at the Pantheon! The Albergo del Senato is a great hotel...rooms are the average tiny size for Rome but are quite adequate....bathroom was large and all marble with great shower....we had a side view peek of the Pantheon from our side window. As mentioned the location is excellent - you can walk to everything. Breakfast was nice however the breakfast room is not that large and can get quite crowded...we had a few minute wait on one morning. Management at the front desk was much friendlier on our departure than our arrival (maybe they were just busier when we arrived) ...they arranged for taxis for us to go to the train station. All in all it is a nice hotel with probably one of the best locations available. Even though it is a busy location outside noise was not a problem in our room. There is an absolutely terrific gelato place up one of the side streets not far from the hotel....sorry can't remember the name but I am sure the hotel knows about it if you ask them (it's a large place with a ton of flavors and the best gelato we had anywhere in Italy).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Tankleton
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Albergo del Senato in December 2007 purely on the recommendations on Trip Advisor & we were not disappointed. It was well worth paying a little extra. A very comfortable, warm & friendly hotel right next to the Pantheon & in a superbly quiet almost traffic-free location, surrounded by cafes, restaurants & shops. Our room overlooking the Pantheon & charming Piazza was scrupulously clean while the bathroom was stocked with high quality toiletries. The staff were extremely helpful & charming. The hotel is within easy walking distance of all the "must-see" sights & reasonable restaurants serving authentic Italian food (rather than expensive tourist fodder) can be found in the winding streets near the hotel. Walking back to the hotel late at night felt very safe. Our only disappointment with the hotel was that we found the breakfasts were half-hearted to say the least &, much to our surprise, the breakfast coffee was utterly tasteless. However, the "best coffee in Rome" can be found less than 5 minutes away at Sant' Eustachio (82, Piazza Sant' Eustachio), & a superb ice-cream parlour is virtually next door to the hotel! We'd definitely stay there again - highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: frombaritomiami
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at the end of January 2008 at the Albergo del Senato with my wife and 10 month old child. We had a great time for many reasons: great location, excellent corteous staff, excellent hotel overall. This is a 3-star rated hotel which could easily be a four star, for the amount of little things and nice touches they have for their guests. Our room did not have a direct view to the Pantheon (room 308) but we did not care. It was large enough to accomodate us and the crib for our baby. Stilish furniture, large bath with towel warmer and marble floors, good quality toiletry. There was turn-down service with next day weather information and a few chocolate treats. The issue with the temperature in the room can easily be solved by placing a call to the reception and they will fix it for you. Great front desk, especially Mauro, who took a great affection to our baby and played with him. He is a master calligrapher, and we thank him for the little note to our prince. Breakfast is good, not great, but as long as there was good coffee and fresh orange juice, who cares... A little info on those who plan to visit Rome and are thinking of booking at this hotel: I made reservations through their website 4-5 months in advance and was able to get an excellent rate. Maybe it was not high season, or maybe we booked so early, but we stayed in our room for half the published price (about 200 euros per night instead of 400). Overall, a great experience, I would go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “It ranks very highly in Rome you know!”
Reviews.Author: spoon47
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights hoping with a room with a view & certainly wasn't dissappointed!! Hotel arranged a car to pick us up at the airport (well worth it if you don't want to trek across town with bags) if you don't mind the price. Just a supurb spot , top floor room with a view & balcony overlooking the Pantheon. Near to everything you might want to see & a very friendly front desk. Might be a little pricier than some ,but you are in Rome after all!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - shame about the bed!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller19
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! A beautiful hotel in a wonderful location and only let down by an extremely uncomfortable bed (Room 108). And as we were on our first visit to Rome and covered a huge number of miles on foot around the beautiful city we definitely needed to sleep well. Regrettably we did not and the overly hard mattress left an indelible mark, not to mention bruised shoulders (!), on us. Less of a problem but a little frustrating was the heating system: The thermostat would not allow a temperature below 23 degrees C (73.4F) - in a bedroom! We switched off the automated system and still had to contend with 20 degrees. We spent 3 nights at what must be one of the best located hotels in Rome - directly adjacent to the amazing Pantheon, complete with huge rotunda and its unrestricted view of the heavens. The hotel staff were at all times charming and helpful; breakfast was OK, albeit the dining room was a little cramped with those arriving after 9.00 am having to wait for a free table. There is (apparently) a lovely roof garden. Regrettably it was closed during our visit - it would have been nice had the staff informed us, rather than having to discover the building site for ourselves! Drinks at the (ground floor) bar were very reasonable (a large glass of good Chianti €4) and there were several nice touches e.g. free use of umbrellas, beds turned down at night with chocolate on pillows, dressing gowns and slippers. We found some excellent restaurants, two recommended by hotel staff that were superb: Grano Ristorante, Piazza Rondanini 53, 00186 Rome (just around the corner from the hotel); Popi-Popi Ristorante, Via Delle Fratte di Trastevere, 00153, Rome (a nice walk south from the hotel across the Tiber to dine with the locals!). A third (also in Trastevere) that we discovered by chance is great for those on a budget (with a family): Ristorante Carlo Menta, Via della Lungaretta 101, 00153 Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: ladygeek61
Reviews.Content: We walked into our room, opened the curtains and there in front of us, almost close enough to touch, was the Parthenon! The hotel's location is amazing, 5 minutes walk to the Trevi Fountain, well positioned to walk to all the other famous sites. Our room, whilst not enormous has huge ceilings and was well appointed, with a flat screen TV and SKY. The beds were very comfortable and there was plenty of hanging space int he wardrobes. The bathroom was small but had a bath, shower and bidet and the usual selection of goodies. The towels were large and soft! The furniture in the room was a wee bit shabby but we didn't stay in the room long enough to bother us. Breakfast was served in a charming dining room, and was continental. There was a little bar which was open in the evenings. The staff were charming and very helpful, the night manager let me go into the back office to check in online for our return flight and print off our boarding tickets. They arranged for a car to take us back to Ciampino airport for 50 euros. I would definitely return to this hotel and can recommend it very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday Ever”
Reviews.Author: KathyDG
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful, romantic stay at this hotel. After a few days in enchanted Umbria and falling in love with Assisi, we were afraid we would be disappointed in Rome. We were WRONG! I walked into our room, threw open the shutters, and began to cry. The view was breathtaking. The room was lovely. The Pantheon is beyond words... Santa Maria sopra Minerva is so close. We walked EVERYWHERE, even to St. Peter's. The location of this hotel is perfect. The staff was so kind, and had a bottle of bubbly waiting for us for my 40th birthday. Mauro at the front desk was so kind, and his calligraphy was beautiful! Breakfast was quite nice. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The del Senato will be a lifelong favorite memory for me.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: lynne_8
Reviews.Content: Just had a wonderful 3 nights in del Senato. We were given a room overlooking the Pantheon. The front of house staff were very friendly, they acknowledged my husband's Birthday and on our return from sight seeing a bottle of bubbly on ice was waiting in our room, all at no extra cost. The breakfast was plentiful particularly enjoyed the baked apple, just a pity the orange juice was not fresh. This lovely hotel cannot be beaten on location and the hotel staff made our stay even more memorable. We will be returning to Rome as still so much more we want to see, and will definitely book into the del Senato.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tahitifred
Reviews.Content: What can I say that others have not already said? It's a nice little hotel with a fantastic location. The staff was great as was the room. We had room 501 which was an apartment, including a kitchen, balcony and sitting room. No view of the Pantheon however. Some items in the room showed a bit of wear and could use a bit of sprucing up, but it was more than we had hoped for. It does get warm on this floor, even in Dec. But we found out that if we cracked the window just a bit at night it was perfect. The one major improvement - the coffe they serve with breakfast. Not good. For good coffee, go around the corner to Tazza d' Oro or to Sant' Eustachio close to the back of the Pantheon (also serves great food). Would I stay here again? Yes!

Reviews.Title: “Wins on Position”
Reviews.Author: globalmobile
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights at this hotel over new year. I think the vast majority of praise heaped upon this hotel is due to it's fantastic location. If you're looking to be in the ancient city and within easy walking distance of everything, then it wins. I have rated our experience as above average simply because of that and the spectacular view from our room and balcony of the Pantheon. Without that I would have rated it as average. The rooms have high ceilings but are not big and showing some signs of age. Our bathroom was quite small, recently renovated and clean with the only problem being the slow draining bath/shower water. Soundproofing was quite good (we were there over new year) and most staff were very polite to us. Breakfast is average, some fresh fruit, cereals and the typical cold meat continental selection. Public areas are clean and well presented. If you're looking for extreme luxury rooms with space and comfortable sitting chairs, go elsewhere. If you're wanting to immerse yourself in wandering the back streets of the ancient city whilst enjoying easy walks to the major sights, finding small local restaurants and having an adequately comfortable room to return to at the end of the day then I would recommend this hotel. Walking back across the Piazza della Rotonda at night is quite magical, it's an above average way to end a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--Bad Staff”
Reviews.Author: englishmike
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the room was fine but not worth the $480 price.The staff were terrible.We have visited 116 countries and stayed in many of the finest hotels in the world anfd the front dest,concierge and other staff are some of the worst we have ever encountered.We also stayed during this same visit to Rome at hotel 47.Hotel 47 was wonderful.Great staff,great breakfast and great location also.Do yourself a favour dont believe the hype about this place and do believe the hype about hotel 47.I think the positive reviews here are mostly due to the wonderful location or are from inexperienced travellors who do not know that the service here is very poor for a hotel at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Position, position, position!”
Reviews.Author: LesRuhrmund
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights just before Christmas and could not have selected a better hotel. The hotel is situated in an area rich in history and surrounded by monuments and churches dedicated to some great historical figures of the Christian era (the tombs of St Catherine of Sienna, St Ignatius of Loyola, Raphael, and others are minutes walk away). Good shopping and eating too are close at hand (the pizza and hot chocolate from the place next door takes some beating). Many of the favourite sites in Rome are in easy walking distance. These include the Pantheon (at your doorstep), Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colosseum and Forum, Piazza Navona, Campo de Fiori and the Vatican. We stayed in a suite with a 4 poster bed that was very spacious and comfortable (room 310) - though the room looks onto a side street and has no view. I would mention that some of the rooms I saw in passing through the coridoors were really small. The staff are charming without exception.

Reviews.Title: “THE Best!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SoFLtravelers
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel in mid-November and were not disappointed! It is everything a small boutique hotel should be! We had a room on the top floor overlooking the Pantheon - we just could not get enough of the view at any time of the day or night. We walked everywhere as this hotel is so centrally located. Our room was very clean, and the bathroom was large and spacious. Mauro is the best - he has a wonderful personality and is very knowledgeable. We relied each evening on Mauro's dinner suggestions and reservations and were lead to some of the best small places for food and wine all within walking distance. We enjoyed nightly pre-dinner drinks and conversation with their most excellent bartender Michele. Breakfast and service at breakfast were wonderful. If you're looking for the best location and best service, you will not be disappointed with this hotel.....THE Best!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: siestafe
Reviews.Content: Location and appointments were perfect, staff excellent and helpful at every turn. Loved the entire stay and wouldn't hesitate to reccomend this hotel to all. View of Pantheon out our room was breathtaking and surrounding restaurants, while pricey were very good, walking to every major attraction except St. Peters was not a problem. If you chose this hotel I don't think you will be disappointed,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Location, Loved, Loved Loved it”
Reviews.Author: dpranne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Albergo del Senato for six nights (November 22 - November 28) and it was wonderful. Our view was spectactular. I opened my window and looked directly at the pantheon. The staff were great and they gave me the best recommendation of where to eat. The restaurant's name is Virginiae. This restaurant is a ten minute walk from the hotel. The food was wonderful and the restaurant staff were warm and lovely. I can't say enough good things about Albergo del Senato and Restaurante Virginiae.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: YoPhilly
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at Albergo del Senato and found it to be the perfect location for exploring Rome on foot. We asked for a room with a view of the Pantheon and were not disappointed. I kept opening the window just to prop my elbows on the window sill and gaze at the scene. Our room was quite large for Rome, with a sofa, a walk-in closet and a huge bathroom with a long, deep soaking tub. Amenities included soft slippers and a night-time cookie on our pillows. In the marble bathroom were tubes of shampoo, etc., a hairdryer, bidet, and magnifying mirror. Our room had ceilings at least 12 feet high with crown molding and damask curtains. The walls were covered in a padded damask fabric to reduce noise. We had a tiny bit of noise from the outdoor bar below us, but not so much to keep us awake. The windows block most of the outdoor sound and the heavy draperies add to the soundproofing. The breakfast buffet was extensive: scrambled eggs, yogurt, croissants, bread, rolls, fresh fruit, canned fruit, salami, cheese, dry cereal, crackers, Nutella, almond torte, and several juices. We also had a choice of espresso, cappuccino, tea or cafe americano. The hotel is spotlessly clean with two small elevators, and the front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful. There is a taxi stand just across the piazza. From the hotel, we walked about 5 minutes to Piazza Navona, 10 minutes to Campo di Fiori and about the same to Ponte Sant Angelo. There are scores of restaurants near the hotel. Most offered outdoor seating with toasty warm gas heaters.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room, location, service, breakfast and Mauro the magnificent”
Reviews.Author: beanybop
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous place. I cannot praise it highly enough. We were ripped off by the taxi getting there from the airport, and Mauro gave us the most magnificent upgrade so that we had a better experience of Rome. What a suite, really, fabulous - it was the one at the back of the brochure with the four poster bed. It did not have a view but we were absulutely delighted with it. Especially since it was the week before our silver wedding anniversary. Mauro is an absolute treasure, recommended good restaurants and could not have been more helpful or nicer, had some really interesting conversations (he has tremendous handwriting too) We really liked the breakfast. Husband really appreciated the cappucinos they were really good, as were the pastries etc. The hotel and rooms were really well presented and scrupulously clean - I know what this is as I run a holiday lettings business myself. Fabulous location right in the centre of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel/Great View!”
Reviews.Author: URKMB
Reviews.Content: When I read that the hotel was located next to the Pantheon, I had no idea that was literally true! Great place, with fantastic views, and convenient to just about everywhere. We stayed on the sixth floor in a room with a small balcony, which would have been a great place for an evening glass of wine had it been warmer. Staff could not have been more friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean, and beds comfortable. I can't imagine staying anywhere else on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: serialportme
Reviews.Content: I cannot add to what the previous reviewers have written - other than to say this hotel was PERFECT. Perfect location and a beautiful hotel. Very centrally located. We walked everywhere (a little hike to Vatican and Villa Borghese though, but did it) from hotel and had no problems. The staff was very nice and helpful. Our room was great - view of the Piazza. Decent size room, very very clean - nice bathroom. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to my family, friends and anyone who is going to Rome. I am a harsh critic and nothing makes me happy. This place did. Again - GREAT location, GREAT hotel. it could not have been better. Contact the hotel directly for great rates.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Mauro!”
Reviews.Author: GetOuttaTownNY
Reviews.Content: When I opened my window on the fourth floor, I was staring directly at the Pantheon and the square (Piazza della Rotonda). I think it was room 408. WOW!! This hotel MADE our trip to Rome. Two blocks from the Piazza Navona, a five minute walk to the Trevi Fountain, 15 minutes to the Colosseum and Trajan's Forum, in my opinion there is NO better location in all of Rome. Which by the way is one of the coolest cities in the world. The rooms - excellent. My husband and I and our three kids stayed in two rooms at the end of a hall, opposite each other. Very clean, nicely furnished, totally adequate size, noise was not a problem. But besides the hotel itself, the concierge, Mauro, was also an absolute gem. He was friendly, kind, professional, competent, helpful - it was wonderful to see a truly welcoming face when we returned from our many excursions. He also had good restaurant recommendations. The other desk people were good as well but Mauro was just superb. The hotel was loaded with American families, but nice ones (!) so our interactions with other hotel guests were also surprisingy pleasant. I can not say enough nice things about this hotel and I hope I never have to stay any place else when I return to Rome! Note: My husband used a travel agent and she was fine, but for our trip I booked one hotel directly and one through Orbitz or something and both of those were fine - so my advice is to skip the travel agent if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAtravellers_7
Reviews.Content: The Del Senato is located about 50 feet from the Pantheon! We had a perfect view of it from out window. The hotel itself is a gem. The concierge/manager Luca was helpful from the start. We asked him if we could get into the vatican for a tour while in Rome and even though we should have booked this months in advance, he called two brothers who are local tour guides who were able to get us a tour of the Vatican museum and Sistine chapel, and they also gave us a wonderful tour of Ancient Rome (the Coliseum, the 7 hills, the senate/forum and two basilicas in addition to a walking tour of Rome itself). Their names were Favio and Stefano. Twin brothers and amazing guides. The room was exactly what we wanted. High enough above the Piazza that there was no noise at night, but close to everything. Rome is Magnificent Chaos and after a full day of experiencing it, there was nothing better than returning to our tranquil room. Lovely furnishings, Excellent breakfast. A cozy little bar for a late night brandy. And tons of great tips about Rome. We couldn't have been more pleased. And having the Pantheon next door was just amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Should be a 4 or 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Rtangvald
Reviews.Content: This is simply a great hotel. First, after reading Trip Advisor, I decided to splurge on this centrally located hotel in Rome. I contacted the hotel by their email address and recieved a reply email within 24 hours. If you can't find the email address, google the hotel name and it will come right up. Since we were traveling in November, I asked what their best discount rate would be. They booked my wife and I for four nights in a double room overlooking the Pantheon for 195 Euro per night. Now, don't get me wrong, 300 bucks a night (euro = $1.50!!) is not normally within my budget, but this place was worth it. We arrived at 10 PM. The hotel is on the same square as the Pantheon, a massive structure built in 27 BC. The hotel is beautiful from the outside and faces the square. We checked in to room 206, a double room with a queen sized bed. Upon opening our window we had a truly remarkable view of the Pantheon some 40 feet away. Really, unbelievable. For those of you wanting a room with a view of the square and the Pantheon, I spent some time with the front desk figuring out what rooms were which. Essentially, rooms 202 through 207 are rooms on the floor I stayed on with a view of the square and the Pantheon. The front desk advised that each of the five floors had rooms of the same type stacked upon one another. (ie room 206 and 306 and 406 and 506 are all double rooms) As such rooms 302-307, 402-407, etc will be rooms that look out on the square and the Pantheon. Room 204 had a balcony right on the square!! I was a bit envious. Room 207 and 202 were junior suites that had two rooms each. The hotel is a 3 star hotel. I don't understand why though. I would rate it at a 4, closer to a five that to a three. The room was not large but not small. It had a queen bed with a nightstand on either side. It had a TV that got CNN and 25 other Italian channels. It had a closet that contained a safe. It had a very nice bathroom with a tub/shower, a toilet and a bidet. The entire building was bright and clean and nicely upscale. Breakfast was included in our rate (as were taxes, etc.). Breakfast consisted of breads, meats, cheeses, coffee, cappicino to order (no fee), eggs, cereal, fruit juices, and other items. Newspapers were available for free oustide of the breakfast area. Breakfast was good and clean. We started each day off with a big breakfast that lasted well into the afternoon. The staff at the hotel could not have been friendlier. They provided us with all sorts of advice that made our trip nicer. The front desk has maps of Rome and many suggestions for good food, a grocery store location, etc. Luca even made sure we had a cab to pick us up as we left for the airport at 3 AM!. The hotel is centrally located. Across the street from the Pantheon. 20 minute walk to the Colliseum and the forum. Ten minute walk to the Trevy Fountains. Fifteen minute walk to the Spanish Steps and shopping on the exclusive boulevard in front of it. 10 Euro cab ride (less than 10 minutes) to the Vatican. Truly a great location. Any review would not be complete without a discussion of any negatives. So, here goes. The bed was hard and I couldn't figure out how to adjust the heat. (It was warm in our room and no I didn't ask) That's it! No more negatives. If I ever am lucky enough to visit Rome again, I will stay at the Hotel Del Senato. It is worth the splurge. Oh, you can also check out live pictures of the square (Piazza) on their web cam located on the roof of the hotel. It is on their website. I hope this review helps others plan and have a great trip to Rome. Rolf T. Spokane, WA

Reviews.Title: “Mixed views”
Reviews.Author: wigan1992
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the hotel. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The hotel is very clean , in a fabulous location and ideal for seeing the sights. It is easy to walk to the Vatican, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the Roman Forum. On the down side we had a room on the side of the hotel and it was very, very noisy . The traffic that passes at the side of the hotel late at night makes it difficult to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Quite the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: roywolfman
Reviews.Content: As Trip Advisor fanatics, the much beloved and I decided that the reviews were so good we would try this hotel. So with aged Father in Law in tow, we booked, made requests re collection by cab at the Airport, Walk in shower for the old fella', and went for it. The cab was in fact a luxury car, the old fella got his walk in shower, we had a lovely comfortable room which did not look over the Pantheon square, we decided the cost was well... just a touch too high, The Hotel is quietly ambiguous in the Pantheon square, but there it is as you walk out. Wow factor 10. Easy walking to all the major places in Rome to get crowds, Forum, Colusseum, Vatican, Spanish steps etc but the hotel will sort out cabs if needed. The staff were exceptional in helping us plan and spoke exceptional Englsih and always gave time. Breakfast was good as it goes in Continental Europe, we enjoyed it anyway, there is no restaurant but across the square in a side street is a brilliant restaurant which I booked a table and was glad as it heaved with locals as well as tourists. Try the ice cream round the corner! So Go for it you will see why we give it 5 out of 5 and "will be back". It is really not 3 star but 4 star We sat in the small but elegant Bar area at the end of each night, there js Internet access there by way of a card code bought from the Desk. The Open air Bar at the top of the Hotel was beautifully set up with views over the city, at night warm evening..glass of wine in the hand... relaxed...you will to want to leave by the way the Old fella managed around the hotel very easly lift was fine steps too the Roof Bar were a bit of a challenge but worth it. So Essex couple recommend it to discerning travellers, my much beloved does not do 2 star tents this was not one of those she wants this review written and approves oh by the way going to the sights and booking them you might need to carry ID but at the Colisseum, if it is b usy take one of offered guided tours which get you in past the long queue it was worth it just to see people's faces......and check the Pope is not using the Sistine chapel when you go to the Vatican morning queue is slow in there and that's cos of security

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Brummybird
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this delightful hotel for two nights and was not disappointed. We were warmly welcomed by English speaking staff who were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The whole place was spotless & tastefully furnished, and it is perfectly situated for sightseeing in Rome. Would have liked a little more choice at the breakfast buffet but otherwise no complaints at all. Be sure to enjoy evening drinks at sunset on the rooftop terrace for spectacular views of the city !! It's not the cheapest but is well worth the extra in my opinion, & we will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “what a view!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: passageWaterford
Reviews.Content: we had booked a normal double room and I had asked a few months before arriving if we could have a view of the Pantheon. As we had only booked a standard room that was not possible. I e-mailed a few days ahead of arrival and again said I would love a view. I expected nothing really but sure you can only ask. We arrived last Tuesday night at 8.30pm and I nearly fainted when we opened the curtains.... Room 107... I felt I could nearly touch the Columns of the Pantheon. It was unbelievable to open the curtains every morning and see that view. We walked everywhere in Rome but if you don't want to do that all you have to ask a taxi driver in to take you to the Pantheon. Luca on the front desk was very friendly and the breakfast was great. It really is all about the location. Our room was superb and I actually think we were upgraded to a suite, bedroom, seperate sitting and wardrobe area etc. super, super super. By the way I never sleep well on holidays but managed at least 8 hours each night. There seems to be NO noise.......

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: oliverlou
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, and we were so glad we did. After learning it was our honeymoon trip, the hotel sent up a bottle of prosecco and upgraded our room to a fabulous view of the Pantheon. Staff was helpful and considerate, to the point of making sure we left with an umbrella when it looked like rain and making a reservation for us at Ristaurante del Fortunato al Pantheon (delicious, I highly recommend it). We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “much more than location”
Reviews.Author: serpiente_7
Reviews.Content: Apart from the unexpected beautiful weather , which was based on pure luck, staying at the Albergo del Senato, made the whole difference to our trip. And that was not based on luck. I booked the hotel after the reviews that I have read at trip advisor and I can totally agree that that is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The quadruple room that we had was spacious and sparkling clean and the same applies to the bathroom. The breakfast was more than adequate and with that I disagree with prior visitors who found it inadequate. Let us remember that in Europe quality counts more than quantity. A special thanks to the manager Ms. Ann Johannson and to Luca at the reception who gave us the tip to go to a restaurant called La Taberna Dei Gracchi, great food and atmosphere that made us feel like playing at the Godfather. Of course, there were no other tourists there but ourselves. That is something to be appreciated in Rome with its millions of tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: patacakeUk
Reviews.Content: I can't say I'd rush back to this hotel. We booked for 5 nights and had only booked the week before so weren't expecting the best room naturally and so we weren't disappointed. It was at the back overlooking an inner well and with a generator outside which was ok if you didn't open the window. They were nice enough to give us a bowl of fruit in our room, however, as it was our anniversary and I felt the staff were trying very hard. The hotel does have it's pluses: a roof terrace bar with wonderful views, helpful staff, a central position and bright ,elegant decor (even if the marble is imitiation, and on closer inspection, you feel it's been done on the cheap). Another plus, this hotel is not far from Giolitti's the fantastic ice-cream parlour..I highly recommend this, especially the Pompelmo Rosa (Pink grapefruit) which is not easy to find elsewhere! However, the rock hard beds made our lives a misery and I didn't get one full nights sleep, tossing and turning, then awaking every morning with aching hips even though I folded a spare blanket into 4 lengthways and put it between myself and the mattress. I had noted that someone else on here had complained about the beds but felt it was worth the risk as it might have been a one -off. I was wrong! I felt permanently tired throughout our stay as a result. The breakfast looked good, but the rolls (poor quality for Italy) and croissants felt tired as if they were yesterdays left overs on three mornings. The coffee was the worst I've ever had anywhere, it was like dark brown water. We asked for stronger coffee and it was marginally stronger so I opted for tea after that. The fruit salad on offer was all tinned (except for one morning when it was finely chopped fruit) and the fruit juices were all with added sugar, so I had to give them a miss as I'm marginally diabetic and on the last morning, when I tried it again I'll swear it was an orange 'drink' rather than juice. There was scrambled egg avaliable, but was positioned almost behind the counter as if you weren't encouraged to have it and it was rather unappetising to look at ,though fine to taste. The staff were very efficient at clearing away, almost too much so, and in view of the other 'economies' it made me wonder if they had enough crockery to go round! We should have eaten breakfast out on reflection, especially as the 'best coffee in the world' at Tassa D'Oro is just round the corner. The nearby cafes are not cheap, being opposite a top tourist attraction. Strangely we didn't find many places to buy a snack or sandwiches around the Pantheon, you really had to search, though there were plenty of restaurants, so this didn't immediately spring to mind as it might have done in, say, Venice. There is a supermarket nearby off the other side of the piazza, which is handy for picnic food, though it's sandwiches were rather boring. On this trip we felt on the whole that there was an air of economy, not just at the hotel, but at the restaurants we chose, good food certainly, but not very much of it unlike other holidays we'd had in this city when the Romans seemed generous. We'd heard from a cab driver that Romans were feeling the pinch and were rueing the loss of the Lira in favour of the Euro, so perhaps that explains it. All this hotel needs is better beds and a better breakfast to make it work. If you can sleep anywhere and you don't mind going out for breakfast this hotel is very well sited and might be worth your while.

Reviews.Title: “Another Happy Stay at the Senato.”
Reviews.Author: richs10
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Senato after a disappointing stay at the Naples Excelsior. We booked a Junior Suite and were given Room 215 (on the third floor in the US) which is on the right corner of the hotel closest to the Pantheon. Being on the corner meant we had three windows in the suite. Since the weather was so nice, we opened all three during the day and it was wonderful. The room was beautiful with fabric walls, wood floors, high decorative ceilings and comfortable furniture. The room and the hotel are meticulously clean and very well maintained The layout of the suite had one room which was a nice entry/dressing room area with a small couch, a great marble bath and the beds in the main room. The views of the piazza and the Pantheon were outstanding. The roof bar (manned by Michele) was open and we had pre-dinner cocktails up there several times. The breakfast was very good, especially the scrambled eggs. All of the staff were fantastic, especially Mauro at the desk. The only minor problem we encountered was with the AC/Heat controls. Apparently, there is a cut-off if the windows are opened (a very good idea), but when the windows are closed, it appears that the thermostat in the room does not work and the system is either on or off as directed by the front desk. There is a card in the room which says the temperature can be controlled by the thermostat, but ours just flashed weirdly during our stay. The engineer who initially came to the room told us the system was controlled from the front desk. It did get a little chilly on one night, but we were too exhausted from running all over Rome to involve the desk. Not a big problem, but maybe those cards should be pulled from the rooms and a better explanation of the system given to the guests. Aside from all the great qualities of the Senato mentioned in other reviews (all true, too), we found the best thing to be the perfect location. A few blocks to the west is the Piazza Navone. To the south, the Forum, Largo Argentina and the Piazza Campo Fiore. The Corso and the Fontana di Trevi are a few blocks to the east. Finally, to the north, is the Altar of Peace, Piazza del Popolo and the Spanish Steps. And there are great places to eat everywhere. We walked all over the place. I have got to go back to Rome, and when I do, I will definately stay at the Albergo del Senato! A wonderful hotel in a wonderful location! BTW, every restaurant at which we ate was very good, except for an unfortunate experience at Fortunato right up the street. (sorry, Rick Steves!) The waiter just disappeared toward the end of the meal and no matter how many times we asked, we could not get a check. We finally walked up to the register after about 20 minuites and got the check along with the only attitude we ever saw in Rome. A bad ending for a otherwise OK meal.

Reviews.Title: “Majority rules”
Reviews.Author: Leer
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is a very good hotel in a wonderful location in Rome. We had a 2 bedroom suite on the 6th floor (601 I think) with a terrace and gorgeous view of the Pantheon. I was a bit nervous about a previous comment regarding the size of the suite as we had our two boys aged 7 and 12 with us but I need not have worried. It was ideal. We had the fruit basket (but unfortunately no champagne for my 50th birthday - even though I had told them!!). It was quiet and we found the breakfast to be typical of hotels in Rome - we have stayed in many hotels in Rome and this ranks highly. We only stayed 2 nights from the 6 - 8 September and would have gladly stayed longer. However, it is fairly expensive at over Au$1,200 per night. I am sure we would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Edward95
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel in a location right opposite the Pantheon - my wife and I had a room overlooking the historic building. There must be approx 30 rooms that do overlook the Square and Pantheon. All the major sites are within walking distance from the hotel and we used it as a base to re-charge before heading off to dine in the numerous streetside bars and restaurants nearby. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The guy's on reception speak very good English and have a fine sense of humour. The hotel is elegant, tastefully decorated and very comfortable. We took their advice and used the hotel car service to the airport which is slightly cheaper than a taxi and the cars are shiny Mercedes or Lancia's - driver also acted as a tour guide en route!! The rooms are spotless, with Sky satellite TV, a flat screen TV, lovely fruit (on arrival) and powerful showers. The beds are firm and encourage a good night's sleep. As one reviewer has said the barman on the rooftop bar (good views of Rome) is a gem. We were struggling to get a good photo at sunset but he took the camera and a chair and took some great pictures for us. All part of the service we were told! This hotel deserves more than 3 stars but may be doesn't get them because there is no restaurant other than for serving breakfast which may not be the best but is equal to most European hotel continental standards and is included in the room rate. We will definitely go back if we are lucky enough to find ourselves back in Rome again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Essence of Rome”
Reviews.Author: GrandTouring
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay in Rome, with a georgious view of the Pantheon if your room faces the charming piazza, or from the roof terrace. Step outside and you are in the middle of historical Rome, with narrow streets branching off in all directions, most of them pedestrian zones and lined with shops and restaurants. The hotel itself is elegant and spotless, with an efficient and friendly staff. If you are willing to pay the above average rates, justified by the location and the hotel features, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: mackfrance
Reviews.Content: What location could be better than opposite the Pantheon. Comfortable and scrupulously clean hotel with service more efficient than friendly. The twin beds were very narrow and the typically low wattage Italian lighting was barely sufficient to read by. The rooms and breakfast were better at Hotel Fortyseven where we stayed last time but the location of Albergo del Senato compensates for any minor quibles and we will definately return

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Stay-Location”
Reviews.Author: washingtonfeds
Reviews.Content: ASK FOR ROOM 204. It is the only room with the private balcony facing the Pantheon. The room was comparable to that of a NY City hotel room. The bed was soft and comfortable. The roomwas clean and service was great. I would absolutely go back to this Hotel in a heart beat

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding - Location & service”
Reviews.Author: Getty1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Senato during the first week of August. When I had booked the room early in the year, I asked to have at least one room on the plaza side. The Senato at the time did not promise a plaza side room, but said they would try to accomodate our request. Since we needed two rooms, one being a triple, I wanted at least one room facing the Plaza. Sooo... not only did they give us a room facing the Plaza, but they upgraded our triple to a suite and BOTH rooms were on the top floor (6th floor) with balconies overlooking the Pantheon and plaza. WOW what a view. My kids could not believe the location we had and I spent my late evening hours sitting out on the balcony watching the "show" below and taking in the Pantheon. The staff was outstanding. They had excellent suggestions for dinner, not outrageously priced (and this was more difficult than it may seem since many of the better restaurants in Rome are closed in August. They accomodated every request with a smile and friendly perspective. Breakfast was very good with enough selection to satisfy, although not overly extensive (the expresso was perfect). The rooms were very nice, not huge but more than enough space for the two of us in the double room and for the kids (three teenagers) in the triple (suite). The baths were very nice and everything was kept clean. Finally, the location for touring the historical areas of Rome cannot be beat. I would stay here again in a hearbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Customer Sevice”
Reviews.Author: thornbird45
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic location - you just can't beat opening the shutters and gazing on the Pantheon. The breakfast and the room itself were somewhere between good and very good. There are 2 reasons for staying here - a central location which is in striking distance of just about everything that you would want to see in Rome and most importantly customer service as good as any hotel that i've ever stayed in. Little touches like a bottle of bubbly on your birthday and the consistently friendly and helpful attitude of the staff are what made our stay perfect

Reviews.Title: “What a great Rome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tplimmer
Reviews.Content: So friendly and helpful. I loved the location of this hotel as it was close to all sites. I celebrated my birthday and the staff were so kind and generous towards me. I loved the rooftop patio and the views were breathtaking. Nothing but amazing things to say about this hotel! Thank you so much, Albergo del Senato for giving me a great experience in Rome. Memories will last a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: saldav9
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Albergo in August and had a wonderful time. As stated in several other reviews the location can't be beaten. We easily walked everywhere with our two children (12 & 9). We had a suite (606) overlooking the Pantheon which was great and hightly recommended. The rooms aren't huge but very comfortable. We had a balcony which meant we enjoyed the hustle and bustle of the square without the crowds! The staff are fantastic and extremely helpful. They recommended a great restaurant - Virginiae. it's an an alley, but had people queuing for tables so a reservation is essential. All in all in all we had a wonderful 4 nights and would definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AZdesertdweller1955
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 4 night stay at the Albergo del Senato. It is truly a beautiful hotel in an outstanding location (within 200 feet of the entrance to The Pantheon!!) and within walking distance of a number of other great sites in Rome. If your budget allows, we would strongly recommend considering the Albergo del Senato for your stay in The Eternal City. When we originally checked in, we were assigned a noisy first floor room with a view of an alley (Room 109) and complained to the front desk... the next day, we were given a new room (405) that looked out directly over the square leading to the Pantheon. Just what we were expecting when we made the original reservation!! Based on our experience, be sure to check your room location and view when making your reservation. The staff is extremely courteous and professional and was always willing to help with directions, taxis, etc.... although I suppose that's to be expected at a hotel that will cost between $450-500/night. A tip... be sure to check out the coffee shop located just a few short steps to the right of the hotel entrance... Tazza d' Oro... one of the best cups of cappacino we enjoyed the entire trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Charmed by the Albergo del Senato”
Reviews.Author: Love2shoppe
Reviews.Content: I was a little sceptical at first but once settled into this charming hotel, all fears were quickly dispelled. The desk staff was very helpful and talkative and I was completely fascinated by this little hotel. My room overlooked the Parthenon. What a view! It blew me away! It was adequate in size and nicely decorated. Of course, there was an in room safe provided. The bath was updated and there was a more than adequate supply of toiletries. The breakfasts were more than satisfactory to send me on a day of exhaustive touring. I never got to the roof top bar because I was too exhausted at the end of each day. I had wrapped up most evenings at the Piazza di Navonna which was very close to the hotel. Internent connection was readily available in a very pleasant setting. The location is excellent! Everything is within walking distance. I spent 3 nights at this hotel and was sorry to leave as it became my "home away from home". I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and would certainly stay there again if and when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: writingfromtheoc
Reviews.Content: This being our first trip to Rome, we wanted it to be perfect. It was -because of our stay at the Albergo del Senato. From the moment we arrived with all of our many bags of luggage to the arranging of the two taxis to take us to our next destination, it was absolutely wonderful. The front desk staff was extremely helpful with all our myriad of questions. (Although they will not cash any travelers checks -even in Euros). We booked a triple room and as that room was not available yet in the early morning when we arrived, arranged two rooms for us so that we could crash immediately at no extra charge. It was always so easy to tell the taxi drivers where to take us- we'd just say take us to the Pantheon. Almost everything is within walking distance but, it was HOT. The Pantheon--what can I say - so amazing to see it (almost touch it) from our open window at all times of the day and night with the lovely Piazza below. It was never too noisy to sleep with the shutters and windows closed and the wonderful air conditioning (it was extremely hot in August). The breakfats were just right for us to begin our heavy days of sightseeing and the drinks on the roof a welcome respite at the end of our days. We never tired of the views up there. The beds were extremely comfortable and the rooms very roomy by European standards. They arranged a pick up at the airport for us and that was perfect too. The driver gave us a wonderful tour of the city on the way to the hotel. You will not be disappointed staying here. Tips: there is a wonderful restaurant behind the hotel called Miscellanea recommended by Rick Steves- be sure to ask for the "sexy wine". Get your tickets for Palantine hill in the Roman forum area they are good for the Colliseum as well and then you skip the ticket line there ( very long). Be sure to get a copy, or just look through one, of the Rome then and Now- very interesting. Try to climb the dome of St. Peters- absolutely stunning views of the city from up there. Be sure to book a tour for the vatican museums and save yourself hours of waiting in line- priceless. Wonderful hotel- wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Italian style with American comforts”
Reviews.Author: jerseytraveler44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after a week in Tuscany, before our flight home. I have stayed in numerous hotels in Rome and none of them offered the quality, spaciousness, amenities, or comfort of Albergo del Senato. The room we had was quite large, as was the bathroom, both beautifully appointed with all the comforts I would expect from a great hotel here in the US - yet it still had all charm and style you hope to get from an Italian hotel. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. And the location simply can't be beat. It's a surreal experience to pull up to the hotel and literally be right next to the Pantheon. The view from the roof at night is stunning.

Reviews.Title: “3 star”
Reviews.Author: arieo
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel, having chosen it because of outstanding reviews. Perhaps because of the reviews I was expecting too much! This is a lovely hotel with helpful and pleasant staff. I would rate it as a good 3 star hotel. The room was pleasant but the decoration was a little worn out. The hotel is clean and public areas well kept. An earlier review commented on the need for refurbishment and it was good to read that they are planning to do this in 2008. The roof terrace has spectacular views, especially at sunset, but it is not designed to meet its full potential. It is lacking in atmosphere and quite tired. It could be a much more interesting space. Breakfast was average though coffee disappointing. We only had breakfast on the first morning. The location makes this an above average experience. I would consider staying here again post refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to another stay!”
Reviews.Author: magistraCharlotte_nc
Reviews.Content: Having enjoyed our previous two stays, will definetly stay again! Have booked a week's stay for March 2008. Loved the location, the ease of walking to all of Rome's tourist must sees! The room, breafasts and lounge areas have been great!

Reviews.Title: “Just a good 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: edm71056
Reviews.Content: Our experience of this hotel was not unpleasant but I am very surprised at the number of 5 ratings it obtainsextoling its virtues. There is no doubt that the location of the hotel on the square next to the Pantheon is spectacular and that all the main tourist attractions are within an easy walk of the hotel. All the staff we encountered were helpful and pleasant. Our hotel room was small (Room 405) but was clean and pleasantly cool (it was 38C while we were there!!). Areas that could be improved are: a) Breakfast : Very basic served in a small room that discouraged conversation because of the closeness of other guests and lack of privacy. b) No Ironing Boards (due to Fire Regulations?) : After surviving at 37000 feet for several hours our clothes needed pressing to make them respectable. The hotel price for pressing clothes is a minimum of 4 Euros an article - too expensive. c) The Rooftop Bar - Dissapointing atmosphere, needs better lighting and music. A perfect viewpoint over Rome is spoiled by lack of ambience. d) Coffee / Tea making facilities would be an advantage in the rooms. This is a good 3 Star hotel so don't expect 5 Star facilities, we would return to the hotel but they need to be careful not to over inflate their prices based on location alone.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but overrates”
Reviews.Author: bonniebchicagoil
Reviews.Content: This is a nice old hotel with a perfect location across from the Pantheon however, the rooms are not 5 star. They are ok with nicely appointed amenities and decent service but not five star quality. Their bar on top of the hotel is nice because it has a lovely view of the city however we were attacked by pigeons because the hotel has not put up any deterrants from the birds. The bartender had to keep swatting them with a pole. However, the view of the city is extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Not the great experience I'd expected”
Reviews.Author: Faience44
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I'd booked a hotel based purely on reviews from tripadvisor.com and I must say I'm a tad bemused by the praise this property has attracted. Our stay was all right, nothing more. I booked in early February, explaining that I wanted three beds in two rooms for myself, my wife and 11-year-old daughter. I settled for a junior suite at 340 Euros (about $510) a night. Closer to the time I contacted the hotel to book a car to take us in from the airport for 55 Euros because I did not want to be tackling the Fiumicino taxi ranks after crossing the Atlantic overnight. This worked out fine. The main advantage of this hotel is its excellent location. The Pantheon is in the very centre of the city and you can walk to pretty much everywhere you'd possibly want to inside 30 minutes. Only when I read the guidebooks did I realise that the Pantheon is also known for its night life. In fact, the noise from the square wasn't a problem with the windows closed. Shame the same couldn't be said for the room. We were put into Room 102 at the front of the hotel. It had a very noisy air conditioning fan and we asked how we could turn it off. "You can't. It has to be done from the reception," was the answer. The first night the system in both rooms worked the way it was supposed to, coming on intermittently. But on the second night the fan in the smaller room (with one bed) ran the whole night. We complained, they sent up a technician, who told us the fan ran the whole time. This was patently not true. The fan ran throughout the night the second night too. In some ways this was a blessing, because it helped drown out the noise from the bar below. That's right -- despite booking SIX months in advance, despite telling the hotel we had a young child, they chose to put us in the one room that was right above the bar. The thump thump of the music went on till midnight. When I complained about the air conditioning the receptionist knocked a token 20 Euros off the nightly rate. The staff were generally helpful, the breakfasts were OK, the laundry was delivered on time, the rooftop bar was absurdly overpriced. Overall our experience was tolerable, but nothing like what I'd been expecting based on reviewers. I do feel the Albergo took us for something of a ride. I won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: surfthewedge
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews in Trip Advisor, my family of four stayed in this hotel in late June 2007 for 6 nights. We were in Italy for 5 weeks and this was the first hotel we stayed in--eventually we stayed in 6 hotels. The hotel has a terrific location. The front desk staff tried very hard to be helpful--though I thought the hotel was understaffed at times. Unfortunately, the desk staff varied greatly in knowledge and communication skills. The two rooms we rented were fine and quiet. The breakfast was also adequate. The hotel was very clean and well appointed for a 3 star Italian hotel. As many reviewers have pointed out, the location of this hotel is crucial in evaluating it. The hotel itself gets 4 stars, but when combined with the location I would consider it a 5 star hotel. And I would stay there again when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sqwawk
Reviews.Content: Being first time visitors to Rome, location was important to us and I don't think you could pick a better location that the Albergo del Senato. We stayed here for 5 nights and during this time we were able to cover all the sites of historic Rome simply, and in our own time, on foot. Then in the evening, there are so many bars and restaurants nearby, the biggest effort you'll need to make is deciding which to choose. Location is not always the only part of the equation of course, and we wanted more than just a bed to sleep in at the end of the day. We chose the Senato based on the many positive Trip Advisor reviews and once again, TA has not let us down. I feel unable to comment on the size of the rooms as were upgraded and placed in the apartment on floor 5. However, the comfort of the bed and cleanliness of the rooms was first class. Breakfast was a simple continental affair, but very tasty and included in the price. In the evening, make sure you call into the bar on the roof terrace as the view from there across the rooftops of Rome is simply fantastic. Overall we had a fantastic time at this hotel, and I cannot think of a single thing that disappointed us about the Senato. Once again Trip Advisor users get top marks and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: waileagirl
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel, perfect location! My husband and I stayed here for three nights before our Med. cruise. The location is outstanding in the heart of the city center. Trevi, Navona, Campo de fiore, ignazio, all a few minutes walk away. Wonderful night live on the square! The hotel is very comfortable. Small european rooms, ours with a stunning view overlooked the pantheon with a nice little balcony. Roof top bar is nice, but pricey. Staff in lobby were very helpful and friendly. ( All speak perfect english.) Breakfast buffet is very good and included with your stay. I highly recommend this hotel. It may be a few euros more than most, but the location makes it worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the Del Senato”
Reviews.Author: KMDA
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this hotel. My husband and I have stayed here 5 times over the last 7 years. The rooms on the 6th floor are totally worth the extra money as they have beautiful balcony views into the Piazza Della Rotundo -one of the most romantic views of the city. The location is perfect - walking distance to everything in the historical center as well as via veneto and the villa borghese park. Stay here and you will not be disappointed! Don't miss the rooftop bar - Michael is the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Book this Hotel and you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: RichMaidstone
Reviews.Content: What can I say, all the reviews about this hotel are true. My wife and I spent two nights here and loved every minute. The hotel is in a great location right next to the Pantheon, within walking distance to all the major sites and fantastic restaurants. As seasoned travellers we've been to a number of hotels but I have never been so impressed with how helpful and friendly the staff were. Don't waste your time looking anywhere else, just book this hotel you won't be disappointed. A couple of tips. If you plan to visit the Colosseum, book your tickets using the official website first to avoid the long queues. Also expect to pay around 10 euros for a taxi from the train station to the city centre. Avoid the taxi touts who claim it will cost 30 euros!. Just jump in a white cab and make sure the meter is running and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scottiemom
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the positive reviews here, and the photos of its proximity to the Pantheon, and I can't say enough good things about it. It's a beautiful hotel in a perfect location. We booked a quad room to accommodate us and our two kids, and the size and layout were ideal. Everything in the room was perfect, including the beautifully painted ceiling. The staff was uniformly nice and helpful, and the breakfasts were great, even by the standards of two teenagers to whom breakfast is very important. Best of all, we could step outside and stroll over to the magnificent Pantheon, and in the evenings enjoy all the activity in the square from a seat in one of the cafes. As first time visitors to Rome, we had very busy days seeing all the sights, and we looked forward to the hotel as our oasis at the end of the day. Our thanks to all of the staff who made us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: Peregrinatio
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. Hospitable staff. Clean. Modern. Spent two nights there. Requested a room overlooking the Piazza della Rotonda, but there was nothing available the first night. Had a small room with a window that opened up to a center block, with little light. But the room was exceptionally clean. The staff informed me the next morning by 9 a.m. that a room had opened up with a better view. It was already cleaned and ready to be occupied and they offered to move my things. I would definitely staff there again when in Rome. The online rates were good, but received a better deal by calling directly.

Reviews.Title: “Another room with a view”
Reviews.Author: doognlol
Reviews.Content: After finding out about the Albergo del Senato through Trip Advisor about a year ago, my wife and I and five of our family decided to book rooms at the hotel for June 2007. I am amazed at the recent criticism of the hotel posted on Trip Advisor as we have nothing but praise for the hotel and staff. Before we arrived, all of our e-mails had been answered promptly by the hotel staff. The hotel also booked cars to pick us up at Fiumicino airport. We were allocated four rooms which were dotted about the hotel and each one was more than satisfactory. My wife and I had a fourth floor bedroom which had a large window which allowed us to look directly at our favourite building in Rome - the Pantheon. One of my sisters in law, who had travelled from Canada, had a sixth floor room with balcony and she was delighted with the room and view from her balcony. The rest of the family would also congregate on her balcony at times to enjoy the view. The bed in our room was one of the most comfortable I have slept in any hotel both during the many times we have visited Italy and during my frequent business trips to help pay for our holidays in Italy. The bed linen was fine and the room was spotless. Our family had nothing but praise for their rooms. Unlike some recent reviewers, we found the check-in staff to be pleasant and helpful. The breakfast staff were also fine. Breakfast was typical of many hotels in Italy and more than sufficient for us. Ham, salami, cheese, cereals, yoghurts, cakes, coffee, tea, juices etc were all available. My wife and I have always considered that breakfast is only a stop gap to tide us over before we can try the variety of osterias and restaurants available. The area around the Pantheon was no exception with a wide choice of places to try and we did not have one bad meal during our 5 days in Rome. My wife and I do not accept bad service and certainly we have no complaints about the service from the Senato. We will certainly return to the hotel on our next trip to Rome and we would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location In Town !”
Reviews.Author: beentoeurope
Reviews.Content: I just finished a trip to France and Italy for my birthday 7/7/07. From the moment I arrived, the front desk staff checked me into my room with a professional european style that made me feel like a celebrity. My room had a very nice bathroom,closet and a wonderful view. But, the best part is step out of the hotel and you are in a wondeful location. All the major tourist locations are a short walking distance with the right directions! I can't say enough about this hotel the experience for me was 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull location!”
Reviews.Author: tk_way
Reviews.Content: Went there in June this year, and it was lovely. Very nice hotel management, the room was not too spacious, but clean and nice beds, good airconditioning, and not a sound to be heard from the piaza! (we were staying in a room at the side) I'm a spoiled traveler, and I've stayed in some very nice hotels during the last years (Kempinski in St.Moritz, Windsor Arms in Toronto), but this hotel was very nice. Honestly, breakfast was disappointing, you had to wait for a table, because they didn't have enough space, and there was not a lot to choose from. But the location (!!!) made everything perfect, what a way to start and end the day, looking out on the beautifull Pantheon. The staff was very friendly and helpfull, something I did not expect from such a touristic place like Rome. I booked the room through e-mail after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. I'll be looking again for my next hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Lance11
Reviews.Content: Five nights in June. Excellent location. Breakfast was inadequate. Our Senior Suite @ 530 Euro had a very nice balcony and view Pantheon but was the size of a postage stamp and not even remotely commensurate with the picture of a suite on their website and brochure. Furthermore, the furniture and bathroom fixtures were very tattered and platting completely removed from all faucets; all in serious need of upgrade and replacement. I asked Luca at the Front Desk to have either the Assistant Hotel Manager or Hotel Manager to call me or come to my suite; however, nobody ever responded.

Reviews.Title: “lovely Albergo el Seanto”
Reviews.Author: rapjkp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights at the Albergo in the beginning of June. Great locaton . We were given a room with a view of the Pantheon. Double glazed windows and wooden shutters( that are easlily closed at night ) keep all but the loudest noises out. I booked the room myself through their internet website and there were no problems at all. The front desk was always very helpful for taxis and recommendations. Service from the airport was flawless. Terrace on the roof was wonderful before and after dinner for cocktails, although the bartender could have used some help at the busiest times. Overall this is a very good hotel with a great location .

Reviews.Title: “Are Reservations Open?”
Reviews.Author: Wallongy
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I was unable to visit this hotel since they do not respond to emails and calls regarding reservations. The front desk manager requested to send an email which was received however until now there is no response after having called international to Italy twice and having emailed twice. I would love to review the experience however my initial experience is not a positive one.

Reviews.Title: “location out of this world!!”
Reviews.Author: elaine-7
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I stayed at the Albergo del Senato at the begining of June based upon the recommendations from trip advisor and we were certainly not disappointed with the location. Steps away from the awesome Pantheon and the views from the roof top terrace at night were breathtaking. Looking out towards Michelangelo's famous dome of St Peter's Basillia was quite moving!
