We were happy with our triple room and had plenty of room for the short time that we stayed in doors as you just have to get out and explore all that Rome has to offer. We ate at restaurants around the pantheon and Trastervere area and were not disappointed, finishing our nights off with cocktails in the Campo de Fiori square, which gets really busy at night time. We also found the breakfast simple but sufficient and the fact that seating is until ten o clock meant a welcome lie in could be had after a hard days sightseeing! One word of caution though, whilst we would not say that the staff at Albergo del Senato were rude during our stay, we certainly did not experience the friendliness that so many other trip advisors have commented upon. Whether this is because the hotel feels that they do not have to try as hard now that they are the number one hotel, I do not know, but we found the staff to be a little abrupt and each time we entered to hotel we found ourselves accosted by the front desk demanding to know whether we we paying guests, making us feel somewhat frumpy and unwelcome! However, Michele who resides within the roof top bar was extremely welcoming and so skilled at his job and that he made up for the other staff's lack of benevolence. Would we stay at the Albergo del Senato again, probably, if it was only for the fabulous location!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Chevron7
Reviews.Content: We (wife and 11 year old daughter) just returned from an 12 day trip to Italy a few days ago and I wanted to provide feedback on our stay. We stayed 6 nights at the Albergo del Senato in Rome. I booked the hotel primarily on reviews I had read on TripAdvisor. I was a little insecure about it because the hotel wasn't even mentioned in several of the guidebooks (Frommer's etc.) I have to say the hotel exceeded my expectations. First of all, the staff was terrific. "Mauro" checked us in and was extremely welcoming. After about 15 hours of travel, he understood how we felt and made it easy to get to our room and was available to us our entire stay with solid restaurant recommendations, advise or helping us out any way he could. The rest of the staff from front desk, maid, to the breakfast help were all first rate. Our room was somewhat smaller than American hotels, but quiet, clean and nice. The bathroom was large by European standards and was a plus since there were three of us. I was concerned about the close proximity to the Pantheon at first, since it is just across the street. I thought it would be too close to the constant tourist traffic. As it turned out, I thought it was the perfect location. Noise was never a problem and It put us within walking distance of everything. 5 minutes to Piazza Novona, Spanish Steps 15 minutes, Vatican 20 minutes, Trastavere 15 minutes, Colloseum 15 to 20 minutes. We have done a fair amount of traveling (Paris, New York, Munich) and I like a certain comfort level. I fully recommend Albergo del Senato. We were glad we stayed there and felt we made the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: frontrowfemale
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel after reading reviews on this site and wasn't disappointed. Stayed here in January of this year. The location is incredible- looking out over the Pantheon. The rooms were a little old fashioned and a little on the small side but very clean. Great value for money. Breakfast is continental so be prepared for that if you are used to a fry up...however, there is a McDonalds accross the street if you need a fix. All the main shops are within walking distance, and there is a large taxi rank just up the street. Would definitely stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING,EXCELLENT,MAGICAL,PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: abascal
Reviews.Content: WOW, our experience at the Albergo del Senato was fantastic. We have stayed in many hotels in Europe, but with this hotel we had no problems. The STAFF was wondeful,helpful and very pleasant. The room size was great, the bed was comfortable, the view awesome. The Albergo del Senato thinks of everything for your needs, I mean everything. The LOCATION, you couldn't have a better place. Our stay in Rome this time will be our most pleasant memory, THANKS TO ALBERGO del SENATO. Everything you want to see is within 10-15 minutes from this hotel. We have a large family and we called them from the hotel and told them to go to the WEB CAM site the hotel has and look for us at the plaza steps in front of the hotel. Our grandkids were very happy to see us waving to them from the plaza. Although, the people in the plaza thought we may be crazy waving up to the roof of the hotel. We HIGHLY recommend the Albergo del Senato.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: raynard
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Albergo and had a lovely stay. The room was a good size. There was a welcome basket of fruit. We overlooked the Pantheon and the Square, the room was very nicely decorated and quiet. The staff are very friendly and helfpul. The breakfast was good with a good variety of choices. We would definately stay there again as it is very central to all the sites. Lovely, lovely Hotel. My favourite thing about the Hotel was the roof top tarrace bar overlooking the City, wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jo_DaveNotts_UK
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful 3 nights at the Sonato. Our room No.406 had a fantastic view of the Pantheon. It was a birthday surprise for my fiance, the wonderful staff and the location made it a momerable occasion. The extra little touches made all the difference. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “What a View!”
Reviews.Author: KNBDenver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo del Senato for 3 nights. Our room, number 605, overlooked the Pantheon and had a small balcony. The room was well appointed, but on the small size. When we arrived there was a plate of fresh fruit waiting for us. A very nice touch. The hotel lobby is very pretty and the staff very accommodating. The breakfast was adequate, with an array of cereals, yogurt, pastries, coffee, fruit juices, etc. This hotel is centrally located to most historical sites. We walked to the Vatican, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and the Colosseum. Even though there was a lot of activity outside our hotel in the evenings, due to restaurants in the piazza, it was quiet when we closed the windows and shutters. As other people have mentioned, the view from the rooms overlooking the Pantheon are amazing. We would definitely stay here again. Thank you to everyone at del Senato for a truly memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfezione!”
Reviews.Author: DebFL
Reviews.Content: My husband suprised me for our anniversary with a trip to Rome. He reserved the plane and I the hotel. After extensive research I chose the Albergo del Senato. What an excellent choice! The hotel is superb! Our room, 603, had a balcony looking onto the Piazza della Rotunda where the PANTHEON resides. Amazing! The room is nicely appointed, clean, quiet, comfortable bed, good AC, nice bathroom and even has robes to lounge around in. The buffet breakfast is delicious and a great start to your day. At night the roof-top lounge has breathtaking views and excellent service. The hotel's excellent location is within walking distance from most sites. The staff at Albergo are exceptional! They booked a car to and from the airport (55eu each way) and after a 9 hour plane ride allowed us early check-in. Mauro was especially helpful, he recommended and reserved great places for dining. We loved "Armando" al Patheon near the hotel. A quaint family run trattoria with an excellent server, Fabiana, who found humur in my husbands poor attempts to speak Italian. Mauro also facilitated the purchase of a Leonardo D'Aniello ring I saw in the hotel curio. The beautiful handcrafted jewelry is one of a kind and the Italian speaking husband and wife team are delightful. To make the purchase flawless, Maria Laura from Albergo translated for us via telephone. We truly appreciate Albergo del Senato and the staff for making this a memorable experience. We highly recommend this hotel. E stati veramente un piacere conoscerti! .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TanyaP
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on other reviews here and we were not disappointed. What a great location! Surprisingly, you do not hear the noise from the Piazza once in the hotel. Our room was #304, which is shown in a hotel photo. Ask for this room -- you're at eye level with the portico of the Pantheon. Hotel is lovely and so clean. We saw our maid scrubbing the wood floor in our room. We totally enjoyed our stay here -- staff was personable and knowledgable. An excellent hotel all around.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Albergo del Senato”
Reviews.Author: dannmike
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 days at the Senato and it was fantastic from beginning to end. Lovely staff, Michele the barman is a great guy! Rooms 310 and 318 are lovely and large and in the back of the hotel, so tranquil there. I would recommend this hotel with the highest honors!!!! Fantastic location, right in the middle of everything. Go there and see for yourself!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in in Rome”
Reviews.Author: nangela
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. Beauty, elegance, wonderful wonderful staff, and the best location in Rome overlooking the Pantheon, my favorite place. Our room was on the sixth floor with a balcony over looking the Panthon piazza. It was just beautiful and such a treat to wake up in the morning and see the piazza emply with the sun rising. This memory will be with me always. We arrived in Rome, dropping off a rental car at Fiumacino airport. I contacted the hotel to see if we could arrange a pick up. They arranged the entire thing. When we arrived at the airport, I had difficulty finding the drop off area, and we were about 45 minutes to an hour late. We were exhausted and when we finally arrived a tthe drop off center, the driver was waiting there for us. We felt so taken care of. It was one of those experiences traveling that one never forgets. This little vignette encapsulizes the incredible service that we received during our entire stay at this hotel, from the time we booked until the moment we left. There are many wonderful small restaurants right around the hotel. One, called Antonio's was really special. I think I will always want to stay here whenever I go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christine72a
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights in this wonderful hotel. We took advantage of the limo pick up service from the airport (55 euros) and were glad we did as there was a taxi strike that day. Our room #306 had an amazing view which overlooked the Pantheon and Piazza. The room was very clean and comfortable with a large bed and a marble tiled bathroom. The rooftop terrace bar was lovely. The staff are all very friendly, helpful and efficient. It's location could not be better as it is central for all of the main sight seeing attractions. Our stay was to celebrate a special birthday for my partner and on the evening of his birthday a maid arrived with a bottle of champagne and a hand written card wishing him a happy birthday from the management which was a lovely touch. We both thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Albergo and can see why it is the number one rated hotel on trip advisor. I would highly recommend it to anyone and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Splendid Place”
Reviews.Author: rysdale
Reviews.Content: We were booked at hotel Raffaello -- a sister property in town-- but our room had problems so they put us up in this hotel for one night. it was such a treat and i wish we could have stayed the week. it was a great location to explore the Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, and just wander around the section in rome. Even right on the plaza it was so quiet at night. Comfy beds too and very clean. We were given a suite because of the problems -- Room 101 which had a downstairs living room and a bedroom up in a loft. very nice upgrade! The gelato place next door (out and to the right) was excellent. There are lots of good small restaurants nearby and the staff at the front desk was very friendly and helpful in giving us tips. I would recommend this but it was not as central to the train station and metros as some of the other hotels we have stayed in, which was important to me. if you are able to cab it everywhere, its really magical and seeing the Pantheon at night and in the crowds is unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “simply magic”
Reviews.Author: chrisinthegarden
Reviews.Content: Our stay - to celebrate our silver anniversary - was made extra special by the superb position, room, facilties and helpful staff. It was our first time in Rome and an ideal location - you walk out of the hotel door and face the 2,000 year old Pantheon. Most of the best roman experiences are within walking distence, We tossed coins in the fountain and decided that when we return, it will be to Albergo Del Senato

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location great price”
Reviews.Author: SheffHotelreviewer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Senato last October/November and loved it so much we went back in January! It is slap bang in the middle of everything - we saw all the major sights and walked to each of them. The hotel itself had somewhat mixed reviews mainly due to room size - and yes the rooms weren't huge, but who goes to Rome to stay in the room?? The hotel was spotless, friendly and comfortable. I have already recommended this hotel to friends and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to you too!

Reviews.Title: “Does it get any better in Rome?”
Reviews.Author: NSLPTV
Reviews.Content: I swore I'd never go back to the same hotel in the same city ... until I came to the Albergo del Senato. You really cannot get a better hotel in Rome, in such a great location. Its central to all of the major sights, including the Pantheon which is ... erm ... 30 yards away! The rooms are of the highest quality, and the spotless marble bathrooms cannot be faulted. Open the louvred shutters of your bedroom window and look down upon Piazza della Rotonda with the Pantheon to your left - it really doesn't get any better. However, if you do want a better view, and there is, then take the lift and stairs to the roof top terrace where the excellent Michele will serve you drinks as you look across the rooftops of Rome. As I'm typing this, I want to go back again! Any downsides? Well, the lifts have to be the smallest in the known universe - 3 people is a squeeze! And, given the quality of the hotel, along with its unbeatable location, it isn't exactly cheap. But, honestly, that's it. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. If you go to Rome, stay in the Albergo del Senato. P.S. Nothing to do with the hotel - The taxi journey from the airport to the hotel makes Mad Max look like a 5 year old in a toy peddle car. Be afraid - be very afraid!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: Cruzer2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night post-cruise stay at the Albergo Del Senato hotel. First of all, much to our incredible delight, we were upgraded to the deluxe suite upon arrival. Since this journey was for our 27th anniversary, it was an excellent surprise. However, no one knew this, nor did we request an upgrade. Rather than go into the spectacular details, I believe you can see this suite on their website. The staff, facility, location, breakfast and ammenities were all as perfect as other guests have stated. To be honest, I was skeptical about all the rave reviews, but I need not have been. Everything about this hotel is great. I would highly recommend this hotel, and we would most certainly return without ever researching other places. It really is worth it. Thank you to Maria and all the professional staff at the Albergo Del Senato!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - we took our children 5y and 3y.”
Reviews.Author: mum-2-2
Reviews.Content: We took our 2 young children for four nights. The hotel is perfectly situated in a large pedestrianised plaza. We had a suite (Rm 606) with a balcony that looked onto the square and you could almost touch the Pantheon if you leant out far enough!! The suite has 2 seperate rooms, which are not large, but fine by European standards with one bathroom and the children had to share a double bed but that was fine. Breakfast was much better than I had been led to believe- cereal, cooked eggs and bacon, croissant and rolls, and the expressos were great. The staff are wonderful and nothing was too much trouble, They had some great dinner recommendations and everywhere is in easy walking distance. We walked to the Colliseum, Spanish Steps, on the park beyond ( where we hired a cycle rickshaw) and to the Vatican. Highly recommend this hotel. It is actually amazingly quiet- perhaps because we were on the 6th floor, but we were never kept awake by noise or light (fine shutters).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Albergo del Senato”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelPlanner
Reviews.Content: My husband, three children and I just returned from a fabulous vacation in Italy. We stayed at the lovely Albergo del Senato for 4 nights...I cannot speak highly enough of this beautiful property and gracious staff. The hotel was elegant and comfortable-- including the beds! The staff (especially Mauro) were some of the most helpful I have ever encountered. The staff were so kind to my children-- the Italians do really seem to enjoy and indulge children. Our first morning they presented each of my children with his/her own pot of hot chocolate that was like hot pudding. I am so grateful; they really made us feel special. And you can't imagine how astounding it is to open your window and be, literally, right next to the pantheon! This hotel is also well located to reach all of the Rome attractions by foot or by bus. We will return to this hotel-- it was worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything!”
Reviews.Author: Navtrad
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from spending a faboulous Easter at the Albergo Del Senato. I have not filed a review on TripAdvisor before, but I feel that this hotel really does warrant making the effort. We had requested a room with a view and, to our delight, the receptionist was happy to inform us on arrival that we had one. We were on the first floor and the window looked directly onto the Pantheon and the square. The buzz from the square from early morning to late night was fantastic. We walked to all of the major tourist sites (including the Vatican) but there was also an abundance of bars, cafe's and restaurants all within an easy stroll of the hotel - useful for recovering when you have overdone the walking during the day! Having found this hotel on TripAdvisor when it was rated #3, and booking based on the comments, I have been monitoring the reviews since and was delighted to see that the Albergo Del Senato is now rated #1. In my opinion, this is well deserved. The staff were extremely friendly, helpful & prompt - ringing restaurants to enquire about making a reservation, allowing us to use their PC and printer to checkin for our return flight, sorting out a mistake with the booking of our limousine service to take us back to the airport.... nothing was too much trouble. Our room was small, but had everything we needed, was clean, nicely decorated and serviced promptly each day. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes to be right in the heart of things and who appreciates good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel;Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoFrequentFlyer
Reviews.Content: We just checked out this morning after having stayed at the Albergo Del Senato for the past week. I had read great reviews over the internet on this hotel and they were all true. The customer service level of the staff was incredible. The free breakfast was very good. The room and the shower were comfortable and clean. The small bar was quaint and the bartender - Michele - was very pleasant. My husband and I travel a lot and have no problem with complaining when it is warranted, but this hotel deserves kudos. Further, the location can't be beat. We were able to walk to the Vatican, the Gallery Borghese, and the Colloseum from this hotel with no problems. You can't go wrong with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: suzeckes
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect. A splurge for us, but well worth it. Location is magnificient. Hotel is quet, elegant...good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TXHillCountry
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the Albergo del Senato. My husband and I just returned from a stay at the del Senato. We booked a package through Air France and had a choice of hotels. I used TripAdvisor to read reviews of each of the hotels offered. Based on the reviews I had read here, I booked the Albergo del Senato. All of the comments that are posted by the other reviewers are true. This hotel is much better than a three-star hotel. We had a lovely room, with a queen-size bed, that did not look out over the Pantheon, which made our room very quiet and absolutely no street noise. Since there are crowds on the piazza all day and most of the evening, I consider having a room not looking out to the Pantheon a definite advantage. Our room was just spotless as was all of the hotel. The breakfast room is lovely and we really enjoyed the breakfast. There was a variety of baked goods, fresh fruits, cereals, etc. And again, the staff was very pleasant and efficient. We walked everywhere, even to the Galleria Borghese. Walking from the del Senato was so convenient. There are shops and restaurants and churches all around. It really is centrally located and so easy from which to navigate. My husband and I both were ill (yes, we drank the tap water - big mistake!). The front desk personnel and the housekeeping staff were absolutely wonderful. They made sure we had everything we needed and were comfortable. When my husband did not find an open pharmacy on the piazza, the front desk called a pharmacy to make sure it was open before directing my husband there. If I had to be sick on a vacation, this hotel is definitely the place to do it. This is a fabulous hotel, I would book it again, and I would recommend it to any of my friends traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service excellent - another brilliant review”
Reviews.Author: sue-and-shane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Senato beginning of March for a 4 night stay. After a very bumpy start (ie flight cancelled on morning of trip after we'd actually boarded!!!!) the Senato were brilliant - we had to rearrange another flight for the following day and they gladly moved our booking forward another day (which meant it went into the weekend) and they made a very bad morning a lot easier. And all without any extra charge. Unfortunately we did not have a room with a view over the piazza even though we had requested it (probably due to the late change in our booking!!) however the hotel itself was excellent - we stayed in room 311 which had a side view of the pantheon. The location of the hotel couldn't be any better and that what makes it so special - right next to the Pantheon and within walking distance to all the sights. The Piazza itself was wonderful - plenty of places to sit, eat and drink (although a little pricey - worth every penny). All in all if we ever go back to Rome (and we do hope to) then i would certainly go back to the Senato (and being quite fussy i don't often say that!!)

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: GigiATL
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Albergo del Senato. The location couldn't be more ideal. It was the perfect location for walking to everything from the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Campo di Fiori, Piazza Navona - we were perfectly situated to walk to everything. The hotel was very nice, the staff very friendly. We appreciated the opportunity to check emails in the hotel bar. We were in room 501, a suite, and absolutely loved it. While we would have enjoyed having a view of the Piazza, it was noisy enough in our room so I imagine rooms directly fronting the piazza would be even louder. But the din ebbed early enough for us to get a good night's sleep. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “The best! Great Location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Keith_Richards
Reviews.Content: ...we've just come back, booked three rooms with our friends for a 4-day city break - what a find, booked on recommendation of trip advisor reports. We all checked in within minutes, great welcome and great rooms... we then left the hotel straight away... bang in the centre of historic Rome, no need for a taxi, took in the atmosphere right outside the hotel with a few drinks in hand, then took the advice not to eat in the restaurants on the square but found some great places a few streets away walking directly opposite away from the hotel (the hotel staff cans advise you). Tip: if you want to eat on the hotel square the restaurant directly opposite next to the 'salami' shop is good for a lunchtime snack, and salami shop is also good). WHAT ABOUT THE LOCATION: Over the next few days we walked to most of the main attractions from the hotel without the need of taxis - stopping on route for drinks and coffees, the Vatican is about a thirty minute walk and the Colloseum-Forum the same (both of which are the furthest you will ever need to walk), Trevi fountain, Pantheon etc are no more than a lazy 15-20 minute strole. Tip: if you want to see Rome from a birds eye view, go to the Vatican early and take the lift to the the top of St.Peters dome - amazing!!!! When you visit the crypt below St.Peters you can not help but feel the change in atmoshere and the increadible vibe - gets v.busy so get up early; you've been advised. The Vatican Museums are also amazing - if you love your art, put plenty time aside and go very early - time was short so we cherry picked the best rooms. One of our party loves Guinness, and if needs must there is a good bar only 10 mins away that can help you out - odly enough no ex-pats only locals / my choice was the great old wine bars serving what the Italians do best / Cul De Sac had some fantastic wines and snacks - some of the best I've ever had. WHAT ABOUT THE HOTEL: Can't say a lot more than what previous people have mentioned... all very very good. There are two bars, one on the roof and one on the ground floor (small, but ideal while waiting for everyone to get ready, being a male it took me 1-2 minutes to put a shirt and jacket together and head for the bar, where I met my other male travellers and then we waited and hour or so for our partners, who being female took ages, perfect) - the barman gave well above avarage service, making all sorts of cocktail nibbles while we drank during our stay. The hotel is for every one, couples, singles, families and small groups... in the way of food there is only breakfast in a smallish but smart dining room, but this is good and again the staff made the difference, plenty of coffee, tea, fruit, meats, cakes, breads, cheese, cereals, juices and scrambled eggs / no cooked breakfasts. We did not find this a problem - when you have so many places to eat to choose from on your doorstep - the idea is to go out and explore the local area - felt very safe at night when walking back to the hotel which is a great plus. CONCLUSION: When I go back, and I've thrown my coin over my should into the Trevi Fountain, I will have no problem in re-booking or recommending this great hotel to my friends and family... in fact I'm already making plans now it was that good a trip, more so than any other I've been on. Many thanks to the Hotel Staff and manager... who told us our wives had run off with some local Italian men for the night and wouldn't be back to late - we were amused - nice John Cleese sort of guy in the best possible way!

Reviews.Title: “Fabalous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RebelChic
Reviews.Content: This was a gorgous hotel with very friendly staff. It was very clean and very central to all the main tourist attractions in Rome. From our hotel room we were looking out on the Pantheon. I could not speak highly enough of this hotel and would definitly recomend it to family and friends

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, staff, rooms”
Reviews.Author: nattyroe
Reviews.Content: wonderful location overlooking the pantheon. excellent staff, service, amenities, breakfast was outstanding (actually had scrambled eggs!). would def stay here again. was a little pricey, but overall a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, fab location”
Reviews.Author: topmanWorcester
Reviews.Content: Terrific location, cheerful staff, clean rooms. The only negative comment would be that the rooms didn't seem to be very soundproof - it sounded like we were sharing a bathroom sometimes! Overall though, definitely recommended and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Helenesays
Reviews.Content: Thank you LUCA, SALVATORE and SARAH for a wonderful stay. The Mini apartment was wonderful for us and the children. Whilst we lacked the amazing view it gave us the luxurious, clean, spacious, comfortable and practical (kitchenette) accommodation that we needed for 6 nights. Its all been said before but having trudged the streets of Rome for 7 days, this really is the place to stay. Beautiful, peaceful (from car noise) and central. Thank you once again. The Dillistone-Miller's

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Oliv
Reviews.Content: Belfast, visitors. It was BRILLIANT. The Scottish visitor has just said it, we can't actually add anything more that would convince a visitor to Rome to visit this hotel. The rooms were lovely, the view was amazing. The receptionist, breakfast staff to housekeeping, I've never stayed anywhere as welcoming as they were at the Albergo Del Senato. It was our first time in Rome and we were there with our 70 year old mother and she was made to feel extremely special, which was perfect. The location couldn't be better, Very safe with lots of police around, the Pantheon is beautiful, and the restaurants in the square at the hotel, were lovely also. We went on two tours with www.edenwalks.com our tour guide was Brilliant and made Rome come to life, I would recommend the sunset tour especially if you arrive in the afternoon, it is a GREAT way to get your bearings and amazing to be told all about the sites whilst they're lit up, our other tour was the Vatican , this guy (Grant) really knew so much it was amazing. Enjoy if you go.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!”
Reviews.Author: Jaunters
Reviews.Content: Believe the fact that this hotel is totally excellent. The staff cannot do enough for you - we went to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday and they made every effort to make sure it was special by giving us a nice room with a fabulous view of the Pantheon. Mauro on reception in particular was most helpful with general advice on sightseeing and restaurant selection. The breakfast is quite adequate to start the day with a good selection. This hotel is in a perfect location to explore Rome on foot and there is an abundance of restaurants in the immediate area. Would not stay anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Drive2crew
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding... really a great location, desk staff were extremely helpful and accomodating. We opted for a view looking out over the Pantheon and were extremely impressed. It's close to about anything you want to do in Rome. For the price... a great value. The bed was extremely comfortable, the staff quickly remembered us and were always friendly and bending over to help us enjoy our visit

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gb1967
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Albergo Del Senato was perfect. We booked a triple room so that our 4 year old could have her own bed and it turned out she had a small separate room. We also had a view of the Pantheon which was incredible. The staff at the hotel made us all feel very welcome and pampered. Each made a fuss over our daughter. One night the bartender even made her a special "cocktail" which she loved. I did not ask if the hotel could arrange for a babysitter, but think now that I probably could have with great results. We could walk absolutely everywhere we wanted to go from the hotel. Along with tourist attractions there were great restaurants and coffee shops nearby. I would tell anyone going to Rome to consider staying at the Albergo Del Senato. It was a bit expensive but I thought it was well worth every Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Extremely Central”
Reviews.Author: ny.novice
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a family break in Rome. Stayed at the Albergo Del Senato after studying many reviews of hotels in Rome. We were not dissappointed. We asked for a quad room as we were travelling with the kids - so we did not expect the best room. We were given an apartment at the back of the hotel - so no views - however two double sofa beds, a kitchen area, dining table for six and upstairs a seperate bedroom and bathroom for myself and my husband. The room was quiet and spacious.The staff were very polite, friendly and helpful. Loved Rome, would thoroughly recommned it to anyone. We took a few guided tours wth a company called Angel Tours, this definately enhanced our experience of The Vatican, Sistine, St Peters, Colliseum, Forum and Pantheon. We even were taken out for an expresso by one of the guides. Would also like to make a special mention of Il Margutta Ristorarte ([--]) a fabulous find. A vegetarian restaurant close to Spanish Steps and Il Popolo offering a buffet lunch to die for !!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: MariaHeather
Reviews.Content: Thank you Tripadvisor, you have never steered us wrong! My husband and I have just returned from a very memorable three day stay at the Albergo del Senato...It was our first visit to Rome and it was way too long overdue. Upon arrival, we were welcomed by Salvatore with such genuine warmth and courtesy that I just knew we were in for a treat...a wonderful first impression! The hotel is positively charming and it's location overlooking the awesome Pantheon is fantastic....Most of the sights are within walking distance and for those further afield there is a taxi rank accross the street...The rooms are immaculate and have extremely comfortable King size beds...bathrooms are very well appointed and there is buckets of hot water to soak in after a long days sightseeing. There is also Sky tv for all the news and sport. Outside on the Piazza della Rotunda there are numerous restaurants of the Pasta/Pizza variety and any we tried were very good! There are also two lovely ice cream parlours well worth a visit... When we would return to the hotel in the evening there was a real sense of homecoming and we were always greeted by our name and with a welcome smile, which is impressive! There is nothing surer than Rome will see us again and I know we will head straight back to the Senato where we were received so well...A big Thank You to Mauro, Salvatore and Laura for their friendliness and also to all the rest of the staff whose names we didn't get...Maria Heather, Dublin, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: PJDublin
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfull hotel, beautiful location with the awesome pantheon on door step. Friendly and helpfull staff. Great service in breakfast room.Good cafe and restaurant advice from front desk staff. Was such a positive experience for my wife and I that I am sending my parents in march for their 40th wedding anniversary. Will be returning myself before long hopefully at a time when roof terrace is open. Airport pick up service takes a lot of hassle out of arrival and is recommended.This hotel has got it right and hopefully things will stay that way, highly recommended. We took a jr suite with pantheon view in january, suite with view apparently unavailable due to renovation at time of my booking.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: BostonStephanie
Reviews.Content: The Albergo del Senato is older, however the rooms have been thoughtfully renovated to maintain the charm. Rooms are immaculately clean, with comfortable beds which get new linen daily. The bathroom was large enough, and there was plenty of hot water. There was the occasional funky smell emmanating from the drains, but this is typical of hotels in older sections of European cities. Nice touches were the slippers and bathrobe, and turndown service. The Albergo Del Senato is situated on the Piazza della Rotunda across from the Pantheon. Our room looked directly at the pediment of the Pantheon, the best preserved ancient Roman temple in the world. Since the streets are closed to traffic, except for the occasional taxi, the only noise were from the tourists hanging around the fountain below, and one lone wailing beggar. I imagine that in summer, the noise level might be problematic. The front desk staff (Piero, Rafaelo, and Mauro) were always very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was ample, and of good quality. The buffet included scrambled eggs, cereals, yoghurt, coissants, various pastries, cheese, salami, ham, fruit, and more. I would stay here again for the service and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Break”
Reviews.Author: MagsGlasgow
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Rome within the last year. We managed to book 2 triple rooms through last.minute.com and got a great deal over 4 days. Our group consisted of 5 women let loose in Rome without our kids or partners. The hotel was superb, the staff very friendly and extremely helpful. Our rooms were at the side, a good size and very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was filling and meant we just had a small snack at Lunchtime. We would recommend it to family and friends and hopefully will be back in Rome and will of course stay in this hotel. One small gripe, no tea/coffee-making facilities in the rooms which we missed.

Reviews.Title: “Sshhhh! Let's keep this our secret...”
Reviews.Author: yereverluvinsis
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day stay at this hotel. My husband and I are lucky enough to be very well travelled and to be honest would not normally stay at a 3 star hotel; however, I am very glad we have found this jewel. It has an unbeatable location within 10 metres of the Pantheon and is superbly central, saving time in your day as everywhere is walkable (cut your toenails, wear flatties and keep your pointy black boots for the evening so you blend in). We were greeted by Mauro who is the best Manager I have ever enountered; unfailingly polite without fawning, knowledgable, honest and good looking! He recommended several excellent restaurants including an outstanding fish one (Gabrielli's?) which was eye wateringly expensive (he had warned us) and a spit from the hotel. Our junior suite was on the 2nd floor which was high enough to gain an impressive view of the square and I was only sorry the rooftop bar was closed as it was winter. Any gripes? Well, hardly. The breakfast room is too small for the size of the hotel so be prepared to queue or go early or late, and what you have read about the orange juice is true - just don't drink it. That's about it. Oh and don't eat in the Piazza Navona - we had 2 antipast (ghastly) 2 pizza and 2 small beers plus 1 coffee and it was 120 euros! Can't beieve we got caught so look at the prices on the menus you are given before ordering. The Colosseum tour was great with a charastmatic italian man (Roberto) doing the 'english' tour. We were then taken across the road to the Palatine hill which was incredibly interesting (good guide called Kate) and well worth E21. St Peters blew my socks off and I can't possibly do it justice here - seeing the Pope was extremely special. When we booked flights they were 1p plus tax on Ryanair. You have absolutely no reason to put it off, just book the hotel and get to Rome as fast as you can. Go!

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Del Senato was Wonderful!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dominique_03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Albergo Del Senato over Christmas 2006. This was our first time to travel outside the U.S., and it was the most wonderful experience we ever had. Our stay at the hotel made everything else that much more wonderful. The staff was awesome (very friendly and very helpful with everything), the rooms were a nice size and very clean, the breakfast was great, and of course we could not have asked for a better location. We could walk to every major site in the city within a reasonable amount of time. This hotel is truly centrally located to everything that you would want to venture out in Rome to see. When we return to Italy, there is no doubt that we will certainly be booking a stay at Albergo Del Senato again, it is magical! I also recommend that you book a vacation in the winter, the temperatures are mild (in the 50’s during the day and 40’s in the evening) with clear and sunny days. We walked a lot, and we were never cold and we never broke a sweat, it was perfect. Also, the winter is “down season” so there are not as many tourist, so you don’t have to wait in line ever. We Love Italy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChiaraViola
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its location, and I wasn't disappointed. For a hotel of this standard in this location, it's very good value for money. It's very clean and comfortable, and the staff couldn't be more helpful. My single room was quite small, but perfectly comfortable, and my friends' double was a reasonable size. Our rooms were at the back, and I don't think I've ever had a quieter room in Italy. The breakfast was pretty standard for Italy. The bar is a bit soulless, but there are plenty of places nearby so it's not a problem. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone not on a very tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Albergo”
Reviews.Author: Flanlovestravel
Reviews.Content: We agree with all the other reivews. Great hotel in fantastic location. We booked through Venere.com which was very easy (and payment is made to the hotel at the end of the stay) and paid 690 Euros for a 4 night stay in January. We were celebrating my birthday and were allocated a lovely room on the 3rd floor with a fantastic view of the Pantheon. The room was well decorated and very clean with a high pressure shower, just what is required after a full day of walking around Rome sightseeing! The location of the hotel is superb and we walked everywhere. 30 mins to the vatican and colleseum and 10 mins to the trevi fountain, 20 mins to the spanish steps, Travestere 30 mins or quicker if you use the tram. The hotel very kindly left a bottle of prosecco in our room on my birthday with a card. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and were happy to give travel advice and help out with our requests including booking a table for a restaurant for us. I will certainly recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “hotel albergo del senato great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: jocoeuk
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the albergo del senato hotel for 3 nights from 13/01/07, it was a great hotel and the location was fantastic you can walk to all the sites which is why we chose this hotel and right outside the hotel are great restaurants some expensive some cheap but still good food. the hotel bedroom and bathroom were nice and clean and at night they turn your bed down and leave chocolates on your pillow and you even get slippers, although we were at the back of the hotel it was quiet but you can ask for a room at the front overlooking the pantheon. the staff were really friendly and speak english. also they arranged a private airport transfer to and from ciampino for 55 Euro which was good as the driver told us about the sites on the way to the hotel. i was really sad to leave and cant wait to return to rome if was fantastic! x from jo manchester uk

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: floidybear
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Rome for a short break and spent three nights at the Albergo del Senato. We chose the hotel because of the almost universally rave reviews on this site and we were not disappointed. The location is truly special and even better than we had expected. Simply being able to step out of the front door of the hotel onto Piazza Della Rotonda with the Pantheon right in front of you feels like a privilege! It is possible to walk to all the main sites including the Vatican and the Roman Forum and you are right in the heart of the old city, with all its little lanes full of interesting shops, restaurants and cafes and all the other "must see" sights. Although our room was small and at the rear of the hotel (so no view), this did not spoil our stay as the room and the rest of the hotel interior were extremely well appointed and the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The only criticism is that the hotel recommended a restaurant to us one evening at our request, which actually was quite poor - very slow service and the food was barely warm. Other than that, a wonderful stay. One tip if you are coming to Rome via Fiumicino airport - take the Leonardo Express (train) from the airport to Stazione Termini for 11 Euros and then a taxi to the hotel for less than 10 Euros. Much cheaper than a taxi all the way and very easy to do.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Ideal”
Reviews.Author: bluespearbone
Reviews.Content: The standards within Albergo del Senato are way above the three star rating awarded - don't let it fool you, and the location is fantastic for anyone out to see Rome. Cannot possibly praise this hotel, the staff, or the good value presented highly enough. Don't hesitate in booking your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Del Senato”
Reviews.Author: O'Shonessy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Del Senato for 6 nights and thought it was terrific in all respects. The hotels location at the Pantheon in Old Rom was ideal for daily walking tours throughout Old Rome. The rooms were small in size but adequate, especially considering we spent most the day walking through Rome. They were very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was small, but well appointed and had all the necessities including hair dryer. The water pressure was great. The breakfast was included and it was generous by European standards. The continental breakfast buffet was well stocked with excellent juices, yogurt, croissants, breads, ham, cheese, fruit and scrambled eggs. In addition to the superb location the superb staff made this hotel a place I would highy recommend. I have stayed in many hotels in many cities, including trips to 6 European countries. I have never encounted a warmer, more courteous, more well informed and helpful staff. They spoke exceptional English and went out of their way to make our stay a great experience. If I return to Rome, I will return to the Del Senato.

Reviews.Title: “Another Rave Review”
Reviews.Author: livetotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Albergo del Senato for 6 nights, from Dec 17 - 22, 2006. We booked directly with the hotel and had requested a room on a high floor with a view of the Pantheon. Our request was met and then some. We had room 603, on the top floor, with a stunning view of the Pantheon from our small balcony. We paid 160E per night which included breakfast. The room and bathroom (with tub and shower) was more than adequate for 2 adults. Service was splendid - cleaned daily in the morning and then tidied-up when we were out to dinner - turn down service with chocolate treats included. The daily breakfast offerings were about standard - cheese, cold meats, eggs, sausage, breads, pastries, etc. Cappuccino was very good. Don't fill up too much here, however, as the best cappuccino, espresso, and cornetto are just around the corner at Tazzo D'Or. The staff here were, to a person, friendly, cordial, and met each our many requests with perfection. All staff spoke impeccable English. And above all else, location, location, location! I can't imagine, for the price, being better situated and in such a beautiful piazza.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further”
Reviews.Author: kiters
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, had the limo from the airport and also on the return. Well worth that little extra to arrive and depart without any fuss trying to get to the bus station etc. Ditto everything positive people have said, try the 3 hour walking tour of the main sights via Viator, you really get a good idea of Rome. Fantastic and have recommended to several friends.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AllanGlasgow
Reviews.Content: From start to finish we were looked after wonderfully by the very attentive staff at the Albergo Del Senato. Many little details such as the breakfast staff remembering your room number and what sort of coffee you liked made the stay truly memorable. The hotel itself is immaculately presented and is in a fabulous location. Would I recommend this hotel? I already have!

Reviews.Title: “a beautifull place like home”
Reviews.Author: albertoscorpion
Reviews.Content: I like Rome, I stay in città eterna for job and for plesure. Always I go to Albergo del Senato: for me is like home. Thank you Salvatore, Maurizio, Luca ... Alberto Di Pietro

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Rome Experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CiaoMilano
Reviews.Content: We visit Rome often and out of all the hotels we have tried in this beautiful city this is our one and only favourite. The photos shown on the hotel website are just as you will find the hotel. Wonderful rooms decorated in the Italian style, swish bathrooms with showers that work, no noise between rooms and a wonderful roof terrace which is open in summer for drinks. There is plenty to eat at breakfast and the hotel staff are friendly and very helpful. This place immediately makes you feel at home. The icing on the cake is of course the hotel position. It is situated on the beautiful Piazza della Rotonda right beside the Pantheon. If you are lucky enough to get a room with a view you can open the shutters and windows and take in the activity and beauty of this wonderful piazza or you can shut it all away and have peace and quiet. If you do not have a room with a view you can still take in the marvels of this place by stepping out the door of the hotel and joining the buzz. Either way you are a winner. Surrounding the hotel are restaurants, bars and shops hidden away in the many narrow cobbled streets that lead to other nearby ‘must sees’ like Piazza Navona, The Trevi and the Spanish Steps. For the art lover, you can call into close by churches to marvel at a Caravaggio or two. Just a wonderful, wonderful hotel and although prices can be expensive in peak season it is very very worth it if you want a real taste of Rome. If it is off-peak season the prices can be quite reasonable so give it a try – you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old-style elegance”
Reviews.Author: cruisemom42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at del Senato for 3 wonderful nights in November. We booked the hotel after much research as representing the best choice in the 3 categories important to us: 1) location, 2) old-style elegance, and 3) friendly (not stuffy) service. In our opinion, this hotel excelled in all 3. We requested a superior double with a view of the Pantheon and were thrilled to discover on arrival that our room had not only a view but a lovely terrace overlooking the Pantheon (and indirectly the piazza). The high ceilings, wood floors, heavy drapes, and overall elegance won us over immediately. The room and bath were relatively large by European standards; the bath was appointed nicely in marble with very new fixtures and a jetted tub. Nice fluffy robes, slippers, and floormats gave us an extra sense of coziness. The beds were comfortable and we experienced no problems with noise either from the outside or from other rooms. The TV was a bit confusing to use, but we didn't really spend much time in the room watching it. The location was perfect for exploring the historical center of Rome. We walked to Trevi, the Spanish steps, Piazza Navona, and the Forum/Colosseum. In addition, there is plenty of shopping in the immediate area for everything from designer clothing and jewelry to Italian handcrafted paper and wooden toys. There is a supermarket nearby (on the street leading to Piazza Navona) with salami, cheese, and wine for a picnic or snack. There was no shortage of restaurants in the immediate vicinity, but steer clear of places that are right on the Piazza and head up one of the side streets for a better price and a better meal. Breakfast was included in our package, and we enjoyed the selection of breads and rolls, cereals, juice, cold meats and cheeses, as well as scrambled eggs each morning in the breakfast room. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and spoke excellent English. The hotel has a rooftop terrace and bar that was closed in November, although we had nice weather during our stay. That's fine, because we enjoyed wine and cheese on our own terrace. There is also a small bar off the lobby, but it appeared to be unused during our stay -- and who wouldn't rather step out the front door and have a drink on the Piazza della Rotunda or walk a few blocks to Piazza Navona instead? In short, we enjoyed our stay tremendously and I will definitely plan to return to del Senato on my next trip to Rome. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a hotel that has a European elegance and feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Rome hotel - Albergo del senato - Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Lennondalton
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome in November and stayed in the Albergo del Senato. From arriving in the hotel the staff could not have been friendlier they were all willing to go out of their way to get you whatever you needed always with a smile and a friendly chat. The extra touches from the maid who visited our room twice a day once in the morning to clean and at night to put goodnight mats at the side of our beds on the laminated floors and she left us little sweets with a little goodnight note. Just the extra little touches really made us feel special. We were left a bottle of champagne in our room but I think this was because I mentioned it was our honeymoon. If you can select your room you must select a room on the 6th floor as this is the only floor where the rooms have a small balcony which looks out on pantheon square. The breakfast was buffet style continental breakfast but it had a good selection of cereal, fruit, delightful pastries with butter and Jam and for those who wanted it - bread cheese and ham. You could go back as many times as you wanted, there was waiter service for fresh coffee & tea. The location of this hotel could not be better. next door to the Panthoen itself, Trevi Fountain just up the road. Half way between the coliseum and the vatacan all within walking distance. I would not hesitate to stay here again. One thought for eating out.- Eating in Pantheon square proved rather expensive. Try the little restaurants running off the square these proved more value for money and alot more friendlier. November was an excellent time to visit Rome as we did not have to queue for any of the sites. The only downside was that the nightlife consisted of a meal and to bed although restaurants all served until around 12 pm, the bars were empty.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel in Rome I will consider again”
Reviews.Author: lisadinva
Reviews.Content: The Senato had been recommended to my husband and I by his boss ... and we were certainly not disappointed! We arrived for a short one night stay on 11/25 and were given a small but immaculate room facing the Pantheon. What an amazing view! Michele the bartender suggested a wonderful restaurant several blocks away and even drew us a map! As we checked out the next morning, I asked if there would be a room available on 11/30 (as we were returning to the hotel on 12/1 already) and they had no problem with getting us in. I arrived prior to my husband on 11/30 and was greeted by name as I approached the desk! Pretty impressive! We were given room 316 this time ... no view at all, but it was HUGE compared to our earlier room and was perfect for us! The entire staff was friendly and helpful. I can't imagine finding another hotel that would compare!

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: goingcrosscountry
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 8 days in italy - 3 nights rome, 2 florence & 2 venice. It was fantastic. We stayed here in rome. It was truly the best hotel! Probably one of my all time favorite hotels ever. And I've stayed in many top hotels in the US. All of the fantastic reviews are true! We had a quad and I think it was probably one of the least decorated rooms in the place. When we got in I couldn't believe how gorgeous it was! The ceilings were so high with painted frescos. The bathroom was fantastic. The decorations were gorgeous. And the place was wonderfully clean. We peaked in other rooms and they were also fabulously decorated. One had a huge poster bed with a crystal chandelier hanging from the ceiling! (after seeing that room I got a bit jealous) The location is fabulous. It truly is magical being across from the pantheon! It also is great for eating choices as well as evening activity. You can also walk to many sites or hop a cab from here. My husband has a bad leg, so we walked to Piazza Navona and Trevi fountain from here. The other locations were also walkable but not really for him so we cabbed it. We loved hanging out at the Piazza Navona & Pantheon at night. The staff was fabulous. Extremely helpful even when we screwed up and didn't understand some things. The only complaint was one of the single beds (they are really chairs that convert to single beds) was broken. It didn't stay flat unless you were laying down in it. We didn't complain though. If we did I'm sure they would have dealt with it. They also had the best breakfast of the 3 hotels. Besides bread, ham/turkey, cheese, salami, fruits, yogurt and cereal. They had real orange juice and grapefruit and also had scrambled eggs. I believe that anyone with any standards (i.e. very high or not) would be extremely happy with this selection.) Just as an FYI we stayed at the La Residenza in Florence and the Hotel Commercio & Pellegrino in Venice. While they weren't the same luxury that Del Senato was I would recommend those also because the locations were great and they were very clean. I'm going to write reviews on those also! Good Luck on your planning!

Reviews.Title: “Really wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireUKtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of friends to celebrate my 50th birthday at the end of June 2006. Rooms were beautiful and spotless and we all had a view of the Pantheon. Air conditioning worked really well - and given the weather, we really needed it. No problems with sound proofing on the busy piazza either. Location is just perfect with lots of choices to eat nearby. Booked return minivan to the airport with the hotel - worked like clockwork and less hassle. Roof bar was just lovely in the evening. Service was impeccable - nothing too much trouble, and as our flight home was late, they provided an apartment for us to get changed before departure after a long day sightseeing. There really is nothing bad to say about this hotel and we would all definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “What a way to end our honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: yoshimurask
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here at the end of our honeymoon. When our taxi driver pulled up in front of the pantheon to drop us off, I think my jaw literally hit the floor. To be merely steps away from a building like the Pantheon is amazing. Our room was small, like all others in Italy. The view from our window overlooking the piazza and Pantheon is one I will never forget. Each morning we woke up, opened the window and just stared in amazement. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The interior of the hotel is stunning, as are the rooms. We were surprised to find a complimentary bottle of champagne in our room in honor of our honeymoon, as well as a hand written note wishing us a wonderful life together. You don't find service (or people) like that very often. And it was even more surprising to find service like this in a city that has to deal with tourists all the time. Our next trip to Rome will definitely include the Albergo del Senato!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: kricketrn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights in November and loved every one. Ths staff went out of their way to be helpful and were extremely friendly. The room was huge as was the bed, and the bathroom was wonderful. Centrally located-we could walk everywhere and did, but was near a bus center for the few times we rode a bus.The continental breakfast was delicious and even had scrambled eggs every morning-a first for us in Europe. Stepping out into the piazza right next to the pantheon never got old. I was so sad the morning we left and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further”
Reviews.Author: anderdad
Reviews.Content: We wanted a location in the center of the historical district. This hotel fit the bill very nicely. Arranging booking online was a breeze. Staff was responsive and answered all our questions thoroughly. Our room overlooked the Piazza della Rotunda with a jaw-dropping view of the Pantheon right out the window. We stayed seven nights and the room was refreshed and ready to go every day. A good breakfast was served every morning which helped get the day off to a great start. The staff was friendly and outgoing. This is always a plus when traveling but we have found that it works both ways. Bossy, demanding, complaining hotel guests don't exactly inspire friendliness and graciousness. You may get a polite smile but that's about it. When we returned from our daily excursions around Rome we were always met with a friendly greeting by the staff at the desk, who would joke with us about how many miles we walked that day. All in all, our experience at the Senato was excellent. If you are looking for the perfect spot from which to venture out into the historical district of Rome, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: CeeGee
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat. It is perfect for any first time visitor to Rome. The Senato feels like a smart boutique hotel right in the center of everything. The staff was courteous and welcoming, rooms well-appointed (though a bit small) but.... WHAT A VIEW!!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zebras
Reviews.Content: This hotel had no air conditioning in our room and they would not do anything about it. They only gave us clean towels twice in a four night stay. We had an extra bed which was like sleeping on an ironing board. Their attitude and service was rude and uncaring about our situation. Stay somewhere else and save yourself a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Short but sweet”
Reviews.Author: ItsColdUpHere
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AdS for only one night when we stayed over in Rome. Our room was ready early for us, which was great since we arrived mid-morning after almost 20 hours of travel. The front desk was courteous and friendly. They answered our questions as needed regarding a place to have dinner (which was wonderful) places to walk to, etc. Our room was great, since it is hard to find a room to fit three. We would definately stay again. Location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “great location; cold service”
Reviews.Author: Biago
Reviews.Content: With a wonderful location next door to the Pantheon, the Albergo del Senato has been, in the past, my favorite place to stay while in Rome. This time the view from our room was spectacular, the room itself comfortable (albeit extremely small) and the general atmosphere quite elegant. As the del Senato is not an inexpensive hotel I did not expect less that superior, warm service as well. Here is where I was disappointed. After having stayed in an equally small hotel in Venice I was a bit spoiled by the service and warmth I had encountered there. In Venice I was greeted upon entering the hotel, attended to at breakfast and generally made to feel like a welcome guest. At the del Senato in Rome I felt like a literal intruder. The gentleman at the reception desk in the evening seemed 'put out' at our presence while the staff at breakfast were particularly curt. Granted, I was told that the hotel was completely booked so perhaps the managment felt no special effort was required. After three stays at the del Senato this will be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: cc0ca
Reviews.Content: We previously stayed at this hotel a couple of years ago and loved the location and hotel. This time the charm wore off. While the location is terrific, the service was lacking. The overall tone was "you're lucking to get a room so be grateful". Our stay was for 3 nights in mid October. On arrival, one of our rooms was not ready which we expected since it was before noon. We were told to be patient that they were fully booked and that the room was "well worth the wait". When we did see the room it was exactly as we reserved (double with a view) so I'm not sure what the "well worth the wait" comment meant. At breakfast we asked for some cold milk for cereal 3 minutes after the buffet was cleared. We were told that we couldn't have any even though it would have taken maybe five steps to get it. Our first night it drizzled rain so the rooftop bar was closed. The second night had great weather so we were excited to go to the rooftop bar and enjoy the view. At sun down upon arrival to the terrace we were told that they would be closing in 15 min. "It is too cold". We were stunned with this news, as it was probably 70F and a beautiful night. We talked to another couple who have stayed at the Senato many more times than us and were told that they had never seen the rooftop bar open! My only guess is that the management sees it as too much trouble. Our overall impression was that thought the location is fantastic the management treats you as thought they don't need or appreciate your business and you should be grateful that you got a room. For this price, we will look elsewhere our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: SJU
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome and stayed at the Albergo del Senato for 8 days and 7 nights (10/16 - 10/23). One of the reasons for selecting this hotel were the comments here in trip advisor. I would certainly recommend staying here. We paid 410 euro a night ( a tad on the expensive side) but the room (see photos)and service were all excellent. Breakfast was included and there was a good variety for the breakfast buffet. Room had a direct view to the Pantheon. Staff personnel always willing and helpful and very freindly. Kudos to Maria Laura and Luca!!Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful introduction to Rome”
Reviews.Author: dskeeles
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Del Senato in late October for 2 nights, to celebrate our anniversary. I booked directly through the hotel, and asked them at the time if they could provide a room to match the occasion, within the rate we'd booked (superior double room). When we arrived, we found they hadn't disappointed, and we had room 603, on the top floor, with a small balcony overlooking the Pantheon and square below. The hotel itself is a detached building, in contrast to all the other buildings fronting the square, and situated immediately to the left of the Pantheon. Apparently a room facing the square requires a superior double rate; of these 20 or so rooms, 5 (on the top floor) have small (2 people standing) balconies, and one (on the 3rd floor?) has a large stone balcony, dead-centre over the entrance. All the others still have large floor-to-ceiling shuttered windows, so you still get the atmosphere from the piazza. The hotel itself is immaculately presented; it's classified as a 3-star, which signifies that it doesn't have space for a gym, rather than representing any compromise in quality. The TV was a flat-screen LCD with free Sky box; the keys were smart-cards; the toiletries were plentiful and of excellent quality. The 3 stars also allows for a friendlier service, which suited us: we ended up chatting and joking with the receptionist for 10 minutes at check-in. Combined with their limo service from the airport, in a leather-trim VW Toureg (€55, vs min €40 for a taxi), it couldn't have been a better arrival. The room was very comfortable - "huge" isn't going to happen in such a location unless you're a rock star - and watching a free concert take place in the square below that evening, from the balcony, was fantastic. It was suggested that we'd get views of the city from the 6th floor, but the surrounding buildings are of equal height; you won't see more than rooftops a couple of streets away. Sadly, the rooftop terrace was closed both nights - apparently having the bar closed due to a little rain meant the entrance to the terrace was locked, which was disappointing. We tried the breakfast one morning, which was very nice. Eg. The pastries and bread were very good quality, and fresh. The area immediately around the hotel is excellent for an evening stroll, and Piazza Navona is around 10 minutes walk away. We tried out Gioletti, ice-cream supplier to the Pope, and Il Bacaro, a wonderfully cosy restaurant; they're both excellent, and a short walk away to the North West.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location -- Excellent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: thomasjob
Reviews.Content: Immediately adjacent to the Pantheon in Piazza della Rotunda, there's no place more centrally located to all the "must see" tourist sites in Rome than the Albergo Del Senato. Unless you simply have to have a Pantheon view, ask for Room 501. For the same price as a superior room facing the piazza, you'll get a large dining room with kitchen; a comfortable sitting room with a very private terrace overlooking the neighborhood behind the hotel; and a large bedroom with a sumptuous bath, all beautifully decorated. It's very quiet on this side of the hotel, unlike the piazza, and the terrace is a great place to enjoy the sunset with a glass of wine. There are only two guest rooms on the entire 5th floor, so the feeling of privacy is unmatched. The staff makes you feel right at home, and every request was instantly fulfilled. The next time we're in Rome, we'll stay at the Albergo Del Senato.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kate181
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at the Albergo del Senato. It was the perfect place to stay in Rome. Our room overlooked the Pantheon. The bedroom and bathroom were a good size and very clean. Breakfast was very good and the wait staff was pleasant and efficient. The front desk staff was attentive and helpful if not overly friendly (which was fine with us). We were able to walk everywhere from the hotel. The Pantheon area was very busy during the day but at night it would quiet down. When we would look out first thing in the morning, it was almost empty. I would definitely stay at the Albergo del Senato again and would recommend it to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wheelwatcher
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop on our 3 week vacation in Europe. We had saved the best for last, Rome was a highly anticipated stop on our itinerary. We also paid the most in Rome for our hotel, but this was our biggest splurge. We were not disappointed! We arrived by taxi, and the first view of the Pantheon takes your breath away, it is truly awesome. The location of this hotel could not be better, the piazza is full of life. We were greeted warmly and given a choice of two rooms. We faced the Pantheon and piazza, just as we had hoped. The roof terrace is lovely, the breakfast was very nice and service was very good. Thank you to Mauro, Luca and Anne for addressing any concerns we had. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. We did have one very disappointing experience. We asked for the name of a private guide to the Vatican. They set us up with a private guide named Stefano, it cost us 120 euro for 3 hours, but this was extremely important to me. It was the worst tour I have ever had. He walked in front of us mumbling, we could not understand him. He was aggravated by the crowd, complaining he spends 9 hrs a day there and is just burned out. It was a waste of our money and a bit of a dampner on our much anticipated visit. Beware. I did let the hotel staff know what happened and the desk clerk felt awful.. It wasn't his fault, but they should know this.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Gattobaci
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the del Senato in mid-September. I only wish we had stayed longer. Even with our high expectations based on all the rave reviews, this place was even better than we had anticipated. All the public areas are beautiful and the staff was exceptional. Although we knew the room would not be large (and it wasn't) it was nicely appointed with lots of nice amenities in the bath. The small balcony with the Pantheon view more than made up for that. It was amazing to lay in bed and see my favorite building in Rome right outside my window. We didn't experience any noise from the Piazza below and enjoyed drinks on the rooftop terrace one evening. Based on our experience, we wouldn't consider any other hotel now on our future visits to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: TheBallfamily
Reviews.Content: This gem of hotel couldn't be better situated in Rome! The Pantheon location gives you your first view of ancient Rome as soon as the taxi weaves it's way through the narrow streets to drop you off (and I do mean weave!). From there on, everything a first time tourist would want to access in Rome is always within walking distance (Ancient Rome, Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Gallery Borghese are all easily within walking distance). My wife and I went on our first visit to Rome with our two children (age 6 and 11) and never needed to take a cab except from the airport and to the train station. We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in their apartment on the first floor (side note - trying to find a hotel that can hold a whole family in one room in Rome is not an easy task. To find one as well located, spacious and comfortable is almost impossible!). The cost was 395 Euro a night, which may be expensive compared to what some of the smaller rooms cost, but when you consider the alternative would be to book 2 rooms to accomodate 4 people, the cost was well worth it. Our apartment was 2 floors, with the lower floor containing a small kitchen set up, a full sized dining table and two pull out beds for the kids and the upstairs area for my wife and myself. The breakfast was great and the staff were very attentive and great with the kids. There are a multitude of good restaurants within walking distance (our favourite would be Myosotis). The other major attraction to the hotel is the view from the bar atop the hotel and the sunsets you get every evening. Spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Del Senato - on the steps of the Pantheon!”
Reviews.Author: LancasterTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Del Senato is literally within penny pitching distance from the Pantheon. And, it is so well suited to tour the rest of room. The Piazza in front of the DS offers numerous shops, restaurants, an ATM and a taxi stand! The Hotel is beautiful inside. The rooms were clean, spacious and had good ac systems. Their breakfast is nice as is the breakfast room and the roof top bar has beautiful views of Rome. Staff service is superb! All the way from our friends at the front desk to porters, breakfast room staff and Michele in the bar the Del Senator staff gets an A+ for please, caring efficient service. Book your room at the Del Senato and you will be glad you did for all of the above reasons and more. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: CMacIntyre
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights and had a wonderful experience. Our room looked out at the awe-inspiring Pantheon, and everywhere else was within walking distance for us. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, the breakfast was more than adequate, and our room very comfortable. Yes, it was a bit pricey, but it was well worth it to us.

Reviews.Title: “faboulous hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: IRISHMEN
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome with friends but this was their first time in the city.The hotel and location was easily the best we have ever been in Rome.The hotel arranged pickup and within 45 minutes we were delivered to our hotel.Staff at reception were were friendly and helpful and within one hour our rooms ere ready.We stayed in Room 406 which gave us a fantastic view of the Pantheon.Room was spotless with all the luxuries one would associate with afour or five star hotel.(Senato is a three star hotel)After recommending restaurants for dinner, we had drinks up in the rooftop garden each evening.Breakfasts were adequate with a good selection of food.This was an excellent hotel with all the facilities one would need for a city break.Location is excellent as you are less than 10 minutes walk from the Trevi Fountain and about 20 minutes to the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Pam l
Reviews.Content: We arrived, hot and tired from a long train journey from Venice, to a warm welcome by the staff and were given a most spacious ground floor apartment with mezzanine. Unfortunately, I found it to be too noisy due to the hotel's air conditioning system being close by. When this was mentioned to reception there was immediate action taken to rectify this and we were relocated. And this was all taken care of while we were sightseeing. Never, have we stayed in such a beautiful room as the one we were then given on the third floor. Not only was it extremely spacious but the four poster bed and spectacular ceiling murals took our breath away. We felt as if we were in seventh heaven. Even the bathroom had a jacuzzi. And as if this wasn't enough, stepping out of the hotel's doors we were straight into the Piazza della Rotunda, a warm and lively square, which is home to the most amazing Pantheon - we had the golden opportunity of being able to go into this amazing circular temple before any other tourists arrived - a site not to be missed! And it is right on the hotel's door step. The breakfast room is quite small, so if you wake up late you may end up having to queue. I can recommend the cake that was always available for breakfast though the orange juice was questionable. The roof terrace was enjoyable and the Bellinis made from fresh peach juice and local sparking wine were an absolute treat. Not to be missed. The staff were always helpful and kind and our room maid was a delightful lady who kept everything spotlessly clean.
