Please be sure, however, NOT to use the money changer in the square for any foreign currency and traveller's cheques. They charge a wopping twelve and a half percent as against any bank's maximum one percent charge. There are two banks in the square and many, many others close by - though the process may take longer than anticipated. The hotel happily accepted our Euro travellers cheques so that cut out a lot of hassle too. My family and I hope to return to Rome and the first hotel we will contact will be the del Senato.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: Moondawg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in August 2006 based on reviews from Tripadvisor and because of its location Everywhere from here is so central. My wife and I used the tourist sightseeing bus to get a general overview of the city and its geography for the first day and discovered that the hotel was central to everywhere. The staff at reception could not have been any nicer - always willing to help and provide information and always had a smile for us. Hotel rooms in Rome are smaller than in the UK or Ireland and this room was as expected however, the room was spotless. There were some nice touches as well like leaving a sweet on our bed side locker, laying down a little floor mat at our bed side and closing our shutters, every evening. Our room overlooked the Pantheon and piazza where there was always a good buzz around it with plenty of restaurants. This location is excellent for dining with numerous restaurants within 10 minutes walk. Put it like this - when I go back to Rome I will definitely stay here again and will recommend it to family and friends. One word of caution - a lot of restaurants and shops close down around the 2nd week in August for a few weeks holidays so it may not be the best time of year to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Read this review, its woth it!”
Reviews.Author: przank
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful, right in the heart of acient Rome. We were able to walk to most sights and plenty of shopping arears. the staff spoke wonderful English, were extremely well dressed, and was most accomadating. The man in the breakfast room knew I took my coffe back to my room and had it ready every morning. The room was upgraded upon arrival to the best suite in the hotel, with an amazing amount of space. The view from the rooftop garden is well worth it, we sat up there almost every night and you can see the sun set over the vatican from there. I used the safe in the room for my passport, drivers liscense, etc and only carried copies which all merchants accepted and made me feel safe. There is a place down the block which will exchange your money at a fair market exchange: ask the front desk where it is. There is a wonderful resaurant behind the Pantheon that is run by Dominican Nuns where the French food and atmosphere is wonderful. The climb to the second floor is worth it just to look at the painted ceilings. I highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location: Walk Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: GoWhere
Reviews.Content: This quiet hotel offers beautifully appointed rooms, clean bathrooms, and a GREAT LOCATION. We stayed for four nights in Dec 2004 and Jan 2005. Loved the view of the square from our window. The hotel is located in the old city near the Forum, Colloseum (sp?), Campidoglio, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. The phrase "When in Rome, Do as the Romans" comes to mind. When you walk out of the hotel, you see local Romans walking their dogs, doing their grocery shopping. My husband and I walked to all the tourist sites from the hotel: the Vatican, the Forum, The Flower Market. etc. The hotel room was spotless. Bathroom clean and modern. The free breakfast was filling and even offered cold cuts (meat). Hotel staff spoke great English. Lots of great nearby restaurants. Try restaurants in the Flower Market area. However, the only poor restaurant experience we had in 5 nights was a restaurant suggested by the concierge. This hotel is somewhat pricey but great for first time Rome tourists to really get a feel for ancient Rome in a very modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Experience”
Reviews.Author: strabaneman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August and can say that this hotel is excellent.We had a room on the sixth floor with a balcony overlooking the Pantheon square.The staff were very friendly and helpful.I am looking forward to my next trip to Rome and i will stay here again.Dont bother looking anymore-this is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous View”
Reviews.Author: JenBonniwell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as our "splurge" to cap off our honeymoon. We stayed in an absolutely fabulous suite overlooking the Pantheon. It is one of only three rooms in the hotel that has its own private terrace with table and chairs -- and the view was well worth the price. The roof terrace also is great, as is the location, which is literally on the Pantheon piazza. Wish the breakfast was better, and Internet was pretty expensive (5-euros for 1hr). The view made up for it all! We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkably friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dave&Carla
Reviews.Content: Our second trip to Rome, my wife wanted a centrally located hotel near a famous site, and selected Albergo Del Senato. This hotel is next to the Pantheon, which also makes it a few blocks from Piazza Navona, and as we later discovered, within walking distance (for those with a bit of stamina) to Vatican City, Coliseum, Spanish Steps, etc. The rooms were very nicely appointed, and surprisingly quiet especially given the location. In the lobby was a computer for Internet access (reasonably price, but typically busy). A rooftop bar offered a nice break before the evening activities. We found the staff to be extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A' Must Do' Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Hen_Girls
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four wonderful nights in the Albergo del Senato. We went to Rome for a Hen weekend and so wanted to stay somewhere really special, and we couldn't have picked a better hotel than this!! The hotel staff couldn't do enough for us, whether it was giving information on reception, serving breakfast or cleaning our room we felt welcomed by all and never an inconvenience. We were particularly fond, as you can imagine being on a Hen weekend, of the cocktail bar on the roof. The views were stunning, especially in the evening when we could see the dome of St Peter's, the Pantheon and Victor Emmanuelle Monument floodlit. The location of the hotel is absolutely amazing, you step out of the main reception into the Piazza della Rotunda and come face to face with the Pantheon. The hotel is in a brilliant location, only a few minutes walk from many of Rome's main attractions, the Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona and the Forum to name but a few. This hotel would be ideal for anyone wanting to make their trip to Rome one to remember. We will definately be back!! All in all, a real 'Must Do' hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Visting Rome? This is the ONLY place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Limbo1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is without doubt one of the best in Rome. We stayed here for part of our honeymoon at the end of August and staying in this hotel made our trip to Rome one of our highlights. The location is the first thing that is excellent. Right next to the Pantheon and just a 2 min walk to Pizza Navona with lots of restaurants and fin things to see at night. Normally when visting a city we have to rely on busses and metro's however from this hotel we could easily walk to the Colesseum, The Vatican, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain etc. The staff at the hotel really would do anything they could to help you and the two guys on the front desk (1 in the mornings and 1 in the evenings) were always friendly and happy to help. I would also recommend popping up to the roof terrace and having a drink before dinner with Michelle the barman, who is happy to offer you tips on good restaurants and have a good chat whilst overlooking the piazza. The day before we arrived I emailed the hotel to arrange a car to pick us up from the airport they were happy to help and responded straight away and it was well worth the money I think it was 55 euros when we arrived and then arranged for a car to take us back to the airport at 45 euros. For the sake of 100 euros I can highly recommend this as transport to the city from Ciampino airport isn't great and being in the back of an airconditioned merc beats sitting on a bus. The whole hotel has a great feeling about it and we will for sure one day be returning here once again. If you want to enjoy the tourist hotspot of Rome in a friendly hotel then this is the place for you.. I have not a bad word to say about it. Staff at the Albergo Del Sonata thankyou very much for making our stay a very memorable one and we will for sure be back again in the future. Katie and Jay Limburn

Reviews.Title: “First stay in Rome; pleasantly surprised!!!”
Reviews.Author: papavictor
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets consistently good reviews, so perhaps we shouldn't have been surprised at how pleased we were with our visit. Perhaps the pessimist in us was waiting for the "other shoe to drop", but it never did. We travelled with our two kids, and this was one of the few hotels we researched that offered to accomodate us all in one room. We were given room 318, with a king-size bed for us (unexpected) and pullout beds for the kids. Totally satisfactory, and the room was still large enough to walk around in! Nice bathroom, too. By the way, dealing with the staff either by e-mail or in person was a pleasure; they were very friendly and helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations, etc. A special mention goes to Michele, our favorite member of the staff, who personably attends the rooftop terrace bar (which has a wonderful view.) We agree with everything everyone has said before about the great location, and the access it gives you to both old and ancient Rome by foot. It was wonderful to stroll the streets of Rome, especially at night, starting from the Pantheon's square. For those of you touring with podcasts, check out the iJourney tours, one of which starts from this square (they are excellent.)

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Blackburns
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent! The location is unbelievable -at right angles to the Pantheon. We were able to walk everywhere from our hotel as it is bang in the historical centre. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful - from the cleaners, the waiting staff to the reception staff and they could not do enough to make our stay memorable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: dolphinmonkey
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I booked our fantastic vacation at this wonderful hotel with Air France Holidays, everything went swimmingly. All of the agents at Air France Holidays knew their stuff about Italy! The package was so cheap, and they gave me so much information that I used during our entire vacation. the hotel itself was in a perfect location and had friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Tedtrout1
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel and location. My wife and I stayed there the second week of August with our two teenagers, and want to go back already. Friendly, helpful staff, clean rooms with great views, and Salvatore was especially helpful with directions and travel advice. We had been through 3 other cities and hotels in Italy before arriving here for a week's stay, and even the kids were impressed from the moment we walked into the lobby. No problems with check in, family friendly, and the AC was fine. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome - we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: UpperWestGal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 days in early August and were extremely happy with our choice. We had a wonderful room with a balcony overlooking the Pantheon. Anytiime we were at our hotel, we could open the large windows and take in the ambience of Rome from the comfort of our own room. (The windows are also great for blocking out sound when you just want some peace and quiet too!) The location is absolutely superb! Right in the middle of everything. Walking distance to the Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Colisseum, etc. You really feel like you are in the heart of Rome. The staff was extremely friendly and extremely professional. They helped us with great restaurant recommendations and arranging transport to the airport upon our departure. Highly recommend it and would definitely stay there again anytime I returned to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: P-KTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Albergo del Senato the last four days of July. Had a wonderful stay. Our room was on the third floor with a breathtaking Pantheon view. Wow! There was no request the front desk staff could not fulfill, at any hour. There was always a smiling and helpful face at the front desk . . . from restaurant recommendations, to walking directions, to arranging for a car to the airport. We do not have one complaint. Our housekeeper was also very nice. The breakfast was more than adequate, and served in a lovely room. We walked everywhere from this location. Only taking a car to Vatican City because of time constraints. Other reviews have discussed the A/C issues. We are from New Orleans and found the rooms to be a tad warm during the day, but comfortable at night. Ours stayed at a steady 22-24 C but nothing that would keep us from returning and recommending to anyone. We do believe that the last two weeks of July were unusually hot and humid by anyone's standards. The rooftop bar was beautiful. Michelle, the bartender, was very nice. The view and his Bellini cocktails were wonderful! Thank you Albergo del Senato for making the end of our Italian holiday unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for Room 310”
Reviews.Author: BMWLover
Reviews.Content: I could not have been happier. I suppose just because I was lucky (but perhaps my travel agent had contacts) I was assigned Room 310. They later told me this was their best room. When I was first handed the key I was told in jest, "We don't want to hear any complaints about the room." I'd say the dimensions are about 20x20 with a separate dressing room and then bath. The room was very tastefully decorated including the painted ceilings. If you get a brochure from them, this is the large room displayed toward the end of the brochure with blue walls. It was not listed as a suite and I paid what I would term a "normal" price. The individuals at the front desk are always very helpful and while I was there they did not fail to remember my name. The breakfast was nothing special but just fine for a continenta breakfast. If I went back to Rome I'd return here for sure....assuming I can get room 310!

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wibberly
Reviews.Content: We got married in Rome in July and the Albergo Del Senato made it an absolute delight. The rooms are beautifully finished; the staff extremely friendly and helpful; and the location is superb for any type of holiday in Rome. The staff made some excellent recommendations for restaurants and added a personal touch that is so often missing in large city hotels. If you are travelling from the UK and know as little Italian as I do, Sarah Honour (on reservations) is from London and was able to solve all of our last minute concerns. If you are in Rome, a stay at the Albergo Del Senato is well worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: EShaps
Reviews.Content: I'm glad to say that we had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The staff was always attentive, courteous, and willing to help with any questions that we had. We were always greeted with a smile and advice was patiently given by the front desk staff whenever we needed it. I had contacted the hotel so many times before our visit through e-mail, that I felt as if I knew them all. My e-mails were always answered quickly and with a friendly response. Our room was spotlessly clean (the furniture is a little worn, but I viewed it as antiques!) and the breakfast was fresh and delicious. Our room was comfortably cool, however the lobby was not air conditioned. We were there July 11th-15th during a terrible heatwave. The staff smiled even while wearing suits (jackets and all !) We, at least were in shorts and t-shirts! We had a very hard time smiling with the heat! The location of this hotel is fabulous. First of all, when we looked out of our window (room 205), we were staring at the Panthon! What a breathtaking view, made only better when the sun went down and the lights of the Pantheon and piazza came on. We loved looking out of the window at all hours. We walked everywhere....to the Vatican, the Colesseum, the Spanish Steps, etc. The only ride that we took was when we left Rome by train at the Termini station. We are not youngsters. My husband celebrated his 60th birthday on the 15th. The heat was stifling, however, we walked everywhere. We were so centrally located to all. I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Thank you to all at the Albergo del Senato for a wonderful and memorable stay. Ellen and Larry New York

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: buckliew
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Rome at the Albergo Del Senato. With Rome being a city without a convenient metro system, we expected to spend much of our time on foot. We planned on picking a hotel that was conveniently located. This hotel is in a great location. Be sure to eat at Il Fortunato (may have spelled it incorrectly). It is a few feet off of the square, next to McDonald's, facing the Pantheon. They have pictures of tons of celebrieties who have eaten there. Everyone from Bill Clinton to Taraq Aziz. The food is great too. The staff at the Hotel was very friendly to us. They helped us with the Bus system & even arranged for a car to take us to the airport (which I would recommend for anyone staying at this hotel). It was cheaper than a taxi, and it was a Mercedes 500SL. I read the negative review of this hotel, and it was not consistant with our experience. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: workinit
Reviews.Content: We were here July 12 - 15th and absolutely loved everything about this hotel. The rooms were clean and the staff was very professional. We arrived at 9:00 am after a long overnight flight and were able to check in to our rooms immediately. We had two rooms - a double for my husband and a triple for my three children. The location is walking distance to everything - Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Colleseum, Spanish Steps. The staff/concierge was very friendly and took the time to interact with my children. The breakfast was outstanding - scrambled eggs, salami, ham, cheese, yogurt, fresh fruit, rolls, pastries, juice, milk, coffee, cappacino, jellies. The rooftop bar has an amazing view of the Pantheon and St. Peter's) and the prices of drinks are very reasonable (3 EUR for a glass of chianti) I would definetely stay here again. Great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and location, average customer service”
Reviews.Author: silver1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in early July. The electricity went out 2 nights, certainly not their fault. The first night they had flashlights in the halls and gave flashlights for the rooms. The second night the power went out when we were on the rooftop terrace at about 6:30 pm. When we returned to the hotel at midnight, there were no flashlights for the halls or the rooms. They certainly had time to get more flashlights, batteries etc. I am one who prefers a cooler room, which I know is a challenge in Italy. But even by European standards, the room was very uncomfortable, 27 to 29C. I called several times and they told me they lowered the thermostat. The view is magnificant. The location is great especially if you like to walk everywhere like we do. The staff were adequate. Except for the male staff on the rooftop terrace, the staff were professional but not very friendly. The hotel was very clean and the breakfast buffet was good. Angel Tours were great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at del Senato”
Reviews.Author: tradescantia
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4 in two separate rooms) loved our stay at Albergo del Senato for 5 nights in July 2006. The rooms were lovely and overlooked the Pantheon and Piazza. Walls are upholstered in padded silk (?) and the rooms were quiet and clean. The lobby and breakfast room were also sparkling and well decorated. The staff at the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful and recommended great restaurants at different price points. They are true professionals with warmth. We observed an interesting mix of travelers in the breakfast room - there were tourists from a variety of countries (US, Europe and Asia) as well as business people. This, to us, was another sign that this is a true Italian albergo, not a tourist trap.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Excellentadventures2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this lovely hotel for 3 nights and while it lacked the flash and glamour of some other hotels I stayed in during my trip to Italy, I must say that I cannot find anything to complain about at all. The rooms are spacious by European standards (call ahead to request a room on an upper floor overlooking the Pantheon. The view is wonderful--the Pantheon, the square, even the dome of St. Peter's Basilica in the distance.), the bathroom was modern and the location is perfect for exploring the entire city. There are several wonderful sidewalk cafes to sit at and just pass some very pleasant time people watching. The concierge is very pleasant and helpful. Be sure to have him arrange for transportation to the hotel from the airport. Do not even think about driving--the streets we took to the hotel were more like alleyways and I could not have found my way there if my life depended on it, Also, if you plan to visit the Vatican, have them arrange a private tour guide. You can easily navigate Vatican City on your own but there is a special entrance for guides that is open from 8-8:45 a.m. We waited in line for 30 minutes in the shade while those in the general admission line waited for about 3 hours in full sun, As for restaurants, the concierge happily made my reservations--I can highly recommend Dal Bolognese and Da Fortunato which is less than 1 minute from the hotel on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel with an excellent staff. My wife and I took our 16 year old son with us to see the sites of Rome. This Hotel was the very best location to work from as we were able to walk to all of the sites. We stayed in the mini-apartment behind the stairs and it was very good sized for Europe. It had a down stairs with two couches (one being a pullout bed), small kicthen and dinning table. Upstairs was a good sized bedroom and a nice bathroom. It was perfect for our son downstairs and my wife and I upstairs. Rome was fantastic so we spent very little time in the room, but what ever we did need the Hotel and staff provided. I can not give a high enough rating to this Hotel and experience. Resturants in the Piazza out front were pricey but excellent, we especially enjoyed Piazza Navona for its open air size, art/crafts and great selection of resturants

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: stephensmom
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay!! The location was terrific for both sightseeing and eating, the rooms clean and good sized (for Europe) and the staff helpful, even when being badgered by an annoyed guest. We will definitely return when in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: MrsByers
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short weekend arriving Friday afternoon and leaving Sunday morning. As the hotel is perfectly situated we covered quite a lot on foot on Friday. The staff were brilliant and very friendly. They set us up with two different tours on Saturday. I took my mam who had a slight problem with walking, so this was perfect as it was on air conditioned buses with tour guide. The piazza Navona was just a short walk with plenty of restaurants and lots of street theatre. Dont know why this is only a 3 star, should be a four. Bedrooms had been up dated and had nice little touches. My mam's room looked over the square and heard music playing when she was resting. Said it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: faprodz
Reviews.Content: Our family (including 2 teens) stayed for 3 nights. We chose the "apartment" since we did not want the kids in a different room. This room has two comfortable sofa beds, a small kitchenette, a large table for 6 and a loft with a double bed and the bathroom. This room does not have a view but is a more economical to stay here than to book two rooms.The location of the hotel is excellent. The area surrounding the hotel is lively with lots of reasonable places to eat and wonderful places to have gellatos. Breakfast at the hotel was good and the staff was very friendly. We had a lovely fruit basket waiting for us in our room upon arrival. I had my birthday during our stay (a detail that the front desk staff noticed) and was surprised with a bottle of champagne in my room. We want to return to this hotel and strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth the splurge”
Reviews.Author: bellasusanna
Reviews.Content: After much soul searching regarding the cost of the Albergo compared to similar 3* hotels we turned to Trip Advisor and made our final decision based on the many postive reviews. It was also a special anniversary that we were celebrating and so we decided to splurge. And we were not in the least bit unhappy with that decision. Although our room was somewhat on the smallish size,it was beautifully appointed and the ceilings were high. But the piece de resistance....throwing open the windows and having the Pantheon as your next door neighbour was truly thrilling....and PRICELESS!!. We very much enjoyed all aspects of the hotel. The staff were very professional and helpful, the breakfast.... delicious.The view from the bar..amazing.And I must note that the hotel was spotless.All in all our 3 nights there were a very special treat

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding room and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To walk out the front door of this beautiful hotel, and literally be right in the piazza in front of the Pantheon will give you goosebumps! Our accomodations were lovely and the service was equally good. Salvatore, one of the staff, made our stay a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 7 days at this hotel. This hotel is everything! Great location, walk to everything in Rome. Look out your window and see the Pantheon and the bustling Piazza. The service is outstanding. The room was wonderful. Best coffee house in Rome just doors away - Tazza d'Oro.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff-great location”
Reviews.Author: jcnosocks
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I had a lovely 7 night stay at this hotel. The location is excellent and the staff accomodating. The rooms were clean and had nice touches...turndown service with chocolates. This hotel is right on the same Piazza as the Pantheon and the activity in the square can go on until late so if you are a light sleeper you may think about a higher floor or a room in the back. There are also quite a few good restaurant choices in all price ranges nearby. We did not have a good experience at Antonio's which was recommended by the hotel staff and Fodor's. Perhaps they have become too popular....undercooked chicken and poor service. All the other recommendations were great. Try the artichoke with their own olive oil at Myosotis. Yum.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel well located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A charming, lovely hotel located within walking distance of all of Rome's tourist sites in a quaint neighborhood. The rooms are small but adequate, opulently detailed with luxurious touches. The staff are all friendly and very knowledgeable and helpful. Breakfast is a full meal and very good. We enjoyed six days in February. A very good value,to which we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: takelson
Reviews.Content: Cannot improve on what's been said. The hotel was spotless, staff warm and helpful, location superb, and room excellent. We stayed 3/17-3/20 2006. Arrived tired and a bit early for the 2:00 check in. We were served complimentary espressos while the room was made up and we were let in early. Our first floor ( USA 2d floor) room was spacious and quiet. The bathroom was huge. Bed linens and towels were luxurious. Breakfast was generous and served in a simple yet elegant room. No question we will stay here on our next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: khep
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Albergo Del Senato for 5 nights of our Italian honeymoon. Hotel room (#604) was standard in size but perfect with balcony and view onto the front of the Pantheon. Our first night we went to sleep to a violinist playing in the surprisingly quiet Piazza Rotunda below. Location cannot be beat with Piazza Navona only being a 5 minute walk. All other sites (Vatican, Roman Forum, Trevi Fountain) were about 15-25 mins. The Trastevere neighborhood and its trattorias were about the same. Staff was warm, friendly and very helpful with suggestions. They booked our tickets for the Borghese Museum and priced the cost of the taxi. Bus stops were just a few minutes away. However, no Metro stop is nearby. Room was spotlessly clean everyday. Honeymoon or not, it is a excellent hotel and we would recommend to any and all ages. We found both tourists, businesspersons and families at breakfast each morning. We travel a lot around the world and this was just a great find. No future trip to Roma will you find us at any other hotel. Grazie! Albergo Del Senato!

Reviews.Title: “Great. fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: menomano
Reviews.Content: My legs have never been so tired as when in rome, but its worth walking and you can to all the sights from the Senato. great hotel, havn't time to write a long review but i agree with the other reviews that it is a lovely place to stay. was a shame theroof top terrace / bar was closed for winder but look forward to going back in the warmer monthgs. rome is a fantastic city. smokers beware though (i didnt realise) bars are now no smoking so you have to stand outside. The room, very nice, reasonable size not small at all as some have said tho i did request a good size one, which probably meant forfeiting the pantheon view but its on the doorstep anyway! They could do with using some door dampeners as the noise of other nearby guests vacating their room very early in the morning was a minor irritation. and breakfast was really good too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: LuvLobbyBars
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for 2 nights. What a beautiful Hotel. Great friendly service. I will be staying here again, no question. Thanks to Tripadvisor.com, the reviews were perfect. Location is A++, we were able to walk Rome in a day. The breakfest at the hotel also A++.

Reviews.Title: “The Albergo Del Senato is the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Oldmyst
Reviews.Content: I found the Albergo Del Senato from Trip Advisor and Fodor's Forum and I was so happy with my choice. The hotel is wonderful, and the staff is extremely gracious. Thank you to all the staff, Luca (who is especially funny), Ann, Sarah, and the many others whose names I didn't get. Our room was lovely. We had a corner room with a gorgeous view of the Pantheon. We had a minibar, safe, armoire, TV, comfortable bed, good linens, and a large, wonderful bathroom with a tub. Thank you for the restaurant recommendations. They were delicous. Breakfast was also very good, and I enjoyed my morning cappuccinos. The location can't be beat. You are in walking distance to the Trevi Fountain, Piazza Narvona and Campo Fiori. We also walked to the Forum and back from the Vatican. Thank you Albergo Del Senato for making our vacation a truly wonderful experience. I don't know why you are only rated 3 stars, as you are definitely a 4 star property. I hope to be back someday soon, and hope you don't get so popular that I can't get a reservation. Ciao for now. Until we meet again, Elissa

Reviews.Title: “I cannot fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jollyhockey
Reviews.Content: I could not fault this hotel. From the location, right beside The Pantheon, to the room itself, it was all just right. We travelled with our 6 year old daughter and even walking at her pace (very slow!) we were within half an hour's walk of all the major attractions of Rome, at the very most. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and there were plenty of restaurants to choose from within easy walking distance of the hotel (the ones in the Piazza Della Rotunda itself appeared to be rather expensive but there were others close by that were well within our price range). I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to others. Thank you Albergo Del Senato for a wonderful 3 night break in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “email hotel before you go!”
Reviews.Author: jilyf
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here last week. Previous comments are spot on - a delightful hotel, in the centre of the city, however I would suggest contacting the hotel before arrival. I booked & paid for the hotel through Expedia, 7 months before our trip and decided a few days before leaving to double check (as we were arriving at midnight) and started to panic when the hotel said they had no record of the booking from Expedia!! Fortunately the hotel had an available room for us and Expedia did sort out the problem - no apologies from them though.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem !!”
Reviews.Author: bosso2064
Reviews.Content: Thanks to reviews on Tripadvisor I chose this hotel for a 3 night stay 04/07-02-06 and can confirm it is excellent! Definately worth more than 3 stars(but keep that quiet!). Cost was €160 per night and we were allocated room 306 which is of adequate size for a short stay and was very clean & decorated to a high standard. The view was directly over the Piazza/Pantheon which is a wonderful sight to wake up to on a sunny morning. No problems with noise from the Piazza below, staff very polite and helpful, booking taxi's and restaurants. Marbled floors throughout the hotel and nice touches like our very own slippers! You must go to Bar Pantheon right next to the hotel and sample their wonderful coffees! also L'ea Vie for a meal, a quaint little place run by an order of Nuns who even seranade you with "Eva Maria", straight out of the hotel, across the Piazza, turn left at the news stand then right and left..about two mins walk! Everywhere is within easy walking distance from theis wonderfully located hotel. Fantastic!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Magical!!!”
Reviews.Author: johnsharpe
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just returned from a 10 day vacation to Rome and Napoli. We stayed 4 nights at the Albergo Del Senato and if it were at all possible, I would take up rsidence there in a heart beat. This charming hotel is by far the most welcoming in all of Rome. I planned this vacation as an engagement trip and upon checking in we were up graded to a junior suite! The room was very large by euro standards and our window opened up directly to the Awesome Pantheon. It was a very humbling view. All are needs were quitely met and great care was taken by every staff member when it came to making this a memorable visit. I have to single one person out however, GiGi was the star of our stay. Always with a gracious and sincere smile, GiGi was quick to take care of or answer any question question. I wish I could thank everyone by name but i cannot as i didnt get all their names. However from the from front desk staff to the young man with the shaved head who delivered us our morning cafe I want to say thank you! I would reccomend this hotel to anyone sadly. I say this only because The Albergo Del Senato is a gem and I am regretting the day - for purely selfish reasons - when the word gets out about this beautiful hotel!!! I have more Pics to come once we go through all of them...

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Russiancrusher
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 night here with my wife and 16 year old son. Best location in Rome. Walking distance to everywhere and my wife visited the Pantheon 3 times a day as it's mere steps from the front door. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was quite large for an European hotel and the breakfast was excellent with the best cappucino in Rome. The free slippers were a nice touch, given the hardwood floors in the room. Bathroom shower was hot and powerful and the towel warmer was great. The room cost me only $186/night for the triple with breakfast. No better deal in Rome. We would stay here again in a minute on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Zuribob
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in many other reviews, fantastic location in Centre of Rome, within walking distance of everything, and only 5 minute walk to the trams which will take you to Trastevere train station and onto Fiumicino airport for a total of €6. Room was a good size with a well appointed bathroom, hard to believe the hotel only gets 3 stars. Staff were friendly and very helpfull, breakfast was very good, can't think of any negative points, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way - do not stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Albergo del Senato Dec 05, as we were getting married in Rome town hall and staying on for our honeymoon. I have only good things to say about this hotel. The location is absolutley perfect, it is located in a lovely piazza, overlooking the Pantheon. It is within walking distance of all the sights, we did not once need to use public transport / taxis. The room was very well appointed, comfy bed, super bathroom (fab shower), we had a little balcony overlooking piazza del rotunda(to the front of the hotel) and felt like we could almost touch the pantheon we were that close! It was so nice after a days sightseeing to have a glass of wine on the balcony and watch the world go by. Although it is located on a busy square, overlooking many restaurants / street cafes, as soon as the balcony door was shut you could not hear a thing. Breakfasts were lovely, plenty of choice - pastries / cereal / egss / meats / breads and gorgeous coffee. We were so impressed by the hotel, and would say it seemed more like a 4 star rating at least. There were some really nice touches eg bed turned down every night, little chocolates on the pillow, complimentary bath robe and slippers, and little mats next to the bed so you didn't get cold feet when getting out of bed! We had a really good deal too, we had a 6th floor double room, pantheon views, balcony for 199 euros. I would recommend this hotel to EVERYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location~! Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vail2Italy
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. I've stayed in Rome many times, and this hotel is clearly the best for the money. First, the location is unbelievable. You are literally steps from the Pantheon on a beautiful piazza. What a joy to be able to slip inside the Pantheon on your way to and from other fabulous sites. It's an easy walk to other great spots, like the Piazza Navona and the Campo de Fiori. We even walked to the Vatican (couldn't get a cab) with three kids. The hotel itself is beautiful. Our rooms were small, but not by Rome standards, and lovely. The bathrooms were fabulous in marble with all necessary appointments. Towels were large and plentiful. There was an excellent selection at breakfast of fruit, breads, croissants (Italian), and eggs. The orange juice tasted like Tang, but that's the worst complaint I can come up with. The hotel was accomodating of our three kids, and thoughtfully reserved rooms next to one another for our family (even though we didn't check in until 7:30 at night). The staff was professional and helpful. Bottom line -- you will not be disappointed if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three day break at the Albergo Del Senato. A great hotel, very clean and warm(it was very cold for Rome)with good quality furnishings. Continental Breakfast all of good quality and varied. We couldn't experience the roof terrace as it is closed for the winter - we are in agreement with other travellers as it is in a good location for most attractions. On the downside we found our room noisy - obviously the walls are very thin. We have to say what we didn't expect Rome to be as expensive as it was. All things considered we would recommend this hotel and woulnd't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay here whilst showing my young daughter around Rome. The location was first class and there is always something happening in the Piazza outside. Our twin room was double aspect, very bright and clean with a unrivalled view over the Pantheon. There was a fair selection of food at breakfast, enough for children to find something they like. Having stayed in Rome hotels before, one key differentiator for the Senato was the friendliness of the staff, with lots of smiles and a helpful attitude during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks - Great Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dean&Christina
Reviews.Content: Just got back today and would like to thank everyone for a great recommendation - from our window we could virtually touch the Pantheon! Hotel had great staff and was clean and nicely furnished throughout. The view from the roof terrance / bar(open April to October)was superb. The atmosphere in the square was great - we are definately going back - Dean & Christina, Manchester, England

Reviews.Title: “Perfrect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located on the Phanteon square, very close to everything. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are nice with good bathroom facilities, minibar, tv etc. However, the breakfast room is crowded, and there is no internet. We paid 315 Euro per night for a room with four beds, so this is a bit expensive. There are other hotels on the Phanteon square. Albergo del Sople al Pantheon (Piazza della totonda, 63)seems very nice also. Albergo Abruzzi (Piazza della Rotonda, 69) is probably moderately priced, as it needs refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: pipk
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from 6 nights at the Del Senato. The hotel is probably placed in the most convenient location in Rome. Within walking distance from every major site. We booked the junior suite room 102 at 350E a night, which I thought was a lot of money, but it was for a special occasion so we bit the bullet. Was it worth the money, no I don't think so. Reading other reviews some of the other rooms sound just a good for a lot less money. The suite consisted of an ante room with small couch and two small chairs, very passage like and not really a room as such. Yes it gave us more room in the main bedroom as we stored our luggage in this area, but we really didn't feel like it was a "suite". The view was magnificent across the piazza to the pantheon. The shutters and double glazing kept out the noise. However we had no hot water the whole time we were there. It was barely luke warm. We complained everyday but nothing was done, other guests we spoke to also had trouble with the hot water. I got the feeling this was not an unusual occurence and they really weren't interested in fixing it. They did however offer financial compensation at the end of the stay. But at 350E a night there shouldn't have been a problem. (we were there six nights) The room however was quiet as there were no other rooms at this end only the cleaners cupboards, so no problems of slamming doors and neighbour noise. I thought the staff were helpful with restaurant suggestions and generally very pleasant. Expect for the breakfast staff who were very "cool" with guests on Sunday morning after a "white night" in Rome which had kept everyone awake and we were all late for breakfast. I don't think 10.00am on a sunday morning is really late though, but we were all made to feel very guilty and they went out of their way to be unfriendly and unhelpful. I would stay here again because of the location but would not spend the extra money on the suite - not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: muddsmom
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the Del Senato, as we never wanted to stay in such a busy area. We decided to give it a try for one night after returning from Tuscany for our return flight home. We found the Del very elegant and certainly didn't find any of the problems recent reviewers had written about. We never heard anything from the rooms on either side of our room. We had requested one of the deluxe rooms on the front of the hotel with a small balcony overlooking the Pantheon. We loved the rooftop terrace and you simply cannot beat the view from there. I still hate the crowds you encounter when you step out the front door, but I truly believe the hotel is worth dealing with those crowds. It really is that nice. Now, I must write about something that really upset me at the Del Senato. We took friends with us who had never been to Italy before. I made all the arrangements, including flights, tours and renting our beautiful cottage in Tusany. I worked very hard to make this trip special for all of us, even though we have been to Rome numerous times. I did allow our friends to make their own room reservations at the two hotels we stayed in while in Rome. I wanted to allow them to pick out a price range they were comfortable with. About a month before our departure date, I asked them to make sure and reconfirm everything. I confirmed my reservation with the Del and heard back from them immediately. Our friends said they couldn't get the hotel to respond to them at all and also realized they had asked for the wrong date. After three attempts, I told them I would e-mail and see what I could find out. I know our friends are very inexperienced with travel matters, so figured they had done something wrong. The Del wrote back to me right away and said they had never heard from our traveling companions, but did have an opening on the correct night. In the meantime, I had our friends contact another hotel just in case. Of course, they thought they had made a reservation there as well, but suddenly remembered they had not written back with their credit card information. Anyway, we arrive at the Del Senato and are taken to our rooms. I knew they had initially asked for a standard room. We met downstairs later and they asked how our room was, knowing we had a more expensive room than theirs. We said it was lovely, but small. They said, "Well, you should see what a standard room looks like." Well, I couldn't imagine what he meant, so we went to their room and I couldn't believe my eyes when we walked in. They had the most expensive suite in the entire hotel and only paid € 250 for it. The hotel had found them a room for the night all right. So, I'm the one who bailed them out of a real mess and we got a tiny room for quite a bit more money and they get the suite? I guess the hotel staff didn't even think about it when I wrote to them and explained how our friends had made a terrible mistake. I was so happy that they were able to get a room, because if I hadn't checked, they would have arrived at the hotel with no reservation anywhere. Geez!!! At least, I got to see what that beautiful room really looked like. I believe the rate for it is € 615 a night. Hmmm, I guess it just added to our friends special trip. Anyway, the Del Senato is a wonderful hotel and I would stay there aga

Reviews.Title: “Del Senato lives up to it's reputation”
Reviews.Author: Gungadin
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Albergo del Senato. Our room was tiny but pretty with gold fabric on the walls and had everything we needed--including a window right on the Pantheon. Much to our surprise, there was also no noise when the window was shut. Beds are just fine , air conditioning if you want it. Hair dryer in the bathroom has plenty of power but is one of those that you have to hold a switch down to make it work--no problem for me , but might be for someone with a more elaborate hairstyle. Service was exceptional and friendly. Good restaurant reccomendations. Breakfast was just fine. Internet access for a nominal fee was most convenient. The rooftop bar with Michael as the barman was a real treat. Be sure, if you stay there, to mention to the management how much you value the bar. Michael is a bit forlorn about not being able to have more amenities up there like he was promised when he took the job. But it is beautiful and he made a fresh bellini for me to drink while watching the sunset. The location is perfect. We have stayed in Rome 3 times and like this location the best.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for touring Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We usually have stayed at 5 star hotels, including the lovely Hassler Hotel and Ingleterra near the Spanish Steps, and though they are lovely, the prices for those hotels now can easily be 800+ dollars a night after service charges for an average room nightly. Unless you wish to shop at all the fine Prada, Gucci etc shops which are wonderful and are just beneath the Spanish Steps, we highly recommend this lovely small hotel. You will not be dissapointed, unless the lovely ammenities such as fine room service, fabulous in hotel restaurants (Hassler Hotel) are what you really want. We recommend this #1 for it's location, at the foot of the Pantheon, but also far closer to walk to the many wonderful sites, (our favorite Piazza Navona is close, the wonderful antique shops are close, the Vatican is not much further, Piazza Venezia, the Forum and the Coloseum are relatively closer) #2 for it's reasonable price (relatively to the grand hotels mentioned above) (around 300+ dollars) #3 it's cleanliness and sophistication. You can eat well many places in Rome, so the lack of a fine dining room does not bother us. This is a relatively good bargain for Rome standards. I highly recommend taking a horse and buggy ride which you can rent at the front of the Pantheon, and which will take you around to these sites on the roads which are now closed to cars, and will save your feet for the many hours you wish to spend in many of these locations. The ride seems expensive 150 euros or so, but is a GREAT way to get aquainted with the city, and for those of us repeat travellers, a wonderful way to get reaquainted with a city we love, occasionally work in, and visit often. Bravo to Hotel del Senato for providing a lovely alternative to the other grand hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “NOT My First Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Italy, and Albergo del Senato was a last minute hurried decision after Expedia messed up our reservation (after sending us a "confirmed" notification! - we found out on our own from the hotel 2 DAYS BEFORE our departure that they had no such reservation at all! Make sure you check because Expedia's confirmation is NOT a guarantee! Our first day arrival could not have gone worse...bad dishonest taxi driver from the Rome airport -BEWARE, they WILL cheat you! So count your money into their hand. He didn't even drop us off in front of the hotel, so we had to lug our suitcases around the cobblestoned alleys to find the Pantheon (several conflicting directions from Italians in the area), and FINALLY arrived at del Senato, dying in the heat and needing rest badly. We mostly (hastily) chose it for its location, but I was misled by the rave reviews for this hotel... There was a dead cockroach by the couch in the lobby. No bellman at the door to help us with our luggage. The front desk guy Salvatore barely welcomed us and called for a porter but by then we had gotten our bags ourselves to the elevator. My exhausted heart fell when the elevator opened - it was TINY!! about the size of a phonebooth! The two of us couldn't even fit with our luggage (and we are petite girls), so we had to make 2 trips. We got off the elevator and dragged our luggage some more up a series of 2-3 steps before we finally got to our small room. BEWARE OF ROOM 112, the view of the balcony is horrible - after looking once we locked it, kept the curtains drawn and never opened them again. you step right out into a dark back alley in which anyone could just climb right up into your room. The walls are PAPER THIN! The door of the next room is literally 2 inches from your door and everytime someone opened and closed (slammed) their door it was loud as if they were trying to come into your room. We could hear EVERYTHING, including every word of our neighbor SINGING while we tried to rest and everyone passing in the hall. But the worst was over, the twin beds were firm and comfy. The bath was clean, although hot water came and went, the water pressure was good. Breakfast was great actually, and another front desk man was very courteous and helped us get a taxi cab when we left - we were so worried about the thin walls keeping us up for our week long stay, that we changed hotels the next day. Also, the rooftop terrace is overrated. I would say it has the feel of a B&B. If you're on a budget and only staying for a few days, it's ok if you don't mind hearing your neighbor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelCapl
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews on TA, I booked two rooms at the Albergo Del Senato for my husband and I and another couple with whom we were traveling. It was our last hotel of a 3 week trip, and it was perfect in many ways. First, we got a great deal through hotels - 130 euros per night. I was afraid that for this price we would be tucked away in the bowels of the building. But instead, we got rooms on the 3rd floor (305 and 306, I believe) - looking directly out onto the Pantheon. The staff was great - they were happy to give us information on restaurants off the beaten path....at whatever price range we were interested in. The rooms were pretty good sized -- and the beds were very comfortable. CNN was available...so we could ease into getting the news prior to our return to the US. Bathroom very nice - great shower. Air-conditioning worked great. The breakfast buffet was excellent -- meats, eggs, fresh fruit, breads, pastries...everything you could want. Having gotten used to very strong coffee in other parts of Italy, the coffee here seemed a bit weak...but a very minor complaint considering everything else. The breakfast room was very comfortable. Location is the best. As noted above, the Pantheon is almost touchable from your window. Getting up early in the morning, it was great to go out in the square and poke around the exterior of the Pantheon with no one else in sight! Most of the major sights are within walking distance. Unfortunately, it was raining the evening we had hoped to use the rooftop bar...but I suspect the views would be extraordinary. A perfect place to recap your day while sipping an ice cold limoncello! From our experience, you can't go wrong with this hotel. We will be sure to return on our next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dilyse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family of four (two teenaged girls). Had two adjoining rooms. Location, staff, and room couldn't be better. Very clean and modern. All other great reviews in this forum are 100% accurate (discovered the hotel on TripAdvisor). We'll stay here again when in Rome!! Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and view”
Reviews.Author: here&there
Reviews.Content: Smallish rooms on a perfect square with a perfect view. Great value in comparison to other hotels nearby. Try to get rooms 603, 604, or 605 which have stunning view and balcony. Room is very quiet once the double pained french doors are closed. Nice bathroom amenities, better breakfast than other places we stayed on our trip. Restaurant suggestions were great. Would definately book again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in Rome that has it all!”
Reviews.Author: WhereToNextThen
Reviews.Content: If you really want to treat yourself to a great hotel in Rome with a fantastic location stay at the Albergo Del Senato right next to the Pantheon. We stayed there for five nights last month and from our room's window (room #406) we could look directly at the front and down the side of the Pantheon! Although expensive (250 euro per night, great breakfast included though) this hotel receives nothing but excellent reviews at tripadvisor.com. The staff is very friendly (especially Salvadore and Alessandro who helped my wife with her Italian) and speak fluent English since a lot of their customer's are American. We really enjoyed the roof top bar of the hotel (say hello to Michele for us) which has an excellent view of the Piazza and the roof lines of Rome, even St. Peters in the distance. This hotel could not be at a better vantage point for reaching most of Rome's main sightseeing locations. We were right in between the Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and we also easily walked to the Piazza Venezia, Colosseum and Roman Forum area. I do not regret spending the money for this hotel for one minute because it 'made' our stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Still the One!”
Reviews.Author: 3gigs
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity in May to spend a night at the Albergo del Senato in order to make a flight connection the next day, and we can report it was as great as on our seven-night stay of last fall (see October 28, 2004 review below). Michele even remembered us from our prior visit. Because it was only one night we took a smaller room on the first floor (107, I think) but it was seemingly within arms' reach of the Pantheon and was every bit as comfortable and well-appointed as the larger one we stayed in the last time. This is definitely a place worth returning to.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PMeredith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2005 and LOVED it! The location is the best in Rome. We walked everywhere. Our room was charming and had a GREAT view of the Pantheon. The hotel staff was wonderful---the front desk staff greeted us by name every time they saw us. They even gave us restaurant ideas for Florence (our next stop). The bartender (roof top bar) was very friendly and the view from the roof top was wonderful. Drinks on the roof top bar were such a treat!!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel - terrific location”
Reviews.Author: davekv
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in a terrific location. Our “room” (number 501) was actually a suite consisting of a large kitchen, a sitting room, private balcony bedroom and bath. It was extremely spacious and, I suspect, is not typical of the normal rooms in the hotel. We had wanted a room in the front of the hotel facing the Pantheon but our room faced the rear overlooking a Hodgepodge of roman apartment buildings. Also, based on the hotel’s web site and brochures, we had expected a room painted and decorated in Roman style. But this suite was furnished very modern. The really good news about this room is that it was extremely quiet. In the evening, we could hear the clamor of the large square in front of the hotel. There are many restaurants, street performers and crowds that create quite a racket. But facing the rear, the noise did not bother us at all. The breakfast is included and while not spectacular it was quite acceptable. We found no reason to search beyond the hotel in the morning. The roof top bar is a wonderful feature. House wines were reasonable (around 15 euros a bottle) and quite good. After walking the streets of Rome, it was a pleasant treat to sit on the roof and watch the sunset over the city. Internet access is available from one computer in the lobby bar and while there was some conflicts from multiple guests wanting to use it at the same time, it did work well. The best feature of this hotel is probably its location. It seems that it was in short walking distance to all the major attractions. We only found the need to take taxis to and from the train station and we never even had to brave the underground. The only criticism at all of this hotel was that the front desk staff was a bit stuffy and lacked warmth. By no means were they rude or inefficient - just a little on the stuffy side. On balance, we’d seriously consider staying there at again although I would also shop around for a better-priced hotel (we paid 250 euros a night). But, unless a better deal could be found and especially if we could have room 501 again, we’d stay again at the Albero del Senato.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Heart Of Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My 11 days' stay at the hotel at the time when Rome was 'inhabited' by another 4 million extra people (because of the farewell celebration of the late Pope, viz. 5-16 april 2005) was a most pleasant one. Situated next to the Pantheon (or Most Sacred Place) and on the Pza. della Rotonda with the famous Longhi fountain, this Albergo makes you immediately feel at home. Immaculately clean and pleasant rooms, kind, helpful and knowledgable staff and wonderful breakfast. All services are rendered without a hint of annoyance and with rapid understanding. When desired you can also make use of their own transport-facilities (a limousine from and to the airports). From here you can almost walk to the innumerable places of beauty Rome is famous for. Although the prices are not 'cheap', I woudn't think twice of going there again, because staying in this Albergo is a 'safe and pleasant heaven/haven' in the Eternal City full of beautiful and exciting encounters with art and ordinary life.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this hotel... and will return!”
Reviews.Author: BerkeleyHomes
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel, and will return whenever we visit Rome. Carol is ready to book the suite! The location is superb (across from the Pantheon on the friendly Piazza della Rotonda). We spent 5 nights there in early April 2005, and always enjoyed returning to the room. Open the windows - the Pantheon is on the left, and the friendly sounds from the Piazza come up from the right! The only downside ... the local musicians kept on playing “Welcome to the Hotel California” How did they know that we lived in Berkeley California? The solution... just close the double-glazed windows! We returned to the Pantheon over half a dozen times. It was the only site in Rome which we really wanted to revisit again and again. Take a look at the photos.. our hotel room is the one with the open window and the light on. You can see what a spectacular view we had from our hotel room! It’s not on a busy street so you don’t have the constant buzz of the Vespas (I’ve since found out that vespa is Italian for Wasp.. an appropriate name cause they sounded like wasps) Internet access was fairly priced. I didn’t try to hook up my PowerBook to their system, instead just plugged in a matchstick-sized USB drive into their computer and sneakernetted any files I needed to/from my laptop. Some previous reviews mentioned some things that others didn’t like: A: The rooms were small. Our room (305?) was just the right size.. it didn’t feel cramped at all. By comparison, our hotel in SOHO New York was so small we couldn’t walk around the room without tripping. B: They served american coffee in the morning. That’s true... all you need do is ask for an espresso (and a 2nd one) and they serve you with delight. Breakfast we just fine! C: There were lots of tourists in the hotel. Hopefully! That described us! When I went out to take photos at night, I’d take the key out of the slot. The lights went out. The staff person said “We Italians are smart as well as clever” and showed us that if we put the hotel business card in the slot, the lights stayed on. Alas, the weather was a bit too cool for them to open the rooftop garden, otherwise we would have been there every night! On November 10, 2004 hertfordshire wrote “please ignore the ridiculous negative comments and give this hotel a go” We did, and were delighted that we did!

Reviews.Title: “nice but pricey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Albergo Del Senato in early May, 2004. The hotel was nice and the rooms were spacious by European standards (comparable to a La Quinta in US but more elegant). The Pantheon was right outside our window and it was fun to watch the crowds in the streets below. It is a short walk to the Spanish Steps and shopping. I found it to be quite pricey, especially considering that the air conditioning was not available (just because a hotel has air conditioning doesn't mean that the hotel has it on and available for guest use unless they decide to do so). I think we paid what amounted to about $425.00 US per night and I did not consider it to be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Experience Rome”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer1952
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights at this fabulous hotel. We had two rooms for my wife and I and our two daughters. As noted by everyone the location is unbeatable - literally in the center of everything. Because it is small you feel very much at home here. The staff is friendly, outgoing and extremely helpful. The breakfast is great, serving fresh pastries & breads, eggs, ham salami, cheese, yogurt, cereals and fruit along with capuccino and latte caldo. The lobby bar is a friendly place to meet and see other guests or to surf the net and catch up on things. Generally the rooms are small by the Sheraton/Marriot standard but very nicely appointed with marble baths and nice furnishings. The beds were very comfortable. Although located in a very busy piazza, Piazza della Rotunda - the rooms were not noisy. The hotel is rated a three start but it provides a four start experience. If you want to see Rome from a very comfortable and accomodating location - this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough”
Reviews.Author: clarke13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely hotel based on what we had read on tripadvisor. We had 4 rooms and all went perfectly. Two of our rooms faced the pantheon and the square. The Pantheon is literally next door to this hotel. Magnificent. We loved the terrace bar with it's wonderful views of the whole city. The location of this hotel is great. We were able to walk ANYWHERE we wanted. If you are fortunate to go to Rome, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Must Stay Here If In Rome”
Reviews.Author: issaquahrules
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a 3 night stay at the Albergo Del Senato. What a great hotel ! We had a quad room which was perfect for our family (2 girls 9 and 13) each got a twin bed/roll out couch while me and the wife had a comfortable king bed. Plenty of room and very clean. The staff was exceptional and very helpful on tips for area restaurants,directions,etc. Michelle in the bar was an excellent host and very personable. There is a computer with interent access in the bar at a small charge which we used every night with a drink/snacks. The free breakfast in the morning was good. You can tell the staff likes working at this hotel. The best thing about the hotel is location, location, location ! With the Pantheon and many cafes outside the front door we had a fantastic time. All of the major Rome sites are no more than a 10 to 15 minute walk away from the hotel. The hotel set-up pick-up and delivery to the airport (mini-van charge to the room). Although not cheap (80 euro each way), after a long flight and vacation...very convenient. We also were set-up with a guide recommended by the hotel for a half-day to see the major sites in Rome. His name was Stefano Corazzo....he was great ! Ask the hotel and they will arrange it. We are already planning on making a return trip to the Albergo Del Senato next year. Have fun !

Reviews.Title: “The Albergo was Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome other times, first trip with my teenage son. The location was great- we walked all over the city from this central spot The rooms were immaculate and well appointed, not large but enough room for us. Even in the hot month of July we were comfortable and loved the view of the Pantheon out of our shuttered window. The rooftop bar was worth the trip to Rome- great service and views, the perfect way to begin a Roman evening with vistas of the entire city. I would recommend this hotel Highly

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Albergo Del Senato”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Albergo Del Senato in April, 2004 and absolutely thought it was great.....Right across from the Pantheon....beautiful!! I have trip advisor to thank for finding it in the first place and saving me from staying at the hotel I originally booked for our trip. It is very expensive, but we went during Easter, so prices were high everywhere....If we ever go back to Rome, that is where we'd stay.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic...........................................”
Reviews.Author: jillWelwynGardenCity
Reviews.Content: this was our second visit to this hotel in the last 6 months.... people people people... what can you possibly have to complain about this hotel. small yes friendly very you cannot get more ideally situated for visiting rome as a tourist to save on your feet,breakfast is simple but yummy and with all that pasta you will be eating what more would you need.the view from your window at the front of the hotel is fantastic and yes the square gets busy but isnt part of visiting a city enjoying the atmosphere and we left our windows open to hear the clatter and chatter and music.you step outside your door and have at your disposal cafes,resturants views and after dinner you can STROLL to the Trevi Fountain and the Piazza Novona how many hotels can boast this. please ignore the rediculous necative comments and give this hotel a go.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect! What a view!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 incredible days in Rome at this exceptional small hotel We had the room overlooking the Piazza della Rotunda and the Pantheon, with balcony. We hardly wanted to leave the room! Yes, the room is a bit small, the bath is not luxurious, but that VIEW! The location is perfect to get to everything on foot: minutes from the Piazza Novana, or the Trevi Fountain, or the Camp di Fiori. It is not noisy. The views from the terrace bar are incredible, especially at sunset. The staff is superb: Salvatore, Michele and Giuseppe. The breakfasts are great, ask for a cappucino. They will probably recommend the Pietro Ristorante, go, it's great and a kick! Wow!

HotelInfo.Name: Albergo del Senato
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza della Rotonda 73, 00186 Rome, Italy
